# Business Model Overview
The "shoppingMall" platform is designed as an intelligent AI-driven multi-channel e-commerce hub enabling seamless transactions between customers, sellers, and administrators. Its purpose is to address evolving consumer demand for efficiency, personalization, and trust in online retailâ€”bridging the gap between traditional and digital shopping experiences with automation and data-driven decision making.

Key market needs include:
- Facilitating secure, convenient shopping journeys in a fragmented e-commerce landscape
- Helping retailers of all sizes manage products, orders, and customers under one unified system
- Leveraging AI to provide better recommendations, dynamic pricing, fraud detection, and proactive customer support
- Delivering transparency, compliance, and reliability at scale

Differentiation lies in:
- Full-cycle operational automation for sellers (from onboarding to inventory, to analytics)
- Personalization for customers via advanced recommendation engines
- Administrative tools and analytics for platform optimization
- Integrated loyalty, coupon, and review systems for community and retention
- Scalable architecture for omnichannel expansion

# Monetization Strategy
Revenue is generated via multiple streams:
- Transaction fees on sales completed through the platform
- Subscription tiers for sellers (with premium features such as advanced analytics or support)
- Commission from value-added services (promoted listings, ads, fulfillment handling)
- Integration partnerships and API access for third parties
- Potential premium account options and upselling to end-users

Additional strategies include platform-agnostic coupon/loyalty program alliances, and market insight reporting subscriptions. The business model is adaptable for B2B, B2C, and hybrid commerce.

# Customer Acquisition & Retention
Customer growth is achieved through channel diversification (web, app, external API), AI-powered marketing, and viral community-building features. Retention is driven by:
- Continuous personalization using behavioral data and feedback
- Loyalty points, targeted discounts, and mileage/reward systems
- Responsive support, transparent policies, and trust-building mechanisms
- Dynamic engagement through reviews, Q&A, and community sections
- Lifecycle-based CRM ensuring re-engagement at trigger moments

# AI & Data Utilization in Growth
AI is utilized throughout:
- Real-time recommendation for products, search, and content
- Dynamic pricing models adjusting inventory based on demand
- Fraud detection in payments, reviews, and account creation
- Sales forecasting for sellers and administrative planning
- Behavior analytics for cohort targeting and campaign optimization
- Automated moderation for reviews, inquiries, and content

Data is aggregated ethically and in compliance with privacy laws, supporting advanced analytics for both platform and sellers, and driving continuous improvement of algorithms and business decision-making.

# KPIs & Evaluation Measures
Performance is gauged by clear, consistent metrics, including:
- Monthly active users (MAU) and daily active users (DAU) growth
- Gross merchandise value (GMV) and average order value (AOV)
- Seller/shop activation/retention rates
- Customer repeat purchase rate and NPS
- Cart conversion rates and order fulfillment efficiency
- Community engagement rates (reviews, Q&A, content posted)
- AI-driven feature adoption and accuracy rates
- Compliance to SLA on performance, error rates, and data security

# EARS-Format Sample Requirements
- THE platform SHALL deliver personalized product recommendations to each user session based on behavioral and historical data.
- WHEN a transaction is completed through the marketplace, THE system SHALL record the associated fee and commission automatically.
- WHERE a seller subscribes to premium features, THE system SHALL grant access to advanced analytics dashboards and support tools.
- IF suspicious activity is detected in customer reviews, THEN THE system SHALL flag the content for moderation and potential removal.
- WHEN AI-driven promotional campaigns are launched, THE platform SHALL track conversion metrics per defined KPI set.

# Favorites and Personalization Requirement Specification

## Introduction & Scope
This document defines the detailed business requirements for the favorites and personalization features within the shoppingMall backend system. It targets developers responsible for implementing core business logic that allows customers, sellers, and admins to mark and manage favorites (products, inquiries, addresses) and benefit from tailored personalization based on saved states, with a focus on traceability, recoverability, and high-performance integration. All technical implementation decisions (architecture, persistence layer, API format, etc.) remain solely with the backend development team and are out of scope.

## Business Context and Objectives
Personalization is a core driver for user engagement and retention in e-commerce platforms. Providing robust favorites management allows users to track interesting products, previous inquiries, and preferred delivery addresses. Snapshots of state-at-favorite-time ensure business transparency and support display/recovery of information, even as core catalog or user data evolvesâ€”critical for supporting customer trust and frictionless repeat purchase scenarios. Sellers and admins rely on accurate favorite and personalization data for analytics, recommendations, and targeted communications.

## Supported User Roles and Permission Overview

| Role     | Favorites (Product) | Favorites (Inquiry) | Favorites (Address) | Personalization Management |
|----------|---------------------|---------------------|---------------------|----------------------------|
| Customer | âœ…                   | âœ…                   | âœ…                   | âœ…                          |
| Seller   | âœ…                   | âœ…                   | âœ…                   | âœ…                          |
| Admin    | ðŸ”Ž (View, not own)   | ðŸ”Ž (View, not own)   | ðŸ”Ž (View, not own)   | ðŸ”Ž (View, not own)          |

- Customers and sellers maintain their own favorite sets and personalization. Admins can access these data objects for analytics, compliance, or business intelligence purposes but do not have personal favorites.
- Authentication is required for any favorite or personalized feature. Unauthorized access to favorites is strictly denied.

## Functional Requirements (Favorites Management)
### 4.1 Product Favorites
- THE system SHALL allow each authenticated customer or seller to add any active product from the shoppingMall catalog to their favorite list at any time.
- WHEN a product is added to favorites, THE system SHALL save a snapshot of critical product data, including title, seller, image(s), price, and stock status, reflecting the state at the time of favoriting.
- WHEN a favorited product is updated in the catalog (e.g., price, availability), THE system SHALL preserve the original favorite snapshot unchanged, except where legal compliance (e.g., product removal due to fraud) requires a favorite to become inaccessible.
- WHERE a customer or seller removes a product from their favorites, THE system SHALL logically delete the relation but retain snapshot history for 30 days (configurable), supporting recovery.
- THE maximum number of favorites per user SHALL be configurable per business policy, defaulting to 500 products unless otherwise specified.
- IF a product in favorites is unpublished (delisted or deleted), THEN THE system SHALL mark the favorite as inactive and notify the user at next login or action.

### 4.2 Favorite Inquiries
- THE system SHALL allow authenticated users to mark specific product inquiries or Q&As as favorites, storing a snapshot of the question, answer (if available), associated product, and responder.
- WHEN an inquiry is updated post-favoriting (e.g., new answer, edit), THE system SHALL maintain the snapshot as it was at favoriting but permit explicit user-triggered refresh.

### 4.3 Address Book and Favorite Addresses
- THE system SHALL support favoriting of user-registered addresses, allowing customers and sellers to highlight commonly used delivery or pickup addresses.
- WHEN a user favors an address, THE system SHALL record a snapshot of the address details, contact info, and metadata, facilitating fast, accurate order placement.
- WHERE a user updates address records, THE system SHALL prompt the user to either update the favorite snapshot or keep the prior version for historical reference.
- WHERE a user removes a favorite address, THE system SHALL retain address snapshot data for 30 days for recovery.
- THE system SHALL support a configurable maximum number of favorite addresses per user (default: 10).

## Personalization Snapshot Logic
- WHEN a user marks any item as favorite, THE system SHALL store a snapshot record capturing all relevant business fields as of favoriting time (e.g., product ID, price, images, descriptions for products; address info for addresses; inquiry details for inquiries).
- THE system SHALL allow retrieval of favorite items and corresponding snapshots in consistent sort order (e.g., most recent first, favorited date descending).
- WHERE favorites are used in system personalization (e.g., "recommended for you", search ranking adjustments), THE system SHALL use snapshot data and real-time catalog data as appropriate, indicating to the user any discrepancies between historical and current values (such as price changes or out-of-stock status).
- THE system SHALL ensure that favorite snapshots are user-specific, preventing leakage between accounts or roles.

## Notification and Event Handling
- WHEN a previously favorited item changes in a significant business-related manner (e.g., product delisted, inquiry deleted, address invalid), THE system SHALL trigger a notification to the owning user(s) via the preferred delivery channel (in-app, email, or SMS, as enabled).
- WHEN a user attempts to interact with an inactive, unpublished, or otherwise obsolete favorite, THE system SHALL inform the user of status and provide recovery or alternate action paths.
- Optional: WHERE user preferences enable periodic reminders, THE system SHALL notify users of "forgotten" or unacted-upon favorites (configurable period, e.g., 30/60/90 days).

## Business and Validation Rules
- THE system SHALL enforce a unique (user, item-type, item) constraint, preventing duplicate favorites.
- THE system SHALL validate the integrity of snapshot dataâ€”rejecting malformed, incomplete, or unauthorized snapshot creations.
- THE system SHALL support user-initiated refresh or deletion of favorite snapshots at any time within policy constraints.
- WHERE legal or compliance requirements mandate data removal (e.g., GDPR, deletion requests), THE system SHALL permanently remove all affected snapshots and associated favorite relations.

## Error Handling and Recovery Processes
- IF a favorite add or remove operation fails due to business constraint violation (e.g., exceeding maximum allowed favorites), THEN THE system SHALL deny the action and provide a structured error response with a clear code and message specifying the cause (e.g., MAX_LIMIT_REACHED).
- IF snapshot creation fails (e.g., due to unavailable item data), THEN THE system SHALL return an appropriate error code and recommend user retry.
- WHERE underlying item data is deleted or irreparably changed, THE system SHALL not display obsolete favorite content in standard queries but allow recovery or audit access via explicit user action.

## Performance Requirements
- WHEN a user requests their favorite list (any type), THE system SHALL return results, including all business fields from the snapshot, within 1 second for up to 100 favorites; larger result sets SHALL be paginated with next-page retrieval also under 1 second.
- THE system SHALL support at least 10,000 concurrent users retrieving favorites and personalization content without degraded response times.
- WHEN adding/removing favorites, THE system SHALL confirm success or provide error feedback within 1 second.

## Integration with Other Modules
- THE system SHALL integrate with catalog/product, inquiry/service, and address/user modules, ensuring referential integrity and consistency in favorite operations.
- WHEN item data changes (e.g., product updates, inquiry edits), THE system SHALL decouple favorite snapshot data, relying only on current catalog/inquiry/address record for live status reference and legal validation (e.g., removal due to fraud).
- THE system SHALL expose favorite/personalization snapshot content to analytics and recommendation engines, as permitted by user privacy policy.

## Mermaid Diagram: Favorites Workflow (Left-to-Right)
```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "Favorites Workflow"
    A["User Authenticates"] --> B["Selects Item to Favorite"]
    B --> C["System Validates Item and User Constraints"]
    C -->|"Pass"| D["Create Snapshot & Record Favorite"]
    C -->|"Fail"| G["Return Error Message"]
    D --> E["Update User's Favorite List"]
    E --> F["Trigger Notification (if needed)"]
    F --> H["Personalization/Analytics Update"]
  end
```

## Success Criteria & KPIs
- THE system SHALL maintain at least 99.99% data integrity between favorite snapshots and source records, barring explicit deletion/compliance actions.
- THE system SHALL support restoration or recovery of favorites removed within policy window (default: 30 days) with full snapshot fidelity.
- THE system SHALL enable tracking and reporting of favorite/personalization statistics by user segment for business insight.

---

# Introduction and Scope
This requirements document addresses all business rules and scenarios for promotional discounts, coupon management, deposit payment options, and mileage/loyalty programs for the shoppingMall backend. It defines how each system is created, how eligibility is validated, how redemption/usage is tracked, and the rules for expiry, stacking, and reporting. The document provides actionable requirements in EARS format and specifies role-based permissions for customers, sellers, and admins.

# Overview of Discounts, Coupons, and Loyalty Features
The shoppingMall backend must enable multiple types of promotional benefits:
- Coupon codes and discount vouchers issued to customers (or groups) under set conditions
- Application of coupons during cart/order flow, subject to eligibility, usage limit, and concurrency rules
- Deposit (prepaid balance) systems for flexible, secure payments
- Mileage/loyalty point accrual, redemption, adjustment, and expiry
The system must ensure robust tracking, audit trails, and user feedback for all benefit-related actions.

# Coupon Types & Issuance
## Types of Coupons
THE system SHALL support the following coupon types:
| Coupon Type              | Description                                             |
|-------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------|
| Order Amount Discount   | Discount off total order value (fixed or percentage)    |
| Product-specific Coupon | Discount applies only to specific products/categories   |
| Seller-issued Coupon    | Coupons issued by sellers for their own products        |
| Platform Coupon         | Issued centrally by admin for use across platform       |
| First-purchase Coupon   | Specific to first order/opportunity for new customers   |
| Birthday/Anniversary    | Special date-based coupons (personalized events)        |
| Free Shipping Coupon    | Waives delivery fee, product/category specific option   |

## Coupon Creation and Distribution Rules
- WHEN an admin or eligible seller requests coupon creation, THE system SHALL validate coupon parameters (amount, type, validity period, target group, usage conditions) prior to issuance.
- WHEN a coupon is created, THE system SHALL apply unique identifiers, usage tracking, and define eligibility criteria at issuance.
- WHERE coupons are distributed in bulk, THE system SHALL atomically create all codes and maintain a full issuance audit log.
- WHEN a customer receives a coupon, THE system SHALL notify the customer via their preferred notification channel within 1 minute.

# Application Conditions & Restrictions
## Eligibility Requirements
- WHEN a customer attempts to redeem a coupon, THE system SHALL validate that:
  - Customer status, role, and group match the coupon eligibility definition.
  - Coupon is within issuance and usage validity period.
  - Coupon has available uses (not exhausted for user or globally).
  - Coupon applies to selected products/channels/orders as specified in rules.
- WHERE coupons are single-use, THE system SHALL prevent further redemption after the initial use.
- WHERE coupons have a minimum spend, THE system SHALL only allow use if cart/order meets that minimum.

## Application and Usage Logic
- WHEN applying a coupon in the cart/order flow, THE system SHALL calculate the applicable discount and show the user net payable, savings, and coupon code applied.
- WHERE multiple coupons are present, THE system SHALL enforce stacking (combinability)/exclusivity rules as defined by the coupon property (e.g., non-stackable, stackable with restrictions).

## Constraints and Validation Rules
- THE system SHALL enforce the maximum number of coupons per order as per business policy.
- WHEN applying both seller and platform coupons, THE system SHALL enforce concurrency rules (e.g., allow/disallow simultaneous use).
- IF an invalid or expired coupon is applied, THEN THE system SHALL display an error with code COUPON_INVALID or COUPON_EXPIRED and block submission.
- WHEN the coupon has product/category/channel restrictions, THE system SHALL evaluate all line items and only apply the discount where valid.
- WHEN a coupon is revoked before redemption, THE system SHALL invalidate its code and notify affected recipients instantly.

## Error Handling and Edge Cases
- IF network or system errors occur during coupon application, THEN THE system SHALL preserve atomicity (rollback discounts added to cart/order) and log all failed attempts for audit.
- IF a customer repeatedly fails coupon eligibility within a short window (e.g., 3 times in 10 minutes), THEN THE system SHALL temporarily block further attempts and recommend contacting support.

# Deposit and Mileage Management
## Deposit System Rules
- THE system SHALL allow customers to top up an account with deposits (prepaid, cash card, gift card, etc.)
- WHEN a deposit-based payment is used for an order, THE system SHALL deduct the correct balance at order confirmation, and confirm the deduction in under 1 second.
- IF a deposit transaction fails, THEN THE system SHALL return the full amount to the customer balance and provide an explanation.
- THE system SHALL provide a full ledger of deposit transactions (top-ups, payments, refunds, expiries) accessible by the customer and admin.

## Mileage/Loyalty Point Accrual
- WHEN a qualifying order is completed, THE system SHALL credit mileage/loyalty points based on business-defined rules (amount, promotion, event, order value, exclusions).
- WHEN a customer returns part or all of an order, THE system SHALL deduct already-credited mileage proportional to the returned items.
- WHERE there are promotional events (double points, limited time offers), THE system SHALL support variable point multipliers during their active window.

## Redemption and Deduction Scenarios
- WHEN redeeming mileage/points, THE system SHALL apply the points to the order total in real-time, ensuring points cannot exceed order value minus excluded items.
- WHERE both mileage and coupon are present, THE system SHALL enforce business rules for combination or exclusivity.
- THE system SHALL provide a clear breakdown (amount redeemed, reward type, expiry) at checkout and in order history.
- WHEN the customer is short of points for redemption, THE system SHALL prompt the exact additional points required and recommend alternative payment if necessary.

## Expiry and Adjustment Logic
- THE system SHALL support per-point expiration, batch-based expiry, and global expiry events (e.g., at year-end).
- WHEN mileage or deposits near expiry (within 30 days), THE system SHALL notify the customer by preferred channel at least twice before actual expiry.
- WHEN points or deposits expire, THE system SHALL remove expired balances, record the event for compliant reporting, and notify the customer.
- WHERE promotional points are adjusted due to system errors or fraud, THE system SHALL require admin-level authorization and record a traceable adjustment entry.

# Redemption and Expiry Processes
## Expiry Dates and User Notification
- WHEN creating coupons, THE system SHALL set issue and expiry dates by business logic, with support for both rolling (e.g., valid for 7 days from issue) and fixed-date models.
- THE system SHALL notify users of expiring coupons/mileage at least twice (7 days and 1 day prior, via default channel).
- WHERE coupons/benefits expire unused, THE system SHALL automatically mark as expired and remove from user entitlement.

## Redemption Flows
- THE system SHALL atomically apply coupons, deposits, and mileage at order commitment and show itemized breakdown to the user.
- IF an error is detected after order submission, THEN THE system SHALL reverse the redemption, restore unused benefits, and notify all affected parties.

## Cascading Use (Combinations, Exclusivity)
- THE system SHALL enforce all combinability/exclusivity logic set at the benefit-definition level (e.g., "Cannot combine this coupon with mileage"), and validate mutual exclusivity at runtime.
- WHERE business rules change, THE system SHALL update future redemptions and notify users for currently entitled but not-yet-used benefits.

## Reporting and Auditing Considerations
- THE system SHALL record every issuance, redemption, adjustment, and expiry event with a traceable audit log including timestamps, responsible actor, affected user, order, and action type.
- THE system SHALL enable admins to generate benefit usage reports filtered by date, user, seller, benefit type, and outcome status (success/failure/expired).

# Role-based Permissions and Access Matrix
## User Functions
| Action                               | Customer | Seller | Admin |
|--------------------------------------|----------|--------|-------|
| Receive assigned coupons             | âœ…       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Redeem coupon at checkout            | âœ…       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Issue coupons (to customers)         | âŒ       | âœ…*    | âœ…    |
| Create/edit coupon templates         | âŒ       | âœ…*    | âœ…    |
| Adjust/revoke coupons post-issue     | âŒ       | âœ…*    | âœ…    |
| Issue/adjust mileage or deposits     | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Approve adjustments for fraud/errors | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| View audit/reports for own actions   | âœ…       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| * Seller authority limited to own products, subject to compliance checks  |

## JWT Payload Structure for Entitled Benefits
- userId (string, required)
- role (enum: customer, seller, admin)
- entitlements (array of assigned coupon/mileage/deposit IDs plus type, expiry, status)
- permissions array as per the above matrix

# Performance and User Experience Expectations
- THE system SHALL complete coupon/deposit/mileage redemption and order pricing calculations in under 2 seconds.
- THE system SHALL synchronize benefit state changes (e.g., usage, expiry) to user-facing apps within 5 seconds.
- All user-facing validation errors SHALL be returned as code-value pairs with human-readable message, for effective UI display.
- User notifications for benefit changes SHALL be queued for immediate dispatch, with retry/redundancy to ensure delivery.

# Mermaid Diagram: Coupon Application Flow (example)
```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "Coupon Redemption Flow"
    A["Start Checkout"] --> B["Enter/Select Coupon Code"]
    B --> C{"Is Coupon Valid?"}
    C -->|"Yes"| D["Apply Discount"]
    C -->|"No"| E["Show Error Message"]
    D --> F["Complete Order"]
    E --> F
    F --> G["Update Usage Record"]
    G --> H["Notify User"]
  end
```

# Glossary
- Coupon: Digital voucher for specific order/product discount
- Mileage: Loyalty points accrued for purchases; redeemable for future discounts
- Deposit: Prepaid account balance; can be used as order payment

# References
- [User Roles and Authentication Requirement Document](./03-user-roles-and-authentication.md)
- [Cart and Order Processing Requirement Document](./07-cart-and-order-processing.md)

# Success and Compliance Criteria
- All requirements above are mandatory for the shoppingMall backend
- Edge cases, exception handling, and audit logging are critical for business compliance
- Developers retain autonomy on technical implementation; the business logic herein must be enforced as specified

## 1. Extensibility Needs (Channels, Payments, APIs)

### Channel Expansion
- THE system SHALL permit onboarding and configuration of new sales channels (e.g., mobile app, POS, third-party marketplaces) without disrupting existing channels.
- WHEN a new channel is added, THE system SHALL enable role-based permissions and tracking for all user activities within that channel.
- THE system SHALL allow each channel to be managed independently, supporting unique business rules, payment methods, and content.

### Payment Integration
- THE system SHALL support adding new payment gateway providers (e.g., credit card, PayPal, crypto, local methods) without downtime or loss of previous functionality.
- WHEN onboarding a new payment integration, THE system SHALL provide clear mapping of transaction data, user-facing status updates, and escalation for failed payments.
- THE system SHALL allow for role-driven control and reporting of payments per channel and seller.

### API-Driven Expansion
- THE system SHALL offer business logic through APIs enabling partner integrations (e.g., shipping, analytics, chatbots, accounting) with strict version and permission control.
- WHERE business operations expand, THE system SHALL support exposing new APIs or endpoints without breaking existing integrations.
- IF a new API function is introduced, THEN THE system SHALL require explicit versioning and rollback processes.

### Data Extensibility and Schema Evolution
- WHEN a new business attribute (e.g., product option, user property) is needed, THE system SHALL permit schema extension without breaking existing features or causing data loss.
- THE system SHALL maintain integrity when extending entities (products, users, orders) to support personalization, promotions, or new business logic.
- THE system SHALL allow for migration of legacy data/integrations with well-defined feature flags and migration windows.

## 2. Performance Optimization Expectations

### User-Facing Responsiveness
- WHEN a customer browses product lists, completes checkout, or interacts with their account, THE system SHALL respond or update status within 2 seconds for 99% of all requests under normal operational load.
- WHERE personalized features are used (recommendations, favorites), THE system SHALL not degrade response below the defined performance SLA.
- WHEN a seller updates product, inventory, or order data, THE system SHALL reflect changes to relevant parties instantly or within 2 seconds of successful operation.

### Automated Scaling
- IF business activity increases suddenly (e.g., events, sales, campaigns), THEN THE system SHALL automatically scale to maintain operational SLAs for all users and roles, without requiring manual intervention.
- WHERE seller or channel onboarding expands, THE system SHALL adjust resource allocation to sustain performance KPIs.

### Concurrent Operation & Load
- THE system SHALL support simultaneous activities by thousands of users (shoppers, sellers, admins) and hundreds of business operations per second, including at peak sales periods.
- WHEN batch operations (e.g., mass coupon issuance, bulk uploads, major inventory syncs) occur, THE system SHALL not degrade the experience for ongoing customer activities.

## 3. Backwards Compatibility & Versioning

### Safe Upgrades and Legacy Support
- WHEN upgrading a business process, logic, or endpoint, THE system SHALL allow existing users and integrations to continue operating without breaking changes or data loss for a minimum of 12 months post-upgrade.
- THE system SHALL maintain documentation of all active and deprecated business interfaces, including version history, status, and supported channels.
- WHERE multiple API or data schema versions coexist, THE system SHALL enforce version-specific business logic and role permissions.

### Required Communication
- WHEN a breaking or substantial change is introduced, THE system SHALL notify all impacted users (customers, sellers, admins) in advance, describing the change, migration period, and fallback options.
- THE system SHALL provide migration windows and dual-run support where possible, with clear timing and responsibility assignment for each party.

## 4. Business Continuity & Expansion Scenarios

### Failover and Recovery
- IF a critical service fails (e.g., payment processor, order management, inventory sync), THEN THE system SHALL continue core business operations by auto-switching to alternate providers or fallback strategies within 30 seconds.
- THE system SHALL ensure data consistency and durability across all expansion and disaster/scenario recovery actions.
- THE system SHALL keep an audit trail of all failover, migration, and disaster recovery activities for business verification.

### Expansion and Migration
- WHEN expanding to a new geography, language, or regulatory domain, THE system SHALL allow for localized configuration, compliance enforcement, and audit logging without impacting global operation.
- THE system SHALL support cross-border payment, tax, shipping, and returns logic per each expansion area.
- WHERE business demand requires, THE system SHALL support live data migration with zero or near-zero downtime (less than 5 minutes of unavailability).

### High Availability and Maintenance
- THE system SHALL ensure high availability (>99.95% uptime per channel/role) and schedule maintenance windows with prior notice to all stakeholders.
- WHEN scheduled or unscheduled maintenance occurs, THE system SHALL redirect users to clear service status updates and, where possible, provide alternative functions (e.g., order viewing if checkout is unavailable).

### Growth Ready
- WHERE additional business models (B2B, subscriptions, white-labeled malls) are introduced, THE system SHALL support isolated management and permission schemes for each model without compromising data integrity or security.
- THE system SHALL allow for business units (sellers, channels, regional managers) to autonomously manage their expansion within assigned permissions.

## Mermaid Diagram: Extensibility & Failover Flow

```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "Scalability & Expansion"
    A["New Channel or Payment Integration"] --> B{"Disrupts Existing?"}
    B -->|"No"| C["Auto Onboarding"]
    B -->|"Yes"| D["Run Migration Process"]
    D --> E{"Fallback Ready?"}
    E -->|"Yes"| F["Enable Failover"]
    E -->|"No"| G["Business Alert & Rollback"]
  end

  subgraph "Performance"
    H["User Surge (Event, Promotion)"] --> I{"Can Scale?"}
    I -->|"Yes"| J["Auto Scale Resources"]
    I -->|"No"| K["Prioritize Critical Paths"]
  end

  A --> H
```

## Requirements Summary Table

| Requirement Category                | EARS Compliance Example                                                                                           |
|-------------------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Extensibility (Channels)            | WHEN new sales channels are onboarded, THE system SHALL provision unique settings, roles, and rules per channel. |
| Payment Integration                 | WHEN new payment providers are added, THE system SHALL enable mappings and extend business reporting instantly.   |
| Performance (Web, API, Batch)       | THE system SHALL respond to user interactions within 2 seconds for 99% of requests under normal load.            |
| Scaling (Events, Bulk Ops)          | IF business demand spikes, THEN THE system SHALL maintain SLAs via automated resource scaling.                    |
| Compatibility (Upgrades)            | WHEN a breaking change is shipped, THE system SHALL provide dual-run and migration support for >=12 months.       |
| Continuity (Failover, Expansion)    | IF a service fails, THEN THE system SHALL route to preconfigured backup channels within 30 seconds.               |

## Error Handling and Edge Scenarios
- IF a payment integration fails during transaction processing, THEN THE system SHALL offer an alternate payment method and notify both the user and seller.
- IF legacy data or integrations cannot be migrated, THEN THE system SHALL maintain legacy endpoints or features until full transition is verified.
- IF regional expansion impacts regulatory compliance, THEN THE system SHALL block non-compliant business functions and inform responsible parties.

## Performance Requirements (User Experience Terms)
- Product discovery, order placement, and listing management responses SHALL be delivered within 2 seconds 99% of the time.
- Bulk actions (batch order exports, coupon distribution) SHALL not interrupt normal transaction and browsing experiences.
- Unplanned downtime for maintenance, upgrade, or expansion SHALL not exceed 5 minutes per event.
- All failover operations SHALL complete within 30 seconds without loss of transactional or audit data.

---

# Introduction
The future-readiness of the shoppingMall service depends on integrating state-of-the-art technologies and practices, including AI/ML, advanced analytics, and seamless user experience across all channels. These features are critical for driving differentiation, operational intelligence, and sustainable competitive advantage. This document establishes business-driven requirements and expectations for these areas, ensuring backend developers know precisely what the business needs and why.

# AI/ML Integration Capabilities
## Objectives
- Automate, personalize, and optimize business processes and customer experiences using AI and machine learning technologies
- Extract actionable insights from behavioral, transactional, and operational data
- Enable predictive and proactive features that boost engagement, conversion, and operational efficiency

## Business Requirements (EARS Format)
- WHEN user interaction data is collected, THE shoppingMall backend SHALL process and store detailed session, action, and outcome records for analysis.
- WHEN product listings are created or updated, THE system SHALL capture and store features/metadata to enable AI-driven recommendations and search optimization.
- WHEN a customer views or searches for products, THE system SHALL surface recommendations based on AI/ML ranking models utilizing behavioral and contextual data.
- WHEN transaction and order data is accrued, THE system SHALL aggregate relevant KPIs for use in training machine learning models for sales forecasting, inventory management, and churn predictions.
- WHEN seller or admin users access analytics dashboards, THE system SHALL present AI-derived insights on demand and facilitate feedback on AI performance.
- IF AI-driven recommendations fail to provide results, THEN THE system SHALL gracefully default to popularity or recency-driven fallback mechanisms, ensuring uninterrupted customer experience.

### Core Business Scenarios
- Product and content recommendation engines (cross-sell, up-sell, personalized feeds)
- AI-powered fraud detection and anomaly monitoring (e.g., unusual purchase patterns)
- Automated and context-driven customer support routing and intent recognition
- Dynamic pricing rules based on real-time demand and supply signals
- Content moderation (AI-flagging of inappropriate/inaccurate listings, reviews, and community content)

## Data & Privacy Expectations
- THE system SHALL process all user and transaction data for AI purposes in compliance with platform privacy policy and applicable regulations, with auditable opt-in/opt-out mechanisms where mandated.
- WHERE users request AI-driven personalization, THE system SHALL record explicit consent and provide mechanisms for users to review, adjust, or revoke such consent at any time.

# Advanced Analytics & Insights
## Objectives
- Deliver actionable, real-time intelligence to business users, allowing for rapid and informed decision making
- Provide comprehensive, self-service analytics to sellers and admins
- Enable retrospective and predictive analysis for business optimization

## Business Requirements (EARS Format)
- WHEN any authenticated seller or admin accesses their analytics portal, THE system SHALL display up-to-date metrics, trends, and detailed breakdowns on sales, inventory, customer interactions, and performance targets.
- WHEN users interact with analytics tools, THE system SHALL support dynamic filtering, segmentation, and drill-down on all major KPIs (e.g., sales per product/category, conversion rates, revenue attribution, cohort analysis).
- WHEN admins require platform-wide reports, THE system SHALL aggregate, anonymize, and prepare datasets at daily, weekly, monthly, and yearly granularity for reporting and export.
- WHEN unusual activity (e.g., sales spike/drop, abnormal traffic) is detected, THE system SHALL trigger notifications and enable root cause analysis via advanced analytics dashboards.
- THE system SHALL track and present net effects of promotions/loyalty programs on sales and user behavior, supporting ROI and retention analysis.

### Analytics User Scenarios
- Sellers track promotional performance and real-time sales with customizable dashboards
- Admins monitor overall platform health, identify emerging trends or issues, and validate the performance/effectiveness of AI recommendations

## Data Sources, Governance, and Access
- THE system SHALL compile analytics from all integrated systems: orders, products, user sessions, reviews, customer support, and third-party channels.
- Data displayed SHALL respect user roles/permissions strictly: sellers see their own data, admins see global analytics, customers see their own behavior history only.

# Omnichannel and Cross-Platform Features
## Objectives
- Seamless customer and seller experience across all web, mobile apps, third-party integrations, POS, and future channels
- Consistent user identity, preferences, and histories across platforms and devices
- Unified business operations, tracking, and analytics regardless of access channel

## Business Requirements (EARS Format)
- WHEN a user interacts with the shoppingMall service via any device or channel, THE system SHALL synchronize user profile, session, and personalization data in real time, preventing conflicts or data loss.
- WHILE a user is logged in on multiple platforms/devices, THE system SHALL maintain a consistent and up-to-date state for preferences, loyalty/mileage, order status, and notifications.
- WHEN sellers update products, manage orders, or handle inquiries, THE system SHALL ensure changes are reflected and consistent across all channels, with conflict resolution rules for simultaneous updates.
- IF concurrent updates or conflicts occur across channels, THEN THE system SHALL implement business-defined conflict resolution workflows and log all change events for auditability.
- WHEN new external channels are integrated (e.g., social commerce, affiliate platforms), THE system SHALL provide mapping and translation layers so that business workflows, analytics, and personalization logic remain consistent and traceable.

### Omnichannel Scenarios
- Customers add products to cart on desktop, purchase on mobile, track orders via chatbot, and accrue loyalty points seamlessly
- Sellers manage listings both via mobile apps and desktop dashboards with no loss of state or unsynchronized changes
- Admins receive consolidated analytics across all channels, diagnose cross-channel discrepancies, and enforce unified platform rules

## Technical Enablement (Business Rules Only)
- THE system SHALL clearly define business logic, role-based data visibility, and interaction rules for each supported channel and integration point
- THE system SHALL prepare for future channel expansions with a modular permission and audit structure; architecture, specific integrations, and technologies are delegated to the development team

# Roadmap for Continuous Innovation
## Objectives
- Ensure shoppingMall keeps pace with technological evolution, customer expectations, and competitive pressures
- Identify, prioritize, and review advanced feature adoption in line with business value

## Business Requirements (EARS Format)
- THE business team SHALL review all advanced features biannually, with input from stakeholders, to prioritize investments in AI, analytics, and omnichannel support.
- WHEN critical new technologies or practices are identified (e.g., regulatory change, major competitor innovation), THE system SHALL accommodate rapid reviews and business-driven reprioritization of the innovation roadmap.
- Where possible, THE system SHALL facilitate data-driven evaluation of innovation impacts on KPIs, user satisfaction, and revenue growth, via experimentation and A/B testing at the business rule level.

# Success Criteria & Performance Expectations
- WHEN AI-driven personalization or recommendations are presented to users, THE results SHALL be returned within 1 second for typical queries, with clear user-facing feedback if longer delays occur.
- WHEN analytics dashboards are loaded, THE system SHALL deliver requested metrics or visualizations within 3 seconds under normal operating loads.
- WHEN users switch between channels, THE user session state, preferences, and critical business data SHALL synchronize within 2 seconds across all devices.

# Business Rules & Error Handling
- IF AI/ML models are unavailable, THEN THE system SHALL default to business rule-based logic and clearly record the exception for review.
- IF analytics data cannot be generated in real time, THEN THE system SHALL gracefully notify the requester and deliver the most recent data snapshot available, with a timestamp.
- IF channel synchronization fails, THEN THE system SHALL log the issue, attempt automated retry, and alert both the user and platform support where user impact is detected.

# Mermaid Diagrams
## Omnichannel Workflow Example
```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "User Experience Flow"
    A["User Browses & Adds Cart on Web"] --> B["Session Data Sync"]
    B --> C["User Completes Purchase on Mobile"]
    C --> D["Order Status Updated"]
    D --> E["Analytics Updated Across Devices"]
  end

  subgraph "Seller Experience Flow"
    F["Seller Updates Inventory via App"] --> G["Inventory State Sync"]
    G --> H["Admin Reviews Analytics"]
  end

  E --> I["Unified Analytics Dashboard"]
  H --> I
```

# References and Alignment
- For vision and value proposition, see [Service Vision & Value Proposition](./01-service-vision.md)
- For foundational business model, see [Business Model & Objectives](./02-business-model.md)
- For security, compliance, and scalability, see [Security, Compliance & Data Privacy](./13-security-compliance-and-data-privacy.md) and [Scalability & Future Expansion](./14-scalability-and-future-expansion.md)
- All rules and requirements here are strictly business-driven: technical designs, architectures, and implementations are reserved for the development team.

# AI Shopping Mall Backend: Service Vision & Value Proposition

## Project Purpose & Market Need

The goal of the AI Shopping Mall backend project is to deliver a robust, intelligent, and scalable core that powers a next-generation e-commerce platform. In the current digital retail landscape, traditional shopping mall backends often fall short in providing the real-time, personalized, and adaptive experiences users have come to expect. Fragmented systems, limited differentiation between competitors, lack of intelligent automation, and reactive rather than proactive customer experiences are common pain points.

**Key market needs:**
- Users (customers) demand personalized shopping journeys, with tailored recommendations, adaptive pricing, and seamless support across devices and channels.
- Sellers require platforms that can intelligently match them with the right buyers, simplify order and inventory management, and automate customer engagement.
- Admins and operators need powerful analytics and tools to drive growth, ensure compliance, and preemptively improve platform security and robustness.

The project specifically addresses gaps in:
- Personalization at scale
- Proactive support and fraud prevention
- Seller enablement and automation
- Platform scalability and cross-channel consistency

## Business Opportunity & Differentiators

The platform is positioned to seize the rapidly expanding opportunities in omni-channel, AI-driven retail. By leveraging a unified, AI-centric backend, it can deliver value to all parties in the ecosystem:

- **Differentiators:**
  - Embedded AI across personalization, pricing, and fraud detection
  - Automated seller tools for onboarding, engagement, and compliance
  - Deep analytics and feedback loops for continuous system improvement
  - Real-time, cross-channel order and inventory management
  - Advanced loyalty, rewards, and community features enabled by data insights
- **Strategic business opportunities:**
  - Enable new forms of value-based customer engagement
  - Rapidly onboard and empower micro-sellers and brands through smart automation
  - Monetize insights, behavior data, and platform intelligence (e.g., targeted promotions, partner APIs)
  - Expand internationally through scalable compliance, localization, and channel routing

## Stakeholder Goals

| Stakeholder   | Primary Goals |
|--------------|--------------|
| Customers    | Effortless shopping, relevant offers, trusted transactions, unified account across devices/channels, transparency in pricing and reviews |
| Sellers      | Efficient product/catalog management, intelligent sales analytics, direct engagement with buyers, automated promotions, reliable order fulfillment, responsive customer service |
| Admins       | Global view and granular control, enforce platform rules and compliance, monitor risk and anomalies, configure business logic, manage channel expansion and localization |
| Business Executives | Rapid growth, diversified revenue, industry leadership in AI e-commerce, high user retention |
| Technology Partners | Seamless integration, clear APIs, access to analytics, fast onboarding |

The backend is structured to fulfill these goals by embedding them into core business processes, accessible via role-based workflows and management tools.

## AI-driven Value Proposition

AI is the backbone of this shopping mall backend and is directly applied to:
- **Personalized product and content recommendations** based on behavioral analytics, purchase history, and user segmentation
- **Dynamic and predictive pricing**, optimizing conversion and maximizing value automatically
- **Smart fraud detection** leveraging behavior anomaly modeling to proactively block high-risk transactions and notify stakeholders
- **Automated customer support** (e.g., chatbots, inquiry routing) for real-time, 24/7 assistance
- **Seller enablement** through AI-driven dashboards, sales predictions, and inventory alerts
- **Advanced loyalty management**, providing dynamic rewards, targeted campaigns based on engagement metrics, and AI-powered gamification elements

**EARS Requirement Examples:**
- WHEN a customer browses the catalog, THE system SHALL show tailored recommendations based on their browsing and purchase patterns.
- WHEN a suspicious transaction is detected, THE system SHALL flag it and alert the appropriate admin for review within 30 seconds.
- WHEN a seller uploads a new product, THE system SHALL suggest optimal categorization and pricing using AI models trained on sales data.
- WHILE an order is in transit, THE system SHALL provide real-time tracking updates and predictive delivery estimates to the customer.

## Success Metrics

The platform's progress and ultimate success are measured using clear, actionable Key Performance Indicators (KPIs):

| Metric | Definition |
|--------|------------|
| Monthly Active Users (MAU) | Number of unique active user accounts per month (all roles) |
| Customer Satisfaction Score (CSAT) | Aggregate result from post-interaction and periodic surveys, must remain above 85% |
| Seller Growth Rate | Quarterly count of new sellers onboarded, goal of sustained 10% MoM increase |
| Order Conversion Rate | Ratio of completed purchases to unique sessions, should exceed industry benchmark |
| Fraud Incident Rate | Number of verified fraudulent orders per 1,000, must remain below 0.1 |
| Platform Uptime | Percentage of time backend is available (target: 99.95%+) |
| Feature Adoption | Usage analytics for AI-driven features (e.g., recommendation engine activation rates) |
| Time-to-Resolution (Support) | Median time to resolve customer/seller issues, goal: <2 hours |

Performance on these dimensions is monitored in real time and informs both business/AI roadmaps and immediate operational priorities.

## Related Documentation Reference

For more detailed business model components, see the [Business Model Overview and Monetization Guide](./02-business-model.md). For user roles, authentication, and permission systems, see the [User Roles and Authentication Specification](./03-user-roles-and-authentication.md). Comprehensive user scenarios and flows are detailed in the [End-to-End User Workflows and Use Cases Document](./04-user-scenarios-and-flows.md).

# Introduction
Channels in shoppingMall represent distinct sales outlets, brand sites, or marketing presences (such as web, mobile app, external marketplace, or brand-specific microsites). Sections are hierarchical groupings within channels organizing content, products, or campaigns (such as home, sale, new arrivals, promotions, or custom landing pages).

The ability to register, configure, and manage multiple channels and sections is central to customizing business operations, branding, marketing, and analytics. Cross-channel consistency, hierarchical flexibility, and robust permission management are required to facilitate complex retail operations.

# Definitions & Scope
- **Channel**: A top-level sales or display route in shoppingMall (e.g., "Web Storefront", "Mobile App Companion", "Brand A Microsite").
- **Section**: An organized container within a channel, potentially nested, housing content and/or products (e.g., "Home Banner", "Electronics", "Seasonal Deals").
- **Section Type**: Classification such as main/landing/feature/subsection, with business logic attached.

This document governs:
- Channel onboarding and removal
- Channel configuration and visibility
- Section structure and business rules within each channel
- Role-based permissions and restrictions
- Cross-channel consistency mechanisms
- Analytics for section/channel performance

# Channel Registration & Configuration

## Channel Lifecycle
- WHEN an admin creates a new channel, THE system SHALL require a unique channel identifier, display name, type (web, mobile, marketplace, etc.), primary locale, and target audience description.
- IF a channel with the same unique identifier exists, THEN THE system SHALL prevent creation and provide an error code CHANNEL_DUPLICATE_IDENTIFIER.
- WHEN a channel is updated, THE system SHALL allow change of display name, configuration parameters, associated sections, and active statusâ€”while retaining immutable unique identifier.
- IF a channel is deactivated, THEN THE system SHALL mark it as inactive, restrict further section management, and maintain all records for reporting and auditability.
- WHEN an admin removes a channel, THE system SHALL require confirmation and perform a logical delete, archiving all linked sections and disabling customer/seller access within that channel context.

## Business Rules & Validation Logic
- THE system SHALL validate that each channel's display name is unique and non-empty (case-insensitive).
- THE system SHALL require configuration of at least one section (main landing section) before activating the channel for public use.
- IF a channel is missing required configuration (primary section, default locale, or target audience), THEN THE system SHALL block activation with error code CHANNEL_CONFIG_INCOMPLETE.
- WHEN a seller requests channel-specific actions (e.g., product posting), THE system SHALL restrict by seller's assigned channels.

## Channel Configuration Parameters
| Parameter            | Required | Description                                                          |
|----------------------|----------|----------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Unique Identifier    | Yes      | Internal primary key (must be system-wide unique)                    |
| Display Name         | Yes      | User-facing channel name (unique per channel)                        |
| Type                 | Yes      | Enum: web, mobile, marketplace, custom                               |
| Primary Locale       | Yes      | Main language/region setup for channel                               |
| Target Audience      | Yes      | Description for business/analytics                                   |
| Active Status        | Yes      | Boolean - true (active), false (inactive)                            |
| Section List         | Yes      | References to root sections assigned to channel                      |
| Parent Channel (opt) | No       | For hierarchical/cascading channel models (not always used)          |

## Role-based Permissions in Channel Management
- WHERE admin role, THE system SHALL allow full creation/updates/removal of channels.
- WHERE seller role, THE system SHALL restrict channel edit permissions to those for which seller has explicit access (no channel creation/removal allowed by sellers).
- WHERE customer role, THE system SHALL restrict access to channel browsing and content consumption only.

# Section Hierarchy & Management

## Section Types and Structure
- THE system SHALL support nested, multi-level sections per channel. Levels and types include:
    - Main Section (top-level)
    - Subsection (nested)
    - Landing Page Section (default for channel)
    - Special Purpose (campaign, sale, custom feature)
- THE system SHALL permit reordering of sections within a channel, reflecting changes instantly in channel navigation.
- WHEN a section is created, THE system SHALL require assignment to a parent channel and, optionally, a parent section if not root.
- IF attempting to nest a section beyond 5 levels deep, THEN THE system SHALL reject and return error code SECTION_DEPTH_EXCEEDED.

## Section Assignment, Business Rules, and Validation
- WHEN activating or reassigning sections, THE system SHALL validate no cyclic dependencies or orphaned branches occur.
- EACH section SHALL have a unique name within its parent section or within the root of the channel.
- WHERE section name is not unique within its scope, THE system SHALL reject creation/update with error code SECTION_NAME_DUPLICATE.
- WHEN a section is deactivated (not deleted), THE system SHALL hide all child sections unless explicit override is set.
- IF a section is deleted, THEN THE system SHALL archive section records and all immediate descendants, preserving for audit and analytics.

## Section Reordering and Movement Logic
- THE system SHALL allow reordering sections via explicit index or drag-and-drop (business context, not UI), updating the order instantly for all business processes.
- WHILE reordering sections, THE system SHALL prevent assigning duplicate sort indexes.

## Section Visibility, Activity, and Restrictions
- EACH section SHALL have an active/inactive flag and a visibility type (public, seller-only, admin-only).
- WHERE a section is set to seller-only, THE system SHALL restrict content/products to be accessed only by assigned sellers.
- WHERE a section is for admin purposes, THE system SHALL hide from customers and sellers (e.g., staging, test sections).

# Cross-Channel Consistency & Analytics

## Synchronization & Consistency
- THE system SHALL permit configuration templates for sections that can be reused across multiple channels.
- WHEN a template is updated, THE system SHALL propagate changes to all associated channel sections unless marked "customized" for that instance.
- IF a section is customized in a channel, THEN template updates SHALL not overwrite channel-specific configurations.
- THE system SHALL allow batch operations (activate, reorder, archive) for sections across selected channels.

## Handling Differences/Conflicts
- IF a sectionâ€™s structure diverges from template due to channel-specific customization, THEN THE system SHALL flag for business review and analytics tagging.
- WHEN conflicts are detected between templates and customized sections, THE system SHALL present audit records and change history for reconciliation.

## Analytics
- THE system SHALL record creation, update, view, and reordering actions for every channel/section in an immutable business log.
- THE system SHALL generate analytics reports per channel and per section (e.g., products displayed, clicks, sales sourced, active/inactive counts).
- WHERE data inconsistency or unusual behavior is detected (e.g., sections with no activity, looped structures), THE system SHALL flag for admin review.

# Error Handling & Recovery
- IF any business rule or validation fails, THEN THE system SHALL return clear error codes, descriptive messages, and preserve attempted input for user/admin review.
- IF critical structural errors (e.g., cyclic dependency, orphan sections, missing main section), THEN THE system SHALL lock affected channels/sections for recovery and warn relevant user roles.
- WHEN a channel/section operation partially succeeds (e.g., batch operation), THE system SHALL detail which items failed and provide actionable information for each.

# Performance & User Experience Requirements
- WHEN a channel or section is created, updated, or deleted, THE system SHALL complete all operations within 2 seconds in 95% of cases, ensuring a seamless business management experience.
- WHEN activating or deactivating sections for a popular channel (50,000+ subscribers or products), THE system SHALL update all business logic references across the system instantly, or within 5 seconds for rare edge cases.

# Business Rules Reference Table
| Rule Ref | Condition                                         | Expected Business Behavior                                             |
|----------|---------------------------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------|
| BR-101   | Duplicate Channel Identifier                      | Reject with CHANNEL_DUPLICATE_IDENTIFIER                              |
| BR-102   | Missing Main Section on Channel Activation        | Block activation: CHANNEL_CONFIG_INCOMPLETE                           |
| BR-103   | Section Depth > 5                                | Reject with SECTION_DEPTH_EXCEEDED                                    |
| BR-104   | Non-unique Section Name Within Parent             | Reject with SECTION_NAME_DUPLICATE                                    |
| BR-105   | Attempt to Edit Channel/Section as Unauthorized   | Reject with PERMISSION_DENIED                                         |
| BR-106   | Section Customization Diverges from Template      | Flag for analytics, present audit trail                               |
| BR-107   | Cyclic/Orphan Structure in Section Tree           | Lock affected entities, require admin recovery                        |

# Role-based Permission Matrix
| Action                       | Customer | Seller | Admin |
|------------------------------|----------|--------|-------|
| Browse Channel & Sections    | âœ…       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Register New Channel         | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Edit Channel Properties      | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Remove/Deactivate Channel    | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Add/Edit/Remove Sections     | âŒ       | Partial| âœ…    |
| Assign Products to Sections  | âŒ       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Reorder Sections             | âŒ       | Partial| âœ…    |
| Configure Section Templates  | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| View Analytics               | âŒ       | Partial| âœ…    |

- "Partial" means possible if the seller is granted permission on their assigned channels/sections only.

# Example User Scenarios
## Scenario 1: Admin Registers a New Mobile Channel
- Admin chooses "Create Channel", enters required data with unique ID and display name, sets type to "mobile", selects English-US locale, and specifies "Mobile App Shoppers" as audience.
- System requires at least one main section before activation.
- Admin creates "Home", "Deals", and "Categories" sections, assigns to channel root, and activates channel.
- System validates all business rules, logs actions, and channel is now visible to assigned audiences.

## Scenario 2: Seller Edits Assigned Channel Section
- Seller logs in and is authorized for "Brand Outlet" channel. Seller cannot create new channel but can add a new promotional section within assigned channel.
- System restricts nesting beyond 5 levels and validates unique section name. Seller successfully adds "Summer Sale" section, sets to active and seller-only.

## Scenario 3: Template Synchronization
- Admin updates "Standard Home Layout" template. System pushes changes to all channels using this template except those flagged as "customized".
- One channel diverges due to local editsâ€”system flags for admin analytics review and change reconciliation.

# Mermaid Diagram: Channel and Section Management Flow
```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "Channel Management"
    A["Admin Creates Channel"] --> B["System Validates Uniqueness"]
    B -->|"Valid"| C["Channel Created"]
    B -->|"Duplicate"| D["Error: CHANNEL_DUPLICATE_IDENTIFIER"]
  end
  subgraph "Section Management"
    E["Admin/Seller Adds Section"] --> F["Validate Nesting and Uniqueness"]
    F -->|"OK"| G["Section Added or Edited"]
    F -->|"Too Deep"| H["Error: SECTION_DEPTH_EXCEEDED"]
    F -->|"Duplicate Name"| I["Error: SECTION_NAME_DUPLICATE"]
  end
  subgraph "Template Sync"
    J["Admin Updates Template"] --> K["Push to Channels"]
    K -->|"Customized"| L["Flag Divergence for Review"]
    K -->|"Standard"| M["Sections Updated"]
  end
```

# End of Document

# 12-business-rules-and-validation.md

## Introduction
This document defines all central business rules, validation requirements, and evidence preservation logic that the shoppingMall backend must enforce to ensure legal compliance, user trust, and reliable service operation. The document covers requirements for data integrity, order/payment processing, inventory management, error/evidence handling, and the role-based application of these rules.

## Data Integrity & Snapshots

### System-Wide Data Integrity Measures
- THE shoppingMall SHALL ensure that every business action (order, payment, inventory change) produces a permanent, tamper-evident audit record, including actor, timestamp (ISO 8601), original and changed values, and an operation description.
- WHEN transactional data is committed, THE shoppingMall SHALL validate all referential integrity, ensuring no orphaned or dangling records can exist in finalized states.
- THE shoppingMall SHALL prevent the insertion of any record with missing mandatory business fields (referenced in user, product, or transaction profiles).
- WHERE updates or deletes occur to fundamental business data (products, orders, payments, user profiles), THE shoppingMall SHALL snapshot the before and after state (â€œchange snapshotâ€) and link it to audit trails.
- IF a conflict or discrepancy is detected during batch data import/export, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL automatically flag the transaction for admin intervention and preserve all evidence for review.
- WHILE operating under regulatory audit requirements, THE shoppingMall SHALL preserve all business action records in an immutable state for a regulation-compliant retention period (e.g., 5-7 years based on local law).

### Snapshot and Audit Requirements
- WHEN a financial action occurs (order placement, payment, refund, adjustment), THE shoppingMall SHALL create an atomic, time-stamped snapshot of all impacted objects (order, payment, inventory, user, etc.).
- IF a rollback or data restore is triggered, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL revert to the most recent valid snapshot and log all delta changes, including the triggering actor and justification.
- THE shoppingMall SHALL label each snapshot with metadata including source system, operation intent, and business context to support evidence trails during compliance checks and disputes.

### Versioning and Rollback Logic
- WHERE sequential updates are applied to a business object (order, product, payment), THE shoppingMall SHALL increment a version counter and log the full change sequence, supporting both forward and reverse traceability.
- WHEN a critical data error (such as misapplied payment, duplicate delivery, or seller misassignment) is detected, THE shoppingMall SHALL allow admins to initiate a full audit restore to a previous valid state, recording all restoration evidence and rationale.

## Order & Payment Rules

### Core Order Processing Logic
- WHEN a customer places an order, THE shoppingMall SHALL validate that all order items are available (in stock), prices are current and final, all required customer info is present, and that product/seller status permits sale.
- IF an order includes products from multiple sellers, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL split the order into sub-orders by seller, preserving evidence of all pricing, coupons, taxes, and discounts applied per sub-order.
- WHEN a payment is initiated, THE shoppingMall SHALL validate payment method eligibility, enforce fraud checks based on business rules, and confirm that order status and total match the expected values.
- WHEN payment is completed, THE shoppingMall SHALL atomically advance the order status to "paidâ€, trigger inventory allocation, and record all payment gateway evidence (transaction ID, confirmation data, timestamps).
- IF a payment attempt fails, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL NOT create a committed order and SHALL log all input, attempted state transitions, and external payment system responses for post-mortem review.
- WHEN an order is cancelled (customer, seller, admin action), THE shoppingMall SHALL update all associated sub-orders, refunds, coupon usage, inventory, and evidence snapshots, and prevent further untracked actions.
- IF an order eligible for cancellation/refund exceeds business-defined windows (e.g., 7 days from delivery), THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL reject the request and notify the actor with a reason code.
- WHEN a seller/warehouse fails to fulfill an order by a business-defined SLA (e.g., ship within 2 days), THE shoppingMall SHALL notify the customer, trigger evidence collection, and escalate to admin intervention.
- WHEN a refund is processed, THE shoppingMall SHALL record all related evidence (payment gateway ID, timestamp, refund reason) and block further refund actions for that order.

### Payment Rules (Including Evidence and Validation)
- WHEN handling coupons, discounts, or multi-part payments, THE shoppingMall SHALL preserve all original evidence, amounts, and adjustment logic in audit logs, including actor and timestamp.
- IF a chargeback or payment dispute is initiated, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL lock the affected transaction, preserve all evidence, notify admins, and suspend related account actions until investigation completes.

### Refunds and Cancellations
- THE shoppingMall SHALL only process refunds through the original payment channel and SHALL require business justification for each refundâ€”exceptions must be audited and require admin override.
- WHEN processing cancellations, THE shoppingMall SHALL trigger business logic to restore inventory, revert coupons or discounts, and re-compute all evidence snapshots for compliance.

### Edge and Exception Cases
- IF duplicate payments or order submissions are detected within a tolerance window (e.g., 60 seconds), THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL automatically deduplicate, merge, or block actions, record evidence, and notify impacted users.
- WHEN an order or payment discrepancy is detected between shoppingMall and an external integration (e.g., payment gateway), THE shoppingMall SHALL log full evidence snapshots and escalate to admin review.
- WHERE payment or fulfillment occurs in cross-border situations, THE shoppingMall SHALL apply business logic for currency conversion, tax, and regulatory evidence retention, and label all related audit records.


## Inventory Consistency

### Real-time Inventory Handling
- WHEN inventory is allocated to an order, THE shoppingMall SHALL lock and reduce available stock atomically, and update all evidence snapshots simultaneously.
- IF inventory count falls below critical threshold (e.g., 0), THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL block further sales, log the event, and trigger a seller notification.
- WHEN multiple orders attempt to consume the last remaining stock simultaneously, THE shoppingMall SHALL process fulfillment based on order received timestamps and block or reroute later orders, preserving all evidence.
- WHEN a seller manually adjusts inventory (restock, withdrawal, correction), THE shoppingMall SHALL validate changes, capture justification, enforce permission checks, and create evidence snapshots of pre- and post-state.

### Overselling/Underselling Prevention
- WHILE a product is listed for sale, THE shoppingMall SHALL enforce that inventory never goes negative, regardless of order concurrency or external sync processes.
- IF an external channel or feed introduces new inventory inconsistencies (e.g., feed error), THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL quarantine impacted products, notify stakeholders, and require admin review before resuming sales.

### Stock Adjustment Rules
- WHEN inventory changes due to returns, cancellations, or failed payments, THE shoppingMall SHALL atomically restore stock and produce a linked evidence snapshot for traceability.
- SELLERS SHALL NOT be able to retroactively increase/decrease inventory on orders already in a finalized or shipped state; exceptions must require admin override and auditing.

## Error and Evidence Handling

### Error Condition Definitions & User-facing Recovery
- IF any business process fails due to data validation error, THE shoppingMall SHALL deliver a clear error message to the actor, preserve all relevant state and inputs, and assign a traceable error code.
- WHEN an unrecoverable error occurs in an order, payment, or inventory flow, THE shoppingMall SHALL auto-rollback the transaction to the last consistent state and generate a compliance evidence record, including error context and actions taken.
- IF evidence or audit data is missing or corrupted for a critical business action, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL block further actions on affected records until evidence is restored or exception is resolved by admin.

### Evidence Preservation (Audit Trails, Dispute Management)
- THE shoppingMall SHALL persist all evidence for business actions in an immutable, versioned audit log, accessible only to authorized users per regulatory and business policy.
- WHEN a business process enters a dispute, investigation, or compliance challenge, THE shoppingMall SHALL present a full linked trail of all related evidence (snapshots, actor logs, timestamps, justifications) for review.
- WHERE evidence is adjudicated or a business dispute is resolved, THE shoppingMall SHALL close the incident, digitally sign the evidence bundle, and lock records from further editing.

### Legal and Compliance Mandates
- THE shoppingMall SHALL enforce data retention, privacy, and audit requirements per governing law (e.g., GDPR, CCPA, financial transaction regulation), and retain all evidence for the required duration.
- IF compliance time limits expire for any evidence, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL execute documented destruction process and record the action in a compliance log.

## Role-specific Rule Highlights

### Customer
- CUSTOMERS SHALL be prevented from submitting incomplete or fraudulent orders, and all such attempts SHALL be logged for fraud analysis.
- IF a customer repeatedly triggers payment failures or suspected abuse, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL escalate the account for admin/seller review.
- THE system SHALL provide customers an immutable log of their own critical business actions (orders, payments, refunds, returns).

### Seller
- SELLERS SHALL only be permitted to modify the status or content of their own products, orders, and inventory, subject to verification and audit.
- WHEN a seller requests an evidence snapshot or business report, THE shoppingMall SHALL validate permissions, ensure evidence is complete, and deliver it securely.
- IF a seller repeatedly introduces inventory inconsistencies or fails SLAs, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL escalate for admin intervention and evidence preservation.

### Admin
- ADMINS SHALL have authority to audit, override, restore, or correct business actions, with all such operations requiring justification, evidence logs, and independent traceability.
- IF admin overrides a business rule (e.g., late refund, inventory correction), THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL require documentation of rationale, actor, affected objects, and supplementary evidence.
- ADMINS SHALL be able to lock, unlock, or quarantine records (â€œholdâ€) for compliance or security review, linked to evidence and justification.

## Performance & Compliance Requirements
- THE shoppingMall SHALL process all business-critical transactions (order, payment, evidence creation) within 2 seconds in 95% of cases, including audit log writes.
- WHEN an audit or evidence record fails to commit within the performance window, THE shoppingMall SHALL trigger a synchronous retry and escalate failures to admins.
- THE shoppingMall SHALL enforce traceability for all business flows (order, payment, inventory, admin action), with evidence linkage and fast retrieval for compliance or dispute needs.
- ALL error, audit, and evidence recovery scenarios SHALL trigger automated notifications to responsible roles (customer, seller, admin) with contextual information.

## Flowchart: End-to-End Business Rules Interaction

```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "Order Lifecycle & Validation Flow"
    A["Order Initiation (Customer)"] --> B["Validation (Stock, Customer, Product)"]
    B -->|"Passes"| C["Payment Processing"]
    B -->|"Fails"| D["Error & Evidence Snapshot"]
    C -->|"Payment OK"| E["Order Finalize & Evidence Record"]
    C -->|"Payment Fail"| D
    E --> F["Inventory Lock & Update"]
    F --> G["Audit, Logging, Notification"]
    G --> H["Order Complete or Next Step"]
    D --> I["User Notified & Recovery Options"]
  end
  
  subgraph "Admin/Seller Correction & Dispute"
    J["Business Exception (Return, Dispute, Correction)"] --> K["Evidence Collection"]
    K --> L["Admin Validation & Action"]
    L --> M["Snapshot/Audit Log"]
    M --> N["Finalize Resolution/Close Incident"]
  end
```
