# 1. Post, Inquiry & Review Management

## 1.1 Overview
The inquiry, review, and bulletin system allows customers, sellers, and admins to post, interact with, and manage product-related questions, answers, reviews, and general community posts. Core goals include fostering a trustworthy environment, supporting purchase decisions, and maintaining operational integrity through moderation and transparent history.

## 1.2 Definitions
- **Inquiry (Q&A):** Questions and answers posted regarding specific products or services
- **Review:** Ratings, feedback, and media attached to a completed order or service
- **Bulletin Post:** Community announcements, discussions, or notices not directly tied to a single product

### 1.3 Functional Requirements (EARS)

#### Inquiries (Q&A)
- WHEN a customer views a product, THE system SHALL display all public and relevant inquiries and answers for that product, sorted newest first.
- WHEN a customer submits a new inquiry, THE system SHALL validate input length (min 10, max 1,000 characters), check for prohibited content (spam, abuse), and associate the inquiry with the correct product.
- IF the inquiry fails validation (format or prohibited content), THEN THE system SHALL return a user-facing error message identifying the cause and guidance for correction.
- WHEN a seller receives a product inquiry, THE system SHALL provide seller notifications and allow sellers to post answers.
- WHERE an inquiry is answered, THE system SHALL mark the inquiry as "answered"; WHERE it is unresolved longer than a configurable period (e.g., 72 hours), THE system SHALL flag for admin review.
- IF a customer edits or deletes their inquiry, THEN THE system SHALL update status provided edits occur within 24 hours and no answer has been posted (otherwise, lock modification).
- WHEN an admin, seller, or system moderator reviews an inquiry, THE system SHALL allow evidence snapshot downloads of the original and modified states.
- Performance: THE system SHALL return all inquiry-related requests in under 1 second in 95% of cases.

#### Reviews
- WHEN a customer completes an order, THE system SHALL allow posting a review for the purchased product, including text (min 10, max 2,000 characters), star rating (1-5), and media uploads (images/videos, max 5 files, 10MB each).
- IF a review contains prohibited or suspicious content, THEN THE system SHALL hold it for moderation and notify moderators within 10 minutes.
- WHERE a customer edits or deletes a review, THE system SHALL retain immutable audit trails for both original and revised versions, accessible to admins and for dispute resolution.
- WHEN a seller or admin responds to a review, THE system SHALL thread the response under the related review, notify the review author, and prevent further edits after a seller/admin response.
- Performance: THE system SHALL render all reviews and responses within 1.5 seconds for 95% of requests.

#### Bulletins
- WHERE a bulletin post is created by an admin, THE system SHALL automatically pin it and send notifications to all users, respecting user opt-out preferences.
- WHEN a customer, seller, or admin creates a bulletin post, THE system SHALL validate against community guidelines and apply content moderation (keyword, AI, and blacklist check).

## 1.4 Examples & Workflow

```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "Customer Inquiry Submission"
    A["View Product Page"] --> B["Click 'Ask a Question'"]
    B --> C["Write Question & Submit"]
    C --> D{"Passes Validation?"}
  end
  D -->|"Yes"| E["Inquiry Saved & Seller Notified"]
  D -->|"No"| F["Show Validation Error Message"]
  E --> G["Seller Posts Answer"]
  G --> H["Inquiry marked as Answered"]
  H --> I["Visible to All Customers"]
  F --> J["Allow Edit/Retry"]
```

# 2. Comment and Reply Handling

## 2.1 Overview
Customers, sellers, and admins can comment on inquiries, reviews, and bulletin posts. Threaded replies are supported to promote conversation and resolution.

## 2.2 Functional Requirements (EARS)
- WHEN a user submits a comment or reply, THE system SHALL validate the content (min 1, max 500 characters), check for spam/prohibited words, and rate-limit submissions (5 per minute maximum per user).
- WHERE a comment is flagged by more than 3 unique users within 24 hours, THE system SHALL temporarily hide the comment and trigger moderator review.
- IF a comment or reply is deleted, THEN THE system SHALL retain a snapshot for 30 days and mark the parent post as having removed replies.
- WHEN a thread reaches 50 comments, THE system SHALL automatically archive older comments and provide a "view more" option.
- Performance: THE system SHALL process comment-related requests within 1 second for 97% of cases.

# 3. Moderation & Evidence Snapshots

## 3.1 Overview
System supports multi-tier community moderation (automatic, seller, admin) with AI assistance, audit trails, and transparency for dispute handling.

## 3.2 Moderation Functional Requirements (EARS)
- WHEN user-generated content (inquiry, review, comment, bulletin) is submitted, THE system SHALL analyze it via AI for spam/abuse/scam detection, in addition to rules-based checks.
- IF content is flagged by AI or by more than 5 unique users, THEN THE system SHALL quarantine the content, notify admins, and block further user visibility pending review.
- WHEN moderators review flagged content, THE system SHALL present a timeline of edits, flags, and evidence snapshots, plus decision logs (approve, reject, escalate).
- WHERE content requires legal hold (e.g., upon court request), THE system SHALL preserve all evidence snapshots indefinitely and mark as non-deletable.
- WHERE a moderation action is taken, THE system SHALL notify all affected users with sanitized explanations within 5 minutes.
- Performance: THE system SHALL process moderation queue items within 10 seconds.

## 3.3 Evidence Handling
- THE system SHALL retain audit trails for all content modifications, deletions, and flagged statuses, accessible to admins and via court order.
- WHEN evidence snapshots are downloaded, THE system SHALL log access and reason for compliance and security.

# 4. Community Engagement Rules

## 4.1 Overview
Rules to ensure quality discourse, discourage abuse, and encourage meaningful engagement among customers, sellers, and admins.

## 4.2 Engagement Functional Requirements (EARS)
- THE system SHALL enforce the following for all community content:
  - Minimum account age of 24 hours to post
  - No duplicate questions or reviews on the same product or topic
  - Single review per product per order
  - Content marked as spam/abuse in 3+ different threads SHALL result in temporary posting suspension (72 hours)
  - Violations by sellers or repeat offender customers SHALL escalate automatically to admin review and possible longer suspension (configurable)
  - Recognized excellent contributions (as judged by AI or admin) SHALL be surfaced ("Featured") and rewarded with badges
- Performance: THE system SHALL maintain user-facing community features at >99.9% uptime and <2 second overall latency.

# 5. Role-Based Permission Matrix

| Action                                 | Customer | Seller | Admin |
|----------------------------------------|----------|--------|-------|
| Submit product inquiry                 | âœ…       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Answer product inquiry                 | âŒ       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Post review (purchased product only)   | âœ…       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Respond to review                      | âŒ       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Create bulletin post                   | âœ…       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Moderate content                       | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Feature/Hide community content         | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Download evidence snapshots            | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Flag/report community content          | âœ…       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Access flagged/hidden content          | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |

# 6. Error Handling and Performance

- IF invalid, abusive, or duplicate actions are attempted, THEN THE system SHALL return clear error messages specifying next steps or reasons for failure.
- WHEN backend data or evidence is unavailable or system error occurs, THE system SHALL present an error, log details for admin audit, and attempt a retry within 2 seconds.
- All major user-facing operations SHALL meet the specified performance targets as above.

# 7. AI & Analytics

- THE system SHALL provide periodic analytics (dashboard/reporting) to admins and sellers, revealing moderation workload, content trends, flagged abuse and community engagement levels.
- WHEN content is suspected of being AI-generated/manipulated, THE system SHALL flag it for additional review and annotate the content for transparency, without immediate user penalty.

# 8. Compliance and Data Integrity

- THE system SHALL enforce data retention and privacy rules as specified in [Security, Compliance & Data Privacy](./13-security-compliance-and-data-privacy.md), including right of erasure, legal holds, and evidence preservation.

# End of Document

# 1. Introduction
This document provides a comprehensive analysis of the requirements and business flows for the cart and order processing system in the shoppingMall platform. The focus is on clear, actionable business rules, user scenarios, error handling, and performance expectations to guide backend development.

# 2. Cart Functionality & Templates

## 2.1 Core Cart Features
- WHEN a customer is authenticated, THE system SHALL initialize or recall the customer's active cart regardless of device or channel.
- THE system SHALL support addition, update (quantity/option), and removal of products in the cart.
  - Input validation includes product availability, valid SKU/option, and quantity (minimum 1, maximum per business rules).
- WHERE a customer is not authenticated, THE system SHALL support a temporary/session-based cart with upgrade path upon login.
- THE system SHALL maintain separate carts per sales channel when cross-channel shopping is enabled.
- THE system SHALL support bulk cart operations where multiple items can be modified in a single request.

## 2.2 Cart Item Business Rules
- THE cart item SHALL contain snapshots of product name, option, price, discount, coupon eligibility, and seller info as of the time of addition.
- WHERE a product becomes unavailable (out of stock, delisted, paused), THE system SHALL mark the item as invalid and prevent checkout.
- IF the price or option changes after addition to cart but before order, THEN THE system SHALL update or highlight those changes before confirmation.
- THE cart SHALL reflect active promotions, shipping charges, and expected delivery windows.

## 2.3 Edge Cases
- IF the maximum allowed distinct items or quantity is exceeded, THEN THE system SHALL deny the operation and inform the customer.
- WHERE a seller updates product options or closes their store, affected cart items SHALL become invalid and provide actionable messaging.
- THE system SHALL preserve abandoned carts for at least 30 days for authenticated users, enabling recovery and reminders.

# 3. Order Application & Fulfillment

## 3.1 Cart-to-Order Process
- WHEN a customer initiates checkout, THE system SHALL validate all cart items (stock, pricing, eligibility, customer info).
- IF validation fails on any item, THEN THE system SHALL refuse checkout and provide detailed reasons per item.
- THE system SHALL allow select-all or partial item checkout (i.e., not all cart items must be ordered at once).
- AFTER confirmation, THE system SHALL lock cart items, generate the order(s), and deduct stock atomically (to the extent supported by integrations).

## 3.2 Order Creation
- THE order record SHALL snapshot pricing, options, user and seller, channel, discounts, address, payment details, expected delivery, etc.
- WHERE multiple sellers are involved, THE system SHALL generate separate order records (one per seller) under a unified master order ID.
- THE system SHALL record all order creation attempts, failures, and final outcomes with audit logs.

## 3.3 Fulfillment Workflow
- WHEN an order is successfully created, THE system SHALL proceed to payment or reservation phase based on payment method.
- AFTER payment, THE order status SHALL update to "payment confirmed," and fulfillment processes (packing, shipping) SHALL be triggered per seller.
- THE system SHALL provide real-time updates to customers and sellers on order status transitions.

# 4. Payment Method Support

## 4.1 Supported Methods
- THE system SHALL support multiple payment types: credit card, virtual account, digital wallet, bank transfer, on-delivery, and platform-specific credits (coupons, mileage).
- WHERE a payment method is restricted by user, item, or region, THE system SHALL enforce business validation at checkout.
- THE system SHALL handle split payments, promotions, and hybrid models (e.g., combine coupon/mileage plus card payment).
- THE system SHALL synchronize payment status with external processors in near-real time, updating order records and notifying stakeholders.

## 4.2 Payment Exception Handling
- IF payment initiation fails, THEN THE system SHALL provide actionable user errors and allow for retry or payment method change.
- WHERE payment confirmation lags or fails reconciliation, THE system SHALL detect and flag the order as pending, notify admins/sellers, and alert the customer.
- IF payment is later determined invalid (e.g., chargeback, fraud detection), THEN THE system SHALL update the order to dispute or hold, and restrict further fulfillment.

# 5. Order Lifecycle & Status Transitions

## 5.1 Primary Order States
- Cart (unsubmitted)
- Pending payment
- Payment confirmed
- Preparing shipment
- Shipped/In transit
- Delivered
- Completed (confirmed by user or elapsed timeline)
- Cancelled (by user/seller/admin, with reason)
- Returned/Refunded/Partially Fulfilled
- On hold/Disputed

## 5.2 State Transitions
- THE system SHALL enforce allowable state transitions by business logic (see state diagram).
- WHEN an invalid state transition is attempted (e.g., delivery before payment), THE system SHALL forbid it and log the attempt.
- WHERE a transition requires external confirmation (e.g., courier scans or payment), THE system SHALL synchronize state on receipt of confirmation.

## 5.3 Role-based Actions
- Customers: Place/cancel order, track status, initiate returns, confirm receipt.
- Sellers: Accept/prepare shipment, confirm shipment, handle returns/exceptions.
- Admins: Override, dispute, or audit any state (subject to security/compliance requirements).

# 6. Error, Exception & Partial Fulfillment Scenarios

## 6.1 Standard Error Handling
- IF a system or integration error occurs during checkout or payment, THEN THE system SHALL maintain full audit trace and provide clear messaging with next steps.
- IF fulfillment is partially possible (some items cannot be shipped), THEN THE system SHALL support partial fulfillment, offer user choice (ship available now/await all/cancel), and document actions taken.
- THE system SHALL generate automated notifications for any error or abnormality during the order flow to all affected parties (customer, seller, admin).

## 6.2 Edge Cases
- IF seller stock is depleted after order is confirmed, THEN THE system SHALL offer options: refund, exchange, or delayed fulfillment, per user preference and policy rules.
- IF product or payment is under dispute, THEN THE order SHALL be placed on hold and all fulfillment paused until resolution.

# 7. Business Rules, Validation & Performance Requirements

## 7.1 Input and Validation
- All user inputs (cart changes, order data, payment details) are subject to validation: product existence, quantity, user eligibility, payment compliance, address verification, etc.
- All updates to cart/order SHALL be atomic and transactional wherever possible (no partial writes or lost updates).

## 7.2 System Constraints
- Maximum items per cart: configurable per channel/seller, default to 100.
- Maximum order value: configurable; THE system SHALL enforce and notify if exceeded.
- Payment window expiry: default 30 minutes; order auto-cancels after window.
- Returns/cancellation: customers may request within policy limits; system SHALL enforce timing and status-based eligibility.

## 7.3 Error Messaging/Communication
- All user-facing errors SHALL provide actionable feedback in clear language.
- System errors SHALL be logged with unique codes and traceable references accessible for support/admin.

## 7.4 Performance Expectations
- WHEN a customer adds/removes/updates cart items, THE system SHALL respond within 1 second (typical load).
- WHEN a user initiates checkout, THE system SHALL complete cart validation and present order summary within 2 seconds.
- WHEN an order is created and payment confirmed, status updates SHALL be visible to customer/seller/admin within 5 seconds.

# 8. Diagrams & Visual Workflow

## 8.1 Cart-to-Order Flow

```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "Cart Session"
    A["Customer Browses Products"] --> B["Add to Cart"]
    B --> C["Cart Validation (SKU/Price/Stock)"]
    C --> D["Modify/Remove Items"]
    D --> E["Initiate Checkout"]
  end

  subgraph "Order Creation"
    E --> F["Confirm Cart & Delivery Details"]
    F --> G{"All Valid?"}
    G -->|"Yes"| H["Order Record Created"]
    G -->|"No"| I["Abort & Inform User"]
    H --> J["Payment Initiation"]
    J --> K{"Payment Succeeds?"}
    K -->|"Yes"| L["Advance to Fulfillment"]
    K -->|"No"| I
  end

  subgraph "Fulfillment & Completion"
    L --> M["Packing/Shipping"]
    M --> N["Delivery Confirmation"]
    N --> O["Order Completed"]
  end
```

## 8.2 Order Status State Machine

```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
  ["Pending Payment"] --> ["Payment Confirmed"]
  ["Payment Confirmed"] --> ["Preparing Shipment"]
  ["Preparing Shipment"] --> ["Shipped"]
  ["Shipped"] --> ["Delivered"]
  ["Delivered"] --> ["Completed"]
  ["Pending Payment"] --> ["Cancelled"]
  ["Payment Confirmed"] --> ["Cancelled"]
  ["Preparing Shipment"] --> ["Cancelled"]
  ["Shipped"] --> ["Returned"]
  ["Delivered"] --> ["Returned"]
  ["Returned"] --> ["Refunded"]
  ["*"] --> ["On Hold"]
  ["On Hold"] --> ["Pending Payment"]
  ["On Hold"] --> ["Cancelled"]
```

# 9. Conclusion
This specification provides exhaustive business-centric requirements for cart and order processing in shoppingMall, establishing robust business rules, user flows, error handling, and performance benchmarks. This forms a clear blueprint for backend implementation, enabling seamless customer, seller, and admin collaboration throughout the order lifecycle.

file.content:
## 1. Introduction and Scope
This document specifies, in natural language and EARS format, the comprehensive set of business requirements for managing products, product options, categories, tags, and related content within the shoppingMall backend system. The requirements span the entire product lifecycle, cover advanced product configuration, and ensure the support of AI-driven search and change tracking. This document is foundational for system implementers to design backend services that fulfill e-commerce business needs, regulatory standards, and advanced user experience expectations.

Product management in shoppingMall is central to sales, search, and operations. Sellers, admins, and customers interact with products throughout their lifecycle, making precise, role-based specification critical to platform integrity and growth.

## 2. Product Registration & Lifecycle
### 2.1 Product Creation
- WHEN a seller initiates product registration, THE system SHALL present required business fields, including: product name, description, base price, availability status, SKU code, option configuration, images, categories/tags, seller ID, shipping information, and compliance markers.
- THE system SHALL validate that all mandatory fields are provided before product registration is accepted.
- IF a seller attempts to register a product with missing or invalid information, THEN THE system SHALL reject the registration and return a detailed error specifying the missing or invalid fields.
- WHERE an admin creates a product on behalf of a seller, THE system SHALL require explicit role authorization and audit the creation event.
- THE system SHALL assign a unique product identifier and track the creator, timestamp, and version of each product entry.
- THE system SHALL support multi-language and multi-channel product registration to allow international sales and cross-channel publishing.

### 2.2 Product Updates & Revision
- WHEN a seller or admin submits product updates, THE system SHALL validate all changed fields against current business rules and maintain record of prior versions for audit.
- IF an update attempts to alter immutable fields (e.g., product ID), THEN THE system SHALL reject the update and log the attempt as a validation error.
- THE system SHALL maintain a full revision history (snapshots) of product data for traceability, with access permissions based on role.
- WHEN a product is updated, THE system SHALL trigger re-indexing for AI search and notify impacted business units (e.g., inventory, channel managers).

### 2.3 Product Activation, Deactivation, and Deletion
- Sellers can activate/deactivate their own products. Admins can do so for any product.
- WHEN a product is deactivated, THE system SHALL immediately hide it from customer-facing interfaces and mark its state as inactive.
- IF a product tied to active orders is deleted or deactivated, THEN THE system SHALL block the operation and explain the order dependency.
- THE system SHALL allow soft deletion (logical removal) â€“ physical data is preserved for compliance and analysis unless legal removal is ordered by admin with proper evidence.

### 2.4 Product Suspension & Compliance Locking
- WHERE a product is in breach of compliance or reported, THE system SHALL enable admins to suspend listing and tag the case for further review.
- IF a product is locked for investigation, THEN THE system SHALL prohibit all modifications except by authorized compliance roles.

## 3. Option & Inventory Management
### 3.1 Product Options
- Sellers can create products with variable options (e.g., color, size, bundle configurations).
- WHEN a seller configures product options, THE system SHALL support nested options, dependent selections, and distinct SKU assignment per option.
- THE system SHALL enforce that every valid product variant has a unique SKU, and that SKUs comply with marketplace conventions.
- IF a seller defines overlapping or conflicting SKUs, THEN THE system SHALL block the configuration and provide a resolution guide.

### 3.2 Inventory and Stock Logic
- THE system SHALL allow sellers to set and update inventory levels (stock quantities) per option, with threshold-based alerts for low or out-of-stock states.
- WHEN a product or option is set out of stock, THE system SHALL prevent new orders and display a configurable out-of-stock message to customers.
- Inventory updates must be atomic and reflect immediately across all customer and admin interfaces.
- IF the same SKU is updated concurrently by multiple processes, THEN THE system SHALL detect the conflict and require manual resolution by sellers or admins.
- THE system SHALL maintain inventory change logs, showing the adjusting role (seller, admin) and timestamps.

### 3.3 Inventory Reservation, Adjustment, and Reconciliation
- WHEN a customer places an order, THE system SHALL reserve (deduct) inventory for all corresponding SKUs and options at order time.
- IF payment or order completion fails, THEN THE system SHALL release previously reserved inventory without delay.
- THE system SHALL support manual and scheduled reconciliation processes to ensure stock consistency across all sales channels.

## 4. Category & Tag Systems
### 4.1 Category Management
- Admins manage master category structures. Sellers can request sub-categories or tag products within allowed categories.
- WHEN a category is added, changed, or removed, THE system SHALL validate structural integrity, uniqueness, and block removal of non-empty categories (categories with live products or children).
- THE system SHALL allow nesting and depth limitation of categories configurable by admin business rules.
- WHERE cross-channel consistency is required, THE system SHALL synchronize category structures and mapping tables between channels.

### 4.2 Tagging and Classification
- Sellers, with optional admin review, can tag products for marketing, AI search, event campaigns, or overlays.
- THE system SHALL enforce restrictions on reserved tags, prohibited keywords, or redundant labels across the marketplace.
- IF a tag is blacklisted or banned, THEN THE system SHALL reject tag application and notify the assigning role with reasoning.

## 5. Content/SEO Management
### 5.1 Product Content & Rich Media
- Sellers must provide structured product content (names, descriptions, features) and media (images, videos, attachments) in compliance with quality guidelines.
- THE system SHALL validate image dimensions, format, media count limits, and non-duplication before acceptance.
- THE system SHALL support auto-generation or AI suggestion for content fields (e.g., SEO titles, search keywords) where configured.

### 5.2 SEO Metadata & AI Search Fields
- THE system SHALL enable sellers and admins to specify or review SEO-relevant metadata for each product, including meta title, description, open graph tags, and AI-search contexts.
- WHEN SEO data is missing or suboptimal, THE system SHALL flag products and offer recommendations for improvement.
- IF a product is flagged for low-quality or duplicate SEO, THEN THE system SHALL restrict its eligibility for search campaigns or ad boosts until resolved.

## 6. Snapshot & Change Tracking
- THE system SHALL log every change to product, option, category, and content data including actor (role), fields changed, before/after values, and timestamp.
- Snapshots must be accessible with proper authorization for auditing, conflict resolution, and regulatory review.
- WHEN requested, THE system SHALL export historical product/category data for specific time ranges in standard formats (e.g., CSV, JSON).

## 7. Business Rules & Validation
- All product, option, category, tag, and content management must honor business validation logic defined in the [Business Rules and Validation Document](./12-business-rules-and-validation.md).
- THE system SHALL enforce role-based access controls â€“ only authorized roles may perform creation, update, deactivation, promotion, or removal actions as enumerated in [User Roles and Authentication](./03-user-roles-and-authentication.md).
- Validation rules include, but are not limited to: field format checks, uniqueness, mandatory status, prohibited value lists, compliance with product policy, and logical consistency (e.g., non-negative inventory, valid category path).
- All validation errors must be actionable and user-facing, indicating rectification steps where possible.

## 8. Error Handling and Recovery Scenarios
- IF a requested product, option, or category is not found, THEN THE system SHALL display a clear not-found error and log the lookup failure context.
- IF a business rule failure or validation error occurs, THEN THE system SHALL block the operation, return the specific error code, and explain corrective steps in natural language.
- IF concurrent modification or synchronization errors arise, THEN THE system SHALL detect conflict, halt non-idempotent actions, and require user choice to override or abort.
- Manual recovery flows must be defined for unrecoverable or ambiguous product states.

## 9. Performance and User Experience Constraints
- WHEN listing products, categories, or inventory status, THE system SHALL respond within 2 seconds for standard result sets (â‰¤100 items) under normal load.
- WHEN product data is updated, THE system SHALL propagate changes to all relevant modules and channels within 10 seconds.
- THE system SHALL provide instant, consistent inventory status for any product option visible to customers.
- THE system SHALL allow bulk uploads/edits and handle files up to 100MB with progress tracking and error recovery.

## 10. Relationships with Other Documents
- For detailed user flows and error scenarios, refer to the [User Scenarios and Flows Document](./04-user-scenarios-and-flows.md).
- For comprehensive business validation logic, see [Business Rules and Validation Document](./12-business-rules-and-validation.md).

---

# Product and Category Management Flow Diagram

```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "Product Registration"
    A["Seller/Admin Initiates Product Creation"]
    B["Input Validation & Image Upload"]
    C{"Validation Success?"}
    D["Product Registered & ID Issued"]
    E["Validation Error: Block & Respond"]
  end
  
  subgraph "Option & Inventory"
    F["Configure Product Options/SKUs"]
    G["Set Inventory per Option"]
    H["Atomic Inventory Update"]
  end

  subgraph "Category & Tag Ops"
    I["Admin/Seller Manages Category/Tags"]
    J{"Category/Tag Rules Met?"}
    K["Apply to Product"]
    L["Block: Compliance/Error"]
  end

  A --> B
  B --> C
  C -->|"Yes"| D
  C -->|"No"| E
  D --> F
  F --> G
  G --> H
  D --> I
  I --> J
  J -->|"Yes"| K
  J -->|"No"| L
```

# Business Context
This requirement analysis report establishes the BUSINESS logic and detailed process rules for user roles and authentication within the AI-driven shoppingMall backend. The purpose is to clarify every business rule related to user roles (customer, seller, admin), permissions, authentication processes, token management, and account lifecycle scenarios without dictating technical implementation.

## User Roles Overview
- customer: End-users accessing the shopping mall for browsing, purchasing, order management, personalization, coupon usage, and communication. Authentication required for all personalized or transactional features.
- seller: Users who manage and list products, oversee customer orders, handle inventory, and customer service for their offerings. May act as customers, but must have verified seller status for product listing and sales management.
- admin: System administrators managing the platform globally, channel operations, compliance, analytics, moderation, and all advanced configuration. Holds maximum authority and access. Authentication via high-security means.

# Detailed Requirement Analysis

## Introduction and Context
THE shoppingMall backend SHALL provide a secure, robust, and flexible authentication and authorization model supporting all defined user roles and business activities, ensuring both regulatory compliance and seamless user experience.

## Role Catalog & Definitions
### Role Definitions

| Role Name | Description | Typical Actions |
|-----------|-------------|-----------------|
| customer  | End-user; shops, manages orders, reviews, accrues loyalty/mileage, communicates, uses favorites | Register, login, browse, purchase, manage account, write reviews, favorite products |
| seller    | Vendor; lists products, manages inventory, handles orders, provides customer service | Register/convert to seller, manage products, process orders, customer communication |
| admin     | Platform admin; full platform control, moderation, configuration, compliance | Manage users, sellers, settings, content moderation, analytics |

### Role Business Rules Using EARS
- THE shoppingMall backend SHALL require authentication for all transactional and personalized actions.

- WHEN a customer registers, THE system SHALL validate email, password, and agreement to terms as mandatory.

- WHEN a seller registers or requests seller privileges, THE system SHALL require additional business verification before seller privileges are granted.

- WHEN an admin account is provisioned, THE system SHALL enforce high-security registration, with multi-factor requirements and explicit role assignment by an existing admin.

- WHERE a user holds multiple roles (e.g., seller as customer), THE system SHALL reflect the union of all applicable permissions in session.

- WHEN a non-authenticated user attempts a restricted action, THE system SHALL deny access and guide the user to authentication.


## Authentication Flows (API-Driven)
### Registration
- WHEN a new user registers, THE system SHALL collect minimum required information:
  - For customer: Email (validated format), password (policy compliant), full name, marketing opt-in (optional), agreement to terms (required)
  - For seller: Above, plus business identification, tax details, business name and address, seller agreement, and verification status
  - For admin: Only existing admin can create; multi-factor enforced; role cannot be self-assigned

- IF registration data is incomplete or invalid, THEN THE system SHALL reject registration and present clear, actionable feedback for every missing/incomplete field.

### Login & Session Creation
- WHEN a user submits login credentials via API, THE system SHALL validate credentials and respond within 2 seconds for 99% of requests.

- IF authentication fails due to bad credentials, THEN THE system SHALL return clear error codes and guidance for password recovery.

- WHEN login succeeds, THE system SHALL generate a new session, issue JWT access and refresh tokens, and log session metadata (device, channel, IP, issued time, expiration).

- WHERE multi-channel access is required, THE system SHALL allow concurrent sessions per device/channel, but enforce session expiration and revocation rules by configuration.

- WHEN a user logs out via API, THE system SHALL immediately revoke active session tokens for that device or channel.

- WHERE abnormal login patterns are detected (multiple failed attempts, impossible travel, flagged IPs), THE system SHALL trigger account lockout or step-up authentication per security policy.

### Password & Credential Management
- WHEN a user requests password reset, THE system SHALL verify email (and, for seller/admin, additional verification step) and issue a time-limited reset token via secure delivery channel.

- WHEN changing password, THE system SHALL enforce password policy (min 10 characters, at least one upper/lower/digit/special char), require old password for confirmation, and require new password differ from last three passwords.

- WHEN a password reset link/token is used, THE system SHALL invalidate the token after a single use or after expiration.

### Account Verification and Role Escalation
- WHEN a seller role is requested, THE system SHALL place the user in a "pending seller" state until external verification (documents provided, validated, and status set to "verified seller").

- WHEN admin privileges are assigned, THE system SHALL require authorization by an existing admin, with all actions fully auditable.

### Session and Token Lifecycle
- THE system SHALL issue JWTs as standard tokens for API authentication. 
- THE access token SHALL expire in 15 minutes; refresh token SHALL expire after 14 days by default.
- THE session SHALL expire immediately upon logout, device de-authentication, or admin revocation.
- WHERE user requests "log out everywhere", THE system SHALL revoke all active sessions and tokens for that user account.

### Cross-Channel Authentication Support
- WHERE a user authenticates on multiple channels (web, mobile app, partner platform), THE system SHALL support independent session tracking per channel, with unified access and synchronized logout where requested.

### Authentication Process Flow (Mermaid Diagram)
```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "User Registration and Login"
    A["Begin Registration"]
    B["Input Required Info"]
    C["Email Validation"]
    D["Seller Verification (if seller)"]
    E["Account Provisioned"]
    F["Login via API"]
    G["Credential Validation"]
    H["Session & Tokens Issued"]
  end
  
  subgraph "Session Maintenance"
    I["Access Control via JWT"]
    J["API Call Authorization"]
    K["Session Expiration/Revocation"]
    L["Logout / Forced Logout"]
  end
  
  A --> B --> C
  C -->|"If seller"| D
  D --> E
  C -->|"Else"| E
  E --> F
  F --> G --> H
  H --> I --> J
  J --> K
  K --> L
```

## Role-based Permission Matrix

| Action                                             | customer | seller | admin |
|----------------------------------------------------|----------|--------|-------|
| Register as user                                  | âœ…       | âœ…     | âŒ    |
| Register/Apply for seller                         | âŒ       | âœ…     | âŒ    |
| Customer login                                    | âœ…       | âœ…*    | âŒ    |
| Seller dashboard access                           | âŒ       | âœ…     | âŒ    |
| Admin dashboard / platform mgmt                   | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Product listing                                   | âŒ       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Order placement (checkout)                        | âœ…       | âœ…*    | âŒ    |
| Order management                                  | âœ…       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Manage own account/profile                        | âœ…       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| View history, reviews, favorites                  | âœ…       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Review posting/moderation                         | âœ…       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Coupon/mileage accrual and redemption             | âœ…       | âœ…     | âŒ    |
| Access to analytics/reports                       | âŒ       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Compliance & content moderation                   | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Configuration of categories, business rules       | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| System-wide user or seller management             | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| JWT refresh & token management                    | âœ…       | âœ…     | âœ…    |

*Seller users may also act as customers, i.e., perform customer actions

## Session, Token, and Security Management

- THE shoppingMall backend SHALL enforce all session, token, and authentication security standards according to current compliance (see [Security, Compliance & Data Privacy](./13-security-compliance-and-data-privacy.md)).

- WHEN a session is established, THE system SHALL securely store session metadata, including device information, authentication time, and channel.

- WHERE a tokenâ€™s integrity is in doubt (e.g., signature mismatch, expired, tampered), THE system SHALL reject the request and prompt re-authentication.

- WHEN a user or admin initiates session revocation, THE system SHALL immediately terminate the affected session(s) and ensure no further access is granted via revoked tokens.

- IF authentication is attempted with a stale or reused refresh token, THEN THE system SHALL flag the account for security review and deny new sessions.

## Account Lifecycle Scenarios

- WHEN user registration is successful, THE system SHALL send a confirmation email or notification.

- IF a userâ€™s email is not confirmed within 48 hours, THEN THE system SHALL restrict access until confirmation.

- WHEN a user deactivates their account, THE system SHALL erase authentication tokens and mark account as inactive; reactivation SHALL require verification.

- WHEN a user is banned or permanently disabled by admin action, THE system SHALL revoke all sessions and display a ban notification on auth attempts.

- WHERE password reset or session recovery is in progress, THE system SHALL restrict other sensitive actions until process completion.

- WHEN business or regulatory rules change (e.g., password policy, onboarding requirements), THE system SHALL apply changes to all affected subsequent authentications.

## Common Error Scenarios and Handling
- IF a user exceeds failed login attempts (e.g., 5 failures within 1 hour), THEN THE system SHALL temporarily lock the account for 15 minutes and notify the user.

- IF role escalation attempts (e.g., customer to seller) are incomplete or falsified, THEN THE system SHALL deny escalation and provide reasoned feedback.

- IF admin login attempts are detected from non-whitelisted IPs or abnormal contexts, THEN THE system SHALL enforce additional approval measures and alert security admins.

## Performance Expectations
- THE shoppingMall backend SHALL perform all authentication and authorization processes, including token issuance and validation, within 2 seconds for 99% of cases.

- THE system SHALL synchronize session revocation and logout actions across devices/channels within 10 seconds.

- Session and token management SHALL support failover and high availability to prevent authentication downtime.

# End of Requirements

# Table of Contents for shoppingMall Backend â€“ Requirements Analysis

## Document Overview
This Table of Contents (ToC) provides a comprehensive, organized overview of every core document comprising the requirements specification for the shoppingMall backend platform. Its design ensures that both developers and business stakeholders can quickly find, understand, and navigate to any aspect of the service logic. Each entry includes a descriptive link and a brief summary of its scope so backend teams can immediately identify the specification area relevant to their current implementation focus.


## Service Vision & Value Proposition
Describes the high-level purpose, business opportunity, and AI-driven advantages of the shoppingMall backend. Sets out why the platform is being built and the unique differentiators it offers the market.

## 1. Introduction and Scope
This document specifies, in natural language and EARS format, the comprehensive set of business requirements for managing products, product options, categories, tags, and related content within the shoppingMall backend system. The requirements span the entire product lifecycle, cover advanced product configuration, and ensure the support of AI-driven search and change tracking. This document is foundational for system implementers to design backend services that fulfill e-commerce business needs, regulatory standards, and advanced user experience expectations.

Product management in shoppingMall is central to sales, search, and operations. Sellers, admins, and customers interact with products throughout their lifecycle, making precise, role-based specification critical to platform integrity and growth.

## 2. Product Registration & Lifecycle
### 2.1 Product Creation
- WHEN a seller initiates product registration, THE system SHALL present required business fields, including: product name, description, base price, availability status, SKU code, option configuration, images, categories/tags, seller ID, shipping information, and compliance markers.
- THE system SHALL validate that all mandatory fields are provided before product registration is accepted.
- IF a seller attempts to register a product with missing or invalid information, THEN THE system SHALL reject the registration and return a detailed error specifying the missing or invalid fields.
- WHERE an admin creates a product on behalf of a seller, THE system SHALL require explicit role authorization and audit the creation event.
- THE system SHALL assign a unique product identifier and track the creator, timestamp, and version of each product entry.
- THE system SHALL support multi-language and multi-channel product registration to allow international sales and cross-channel publishing.

### 2.2 Product Updates & Revision
- WHEN a seller or admin submits product updates, THE system SHALL validate all changed fields against current business rules and maintain record of prior versions for audit.
- IF an update attempts to alter immutable fields (e.g., product ID), THEN THE system SHALL reject the update and log the attempt as a validation error.
- THE system SHALL maintain a full revision history (snapshots) of product data for traceability, with access permissions based on role.
- WHEN a product is updated, THE system SHALL trigger re-indexing for AI search and notify impacted business units (e.g., inventory, channel managers).

### 2.3 Product Activation, Deactivation, and Deletion
- Sellers can activate/deactivate their own products. Admins can do so for any product.
- WHEN a product is deactivated, THE system SHALL immediately hide it from customer-facing interfaces and mark its state as inactive.
- IF a product tied to active orders is deleted or deactivated, THEN THE system SHALL block the operation and explain the order dependency.
- THE system SHALL allow soft deletion (logical removal) â€“ physical data is preserved for compliance and analysis unless legal removal is ordered by admin with proper evidence.

### 2.4 Product Suspension & Compliance Locking
- WHERE a product is in breach of compliance or reported, THE system SHALL enable admins to suspend listing and tag the case for further review.
- IF a product is locked for investigation, THEN THE system SHALL prohibit all modifications except by authorized compliance roles.

## 3. Option & Inventory Management
### 3.1 Product Options
- Sellers can create products with variable options (e.g., color, size, bundle configurations).
- WHEN a seller configures product options, THE system SHALL support nested options, dependent selections, and distinct SKU assignment per option.
- THE system SHALL enforce that every valid product variant has a unique SKU, and that SKUs comply with marketplace conventions.
- IF a seller defines overlapping or conflicting SKUs, THEN THE system SHALL block the configuration and provide a resolution guide.

### 3.2 Inventory and Stock Logic
- THE system SHALL allow sellers to set and update inventory levels (stock quantities) per option, with threshold-based alerts for low or out-of-stock states.
- WHEN a product or option is set out of stock, THE system SHALL prevent new orders and display a configurable out-of-stock message to customers.
- Inventory updates must be atomic and reflect immediately across all customer and admin interfaces.
- IF the same SKU is updated concurrently by multiple processes, THEN THE system SHALL detect the conflict and require manual resolution by sellers or admins.
- THE system SHALL maintain inventory change logs, showing the adjusting role (seller, admin) and timestamps.

### 3.3 Inventory Reservation, Adjustment, and Reconciliation
- WHEN a customer places an order, THE system SHALL reserve (deduct) inventory for all corresponding SKUs and options at order time.
- IF payment or order completion fails, THEN THE system SHALL release previously reserved inventory without delay.
- THE system SHALL support manual and scheduled reconciliation processes to ensure stock consistency across all sales channels.

## 4. Category & Tag Systems
### 4.1 Category Management
- Admins manage master category structures. Sellers can request sub-categories or tag products within allowed categories.
- WHEN a category is added, changed, or removed, THE system SHALL validate structural integrity, uniqueness, and block removal of non-empty categories (categories with live products or children).
- THE system SHALL allow nesting and depth limitation of categories configurable by admin business rules.
- WHERE cross-channel consistency is required, THE system SHALL synchronize category structures and mapping tables between channels.

### 4.2 Tagging and Classification
- Sellers, with optional admin review, can tag products for marketing, AI search, event campaigns, or overlays.
- THE system SHALL enforce restrictions on reserved tags, prohibited keywords, or redundant labels across the marketplace.
- IF a tag is blacklisted or banned, THEN THE system SHALL reject tag application and notify the assigning role with reasoning.

## 5. Content/SEO Management
### 5.1 Product Content & Rich Media
- Sellers must provide structured product content (names, descriptions, features) and media (images, videos, attachments) in compliance with quality guidelines.
- THE system SHALL validate image dimensions, format, media count limits, and non-duplication before acceptance.
- THE system SHALL support auto-generation or AI suggestion for content fields (e.g., SEO titles, search keywords) where configured.

### 5.2 SEO Metadata & AI Search Fields
- THE system SHALL enable sellers and admins to specify or review SEO-relevant metadata for each product, including meta title, description, open graph tags, and AI-search contexts.
- WHEN SEO data is missing or suboptimal, THE system SHALL flag products and offer recommendations for improvement.
- IF a product is flagged for low-quality or duplicate SEO, THEN THE system SHALL restrict its eligibility for search campaigns or ad boosts until resolved.

## 6. Snapshot & Change Tracking
- THE system SHALL log every change to product, option, category, and content data including actor (role), fields changed, before/after values, and timestamp.
- Snapshots must be accessible with proper authorization for auditing, conflict resolution, and regulatory review.
- WHEN requested, THE system SHALL export historical product/category data for specific time ranges in standard formats (e.g., CSV, JSON).

## 7. Business Rules & Validation
- All product, option, category, tag, and content management must honor business validation logic defined in the [Business Rules and Validation Document](./12-business-rules-and-validation.md).
- THE system SHALL enforce role-based access controls â€“ only authorized roles may perform creation, update, deactivation, promotion, or removal actions as enumerated in [User Roles and Authentication](./03-user-roles-and-authentication.md).
- Validation rules include, but are not limited to: field format checks, uniqueness, mandatory status, prohibited value lists, compliance with product policy, and logical consistency (e.g., non-negative inventory, valid category path).
- All validation errors must be actionable and user-facing, indicating rectification steps where possible.

## 8. Error Handling and Recovery Scenarios
- IF a requested product, option, or category is not found, THEN THE system SHALL display a clear not-found error and log the lookup failure context.
- IF a business rule failure or validation error occurs, THEN THE system SHALL block the operation, return the specific error code, and explain corrective steps in natural language.
- IF concurrent modification or synchronization errors arise, THEN THE system SHALL detect conflict, halt non-idempotent actions, and require user choice to override or abort.
- Manual recovery flows must be defined for unrecoverable or ambiguous product states.

## 9. Performance and User Experience Constraints
- WHEN listing products, categories, or inventory status, THE system SHALL respond within 2 seconds for standard result sets (â‰¤100 items) under normal load.
- WHEN product data is updated, THE system SHALL propagate changes to all relevant modules and channels within 10 seconds.
- THE system SHALL provide instant, consistent inventory status for any product option visible to customers.
- THE system SHALL allow bulk uploads/edits and handle files up to 100MB with progress tracking and error recovery.

## 10. Relationships with Other Documents
- For detailed user flows and error scenarios, refer to the [User Scenarios and Flows Document](./04-user-scenarios-and-flows.md).
- For comprehensive business validation logic, see [Business Rules and Validation Document](./12-business-rules-and-validation.md).

# AI Shopping Mall Backend: Service Vision & Value Proposition

## Project Purpose & Market Need

The goal of the AI Shopping Mall backend project is to deliver a robust, intelligent, and scalable core that powers a next-generation e-commerce platform. In the current digital retail landscape, traditional shopping mall backends often fall short in providing the real-time, personalized, and adaptive experiences users have come to expect. Fragmented systems, limited differentiation between competitors, lack of intelligent automation, and reactive rather than proactive customer experiences are common pain points.

**Key market needs:**
- Users (customers) demand personalized shopping journeys, with tailored recommendations, adaptive pricing, and seamless support across devices and channels.
- Sellers require platforms that can intelligently match them with the right buyers, simplify order and inventory management, and automate customer engagement.
- Admins and operators need powerful analytics and tools to drive growth, ensure compliance, and preemptively improve platform security and robustness.

The project specifically addresses gaps in:
- Personalization at scale
- Proactive support and fraud prevention
- Seller enablement and automation
- Platform scalability and cross-channel consistency

## Business Opportunity & Differentiators

The platform is positioned to seize the rapidly expanding opportunities in omni-channel, AI-driven retail. By leveraging a unified, AI-centric backend, it can deliver value to all parties in the ecosystem:

- **Differentiators:**
  - Embedded AI across personalization, pricing, and fraud detection
  - Automated seller tools for onboarding, engagement, and compliance
  - Deep analytics and feedback loops for continuous system improvement
  - Real-time, cross-channel order and inventory management
  - Advanced loyalty, rewards, and community features enabled by data insights
- **Strategic business opportunities:**
  - Enable new forms of value-based customer engagement
  - Rapidly onboard and empower micro-sellers and brands through smart automation
  - Monetize insights, behavior data, and platform intelligence (e.g., targeted promotions, partner APIs)
  - Expand internationally through scalable compliance, localization, and channel routing

## Stakeholder Goals

| Stakeholder   | Primary Goals |
|--------------|--------------|
| Customers    | Effortless shopping, relevant offers, trusted transactions, unified account across devices/channels, transparency in pricing and reviews |
| Sellers      | Efficient product/catalog management, intelligent sales analytics, direct engagement with buyers, automated promotions, reliable order fulfillment, responsive customer service |
| Admins       | Global view and granular control, enforce platform rules and compliance, monitor risk and anomalies, configure business logic, manage channel expansion and localization |
| Business Executives | Rapid growth, diversified revenue, industry leadership in AI e-commerce, high user retention |
| Technology Partners | Seamless integration, clear APIs, access to analytics, fast onboarding |

The backend is structured to fulfill these goals by embedding them into core business processes, accessible via role-based workflows and management tools.

## AI-driven Value Proposition

AI is the backbone of this shopping mall backend and is directly applied to:
- **Personalized product and content recommendations** based on behavioral analytics, purchase history, and user segmentation
- **Dynamic and predictive pricing**, optimizing conversion and maximizing value automatically
- **Smart fraud detection** leveraging behavior anomaly modeling to proactively block high-risk transactions and notify stakeholders
- **Automated customer support** (e.g., chatbots, inquiry routing) for real-time, 24/7 assistance
- **Seller enablement** through AI-driven dashboards, sales predictions, and inventory alerts
- **Advanced loyalty management**, providing dynamic rewards, targeted campaigns based on engagement metrics, and AI-powered gamification elements

**EARS Requirement Examples:**
- WHEN a customer browses the catalog, THE system SHALL show tailored recommendations based on their browsing and purchase patterns.
- WHEN a suspicious transaction is detected, THE system SHALL flag it and alert the appropriate admin for review within 30 seconds.
- WHEN a seller uploads a new product, THE system SHALL suggest optimal categorization and pricing using AI models trained on sales data.
- WHILE an order is in transit, THE system SHALL provide real-time tracking updates and predictive delivery estimates to the customer.

## Success Metrics

The platform's progress and ultimate success are measured using clear, actionable Key Performance Indicators (KPIs):

| Metric | Definition |
|--------|------------|
| Monthly Active Users (MAU) | Number of unique active user accounts per month (all roles) |
| Customer Satisfaction Score (CSAT) | Aggregate result from post-interaction and periodic surveys, must remain above 85% |
| Seller Growth Rate | Quarterly count of new sellers onboarded, goal of sustained 10% MoM increase |
| Order Conversion Rate | Ratio of completed purchases to unique sessions, should exceed industry benchmark |
| Fraud Incident Rate | Number of verified fraudulent orders per 1,000, must remain below 0.1 |
| Platform Uptime | Percentage of time backend is available (target: 99.95%+) |
| Feature Adoption | Usage analytics for AI-driven features (e.g., recommendation engine activation rates) |
| Time-to-Resolution (Support) | Median time to resolve customer/seller issues, goal: <2 hours |

Performance on these dimensions is monitored in real time and informs both business/AI roadmaps and immediate operational priorities.

## Related Documentation Reference

For more detailed business model components, see the [Business Model Overview and Monetization Guide](./02-business-model.md). For user roles, authentication, and permission systems, see the [User Roles and Authentication Specification](./03-user-roles-and-authentication.md). Comprehensive user scenarios and flows are detailed in the [End-to-End User Workflows and Use Cases Document](./04-user-scenarios-and-flows.md).

# 12-business-rules-and-validation.md

## Introduction
This document defines all central business rules, validation requirements, and evidence preservation logic that the shoppingMall backend must enforce to ensure legal compliance, user trust, and reliable service operation. The document covers requirements for data integrity, order/payment processing, inventory management, error/evidence handling, and the role-based application of these rules.

## Data Integrity & Snapshots

### System-Wide Data Integrity Measures
- THE shoppingMall SHALL ensure that every business action (order, payment, inventory change) produces a permanent, tamper-evident audit record, including actor, timestamp (ISO 8601), original and changed values, and an operation description.
- WHEN transactional data is committed, THE shoppingMall SHALL validate all referential integrity, ensuring no orphaned or dangling records can exist in finalized states.
- THE shoppingMall SHALL prevent the insertion of any record with missing mandatory business fields (referenced in user, product, or transaction profiles).
- WHERE updates or deletes occur to fundamental business data (products, orders, payments, user profiles), THE shoppingMall SHALL snapshot the before and after state (â€œchange snapshotâ€) and link it to audit trails.
- IF a conflict or discrepancy is detected during batch data import/export, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL automatically flag the transaction for admin intervention and preserve all evidence for review.
- WHILE operating under regulatory audit requirements, THE shoppingMall SHALL preserve all business action records in an immutable state for a regulation-compliant retention period (e.g., 5-7 years based on local law).

### Snapshot and Audit Requirements
- WHEN a financial action occurs (order placement, payment, refund, adjustment), THE shoppingMall SHALL create an atomic, time-stamped snapshot of all impacted objects (order, payment, inventory, user, etc.).
- IF a rollback or data restore is triggered, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL revert to the most recent valid snapshot and log all delta changes, including the triggering actor and justification.
- THE shoppingMall SHALL label each snapshot with metadata including source system, operation intent, and business context to support evidence trails during compliance checks and disputes.

### Versioning and Rollback Logic
- WHERE sequential updates are applied to a business object (order, product, payment), THE shoppingMall SHALL increment a version counter and log the full change sequence, supporting both forward and reverse traceability.
- WHEN a critical data error (such as misapplied payment, duplicate delivery, or seller misassignment) is detected, THE shoppingMall SHALL allow admins to initiate a full audit restore to a previous valid state, recording all restoration evidence and rationale.

## Order & Payment Rules

### Core Order Processing Logic
- WHEN a customer places an order, THE shoppingMall SHALL validate that all order items are available (in stock), prices are current and final, all required customer info is present, and that product/seller status permits sale.
- IF an order includes products from multiple sellers, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL split the order into sub-orders by seller, preserving evidence of all pricing, coupons, taxes, and discounts applied per sub-order.
- WHEN a payment is initiated, THE shoppingMall SHALL validate payment method eligibility, enforce fraud checks based on business rules, and confirm that order status and total match the expected values.
- WHEN payment is completed, THE shoppingMall SHALL atomically advance the order status to "paidâ€, trigger inventory allocation, and record all payment gateway evidence (transaction ID, confirmation data, timestamps).
- IF a payment attempt fails, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL NOT create a committed order and SHALL log all input, attempted state transitions, and external payment system responses for post-mortem review.
- WHEN an order is cancelled (customer, seller, admin action), THE shoppingMall SHALL update all associated sub-orders, refunds, coupon usage, inventory, and evidence snapshots, and prevent further untracked actions.
- IF an order eligible for cancellation/refund exceeds business-defined windows (e.g., 7 days from delivery), THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL reject the request and notify the actor with a reason code.
- WHEN a seller/warehouse fails to fulfill an order by a business-defined SLA (e.g., ship within 2 days), THE shoppingMall SHALL notify the customer, trigger evidence collection, and escalate to admin intervention.
- WHEN a refund is processed, THE shoppingMall SHALL record all related evidence (payment gateway ID, timestamp, refund reason) and block further refund actions for that order.

### Payment Rules (Including Evidence and Validation)
- WHEN handling coupons, discounts, or multi-part payments, THE shoppingMall SHALL preserve all original evidence, amounts, and adjustment logic in audit logs, including actor and timestamp.
- IF a chargeback or payment dispute is initiated, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL lock the affected transaction, preserve all evidence, notify admins, and suspend related account actions until investigation completes.

### Refunds and Cancellations
- THE shoppingMall SHALL only process refunds through the original payment channel and SHALL require business justification for each refundâ€”exceptions must be audited and require admin override.
- WHEN processing cancellations, THE shoppingMall SHALL trigger business logic to restore inventory, revert coupons or discounts, and re-compute all evidence snapshots for compliance.

### Edge and Exception Cases
- IF duplicate payments or order submissions are detected within a tolerance window (e.g., 60 seconds), THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL automatically deduplicate, merge, or block actions, record evidence, and notify impacted users.
- WHEN an order or payment discrepancy is detected between shoppingMall and an external integration (e.g., payment gateway), THE shoppingMall SHALL log full evidence snapshots and escalate to admin review.
- WHERE payment or fulfillment occurs in cross-border situations, THE shoppingMall SHALL apply business logic for currency conversion, tax, and regulatory evidence retention, and label all related audit records.


## Inventory Consistency

### Real-time Inventory Handling
- WHEN inventory is allocated to an order, THE shoppingMall SHALL lock and reduce available stock atomically, and update all evidence snapshots simultaneously.
- IF inventory count falls below critical threshold (e.g., 0), THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL block further sales, log the event, and trigger a seller notification.
- WHEN multiple orders attempt to consume the last remaining stock simultaneously, THE shoppingMall SHALL process fulfillment based on order received timestamps and block or reroute later orders, preserving all evidence.
- WHEN a seller manually adjusts inventory (restock, withdrawal, correction), THE shoppingMall SHALL validate changes, capture justification, enforce permission checks, and create evidence snapshots of pre- and post-state.

### Overselling/Underselling Prevention
- WHILE a product is listed for sale, THE shoppingMall SHALL enforce that inventory never goes negative, regardless of order concurrency or external sync processes.
- IF an external channel or feed introduces new inventory inconsistencies (e.g., feed error), THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL quarantine impacted products, notify stakeholders, and require admin review before resuming sales.

### Stock Adjustment Rules
- WHEN inventory changes due to returns, cancellations, or failed payments, THE shoppingMall SHALL atomically restore stock and produce a linked evidence snapshot for traceability.
- SELLERS SHALL NOT be able to retroactively increase/decrease inventory on orders already in a finalized or shipped state; exceptions must require admin override and auditing.

## Error and Evidence Handling

### Error Condition Definitions & User-facing Recovery
- IF any business process fails due to data validation error, THE shoppingMall SHALL deliver a clear error message to the actor, preserve all relevant state and inputs, and assign a traceable error code.
- WHEN an unrecoverable error occurs in an order, payment, or inventory flow, THE shoppingMall SHALL auto-rollback the transaction to the last consistent state and generate a compliance evidence record, including error context and actions taken.
- IF evidence or audit data is missing or corrupted for a critical business action, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL block further actions on affected records until evidence is restored or exception is resolved by admin.

### Evidence Preservation (Audit Trails, Dispute Management)
- THE shoppingMall SHALL persist all evidence for business actions in an immutable, versioned audit log, accessible only to authorized users per regulatory and business policy.
- WHEN a business process enters a dispute, investigation, or compliance challenge, THE shoppingMall SHALL present a full linked trail of all related evidence (snapshots, actor logs, timestamps, justifications) for review.
- WHERE evidence is adjudicated or a business dispute is resolved, THE shoppingMall SHALL close the incident, digitally sign the evidence bundle, and lock records from further editing.

### Legal and Compliance Mandates
- THE shoppingMall SHALL enforce data retention, privacy, and audit requirements per governing law (e.g., GDPR, CCPA, financial transaction regulation), and retain all evidence for the required duration.
- IF compliance time limits expire for any evidence, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL execute documented destruction process and record the action in a compliance log.

## Role-specific Rule Highlights

### Customer
- CUSTOMERS SHALL be prevented from submitting incomplete or fraudulent orders, and all such attempts SHALL be logged for fraud analysis.
- IF a customer repeatedly triggers payment failures or suspected abuse, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL escalate the account for admin/seller review.
- THE system SHALL provide customers an immutable log of their own critical business actions (orders, payments, refunds, returns).

### Seller
- SELLERS SHALL only be permitted to modify the status or content of their own products, orders, and inventory, subject to verification and audit.
- WHEN a seller requests an evidence snapshot or business report, THE shoppingMall SHALL validate permissions, ensure evidence is complete, and deliver it securely.
- IF a seller repeatedly introduces inventory inconsistencies or fails SLAs, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL escalate for admin intervention and evidence preservation.

### Admin
- ADMINS SHALL have authority to audit, override, restore, or correct business actions, with all such operations requiring justification, evidence logs, and independent traceability.
- IF admin overrides a business rule (e.g., late refund, inventory correction), THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL require documentation of rationale, actor, affected objects, and supplementary evidence.
- ADMINS SHALL be able to lock, unlock, or quarantine records (â€œholdâ€) for compliance or security review, linked to evidence and justification.

## Performance & Compliance Requirements
- THE shoppingMall SHALL process all business-critical transactions (order, payment, evidence creation) within 2 seconds in 95% of cases, including audit log writes.
- WHEN an audit or evidence record fails to commit within the performance window, THE shoppingMall SHALL trigger a synchronous retry and escalate failures to admins.
- THE shoppingMall SHALL enforce traceability for all business flows (order, payment, inventory, admin action), with evidence linkage and fast retrieval for compliance or dispute needs.
- ALL error, audit, and evidence recovery scenarios SHALL trigger automated notifications to responsible roles (customer, seller, admin) with contextual information.

## Flowchart: End-to-End Business Rules Interaction

```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "Order Lifecycle & Validation Flow"
    A["Order Initiation (Customer)"] --> B["Validation (Stock, Customer, Product)"]
    B -->|"Passes"| C["Payment Processing"]
    B -->|"Fails"| D["Error & Evidence Snapshot"]
    C -->|"Payment OK"| E["Order Finalize & Evidence Record"]
    C -->|"Payment Fail"| D
    E --> F["Inventory Lock & Update"]
    F --> G["Audit, Logging, Notification"]
    G --> H["Order Complete or Next Step"]
