# 12-business-rules-and-validation.md

## Introduction
All central business rules, validation requirements, and evidence preservation logic for the shoppingMall backend ensure legal compliance, user trust, and reliable operational integrity. This specification addresses every aspect of data integrity, order and payment validation, inventory management, error and evidence handling, and proprietary rules for each role (customer, seller, admin). All requirements use EARS syntax for actionability and traceability.

## Data Integrity & Snapshots

### System-Wide Data Integrity Measures
- THE shoppingMall SHALL ensure that every business action (such as order, payment, inventory change, or user update) produces a permanent, tamper-evident audit record. The audit record SHALL contain actor, timestamp (ISO 8601), original and changed values, operation type, and a business context description.
- WHEN transactional data is committed to the core backend, THE shoppingMall SHALL validate referential integrity, ensuring no orphaned or dangling records can exist in any finalized business state.
- THE shoppingMall SHALL block the insertion or creation of any record missing mandatory business fields from user, product, order, or transaction profiles.
- WHEN updates or deletes occur to fundamental data (product, order, payment, user profile), THE shoppingMall SHALL create change snapshots capturing the before and after state, and link each to immutable audit trails.
- IF a conflict or data discrepancy (mismatched total, missing entity, invalid state) is detected during batch import/export or business process automation, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL flag the transaction for admin intervention and preserve complete evidence, including source system, triggering action, and data context.
- WHILE operating under an active regulatory compliance regime, THE shoppingMall SHALL preserve all business action records in an immutable state for a regulation-compliant retention period (such as 5-7 years, per jurisdiction).

### Evidence Lifecycle and Audit Requirements
- WHEN a financial or regulatory action (order placement, payment, refund, escalation, punitive adjustment) occurs, THE shoppingMall SHALL create a time-stamped, atomic snapshot of all directly or indirectly impacted objects (order, payment, inventory, user, evidence, etc.).
- IF a rollback, undo, or restoration is initiated, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL restore data to the most recent valid snapshot, log all delta changes, identify the triggering actor, and require a business justification.
- THE shoppingMall SHALL label every snapshot with metadata: source system, intent of operation, and business context, ensuring exhaustive evidence search and presentation during legal, compliance, or dispute audits.
- WHERE sequential updates are applied to a business entity (such as order, product, payment, or inventory item), THE shoppingMall SHALL increment the business object's version and maintain a fully ordered, traceable change sequence supporting forward and backward auditing.
- WHEN a critical data error (payment applied to wrong order, duplicate shipping, seller misassignment, mismatched regulatory key) is detected, THE shoppingMall SHALL permit authorized admins to run a full audit restore to a previous valid state and SHALL require documentation of the restoration evidence, rationale, and all resulting deltas.
- WHEN legal or compliance-mandated evidence export is triggered, THE shoppingMall SHALL provide traceable, tamper-evident, and digitally signed content.

## Order & Payment Rules

### Core Order and Payment Logic
- WHEN a customer submits an order, THE shoppingMall SHALL validate at submission that all selected items are available and in stock, prices are final and synchronized, customer identity and delivery information is present and validated, and the product and seller are in saleable status.
- IF an order contains items from multiple sellers, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL split the transaction into sub-orders per seller, preserving independent evidence for price, coupon, tax, and discount calculations per sub-order.
- WHEN a payment is initiated, THE shoppingMall SHALL validate the payment method eligibility, enforce anti-fraud and compliance rules based on business settings, and confirm that order status, line items, and payment totals exactly match the committed evidence and business policy.
- WHEN payment is successfully completed, THE shoppingMall SHALL atomically advance the order status to "paid,â€ trigger immediate inventory allocation, and record immutable evidence from payment gateways (transaction IDs, confirmations, financial timestamps).
- IF a payment attempt fails, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL NOT create or lock a committed order, and SHALL log all attempt context, transitions, input parameters, and received payment system responses for future review.
- WHEN an order is cancelled (by customer, seller, or admin), THE shoppingMall SHALL atomically update all related sub-orders and records, manage all linked refunds, lapse coupon/discount usages, update inventory, record snapshots, and prevent any future untracked changes.
- IF a cancellation/refund is requested outside policy (e.g., after 7 days from item delivery or policy cut-off), THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL reject the request with a specific reason code and automated notification.
- WHEN the seller or associated warehouse misses a fulfillment SLA (such as shipping within 2 business days), THE shoppingMall SHALL notify the customer automatically, collect supporting evidence, and escalate to admin for investigation.
- WHEN processing a refund, THE shoppingMall SHALL record all required gateway evidence and audit details (payment channel, reason, timestamp, admin/seller/customer trigger) and restrict the order from being refunded again.

### Payment Evidence and Fraud Scenarios
- WHEN handling multi-step payments (coupon discount, split tender, etc.), THE shoppingMall SHALL preserve all evidence (amounts, actors, timestamps, adjustment sequences) in immutable logs.
- IF a chargeback, reversal, or payment dispute is reported for any order, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL lock the affected transaction and evidence, notify appropriate admins, bar further related actions, and keep all records until dispute closure.

### Refunds, Cancellations, and Enforcement
- THE shoppingMall SHALL process all refunds exclusively through the original payment channel, requiring business justification for every refund; admin override and new evidence entry are required for exceptions.
- WHEN a cancellation is validated and processed, THE shoppingMall SHALL restore product inventory, revert all coupon or discount benefits to the original state, recompute all evidence, and record a compliant audit trail.
- IF a duplicate payment or order submission is detected within a short tolerance window (e.g., 60 seconds), THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL merge, deduplicate, or block such attempts, make a comprehensive evidence record, and notify all affected users with explanatory reason.
- WHEN any order or payment discrepancy is detected between shoppingMall and external integrations (such as payment gateways or logistics providers), THE shoppingMall SHALL record a complete evidence snapshot and escalate for immediate admin review.
- WHERE payment or fulfillment involves regulatory or cross-border rules (currency conversion, VAT/export/import), THE shoppingMall SHALL follow all compliance requirements for evidence labeling, metadata, and reporting.

### SLA and Compliance Rules
- THE shoppingMall SHALL support business-defined SLAs for all major order, payment, and fulfillment activities. When an SLA is violated, THE system SHALL automatically flag the incident, escalate to the next-level reviewer, and collect notification evidence for compliance.

## Inventory Consistency

### Real-Time Inventory Validation
- WHEN inventory is allocated due to a new order, THE shoppingMall SHALL atomically deduct from available stock, lock reserved levels, and update all associated evidence files synchronously.
- IF inventory falls to or below the critical threshold (zero or negative), THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL immediately block future checkout/fulfillment, log the event with stakeholder notifications, and permit only admin-authorized adjustments moving forward.
- WHEN multiple orders present simultaneous requests for the last available inventory, THE shoppingMall SHALL confirm fulfillment based on earliest received timestamp, blocking or rerouting later orders, and preserving all event evidence.
- WHEN a manual stock adjustment is made by a seller (restock, deduction, correction), THE shoppingMall SHALL validate all permissions, require justification, ensure compliance to business policy, and create paired before/after evidence snapshots.
- WHEN inventory is returned to stock due to order cancelation, return, or payment failure, THE shoppingMall SHALL restore stated inventory atomically and link to traceable audit records.
- SELLERS SHALL be forbidden from retroactively adjusting inventory for finalized or shipped orders; business exceptions require admin approval with required evidence entry.

### Oversell and Undersell Prevention
- WHILE an item is published and open for sale, THE shoppingMall SHALL enforce never-negative inventory regardless of order concurrency or suspected double-sell edge cases.
- IF an external feed, third-party sync, or API introduces mismatch in inventory levels, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL isolate the inconsistent product, block new sales, notify both seller and admin, and require compliance review and explicit release.

### Cross-Channel Synchronization and Stock Auditing
- WHEN inventory is synchronized or merged from external channels, THE shoppingMall SHALL trigger a full audit reconciliation and preserve side-by-side evidence, supporting cross-channel consistency and business reporting.

## Error Handling & Evidence Management

### User-Facing Errors and Recovery
- IF any business process fails due to user, system, or data validation error, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL provide a human-readable error referencing specific failure context, log all input parameters, and assign a unique error code for support traceability.
- WHEN an unrecoverable error impacts an order, payment, or inventory flow, THE shoppingMall SHALL atomically roll back all affected actions to the last consistent state and generate a comprehensive evidence record including causal analysis, affected entities, and all attempted remediations.
- WHEN a user initiates a correction action (such as cancel, return, evidence request), THE shoppingMall SHALL validate permissions, surface relevant evidence, and deliver success or error status with actionable feedback.
- IF evidence or audit data is missing, corrupt, or fails a compliance integrity check, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL lock affected business records, block subsequent actions, and escalate to admin or compliance admin for restoration.

### Evidence and Audit Trail Preservation
- THE shoppingMall SHALL store all business event evidence in an immutable, versioned audit log. Audit log access is restricted and auditable; only authorized parties may retrieve evidence bundles.
- WHEN a dispute, investigation, or compliance query is initiated, THE shoppingMall SHALL present a complete, chronologically linked trail of all related evidence (snapshots, actors, workflow logs, justifications, notifications, etc.) for admin and legal review.
- WHERE evidence for a dispute is adjudicated or the business incident is resolved, THE shoppingMall SHALL lock and digitally sign the evidence bundle, sealing it from further edits per legal standard.
- THE shoppingMall SHALL perform periodic evidence integrity checks for critical business flows (such as order, payment, admin override, or inventory adjustment), raising alerts for missing or suspicious entries.

### Legal and Regulatory Mandates
- THE shoppingMall SHALL comply with all regional and global data retention, privacy, and audit laws (such as GDPR, CCPA, SOX, financial regulations), preserving evidence for required periods and prohibiting unauthorized deletion.
- WHEN a regulatory time limit for evidence retention expires, THE shoppingMall SHALL securely destroy all qualifying data, logging the destruction and reason per compliance requirement; destruction logs are themselves retained for future audits.
- IF legal hold or court-requested evidence preservation is triggered, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL block any record modification or deletion until the hold is formally released.

## Role-Specific Rule Summaries

### Customer-Facing
- WHEN a customer attempts to submit an incomplete, fraudulent, or otherwise invalid order, THE shoppingMall SHALL reject the attempt, record all details for fraud prevention, and notify relevant compliance stakeholders.
- IF a customer repeatedly triggers suspected abuse (such as serial payment failures, excessive refund requests), THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL flag the account for elevated admin/seller review and evidence tagging.
- THE shoppingMall SHALL maintain an immutable, user-accessible log for each customer's major business events (orders, payments, refunds, returns, evidence requests), supporting transparency and self-service history queries.

### Seller-Facing
- SELLERS SHALL only alter or manage products, orders, and inventory strictly within their authorized domain, subject to verification and audit at all times.
- WHEN a seller requests an evidence report or business audit snapshot, THE shoppingMall SHALL validate the request, ensure all records are complete and up to date, and deliver securely via authorized channel.
- IF a seller repeatedly fails to maintain inventory accuracy, violates SLAs, or triggers compliance incidents, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL escalate for admin action and evidence preservation review.

### Admin/Compliance
- ADMINS SHALL have explicit authority to audit, override, restore, or quarantine any business action, but every admin-level change MUST capture a complete evidence record (actor, timestamp, operation, rationale, affected data snapshot).
- IF an admin override is enacted (e.g., late refund, inventory correction, SLAs adjustment), THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL require explicit documentation in the audit trail, justification text, and referential linkage to all impacted business records.
- ADMINS SHALL be able to place business records "on hold" (locking further action) for compliance review or active investigation, with evidence of cause and associated notifications to relevant roles.

## Performance and Response Expectations
- THE shoppingMall SHALL process business-critical actions (order, payment, evidence entry or update, inventory mutation, audit read/write) within 2 seconds 95% of the time. This includes synchronous audit log or evidence writes.
- WHEN evidence or audit records fail to commit within the performance window, THE shoppingMall SHALL synchronously retry at least once. Persistent failure SHALL escalate as a blocking error to the admin for intervention.
- THE shoppingMall SHALL ensure all business and compliance flows are fully traceable: every order, payment, inventory transaction, and admin override SHALL link to its supporting evidence for compliance, dispute, or review with retrieval response within 2 seconds.
- ALL major error, audit, and evidence recovery scenarios SHALL automatically trigger notifications to the correct roles (customer, seller, admin) with contextual details for next-step action and support.

## User and System Flow Diagram: Business Rules and Validation

```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "Order & Business Validation Lifecycle"
    A["Order Initiation (Customer)"] --> B["Validation (Stock, Identity, Product, Compliance)"]
    B -->|"Passes"| C["Payment Processing"]
    B -->|"Fails"| D["Error Handling & Evidence Snapshot"]
    C -->|"Payment OK"| E["Order Finalized & Evidence Recording"]
    C -->|"Payment Fail"| D
    E --> F["Inventory Allocation & Stock Audit"]
    F --> G["Audit Logging, Notifications, Compliance Escalation"]
    G --> H["Order Completion or Next Lifecycle Step"]
    D --> I["User Feedback & Recovery Options"]
  end
  subgraph "Admin/Seller Exception & Dispute Management"
    J["Business Exception (Return, Dispute, Correction)"] --> K["Evidence Collection & Justification"]
    K --> L["Admin Validation, Approval, Action"]
    L --> M["Snapshot & Audit Trail Entry"]
    M --> N["Resolution Finalization & Incident Closure"]
  end
```

## Integration and Cross-Reference
- All product, user, order, and evidence management rules herein are referenced in or relied upon by the following requirement documents:
    - [Product and Category Management Requirements](./05-product-and-category-management.md)
    - [User Roles and Authentication Requirements](./03-user-roles-and-authentication.md)
    - [Cart and Order Processing Requirements](./07-cart-and-order-processing.md)
    - [Security, Compliance & Data Privacy](./13-security-compliance-and-data-privacy.md)
    - [User Scenarios and Service Flows](./04-user-scenarios-and-flows.md)
- Any future expansion or modification of business logic regarding validation, compliance, or audit must update this document accordingly.

file.content:
# Introduction
Channels in shoppingMall represent distinct sales outlets, brand sites, or marketing presences (such as web, mobile app, external marketplace, or brand-specific microsites). Sections are hierarchical groupings within channels organizing content, products, or campaigns (such as home, sale, new arrivals, promotions, or custom landing pages).

The ability to register, configure, and manage multiple channels and sections is central to customizing business operations, branding, marketing, and analytics. Cross-channel consistency, hierarchical flexibility, and robust permission management are required to facilitate complex retail operations.

# Definitions & Scope
- **Channel**: A top-level sales or display route in shoppingMall (e.g., "Web Storefront", "Mobile App Companion", "Brand A Microsite").
- **Section**: An organized container within a channel, potentially nested, housing content and/or products (e.g., "Home Banner", "Electronics", "Seasonal Deals").
- **Section Type**: Classification such as main/landing/feature/subsection, with business logic attached.

This document governs:
- Channel onboarding and removal
- Channel configuration and visibility
- Section structure and business rules within each channel
- Role-based permissions and restrictions
- Cross-channel consistency mechanisms
- Analytics for section/channel performance

# Channel Registration & Configuration

## Channel Lifecycle
- WHEN an admin creates a new channel, THE system SHALL require a unique channel identifier, display name, type (web, mobile, marketplace, etc.), primary locale, and target audience description.
- IF a channel with the same unique identifier exists, THEN THE system SHALL prevent creation and provide an error code CHANNEL_DUPLICATE_IDENTIFIER.
- WHEN a channel is updated, THE system SHALL allow change of display name, configuration parameters, associated sections, and active statusâ€”while retaining immutable unique identifier.
- IF a channel is deactivated, THEN THE system SHALL mark it as inactive, restrict further section management, and maintain all records for reporting and auditability.
- WHEN an admin removes a channel, THE system SHALL require confirmation and perform a logical delete, archiving all linked sections and disabling customer/seller access within that channel context.

## Business Rules & Validation Logic
- THE system SHALL validate that each channel's display name is unique and non-empty (case-insensitive).
- THE system SHALL require configuration of at least one section (main landing section) before activating the channel for public use.
- IF a channel is missing required configuration (primary section, default locale, or target audience), THEN THE system SHALL block activation with error code CHANNEL_CONFIG_INCOMPLETE.
- WHEN a seller requests channel-specific actions (e.g., product posting), THE system SHALL restrict by seller's assigned channels.

## Channel Configuration Parameters
| Parameter            | Required | Description                                                          |
|----------------------|----------|----------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Unique Identifier    | Yes      | Internal primary key (must be system-wide unique)                    |
| Display Name         | Yes      | User-facing channel name (unique per channel)                        |
| Type                 | Yes      | Enum: web, mobile, marketplace, custom                               |
| Primary Locale       | Yes      | Main language/region setup for channel                               |
| Target Audience      | Yes      | Description for business/analytics                                   |
| Active Status        | Yes      | Boolean - true (active), false (inactive)                            |
| Section List         | Yes      | References to root sections assigned to channel                      |
| Parent Channel (opt) | No       | For hierarchical/cascading channel models (not always used)          |

## Role-based Permissions in Channel Management
- WHERE admin role, THE system SHALL allow full creation/updates/removal of channels.
- WHERE seller role, THE system SHALL restrict channel edit permissions to those for which seller has explicit access (no channel creation/removal allowed by sellers).
- WHERE customer role, THE system SHALL restrict access to channel browsing and content consumption only.

# Section Hierarchy & Management

## Section Types and Structure
- THE system SHALL support nested, multi-level sections per channel. Levels and types include:
    - Main Section (top-level)
    - Subsection (nested)
    - Landing Page Section (default for channel)
    - Special Purpose (campaign, sale, custom feature)
- THE system SHALL permit reordering of sections within a channel, reflecting changes instantly in channel navigation.
- WHEN a section is created, THE system SHALL require assignment to a parent channel and, optionally, a parent section if not root.
- IF attempting to nest a section beyond 5 levels deep, THEN THE system SHALL reject and return error code SECTION_DEPTH_EXCEEDED.

## Section Assignment, Business Rules, and Validation
- WHEN activating or reassigning sections, THE system SHALL validate no cyclic dependencies or orphaned branches occur.
- EACH section SHALL have a unique name within its parent section or within the root of the channel.
- WHERE section name is not unique within its scope, THE system SHALL reject creation/update with error code SECTION_NAME_DUPLICATE.
- WHEN a section is deactivated (not deleted), THE system SHALL hide all child sections unless explicit override is set.
- IF a section is deleted, THEN THE system SHALL archive section records and all immediate descendants, preserving for audit and analytics.

## Section Reordering and Movement Logic
- THE system SHALL allow reordering sections via explicit index or drag-and-drop (business context, not UI), updating the order instantly for all business processes.
- WHILE reordering sections, THE system SHALL prevent assigning duplicate sort indexes.

## Section Visibility, Activity, and Restrictions
- EACH section SHALL have an active/inactive flag and a visibility type (public, seller-only, admin-only).
- WHERE a section is set to seller-only, THE system SHALL restrict content/products to be accessed only by assigned sellers.
- WHERE a section is for admin purposes, THE system SHALL hide from customers and sellers (e.g., staging, test sections).

# Cross-Channel Consistency & Analytics

## Synchronization & Consistency
- THE system SHALL permit configuration templates for sections that can be reused across multiple channels.
- WHEN a template is updated, THE system SHALL propagate changes to all associated channel sections unless marked "customized" for that instance.
- IF a section is customized in a channel, THEN template updates SHALL not overwrite channel-specific configurations.
- THE system SHALL allow batch operations (activate, reorder, archive) for sections across selected channels.

## Handling Differences/Conflicts
- IF a sectionâ€™s structure diverges from template due to channel-specific customization, THEN THE system SHALL flag for business review and analytics tagging.
- WHEN conflicts are detected between templates and customized sections, THE system SHALL present audit records and change history for reconciliation.

## Analytics
- THE system SHALL record creation, update, view, and reordering actions for every channel/section in an immutable business log.
- THE system SHALL generate analytics reports per channel and per section (e.g., products displayed, clicks, sales sourced, active/inactive counts).
- WHERE data inconsistency or unusual behavior is detected (e.g., sections with no activity, looped structures), THE system SHALL flag for admin review.

# Error Handling & Recovery
- IF any business rule or validation fails, THEN THE system SHALL return clear error codes, descriptive messages, and preserve attempted input for user/admin review.
- IF critical structural errors (e.g., cyclic dependency, orphan sections, missing main section), THEN THE system SHALL lock affected channels/sections for recovery and warn relevant user roles.
- WHEN a channel/section operation partially succeeds (e.g., batch operation), THE system SHALL detail which items failed and provide actionable information for each.

# Performance & User Experience Requirements
- WHEN a channel or section is created, updated, or deleted, THE system SHALL complete all operations within 2 seconds in 95% of cases, ensuring a seamless business management experience.
- WHEN activating or deactivating sections for a popular channel (50,000+ subscribers or products), THE system SHALL update all business logic references across the system instantly, or within 5 seconds for rare edge cases.

# Business Rules Reference Table
| Rule Ref | Condition                                         | Expected Business Behavior                                             |
|----------|---------------------------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------|
| BR-101   | Duplicate Channel Identifier                      | Reject with CHANNEL_DUPLICATE_IDENTIFIER                              |
| BR-102   | Missing Main Section on Channel Activation        | Block activation: CHANNEL_CONFIG_INCOMPLETE                           |
| BR-103   | Section Depth > 5                                | Reject with SECTION_DEPTH_EXCEEDED                                    |
| BR-104   | Non-unique Section Name Within Parent             | Reject with SECTION_NAME_DUPLICATE                                    |
| BR-105   | Attempt to Edit Channel/Section as Unauthorized   | Reject with PERMISSION_DENIED                                         |
| BR-106   | Section Customization Diverges from Template      | Flag for analytics, present audit trail                               |
| BR-107   | Cyclic/Orphan Structure in Section Tree           | Lock affected entities, require admin recovery                        |

# Role-based Permission Matrix
| Action                       | Customer | Seller | Admin |
|------------------------------|----------|--------|-------|
| Browse Channel & Sections    | âœ…       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Register New Channel         | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Edit Channel Properties      | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Remove/Deactivate Channel    | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Add/Edit/Remove Sections     | âŒ       | Partial| âœ…    |
| Assign Products to Sections  | âŒ       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Reorder Sections             | âŒ       | Partial| âœ…    |
| Configure Section Templates  | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| View Analytics               | âŒ       | Partial| âœ…    |

- "Partial" means possible if the seller is granted permission on their assigned channels/sections only.

# Example User Scenarios
## Scenario 1: Admin Registers a New Mobile Channel
- Admin chooses "Create Channel", enters required data with unique ID and display name, sets type to "mobile", selects English-US locale, and specifies "Mobile App Shoppers" as audience.
- System requires at least one main section before activation.
- Admin creates "Home", "Deals", and "Categories" sections, assigns to channel root, and activates channel.
- System validates all business rules, logs actions, and channel is now visible to assigned audiences.

## Scenario 2: Seller Edits Assigned Channel Section
- Seller logs in and is authorized for "Brand Outlet" channel. Seller cannot create new channel but can add a new promotional section within assigned channel.
- System restricts nesting beyond 5 levels and validates unique section name. Seller successfully adds "Summer Sale" section, sets to active and seller-only.

## Scenario 3: Template Synchronization
- Admin updates "Standard Home Layout" template. System pushes changes to all channels using this template except those flagged as "customized".
- One channel diverges due to local editsâ€”system flags for admin analytics review and change reconciliation.

# Mermaid Diagram: Channel and Section Management Flow
```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "Channel Management"
    A["Admin Creates Channel"] --> B["System Validates Uniqueness"]
    B -->|"Valid"| C["Channel Created"]
    B -->|"Duplicate"| D["Error: CHANNEL_DUPLICATE_IDENTIFIER"]
  end
  subgraph "Section Management"
    E["Admin/Seller Adds Section"] --> F["Validate Nesting and Uniqueness"]
    F -->|"OK"| G["Section Added or Edited"]
    F -->|"Too Deep"| H["Error: SECTION_DEPTH_EXCEEDED"]
    F -->|"Duplicate Name"| I["Error: SECTION_NAME_DUPLICATE"]
  end
  subgraph "Template Sync"
    J["Admin Updates Template"] --> K["Push to Channels"]
    K -->|"Customized"| L["Flag Divergence for Review"]
    K -->|"Standard"| M["Sections Updated"]
  end
```

# End of Document

# Channel and Section Management Requirements (shoppingMall)

## Introduction
Channels in shoppingMall represent discrete sales, marketing, or branding outletsâ€”such as web storefronts, mobile apps, external marketplaces, and partner or brand-specific microsites. Sections are hierarchical, ordered groupings within channels that structure navigational content, products, or promotions (including homepages, sales, featured categories, custom landing areas, and campaign pages). Robust orchestration of channels and sections enables organizational agility, multi-brand/multi-tenant commerce, tailored customer experiences, and omni-channel analytics. All roles (admin, seller, customer) interact with channel/section structures according to business policies, permissions, and scope. Only explicit business requirements are enumerated belowâ€”no technical, integration, or UI detail is specified.

## 1. Channel Registration & Configuration

### 1.1 Channel Lifecycle and Business Logic
- WHEN an admin creates a new channel, THE system SHALL require and validate all mandatory parameters: unique identifier (system-wide unique), non-empty display name (unique across channels, case-insensitive), type (`web`, `mobile`, `marketplace`, `custom`), primary locale, and target audience description.
- THE system SHALL prevent creation if any required parameter is invalid, missing, or if the display name or identifier duplicates an existing channel. IF validation fails, THEN THE system SHALL return clear error codes (`CHANNEL_DUPLICATE_IDENTIFIER`, `CHANNEL_CONFIG_INCOMPLETE`, etc.) with specific guidance for correction.
- WHEN a channel is edited by an authorized admin, THE system SHALL allow modification of any business parameter except the immutable unique identifier; all changes SHALL be logged for audit and traceability.
- IF a channel is deactivated, THEN THE system SHALL mark it as inactive, block all further section management (except audit or restoration), and retain historical records for analytics or regulatory review. Customer/seller access SHALL be gated by channel status.
- WHEN an admin requests channel removal, THE system SHALL require explicit confirmation, perform a logical delete by archiving the channel and all linked section records, and disable any customer/seller interactions inside that channel context. Physical deletion SHALL never occur except under explicit business policy and with full evidence logging.
- WHERE a parent-child relationship exists between channels (e.g., local variant, white-label, syndicated model), THE system SHALL require validation on cascading changes and prevent orphaned child channels.

### 1.2 Mandatory Channel Parameters Table
| Parameter           | Required | Description                                                 |
|---------------------|----------|-------------------------------------------------------------|
| Unique Identifier   | Yes      | System-wide unique, immutable key                           |
| Display Name        | Yes      | User- and admin-facing label; must be unique (case-insens.)  |
| Type                | Yes      | `web`, `mobile`, `marketplace`, or `custom`                 |
| Primary Locale      | Yes      | Default language/region for content/sorting                 |
| Target Audience     | Yes      | Free-text or controlled vocab, used for analytics/marketing |
| Active Status       | Yes      | Boolean: true (active), false (inactive)                    |
| Section List        | Yes      | References to root sections assigned to channel             |
| Parent Channel      | No       | For hierarchical/cascading models, enables multi-tenant ops |

### 1.3 Business Rule Validation (EARS Examples)
- THE system SHALL block activation of any channel that lacks minimum configuration (at least one main section, primary locale, target audience) with error `CHANNEL_CONFIG_INCOMPLETE`.
- WHERE a channel or display name already exists, THE system SHALL reject creation/update with `CHANNEL_DUPLICATE_IDENTIFIER` error.
- WHEN a seller attempts to post products or manage a section in a channel they're not assigned to, THE system SHALL enforce permission blockade and return error `PERMISSION_DENIED`.
- IF attempted deactivation of a channel would orphan sections or cascade to locked channels, THEN THE system SHALL block the action, inform the admin, and provide an audit trail for manual recovery.

### 1.4 Role-Based Permissions
- WHERE admin role, THE system SHALL allow creation, modification, activation/deactivation, and removal of channels and full authority over channel-section structure.
- WHERE seller role, THE system SHALL restrict editing permissions to those channels to which the seller has explicit access (and never permit creation/removal of channels).
- WHERE customer role, THE system SHALL grant permission for channel browsing, product/content interaction, and section traversal but deny administrative or seller-only functions.

## 2. Section Hierarchy & Business Rules

### 2.1 Section Types and Assignment
- THE system SHALL support unlimited channels; within each channel, the system SHALL enable nested, multi-level sections structured as Main Section (root), Subsection (one or more nested levels), Landing Page Section (default or special use), and Special Purpose Section (campaign, promotion, custom features).
- WHEN any section is created by an eligible admin or seller, THE system SHALL require association with a parent channel andâ€”except for rootâ€”a parent section. All assignments SHALL be validated to prevent cycles or logic errors.
- IF attempting to nest a section deeper than five levels, THEN THE system SHALL reject the operation and return error code `SECTION_DEPTH_EXCEEDED`.
- WHEN reordering is invoked, THE system SHALL enable explicit index-based or business-driven sorting; any sort order changes SHALL be applied to channel navigation logic immediately, with all sorts maintaining unique index values (duplicate or invalid assignments are rejected with error `SECTION_SORT_DUPLICATE`).

### 2.2 Section Validation, Visibility, and Role Restrictions
- EACH section SHALL have a unique name within its parent section or channel root; inputs are case-insensitive. WHERE the name is not unique, THE system SHALL block creation with error `SECTION_NAME_DUPLICATE`.
- WHEN a section is activated or re-assigned, THE system SHALL validate to ensure no orphaned, cyclic, or otherwise invalid hierarchies result. IF cycles/orphans detected, THEN THE system SHALL reject the move, lock the affected branch, and detail recovery steps for resolution: error `SECTION_CYCLIC_OR_ORPHAN`.
- EACH section SHALL expose a `visibility` flag (public, seller-only, admin-only) and `active/inactive` status. WHERE a section is set to seller-only, THE system SHALL restrict content/products within it to assigned seller roles only. WHERE a section is admin-exclusive (e.g., staging, test, regulation), THE system SHALL prevent customer/seller visibility.
- WHEN a section is deactivated, THE system SHALL automatically hide all child sections unless an explicit override is set. IF deleted, THEN THE system SHALL archive section history and any descendants for future analytics, with all data available to admins.

### 2.3 Section CRUD Workflows (Business Logic Only)
- WHEN a seller is authorized for a channel, THE system SHALL permit section creation, editing, and product assignment only within that scope.
- IF a seller attempts to exceed authorized actions (create/remove/edit sections outside assigned scope), THEN THE system SHALL block and return error `PERMISSION_DENIED`.
- Admins may reorganize any section structure, transfer sections between channels (subject to validation), and lock/unlock sections for enforcement or remediation.

### 2.4 Edge Cases and Recovery
- WHEN a batch update (activation, move, archive) is partially completed (e.g., due to business validation error on some sections), THE system SHALL detail which sections succeeded/failed, provide error context (code and description) for each, and guide the user to remediate failed items without rollback of successful operations.
- IF any critical structural error occurs (e.g., looped hierarchy, orphaned root, missing main section during activation), THEN THE system SHALL automatically lock the affected entity, escalate to administrator, and flag for urgent business recovery. All actions SHALL be audit-logged.

### 2.5 Role-Based Permission Matrix
| Action                       | Customer | Seller                | Admin         |
|------------------------------|----------|-----------------------|---------------|
| Browse Channel & Sections    | âœ…       | âœ…                    | âœ…            |
| Register New Channel         | âŒ       | âŒ                    | âœ…            |
| Edit Channel Properties      | âŒ       | âŒ                    | âœ…            |
| Remove/Deactivate Channel    | âŒ       | âŒ                    | âœ…            |
| Add/Edit/Remove Sections     | âŒ       | Partial*              | âœ…            |
| Assign Products to Sections  | âŒ       | âœ… (as assigned)       | âœ…            |
| Reorder Sections             | âŒ       | Partial*              | âœ…            |
| Configure Section Templates  | âŒ       | âŒ                    | âœ…            |
| View Analytics               | âŒ       | Partial (assigned)    | âœ…            |

- *Partial: permitted on assigned channel(s)/sections only; activity out-of-scope is denied with error.

## 3. Cross-Channel Consistency, Templates, and Analytics

### 3.1 Template Consistency and Synchronization
- THE system SHALL support configuration templates for section structures reusable across multiple channels. WHEN a template is applied or modified, THE system SHALL propagate changes to all linked sectionsâ€”except for those flagged as "customized" at the instance level. WHERE a section diverges from template-based configuration due to local edits, THE system SHALL record this "override" state, flag for business review, and append the divergence to analytics logs.
- IF a customized section is present in a template update batch, THEN THE system SHALL skip automated update and visibly mark it for admin action.
- WHEN conflicts between template and customized section are detected, THE system SHALL show a detailed change/audit log, trace history, and enable business-driven reconciliation workflows only by authorized admins.

### 3.2 Batch Operations and Analytics
- THE system SHALL support batch actions (activate, reorder, archive, assign product, propagate template, etc.) across arbitrary sets of channels/sections for authorized admins. WHERE a batch includes ineligible, locked, or error status channels/sections, THE system SHALL break out actions per item, apply only successful sub-operations, and detail failed ones with actionable error context and codes.
- All channel/section create, edit, move, activate, archive, and audit operations SHALL be recorded in a tamper-evident, immutable business log accessible by admins with role-appropriate filtering.
- THE system SHALL provide analytics dashboards and exportable reports at both the channel and section level. Metrics include: item/product count, view counts, click-throughs, successful/failed actions, divergence from template, active/inactive section ratios, change frequency, and business success/conversion scores where applicable.
- WHERE data inconsistency or unusual behavior is detected (e.g., repeated failed actions, looped hierarchies, sections with no activity for defined period), THE system SHALL auto-flag the anomalies for admin business review.

### 3.3 Performance and User Experience
- WHEN a channel or section is created, updated, moved, activated/deactivated, or deleted, THE system SHALL complete all operations within 2 seconds for 95% of invocations. WHERE batch or high-load scenarios occur (e.g., activating sections across a channel with >50,000 products or users), the business logic propagation SHALL be completed within 5 seconds with push notifications for long-running operations.
- FAILURE to meet performance targets SHALL be logged and trigger admin awareness for business escalation.

### 3.4 Summary of Business Rules & Error Handling
| Ref   | Condition                                       | Expected Business Rule Behavior                           |
|-------|-------------------------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------|
| BR-101| Duplicate Channel ID or Name                    | Reject, error code: CHANNEL_DUPLICATE_IDENTIFIER         |
| BR-102| Main Section Missing at Channel Activation      | Block activation, error code: CHANNEL_CONFIG_INCOMPLETE  |
| BR-103| Section Nested Beyond Five Levels               | Reject, error code: SECTION_DEPTH_EXCEEDED               |
| BR-104| Duplicate Section Name In Parent                | Reject, error code: SECTION_NAME_DUPLICATE               |
| BR-105| Unauthorized Channel/Section Edit               | Reject, error code: PERMISSION_DENIED                    |
| BR-106| Section Divergence from Template                | Mark as customized, require admin review in analytics    |
| BR-107| Cyclic Orphan Structure                         | Lock entity, trigger admin recovery, error: SECTION_CYCLIC_OR_ORPHAN |

## 4. End-to-End User Scenarios

### Scenario 1: Admin Registers New Omnichannel with Template
- Admin selects â€œAdd Channelâ€, enters all required fields (unique ID, name, type: web, primary locale: English, audience: "US Sports Fans"), and applies a master template for root and campaign sections. Admin is prompted to add at least one main section before activation. System validates uniqueness, links template, and completes activation. All steps are audit-logged.

### Scenario 2: Seller Adds Custom Promotion Section to Assigned Channel
- Seller with explicit access to "Brand Outlet" channel logs in, is shown eligible sections, and may add sub-sections up to five levels. Seller proposes new section "Back-to-School Savings" under assigned node. System validates section name, nesting, and permissions. Section is created and, if seller designates as â€œSeller-Onlyâ€, section is visible only to the seller and assigned collaborators. All steps are logged and included in analytics.

### Scenario 3: Admin Performs Batch Template Sync
- Admin updates "Standard Home Layout" section template. System applies changes to all channels using the template, skipping and flagging customized exceptions. Any skipped sections are added to adminâ€™s review queue with change history and required reconciliation step. Analytics updated for all completed actions.

### Scenario 4: Batch Error and Recovery
- Admin attempts to activate multiple sections across channels. System successfully activates 18, but 3 fail: one lacks a main section, one is locked by a cyclic orphan, and one violates unique name. For each failure, system returns error codes (`CHANNEL_CONFIG_INCOMPLETE`, `SECTION_CYCLIC_OR_ORPHAN`, `SECTION_NAME_DUPLICATE`), preserves the adminâ€™s attempted inputs, and notifies which succeeded.

### Scenario 5: Automated Inactivity Flag
- Analytics module identifies a section in a popular channel with no views or product listings for 90 days. System auto-flags for admin review, adding a suggested action note to the analytics dashboard.

## 5. Mermaid Diagram: Channel and Section Management Flow
```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "Channel Management"
    A["Admin Creates Channel"] --> B["System Validates Uniqueness"]
    B -->|"Valid"| C["Channel Created"]
    B -->|"Duplicate"| D["Error: CHANNEL_DUPLICATE_IDENTIFIER"]
  end
  subgraph "Section Management"
    E["Admin/Seller Adds Section"] --> F["Validate Nesting and Uniqueness"]
    F -->|"OK"| G["Section Added or Edited"]
    F -->|"Too Deep"| H["Error: SECTION_DEPTH_EXCEEDED"]
    F -->|"Duplicate Name"| I["Error: SECTION_NAME_DUPLICATE"]
  end
  subgraph "Template Sync"
    J["Admin Updates Template"] --> K["Push to Channels"]
    K -->|"Customized"| L["Flag Divergence for Review"]
    K -->|"Standard"| M["Sections Updated"]
  end
```

## 6. Compliance, Auditability, and Developer Autonomy
All requirements above represent explicit business rules and logic for shoppingMall channel and section management. Developers have full autonomy over system architecture, databases, and internal APIs, subject to business logic and audit constraints as described. No UI, integration, or technical design is specified in this document.

file.content:
# Introduction
The future-readiness of the shoppingMall service depends on integrating state-of-the-art technologies and practices, including AI/ML, advanced analytics, and seamless user experience across all channels. These features are critical for driving differentiation, operational intelligence, and sustainable competitive advantage. This document establishes business-driven requirements and expectations for these areas, ensuring backend developers know precisely what the business needs and why.

# AI/ML Integration Capabilities
## Objectives
- Automate, personalize, and optimize business processes and customer experiences using AI and machine learning technologies
- Extract actionable insights from behavioral, transactional, and operational data
- Enable predictive and proactive features that boost engagement, conversion, and operational efficiency

## Business Requirements (EARS Format)
- WHEN user interaction data is collected, THE shoppingMall backend SHALL process and store detailed session, action, and outcome records for analysis.
- WHEN product listings are created or updated, THE system SHALL capture and store features/metadata to enable AI-driven recommendations and search optimization.
- WHEN a customer views or searches for products, THE system SHALL surface recommendations based on AI/ML ranking models utilizing behavioral and contextual data.
- WHEN transaction and order data is accrued, THE system SHALL aggregate relevant KPIs for use in training machine learning models for sales forecasting, inventory management, and churn predictions.
- WHEN seller or admin users access analytics dashboards, THE system SHALL present AI-derived insights on demand and facilitate feedback on AI performance.
- IF AI-driven recommendations fail to provide results, THEN THE system SHALL gracefully default to popularity or recency-driven fallback mechanisms, ensuring uninterrupted customer experience.

### Core Business Scenarios
- Product and content recommendation engines (cross-sell, up-sell, personalized feeds)
- AI-powered fraud detection and anomaly monitoring (e.g., unusual purchase patterns)
- Automated and context-driven customer support routing and intent recognition
- Dynamic pricing rules based on real-time demand and supply signals
- Content moderation (AI-flagging of inappropriate/inaccurate listings, reviews, and community content)

## Data & Privacy Expectations
- THE system SHALL process all user and transaction data for AI purposes in compliance with platform privacy policy and applicable regulations, with auditable opt-in/opt-out mechanisms where mandated.
- WHERE users request AI-driven personalization, THE system SHALL record explicit consent and provide mechanisms for users to review, adjust, or revoke such consent at any time.

# Advanced Analytics & Insights
## Objectives
- Deliver actionable, real-time intelligence to business users, allowing for rapid and informed decision making
- Provide comprehensive, self-service analytics to sellers and admins
- Enable retrospective and predictive analysis for business optimization

## Business Requirements (EARS Format)
- WHEN any authenticated seller or admin accesses their analytics portal, THE system SHALL display up-to-date metrics, trends, and detailed breakdowns on sales, inventory, customer interactions, and performance targets.
- WHEN users interact with analytics tools, THE system SHALL support dynamic filtering, segmentation, and drill-down on all major KPIs (e.g., sales per product/category, conversion rates, revenue attribution, cohort analysis).
- WHEN admins require platform-wide reports, THE system SHALL aggregate, anonymize, and prepare datasets at daily, weekly, monthly, and yearly granularity for reporting and export.
- WHEN unusual activity (e.g., sales spike/drop, abnormal traffic) is detected, THE system SHALL trigger notifications and enable root cause analysis via advanced analytics dashboards.
- THE system SHALL track and present net effects of promotions/loyalty programs on sales and user behavior, supporting ROI and retention analysis.

### Analytics User Scenarios
- Sellers track promotional performance and real-time sales with customizable dashboards
- Admins monitor overall platform health, identify emerging trends or issues, and validate the performance/effectiveness of AI recommendations

## Data Sources, Governance, and Access
- THE system SHALL compile analytics from all integrated systems: orders, products, user sessions, reviews, customer support, and third-party channels.
- Data displayed SHALL respect user roles/permissions strictly: sellers see their own data, admins see global analytics, customers see their own behavior history only.

# Omnichannel and Cross-Platform Features
## Objectives
- Seamless customer and seller experience across all web, mobile apps, third-party integrations, POS, and future channels
- Consistent user identity, preferences, and histories across platforms and devices
- Unified business operations, tracking, and analytics regardless of access channel

## Business Requirements (EARS Format)
- WHEN a user interacts with the shoppingMall service via any device or channel, THE system SHALL synchronize user profile, session, and personalization data in real time, preventing conflicts or data loss.
- WHILE a user is logged in on multiple platforms/devices, THE system SHALL maintain a consistent and up-to-date state for preferences, loyalty/mileage, order status, and notifications.
- WHEN sellers update products, manage orders, or handle inquiries, THE system SHALL ensure changes are reflected and consistent across all channels, with conflict resolution rules for simultaneous updates.
- IF concurrent updates or conflicts occur across channels, THEN THE system SHALL implement business-defined conflict resolution workflows and log all change events for auditability.
- WHEN new external channels are integrated (e.g., social commerce, affiliate platforms), THE system SHALL provide mapping and translation layers so that business workflows, analytics, and personalization logic remain consistent and traceable.

### Omnichannel Scenarios
- Customers add products to cart on desktop, purchase on mobile, track orders via chatbot, and accrue loyalty points seamlessly
- Sellers manage listings both via mobile apps and desktop dashboards with no loss of state or unsynchronized changes
- Admins receive consolidated analytics across all channels, diagnose cross-channel discrepancies, and enforce unified platform rules

## Technical Enablement (Business Rules Only)
- THE system SHALL clearly define business logic, role-based data visibility, and interaction rules for each supported channel and integration point
- THE system SHALL prepare for future channel expansions with a modular permission and audit structure; architecture, specific integrations, and technologies are delegated to the development team

# Roadmap for Continuous Innovation
## Objectives
- Ensure shoppingMall keeps pace with technological evolution, customer expectations, and competitive pressures
- Identify, prioritize, and review advanced feature adoption in line with business value

## Business Requirements (EARS Format)
- THE business team SHALL review all advanced features biannually, with input from stakeholders, to prioritize investments in AI, analytics, and omnichannel support.
- WHEN critical new technologies or practices are identified (e.g., regulatory change, major competitor innovation), THE system SHALL accommodate rapid reviews and business-driven reprioritization of the innovation roadmap.
- Where possible, THE system SHALL facilitate data-driven evaluation of innovation impacts on KPIs, user satisfaction, and revenue growth, via experimentation and A/B testing at the business rule level.

# Success Criteria & Performance Expectations
- WHEN AI-driven personalization or recommendations are presented to users, THE results SHALL be returned within 1 second for typical queries, with clear user-facing feedback if longer delays occur.
- WHEN analytics dashboards are loaded, THE system SHALL deliver requested metrics or visualizations within 3 seconds under normal operating loads.
- WHEN users switch between channels, THE user session state, preferences, and critical business data SHALL synchronize within 2 seconds across all devices.

# Business Rules & Error Handling
- IF AI/ML models are unavailable, THEN THE system SHALL default to business rule-based logic and clearly record the exception for review.
- IF analytics data cannot be generated in real time, THEN THE system SHALL gracefully notify the requester and deliver the most recent data snapshot available, with a timestamp.
- IF channel synchronization fails, THEN THE system SHALL log the issue, attempt automated retry, and alert both the user and platform support where user impact is detected.

# Mermaid Diagrams
## Omnichannel Workflow Example
```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "User Experience Flow"
    A["User Browses & Adds Cart on Web"] --> B["Session Data Sync"]
    B --> C["User Completes Purchase on Mobile"]
    C --> D["Order Status Updated"]
    D --> E["Analytics Updated Across Devices"]
  end

  subgraph "Seller Experience Flow"
    F["Seller Updates Inventory via App"] --> G["Inventory State Sync"]
    G --> H["Admin Reviews Analytics"]
  end

  E --> I["Unified Analytics Dashboard"]
  H --> I
```

# References and Alignment
- For vision and value proposition, see [Service Vision & Value Proposition](./01-service-vision.md)
- For foundational business model, see [Business Model & Objectives](./02-business-model.md)
- For security, compliance, and scalability, see [Security, Compliance & Data Privacy](./13-security-compliance-and-data-privacy.md) and [Scalability & Future Expansion](./14-scalability-and-future-expansion.md)
- All rules and requirements here are strictly business-driven: technical designs, architectures, and implementations are reserved for the development team.

---
This document is business requirements only; all implementation specifics are left to developer discretion.

## AI/ML Integration Capabilities

### Objectives
- Accelerate automation, personalization, and business process optimization throughout shoppingMall using advanced AI and machine learning
- Enable data-driven insights, proactive recommendations, and operational resilience for all user roles (customer, seller, admin)
- Position shoppingMall as an adaptable, intelligent, and future-ready platform

### Business Requirements (EARS)

- WHEN a customer interacts with discovery or search, THE system SHALL surface context-aware, AI-curated recommendations using real-time behavioral and contextual data.
- WHEN sellers or admins monitor dashboards, THE system SHALL present AI-derived forecasts on sales trends, demand spikes, inventory risks, and fraud signals using the latest available training data.
- WHEN new transactional or feedback data is aggregated, THE system SHALL periodically (every 24 hours or less) retrain or update supervised/unsupervised models to enhance predictive accuracy and relevance.
- IF a user asks for an explanation of an AI-powered personalization result, THEN THE system SHALL provide a concise business-level summary of which key data facts or rules contributed most to the recommendation.
- WHEN automated decisioning is used for sensitive business flows (e.g., fraud detection, review moderation, personalized pricing), THE system SHALL maintain and expose human-auditable logs of input data features, model version, and reasoning chains for regulatory or dispute resolution.
- WHERE user consent is required or privacy regulations (GDPR, CCPA, etc.) apply, THE system SHALL capture, manage, and audit all opt-in/opt-out status, allowing users to review, adjust, or revoke personalization consent in real time.
- IF any AI-driven result or automation step cannot complete due to model failure, performance degradation, or missing data, THEN THE system SHALL fall back to established business rules (e.g., popularity sort, static discount tiers) and record the event for postmortem analysis.

### Business Scenarios and Core Capabilities
- Personalized product, offer, and content recommendation engines (cross-sell, up-sell, real-time personalization)
- AI-powered fraud or anomaly detection in order, payment, and seller behavior
- Automated support routing, intent recognition, and dynamic FAQ provisioning
- Dynamic context-based pricing, promotion deployment, and risk-based personalization
- Proactive community/content moderation with explainable AI-based flagging and escalation

### Data, Privacy, Bias and Explainability Expectations

- IF users or external reviewers request AI audit records, THEN THE system SHALL deliver business-level explanations of how model inputs/logic led to results.
- THE system SHALL support A/B and multivariate testing of new AI features, retaining all test results for stakeholder review and version updating.

- WHEN AI-powered recommendations, moderation, or automation are invoked, THE system SHALL return results within 1 second 99% of the time for standard user-facing operations; a clear status or fallback SHALL be communicated for delays/exceptions.
- IF significant AI system latency or disruption impacts user experience, THEN THE system SHALL disable real-time recommendations for the affected session, switch to default business logic, and inform affected users/sellers/admins within 2 seconds.
- WHEN business users, sellers, or admins provide feedback on AI accuracy or perception, THE system SHALL track, aggregate, and use such feedback to improve future model performance.

---

### Objectives
- Provide real-time, actionable intelligence, enabling daily, weekly, and long-range data-driven business decisions across all roles
- Equip sellers and admins with advanced dashboarding, trend spotting, root cause analysis, and export capabilities supporting ongoing optimization
- Enable comprehensive role-based insights, KPIs, and customizable reports across sales, operations, user engagement, and risk

- WHEN a user interacts with analytics tools (filters, timeframes, segments), THE system SHALL immediately update all data, granting multi-level drill-downs and comparative views within 2 seconds per action.
- WHEN business events (sales spike/drop, unusual returns, suspect patterns) are detected by analytics algorithms, THE system SHALL alert relevant sellers/admins instantly and provide direct links to root cause analysis or remediation workflows.
- WHEN admins need platform-wide or compliance reporting, THE system SHALL compile, anonymize, and prepare full datasets, scheduled exports, and secure direct downloads per business rule requirements and jurisdiction.
- WHEN users review analytics results, THE system SHALL document all user-selected views, applied filters, and generated exports for traceability, auditing, and role-based access enforcement.
- IF analytics data cannot be delivered in real time (system, data, or integration failure), THEN THE system SHALL fall back to the most recent dataset, indicate the data timestamp to the user, and attempt automatic reprocessing within 10 minutes.
- THE system SHALL tailor analytics scope and data visibility strictly per user role: customers see only their data; sellers see data restricted to their catalogs/orders; admins access global and local analytics, full audit trails, and regulatory evidence as required.
- THE system SHALL support business experimentation (e.g., promotional A/B tests, banner impact studies) in analytics flows, tracking test/group assignment for all users and retaining results for business intelligence.
- WHEN actionable business KPIs (sales, churn, return rate, NPS, etc.) deviate beyond defined thresholds, THE system SHALL proactively notify responsible roles and provide scenario-based recommendations to improve outcomes.

### Analytics User Scenarios
- Sellers monitor flash sale effectiveness, inventory alerts, return spikes, and track coupon usage in real-time dashboards
- Sellers export monthly order, revenue, conversion, and feedback analytics in CSV and secure PDF formats
- Admins analyze platform-wide health, monitor fraud signals, compliance and MIS reports, AI impact evaluation, and enforce business rule adherence

### KPIs, Data Governance, Auditability
- THE system SHALL provide full lineage, data source mapping, and audit traces for every metric and calculation presented in analytics
- KPIs SHALL include MAU, session time, acquisition and retention rates, GMV, conversion, refund rate, shipping/fulfillment cycle time, loyalty program ROI, AI recommendation precision/recall, and customer satisfaction indices
- WHERE data sources are integrated or external, THE system SHALL document all inbound data contracts, failure handling, and reprocessing rules
- IF analytics data is corrected (data error, regulatory adjustment), THE system SHALL record prior, change, and rationale in immutable audit logs and provide version references in reports

### Error Handling and Edge Case Management
- IF analytics latency exceeds 3 seconds, THEN THE system SHALL warn the user, log the occurrence with root cause trace, and retry data preparation internally
- IF analytics features are unavailable, THEN THE system SHALL inform users via clear interface status, suppress reporting functions, and prioritize automatic service restoration

---

## Omnichannel and Cross-Platform Features

### Objectives
- Deliver seamless, role-consistent shoppingMall experience for customers, sellers, and adminsâ€”across web, mobile, POS, APIs, and future sales/integration channels
- Maintain unified user state, preference, business rules, and service continuity across devices, apps, and integrations
- Facilitate robust, traceable business operations and analytics regardless of access point

### Business Requirements (EARS)
- WHEN any user accesses shoppingMall through any channel, THE system SHALL synchronize user profiles, active session state, loyalty data, preferences, and recent orders across all touch points in real time.
- WHILE a user is authenticated on more than one device or platform, THE system SHALL preserve consistent notification queues, order status, and business context between all instancesâ€”resolving conflicts using defined business rule hierarchy.
- WHEN sellers update catalog data or process orders, THE system SHALL ensure item/inventory state, messages, and business event data propagate without delay across all associated channels.
- IF two or more updates conflict (multi-session or cross-channel), THEN THE system SHALL invoke a pre-defined merge/conflict resolution process, flag result for audit, and alert affected roles within 5 seconds.
- WHEN new external channels, partners, or platforms are added, THE system SHALL adapt data flows and business rules so that analytics, personalization, and compliance logic function without loss of accuracy or traceability.
- WHEN user or business actions require rollback or recovery (session loss, device switch, platform outage), THE system SHALL restore last known valid state across all platforms and provide continuity notification to affected users/sellers/admins.
- THE system SHALL log all cross-channel and multi-device data merges, user actions, and recovery events with timestamps and actor attribution; audit trails SHALL be available to authorized roles for diagnostics and compliance assessments.

### Omnichannel Scenarios and User Journeys

- Sellers toggle between mobile and desktop dashboards to manage orders, inventory, and inquiries with no lag and shared history of all transactions
- Admins enforce platform rules and analyze behaviors across all channels, quickly tracing any discrepancy or cross-user event, and initiating corrective workflows

### Role-Based Permissions, Personalization, and State Management
- THE system SHALL enforce role-based visibility/permissions for all omnichannel and analytics data (customers: own data only; sellers: own plus subordinates; admins: all scope)
- THE system SHALL provide business rules for data protection, masking, and privacy by channel (e.g., stricter retention or access in certain legal jurisdictions or partner integrations)
- WHEN omnichannel state sync fails (partial outage, unresponsive endpoint), THEN THE system SHALL flag an incident for support, attempt automated resync every 30 seconds, inform the user, and provide alternate access to critical functions

### Performance and Recovery Requirements
- WHEN a user switches devices or channels (e.g., web to app), THE system SHALL synchronize preferences, cart, and mission-critical data within 2 seconds under normal operating conditions
- WHEN sellers/admins initiate or monitor a business operation across channels, THE system SHALL reflect the change systemwide with no more than 5 seconds latency in 99% of cases

### Mermaid Diagram: Omnichannel Workflow Example
```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "User Experience Workflow"
    A["User Browses & Adds Cart on Web"] --> B["Session Data Sync"]
    B --> C["Completes Purchase on Mobile"]
    C --> D["Order Status and Loyalty Updated"]
    D --> E["Analytics & Reports Updated in Real Time"]
  end

  subgraph "Seller Flow"
    F["Seller Edits Inventory via App"] --> G["Cross-channel Inventory Sync"]
    G --> H["Admin Sees Consolidated Analytics"]
  end

  E --> I["Unified Cross-Channel Analytics Dashboard"]
  H --> I
```

---

## Roadmap for Continuous Innovation

### Objectives
- Ensure that shoppingMall proactively adapts to new technologies, regulatory drivers, business trends, and competitive pressuresâ€”delivering ongoing value for all user roles
- Systematically review, test, and adopt advanced features, running judicious business validation cycles and prioritization processes

### Business Requirements (EARS)

- WHEN a critical new technology, compliance need, or market demand is identified, THE system SHALL allow prioritized review, experimentation, and rapid pilot evaluationâ€”tracking each stage in an innovation log
- WHERE feasible, THE system SHALL use A/B or staged pilot testing for major new advanced features; results SHALL be measured against KPIs for adoption, impact, user satisfaction, and revenue or efficiency gains
- WHEN feature rollouts are delayed, reversed, or deprecated, THE system SHALL communicate clear change timelines to all roles (customer, seller, admin), update documentation, and audit effect on KPIs
- THE system SHALL expose business-level dashboards for tracking innovation cycle, including current experiments, completed projects, outstanding opportunities, and realized value
- IF a new risk or regulatory mandate emerges during the innovation cycle, THEN THE system SHALL facilitate rapid compliance review, feature gating, or rollback as appropriate

### Performance, Success Criteria, and Error Recovery
- WHEN a new advanced feature is released platform-wide, THE system SHALL track performance against baseline KPIs (latency, accuracy, NPS, business metric impact) for at least 60 days
- IF adoption or performance lags target, THEN the system SHALL escalate to stakeholder review with recommendations for rollback, remediation, or secondary rollout

---

## References and Alignment

- For commercial incentives and business value logic, see [Business Model & Objectives](./02-business-model.md)

file.content:
# 1. Introduction
This document provides a comprehensive analysis of the requirements and business flows for the cart and order processing system in the shoppingMall platform. The focus is on clear, actionable business rules, user scenarios, error handling, and performance expectations to guide backend development.

# 2. Cart Functionality & Templates

## 2.1 Core Cart Features
- WHEN a customer is authenticated, THE system SHALL initialize or recall the customer's active cart regardless of device or channel.
- THE system SHALL support addition, update (quantity/option), and removal of products in the cart.
  - Input validation includes product availability, valid SKU/option, and quantity (minimum 1, maximum per business rules).
- WHERE a customer is not authenticated, THE system SHALL support a temporary/session-based cart with upgrade path upon login.
- THE system SHALL maintain separate carts per sales channel when cross-channel shopping is enabled.
- THE system SHALL support bulk cart operations where multiple items can be modified in a single request.

## 2.2 Cart Item Business Rules
- THE cart item SHALL contain snapshots of product name, option, price, discount, coupon eligibility, and seller info as of the time of addition.
- WHERE a product becomes unavailable (out of stock, delisted, paused), THE system SHALL mark the item as invalid and prevent checkout.
- IF the price or option changes after addition to cart but before order, THEN THE system SHALL update or highlight those changes before confirmation.
- THE cart SHALL reflect active promotions, shipping charges, and expected delivery windows.

## 2.3 Edge Cases
- IF the maximum allowed distinct items or quantity is exceeded, THEN THE system SHALL deny the operation and inform the customer.
- WHERE a seller updates product options or closes their store, affected cart items SHALL become invalid and provide actionable messaging.
- THE system SHALL preserve abandoned carts for at least 30 days for authenticated users, enabling recovery and reminders.

# 3. Order Application & Fulfillment

## 3.1 Cart-to-Order Process
- WHEN a customer initiates checkout, THE system SHALL validate all cart items (stock, pricing, eligibility, customer info).
- IF validation fails on any item, THEN THE system SHALL refuse checkout and provide detailed reasons per item.
- THE system SHALL allow select-all or partial item checkout (i.e., not all cart items must be ordered at once).
- AFTER confirmation, THE system SHALL lock cart items, generate the order(s), and deduct stock atomically (to the extent supported by integrations).

## 3.2 Order Creation
- THE order record SHALL snapshot pricing, options, user and seller, channel, discounts, address, payment details, expected delivery, etc.
- WHERE multiple sellers are involved, THE system SHALL generate separate order records (one per seller) under a unified master order ID.
- THE system SHALL record all order creation attempts, failures, and final outcomes with audit logs.

## 3.3 Fulfillment Workflow
- WHEN an order is successfully created, THE system SHALL proceed to payment or reservation phase based on payment method.
- AFTER payment, THE order status SHALL update to "payment confirmed," and fulfillment processes (packing, shipping) SHALL be triggered per seller.
- THE system SHALL provide real-time updates to customers and sellers on order status transitions.

# 4. Payment Method Support

## 4.1 Supported Methods
- THE system SHALL support multiple payment types: credit card, virtual account, digital wallet, bank transfer, on-delivery, and platform-specific credits (coupons, mileage).
- WHERE a payment method is restricted by user, item, or region, THE system SHALL enforce business validation at checkout.
- THE system SHALL handle split payments, promotions, and hybrid models (e.g., combine coupon/mileage plus card payment).
- THE system SHALL synchronize payment status with external processors in near-real time, updating order records and notifying stakeholders.

## 4.2 Payment Exception Handling
- IF payment initiation fails, THEN THE system SHALL provide actionable user errors and allow for retry or payment method change.
- WHERE payment confirmation lags or fails reconciliation, THE system SHALL detect and flag the order as pending, notify admins/sellers, and alert the customer.
- IF payment is later determined invalid (e.g., chargeback, fraud detection), THEN THE system SHALL update the order to dispute or hold, and restrict further fulfillment.

# 5. Order Lifecycle & Status Transitions

## 5.1 Primary Order States
- Cart (unsubmitted)
- Pending payment
- Payment confirmed
- Preparing shipment
- Shipped/In transit
- Delivered
- Completed (confirmed by user or elapsed timeline)
- Cancelled (by user/seller/admin, with reason)
- Returned/Refunded/Partially Fulfilled
- On hold/Disputed

## 5.2 State Transitions
- THE system SHALL enforce allowable state transitions by business logic (see state diagram).
- WHEN an invalid state transition is attempted (e.g., delivery before payment), THE system SHALL forbid it and log the attempt.
- WHERE a transition requires external confirmation (e.g., courier scans or payment), THE system SHALL synchronize state on receipt of confirmation.

## 5.3 Role-based Actions
- Customers: Place/cancel order, track status, initiate returns, confirm receipt.
- Sellers: Accept/prepare shipment, confirm shipment, handle returns/exceptions.
- Admins: Override, dispute, or audit any state (subject to security/compliance requirements).

# 6. Error, Exception & Partial Fulfillment Scenarios

## 6.1 Standard Error Handling
- IF a system or integration error occurs during checkout or payment, THEN THE system SHALL maintain full audit trace and provide clear messaging with next steps.
- IF fulfillment is partially possible (some items cannot be shipped), THEN THE system SHALL support partial fulfillment, offer user choice (ship available now/await all/cancel), and document actions taken.
- THE system SHALL generate automated notifications for any error or abnormality during the order flow to all affected parties (customer, seller, admin).

## 6.2 Edge Cases
- IF seller stock is depleted after order is confirmed, THEN THE system SHALL offer options: refund, exchange, or delayed fulfillment, per user preference and policy rules.
- IF product or payment is under dispute, THEN THE order SHALL be placed on hold and all fulfillment paused until resolution.

# 7. Business Rules, Validation & Performance Requirements

## 7.1 Input and Validation
- All user inputs (cart changes, order data, payment details) are subject to validation: product existence, quantity, user eligibility, payment compliance, address verification, etc.
- All updates to cart/order SHALL be atomic and transactional wherever possible (no partial writes or lost updates).

## 7.2 System Constraints
- Maximum items per cart: configurable per channel/seller, default to 100.
- Maximum order value: configurable; THE system SHALL enforce and notify if exceeded.
- Payment window expiry: default 30 minutes; order auto-cancels after window.
- Returns/cancellation: customers may request within policy limits; system SHALL enforce timing and status-based eligibility.

## 7.3 Error Messaging/Communication
- All user-facing errors SHALL provide actionable feedback in clear language.
- System errors SHALL be logged with unique codes and traceable references accessible for support/admin.

## 7.4 Performance Expectations
- WHEN a customer adds/removes/updates cart items, THE system SHALL respond within 1 second (typical load).
- WHEN a user initiates checkout, THE system SHALL complete cart validation and present order summary within 2 seconds.
- WHEN an order is created and payment confirmed, status updates SHALL be visible to customer/seller/admin within 5 seconds.

# 8. Diagrams & Visual Workflow

## 8.1 Cart-to-Order Flow

```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "Cart Session"
    A["Customer Browses Products"] --> B["Add to Cart"]
    B --> C["Cart Validation (SKU/Price/Stock)"]
    C --> D["Modify/Remove Items"]
    D --> E["Initiate Checkout"]
  end

  subgraph "Order Creation"
    E --> F["Confirm Cart & Delivery Details"]
    F --> G{"All Valid?"}
    G -->|"Yes"| H["Order Record Created"]
    G -->|"No"| I["Abort & Inform User"]
    H --> J["Payment Initiation"]
    J --> K{"Payment Succeeds?"}
    K -->|"Yes"| L["Advance to Fulfillment"]
    K -->|"No"| I
  end

  subgraph "Fulfillment & Completion"
    L --> M["Packing/Shipping"]
    M --> N["Delivery Confirmation"]
    N --> O["Order Completed"]
  end
```

## 8.2 Order Status State Machine

```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
  ["Pending Payment"] --> ["Payment Confirmed"]
  ["Payment Confirmed"] --> ["Preparing Shipment"]
  ["Preparing Shipment"] --> ["Shipped"]
  ["Shipped"] --> ["Delivered"]
  ["Delivered"] --> ["Completed"]
  ["Pending Payment"] --> ["Cancelled"]
  ["Payment Confirmed"] --> ["Cancelled"]
  ["Preparing Shipment"] --> ["Cancelled"]
  ["Shipped"] --> ["Returned"]
  ["Delivered"] --> ["Returned"]
  ["Returned"] --> ["Refunded"]
  ["*"] --> ["On Hold"]
  ["On Hold"] --> ["Pending Payment"]
  ["On Hold"] --> ["Cancelled"]
```

# 9. Conclusion
This specification provides exhaustive business-centric requirements for cart and order processing in shoppingMall, establishing robust business rules, user flows, error handling, and performance benchmarks. This forms a clear blueprint for backend implementation, enabling seamless customer, seller, and admin collaboration throughout the order lifecycle.
