- On Hold/Disputed
- Partially Paid/Partially Fulfilled (if supported)

- WHERE a transaction is manually (admin) overridden, THE shoppingMall SHALL require justification and create a full change audit trail.
- WHEN time-based or business-based auto-transitions should occur (e.g., auto-cancel after payment window, auto-complete after delivery elapsed), THE shoppingMall SHALL execute and log the auto-action and notify all affected roles.

## 5.3 Role-based Actions
- Customers: Place orders, cancel pending orders (within policy timeframes/status), request returns/refunds, track order status at all stages, confirm final receipt, and communicate directly with sellers on order issues.
- Sellers: Accept/acknowledge new orders, prepare packages, mark as shipped (with fulfillment details), handle returns/exceptions, update delivery status, provide communication threads for order-related issues.
- Admins: View, override, intervene, or audit any order/business state, forcibly change order/payment/fulfillment status for compliance or fraud, access all audit logs, unlock held/disputed orders after due process.
- WHERE a seller is also a customer (dual role), both permissions and responsibilities of each SHALL apply per business context.

- IF a system-level, integration, or process error occurs during checkout or payment, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL roll back all partial business actions, retain an immutable audit snapshot, and instantly present a clear, actionable error to the customer, including recovery paths such as retry, contact support, or alternative methods.

- THE shoppingMall SHALL automate error notifications to all parties (customer, seller, admin) via their preferred channels within 10 seconds of detection.

## 6.2 Edge Cases
- IF seller inventory is depleted after order confirmation, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL offer refund, product exchange, or delayed shipping options to the customer as per configurable policy and document the customerâ€™s selected resolution.
- IF a payment or delivered product enters dispute (chargebacks, customer claim, external fraud report), THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL transition the order to "on hold/disputed", halt further fulfillment, restrict subsequent related operations, and alert admin for manual review.
- WHEN legal or compliance factors (e.g., embargo, legal order) require stopping fulfillment, THE shoppingMall SHALL lock the order and archive all associated evidence for regulatory access.

## 7.1 Input and Validation
- THE shoppingMall SHALL validate all user-supplied data (cart changes, order entry, payment details) for type, existence, format, value ranges, cross-field dependencies, and per-role eligibility before any state change is committed to business records.
- WHEN possible, all cart/order updates SHALL be atomic and transactional, ensuring data consistency with no partial or lost updates, and logged by actor, timestamp, and context.
- WHEN address or delivery data is provided, THE shoppingMall SHALL validate for geographic, regulatory, and delivery eligibility in real time before order can proceed.

## 7.2 System Constraints
- Maximum cart items per user/channel: business-configurable (default 100).
- Maximum order value per transaction: business-configurable (e.g., $10,000); orders above threshold SHALL be denied with clear rationale and escalation path.
- Payment windows for order completion: default 30 minutes from initiation; THE shoppingMall SHALL cancel unpaid orders automatically upon window expiry and notify all involved parties with recovery next-steps.
- Returns/cancellation eligibility: customers may initiate within configured business rules (e.g., before shipment, within 7 days of delivery); THE shoppingMall SHALL enforce timing, payment, and order state rules.
- Minimum and maximum quantity per item: per product and business policy, checked at every cart/add and checkout validation.
- Cart abandonment: carts persisted for a minimum (30 days for authenticated customers), session-length for non-authenticated users.

## 7.3 Error Messaging & Communication
- THE shoppingMall SHALL generate all customer- and seller-facing errors in clear, actionable language, specifying error code, cause, and recovery; all such events SHALL be traceable in support and admin logs.
- System and admin errors SHALL be assigned unique trace codes linked to audit records; errors impacting a financial or regulatory commitment SHALL be escalated per business escalation protocol.

## 7.4 Performance Expectations
- WHEN a customer adds, removes, or updates cart items, THE shoppingMall SHALL respond within 1 second for 99% of requests under normal system load.
- WHEN a customer initiates checkout, THE shoppingMall SHALL validate cart and offer a full summary screen in â‰¤2 seconds for up to 50 items; bulk or high-value orders SHALL scale accordingly with user notification if additional time is required.
- WHEN an order is created and payment confirmed, THE updated status SHALL propagate to all affected parties within 5 seconds.
- Under load, the shoppingMall SHALL maintain atomicity and consistency, never resulting in partial orders, orphaned items, or lost payments.
- Bulk/batch cart and checkout operations (â‰¥20 items at once) SHALL preserve full business rollback and per-item feedback within 5 seconds for typical usage.

# 8. Diagrams & Visual Workflow

## 8.1 Cart-to-Order Flow

```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "Cart Session"
    A["Customer Browses Products"] --> B["Add to Cart"]
    B --> C["Cart Validation(SKU/Price/Stock)"]
    C --> D["Modify/Remove Items"]
    D --> E["Initiate Checkout"]
  end

  subgraph "Order Creation"
    E --> F["Confirm Cart & Delivery Details"]
    F --> G{"All Valid?"}
    G -->|"Yes"| H["Order Record Created"]
    G -->|"No"| I["Abort & Inform User"]
    H --> J["Payment Initiation"]
    J --> K{"Payment Succeeds?"}
    K -->|"Yes"| L["Advance to Fulfillment"]
    K -->|"No"| I
  end

  subgraph "Fulfillment & Completion"
    L --> M["Packing/Shipping"]
    M --> N["Delivery Confirmation"]
    N --> O["Order Completed"]
  end
```

## 8.2 Order Status State Machine

```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
  ["Pending Payment"] --> ["Payment Confirmed"]
  ["Payment Confirmed"] --> ["Preparing Shipment"]
  ["Preparing Shipment"] --> ["Shipped"]
  ["Shipped"] --> ["Delivered"]
  ["Delivered"] --> ["Completed"]
  ["Pending Payment"] --> ["Cancelled"]
  ["Payment Confirmed"] --> ["Cancelled"]
  ["Preparing Shipment"] --> ["Cancelled"]
  ["Shipped"] --> ["Returned"]
  ["Delivered"] --> ["Returned"]
  ["Returned"] --> ["Refunded"]
  ["*"] --> ["On Hold"]
  ["On Hold"] --> ["Pending Payment"]
  ["On Hold"] --> ["Cancelled"]
```

# 9. Conclusion
All requirements and flows specified herein are presented in business-focused, unambiguous language, using EARS format for expressivity and testability. Full coverage of user, seller, and admin scenarios, along with edge cases and performance tolerances, enables shoppingMall backend developers to implement robust, scalable, and user-friendly cart and order processing functionalities. Technical implementation (code, schema, API) is at developer discretion; only business rules and requirements are prescribed herein.

# 1. Post, Inquiry & Review Management

## 1.1 Overview
The inquiry, review, and bulletin system allows customers, sellers, and admins to post, interact with, and manage product-related questions, answers, reviews, and general community posts. Core goals include fostering a trustworthy environment, supporting purchase decisions, and maintaining operational integrity through moderation and transparent history.

## 1.2 Definitions
- **Inquiry (Q&A):** Questions and answers posted regarding specific products or services
- **Review:** Ratings, feedback, and media attached to a completed order or service
- **Bulletin Post:** Community announcements, discussions, or notices not directly tied to a single product

### 1.3 Functional Requirements (EARS)

#### Inquiries (Q&A)
- WHEN a customer views a product, THE system SHALL display all public and relevant inquiries and answers for that product, sorted newest first.
- WHEN a customer submits a new inquiry, THE system SHALL validate input length (min 10, max 1,000 characters), check for prohibited content (spam, abuse), and associate the inquiry with the correct product.
- IF the inquiry fails validation (format or prohibited content), THEN THE system SHALL return a user-facing error message identifying the cause and guidance for correction.
- WHEN a seller receives a product inquiry, THE system SHALL provide seller notifications and allow sellers to post answers.
- WHERE an inquiry is answered, THE system SHALL mark the inquiry as "answered"; WHERE it is unresolved longer than a configurable period (e.g., 72 hours), THE system SHALL flag for admin review.
- IF a customer edits or deletes their inquiry, THEN THE system SHALL update status provided edits occur within 24 hours and no answer has been posted (otherwise, lock modification).
- WHEN an admin, seller, or system moderator reviews an inquiry, THE system SHALL allow evidence snapshot downloads of the original and modified states.
- Performance: THE system SHALL return all inquiry-related requests in under 1 second in 95% of cases.

#### Reviews
- WHEN a customer completes an order, THE system SHALL allow posting a review for the purchased product, including text (min 10, max 2,000 characters), star rating (1-5), and media uploads (images/videos, max 5 files, 10MB each).
- IF a review contains prohibited or suspicious content, THEN THE system SHALL hold it for moderation and notify moderators within 10 minutes.
- WHERE a customer edits or deletes a review, THE system SHALL retain immutable audit trails for both original and revised versions, accessible to admins and for dispute resolution.
- WHEN a seller or admin responds to a review, THE system SHALL thread the response under the related review, notify the review author, and prevent further edits after a seller/admin response.
- Performance: THE system SHALL render all reviews and responses within 1.5 seconds for 95% of requests.

#### Bulletins
- WHERE a bulletin post is created by an admin, THE system SHALL automatically pin it and send notifications to all users, respecting user opt-out preferences.
- WHEN a customer, seller, or admin creates a bulletin post, THE system SHALL validate against community guidelines and apply content moderation (keyword, AI, and blacklist check).

## 1.4 Examples & Workflow

```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "Customer Inquiry Submission"
    A["View Product Page"] --> B["Click 'Ask a Question'"]
    B --> C["Write Question & Submit"]
    C --> D{"Passes Validation?"}
  end
  D -->|"Yes"| E["Inquiry Saved & Seller Notified"]
  D -->|"No"| F["Show Validation Error Message"]
  E --> G["Seller Posts Answer"]
  G --> H["Inquiry marked as Answered"]
  H --> I["Visible to All Customers"]
  F --> J["Allow Edit/Retry"]
```

# 2. Comment and Reply Handling

## 2.1 Overview
Customers, sellers, and admins can comment on inquiries, reviews, and bulletin posts. Threaded replies are supported to promote conversation and resolution.

## 2.2 Functional Requirements (EARS)
- WHEN a user submits a comment or reply, THE system SHALL validate the content (min 1, max 500 characters), check for spam/prohibited words, and rate-limit submissions (5 per minute maximum per user).
- WHERE a comment is flagged by more than 3 unique users within 24 hours, THE system SHALL temporarily hide the comment and trigger moderator review.
- IF a comment or reply is deleted, THEN THE system SHALL retain a snapshot for 30 days and mark the parent post as having removed replies.
- WHEN a thread reaches 50 comments, THE system SHALL automatically archive older comments and provide a "view more" option.
- Performance: THE system SHALL process comment-related requests within 1 second for 97% of cases.

# 3. Moderation & Evidence Snapshots

## 3.1 Overview
System supports multi-tier community moderation (automatic, seller, admin) with AI assistance, audit trails, and transparency for dispute handling.

## 3.2 Moderation Functional Requirements (EARS)
- WHEN user-generated content (inquiry, review, comment, bulletin) is submitted, THE system SHALL analyze it via AI for spam/abuse/scam detection, in addition to rules-based checks.
- IF content is flagged by AI or by more than 5 unique users, THEN THE system SHALL quarantine the content, notify admins, and block further user visibility pending review.
- WHEN moderators review flagged content, THE system SHALL present a timeline of edits, flags, and evidence snapshots, plus decision logs (approve, reject, escalate).
- WHERE content requires legal hold (e.g., upon court request), THE system SHALL preserve all evidence snapshots indefinitely and mark as non-deletable.
- WHERE a moderation action is taken, THE system SHALL notify all affected users with sanitized explanations within 5 minutes.
- Performance: THE system SHALL process moderation queue items within 10 seconds.

## 3.3 Evidence Handling
- THE system SHALL retain audit trails for all content modifications, deletions, and flagged statuses, accessible to admins and via court order.
- WHEN evidence snapshots are downloaded, THE system SHALL log access and reason for compliance and security.

# 4. Community Engagement Rules

## 4.1 Overview
Rules to ensure quality discourse, discourage abuse, and encourage meaningful engagement among customers, sellers, and admins.

## 4.2 Engagement Functional Requirements (EARS)
- THE system SHALL enforce the following for all community content:
  - Minimum account age of 24 hours to post
  - No duplicate questions or reviews on the same product or topic
  - Single review per product per order
  - Content marked as spam/abuse in 3+ different threads SHALL result in temporary posting suspension (72 hours)
  - Violations by sellers or repeat offender customers SHALL escalate automatically to admin review and possible longer suspension (configurable)
  - Recognized excellent contributions (as judged by AI or admin) SHALL be surfaced ("Featured") and rewarded with badges
- Performance: THE system SHALL maintain user-facing community features at >99.9% uptime and <2 second overall latency.

# 5. Role-Based Permission Matrix

| Action                                 | Customer | Seller | Admin |
|----------------------------------------|----------|--------|-------|
| Submit product inquiry                 | âœ…       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Answer product inquiry                 | âŒ       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Post review (purchased product only)   | âœ…       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Respond to review                      | âŒ       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Create bulletin post                   | âœ…       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Moderate content                       | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Feature/Hide community content         | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Download evidence snapshots            | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Flag/report community content          | âœ…       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Access flagged/hidden content          | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |

# 6. Error Handling and Performance

- IF invalid, abusive, or duplicate actions are attempted, THEN THE system SHALL return clear error messages specifying next steps or reasons for failure.
- WHEN backend data or evidence is unavailable or system error occurs, THE system SHALL present an error, log details for admin audit, and attempt a retry within 2 seconds.
- All major user-facing operations SHALL meet the specified performance targets as above.

# 7. AI & Analytics

- THE system SHALL provide periodic analytics (dashboard/reporting) to admins and sellers, revealing moderation workload, content trends, flagged abuse and community engagement levels.
- WHEN content is suspected of being AI-generated/manipulated, THE system SHALL flag it for additional review and annotate the content for transparency, without immediate user penalty.

# 8. Compliance and Data Integrity

- THE system SHALL enforce data retention and privacy rules as specified in [Security, Compliance & Data Privacy](./13-security-compliance-and-data-privacy.md), including right of erasure, legal holds, and evidence preservation.

# End of Document

# Inquiry, Review, and Bulletin Management Requirement Specification

## 1. Post, Inquiry & Review Management
### 1.1 Overview
Posting, inquiry, and review management in shoppingMall enables customers, sellers, and admins to engage in transparent questions, feedback, and shared knowledge about products, services, and the broader community. The goal is to foster trust, augment purchase confidence, and prevent fraud or abuseâ€”while ensuring contributors are recognized, and negative actors quickly contained. Features are structured to comply with privacy, evidence, and moderation requirements.

### 1.2 Key Definitions
- **Inquiry (Q&A)**: Customer questions about products; sellers/admins provide answers.
- **Review**: Feedback, ratings, text, and media about a previously purchased product/order.
- **Bulletin Post**: Community postsâ€”announcements, topics of interest, policy updates; not tied to a single product.

## 1.3 Business Requirements (EARS)
### Inquiries (Q&A)
- WHEN a customer authenticates and views a product detail page, THE system SHALL display all public inquiries and answers, sorted newest first, and indicate unanswered questions separately.
- WHEN a customer posts a new inquiry, THE system SHALL validate input (length: 10-1000 chars, no prohibited expressions, references a valid/active product, one active inquiry per product per user) before accepting submission.
- IF an inquiry fails validation, THEN THE system SHALL provide an actionable error message, identifying the rule(s) violated and offering resubmission guidance.
- WHEN a seller receives a product inquiry, THE system SHALL generate a real-time notification and allow the seller or designated admin to post one formal answer.
- WHEN an inquiry is answered, THE system SHALL mark it as "answered"; WHERE it remains unanswered 72h, THE system SHALL alert admins and re-notify seller.
- IF a customer edits or deletes their inquiry, THEN THE system SHALL allow changes only within 24 hours and only if unanswered. All edits/deletions SHALL be logged with before/after snapshots accessible to admins.
- WHEN an admin, seller, or moderator reviews an inquiry, THE system SHALL allow evidence snapshot downloads (both original and modified states; timestamp, actor included).
- Performance: THE system SHALL respond to all inquiry requests in under 1 second for 95% of traffic, and under 2 seconds at peak loads.

### Reviews
- WHEN a customer completes a purchase (order status "delivered" or "completed"), THE system SHALL enable review for that purchased item (text: 10-2000 chars, 1-5 star rating, optionally up to 5 images/videos, single review per product per order).
- WHEN submitting a review, THE system SHALL validate content for prohibited expressions, duplicate reviews, rating scale, and file limits (max 10MB/file).
- IF a review is flagged for abuse, THEN THE system SHALL quarantine it from public display, notify moderators, and provide the customer with the status and appeal mechanism in <10 minutes.
- WHEN sellers or admins reply to a review, THE system SHALL allow one official response per review; original author is notified via their preferred channel and may not further edit the original review after this response.
- WHERE a customer edits or deletes their review, THE system SHALL permanently snapshot the prior version for admin dispute review.
- WHERE a review is flagged by >3 unrelated users or by AI moderation, THE system SHALL queue it for moderator review and withhold publication until resolved.
- Performance: THE system SHALL render reviews, responses, and related content within 1.5 seconds for 97% of requests.

### Bulletins
- WHERE an admin creates a bulletin post, THE system SHALL automatically pin the post atop bulletin listings and notify all authenticated users, unless a user has opted out of such communications in preferences.
- WHEN customers or sellers create bulletin posts (if enabled), THE system SHALL validate content using both keyword/AI checks and enforce guidelines for allowable topics; posts containing flagged content are held for moderator approval prior to publication.
- IF content is removed, THEN THE system SHALL provide a clear rationale and audit trail for the affected user(s), accessible via user dashboard.
- WHERE bulletins relate to legal or policy changes, THE system SHALL ensure users cannot dismiss/ignore the announcement until it is read.

#### Edge Cases and Exceptions
- IF product is de-listed or hidden, THEN THE system SHALL hide related inquiries and reviews from public search, but retain them for authorized audit.
- WHEN a user is placed in restricted or suspended status, THE system SHALL deny post/inquiry/review creation and display a status-specific message (see [User Roles and Authentication Requirements](./03-user-roles-and-authentication.md)).
- IF a review or inquiry is under legal hold (court order, dispute), THEN THE system SHALL lock edits/deletions and retain all versions until formal resolution.

### Workflow Examples
```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "Customer Inquiry Submission"
    A["View Product Page"] --> B["Click 'Ask a Question'"]
    B --> C["Write Question & Submit"]
    C --> D{"Passes Validation?"}
  end
  D -->|"Yes"| E["Inquiry Saved & Seller Notified"]
  D -->|"No"| F["Show Validation Error Message"]
  E --> G["Seller Posts Answer"]
  G --> H["Inquiry marked as Answered"]
  H --> I["Visible to All Customers"]
  F --> J["Allow Edit/Retry"]
```

## 2. Comment and Reply Handling
### 2.1 Overview
All users (customer, seller, admin) may comment on inquiries, reviews, or bulletins they are authorized to view; replies are fully threaded, and top-level comments may anchor discussions.

### 2.2 Functional Requirements (EARS)
- WHEN a user submits a comment or reply, THE system SHALL check length (1-500 chars), spam/profanity, and enforce one comment per minute per thread per user (burst up to 5/minute system-wide).
- WHERE a comment or reply is flagged by more than 3 unique users or by AI moderation within 24h, THE system SHALL temporarily hide it pending moderator decision.
- IF a comment or reply is deleted, THEN THE system SHALL retain a snapshot for 30 days for admin review, and indicate to remaining users that a reply has been removed.
- WHEN a thread exceeds 50 items, THE system SHALL archive the oldest comments but provide an option to "view more" or load history.
- Performance: THE system SHALL respond to comment/reply actions within 1 second for 98% of user requests.

### 2.3 Edge Cases
- IF a parent post is removed for abuse, all child comments are hidden but retained for compliance.
- IF an admin closes a thread (e.g., after dispute), THE system SHALL block further comments and indicate closure reason.

## 3. Moderation & Evidence Snapshots
### 3.1 Multi-tier Moderation
Moderation occurs at three levels:
- **Automated (AI/rule-based) first pass**
- **Seller/admin review (for their products or categories)**
- **Full admin/judicial intervention (appeals, escalations, legal holds)**

### 3.2 Business Requirements (EARS)
- WHEN any community content (inquiry, review, comment, bulletin) is submitted, THE system SHALL screen via AI for offensive, abusive, or fraudulent content, flagging items as needed for rapid evaluation.
- WHEN flagged content meets escalation criteria, THE system SHALL quarantine it, notify affected actors, and restrict further visibility except to reviewers.
- WHEN a moderator reviews flagged content, THE system SHALL present a timeline of all edits, flags, moderation actions, and evidence snapshots; every moderation decision (accept, remove, escalate) SHALL be logged with reason, reviewer, and timestamp.
- IF an item is flagged for legal hold by court or compliance, THEN THE system SHALL override normal retention and preservation limits and prevent action until release.
- WHEN moderation action is taken, THE system SHALL notify all affected users, log actions, and update visibility in <5 minutes.
- Performance: THE system SHALL process each moderation queue item within 10 seconds; audit trail for every content event must be queryable by admins and legal as required.

### 3.3 Evidence and Audit Snapshots
- THE system SHALL retain detailed audit trails for all content modifications, deletions, and flagged actions; these trails are accessible by admins and subject to right of erasure (see [Security, Compliance & Data Privacy Requirements](./13-security-compliance-and-data-privacy.md)).
- WHEN any evidence snapshot is downloaded, THE system SHALL log the request with metadata (actor, timestamp, purpose).
- WHERE a dispute or formal review is underway, THE system SHALL keep all evidence snapshots immutable until closure and record any access or download events.

### 3.4 Example: Moderation Process
```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "Moderation Flow"
    A["User Content Submitted"] --> B["AI Rule-Check"]
    B --> C{"Flagged as Problematic?"}
    C -->|"No"| D["Published Immediately"]
    C -->|"Yes"| E["Quarantine & Notify Moderators"]
    E --> F["Moderator Reviews Timeline & Snapshots"]
    F --> G{"Action Taken?"}
    G -->|"Approve"| D
    G -->|"Remove"| H["Content Blocked; User Notified"]
    G -->|"Escalate"| I["Legal/Admin Review"]
  end
```

## 4. Community Engagement Rules
### 4.1 Participation Requirements
All continued participation in posting/review/discussion is governed by:
- Minimum account age (24h from registration for new users)
- No duplicate inquiries, reviews, or bulletins per topic/product/order
- Single review per product/order
- Posting restricts for flagged or suspended users (dynamic updates)
- Automated and admin-moderated recognition of quality contributions (badges, featured placement, periodic rewards for engagement/positive impact)
- Transparent, actionable communication of all rule enforcement or status changes

### 4.2 EARS Engagement Requirements
- WHEN any user attempts to post content, THE system SHALL check minimum account age and posting rights; IF not satisfied, THEN block with reason.
- WHEN duplicate content is detected, THE system SHALL reject submission and provide recourse instructions.
- WHEN a user's content is repeatedly marked as abusive (>3 times in 3 separate threads in 72h), THE system SHALL suspend posting privileges for 72h and notify the user with appeal options.
- WHERE repeated violations occur from a seller or from customers under business review, THE system SHALL escalate to admin for longer suspension or permanent ban.
- WHEN positive contributions (as identified by admin, moderator, or AI) accrue, THE system SHALL reward the user and/or surface their posts (featured, badge, leaderboard, community announcements, etc.).
- Performance: THE system SHALL maintain all community engagement features at 99.95%+ uptime and ensure interaction latency does not exceed 2 seconds for any typical operation.

### 4.3 Example: Recognition and Restriction
```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "Contribution Feedback"
    A["User Posts or Replies"] --> B["Community, AI, Admin Evaluate"]
    B --> C{"Positive?"}
    C -->|"Yes"| D["Add Badge, Feature Post"]
    C -->|"No"| E{"Violates Community?"}
    E -->|"Yes"| F["Suspend or Escalate User"]
    E -->|"No"| G["No Action"]
  end
```

## 5. Role-Based Permission Matrix
| Action                                    | Customer | Seller | Admin |
|-------------------------------------------|----------|--------|-------|
| Submit product inquiry                    | âœ…       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Answer product inquiry                    | âŒ       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Post review (purchased product only)      | âœ…       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Respond to review                         | âŒ       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Create bulletin post                      | âœ…       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Moderate content (approve, block)         | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Feature/Hide community content            | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Download evidence snapshots               | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Flag/report community content             | âœ…       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Access flagged or hidden content          | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| View moderation/audit logs                | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Appeal moderation decisions               | âœ…       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Access historical content on legal hold   | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Be suspended or restricted                | âœ…       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Participate if under suspension           | âŒ       | âŒ     | âŒ    |
| Be rewarded/featured                      | âœ…       | âœ…     | âœ…    |

## 6. Error Handling and Performance
- IF any posting, review, or moderation action is invalidated (e.g., submitting while suspended, duplicate, or against policy), THEN THE system SHALL return a detailed, actionable error, citing rule violated, with clear recovery steps.
- WHEN data or evidence access fails (system error/unavailable/legal block), THE system SHALL display a descriptive failure message, log for admin review, and attempt auto-recovery where feasible in <2 seconds.
- WHEN network or storage conditions degrade, THE system SHALL queue actions for retry and provide status.
- Performance and latency metrics for all endpoints SHALL be logged and available for admin review to ensure SLA compliance.

## 7. AI, Analytics, and Transparency
- THE system SHALL offer dashboards to admins and sellers summarizing workload, content backlog, moderation outcomes, flagged/featured contributions, and community engagement trendsâ€”updated daily.
- WHEN suspected AI-generated or manipulated content is encountered, THE system SHALL mark/annotate for full transparency and generate a dedicated AI review flag; if thresholds are crossed, escalate to admin.
- WHERE anonymized, aggregate analytics are used, THE system SHALL provide opt-out (where required by policy) and follow data governance guidelines per [Security, Compliance & Data Privacy Requirements](./13-security-compliance-and-data-privacy.md).

## 8. Compliance, Data Integrity, and Related Policies
- THE system SHALL align all retention, privacy, and evidence policies with [Security, Compliance & Data Privacy Requirements](./13-security-compliance-and-data-privacy.md), including right of erasure, legal hold, and audit retention periods.
- All cross-referenced content access and data downloads SHALL be logged per security requirements.
- All audit and evidence requirements apply equally to routine, escalated, or legal case handling.

## 9. Illustrative User Scenarios
### Scenario 1: Customer Posts Inquiry
- Customer browses to product page, clicks â€œAsk a Questionâ€, submits inquiry. System validates input and, if approved, posts inquiry and notifies seller.
- Seller answers in dashboard, marking question resolved. System notifies customer and displays answer under product.
- If no answer after 72 hours, system escalates to admin for review or follow-up.

### Scenario 2: Review Moderation Edge Case
- After a customer posts a review, it receives several abuse flags. AI detects potentially manipulated language and holds review for moderator check.
- Moderator reviews audit log, sees similar abuse in other reviews from same user, and chooses to suspend account for 72 hours, preserving all evidence snapshots.
- If the review was accurate and abuse flags unfounded, moderator can restore visibility, and system notifies all involved parties of the outcome.

### Scenario 3: Bulletin Legal/Policy Update
- Admin posts a critical legal update via bulletin. System automatically pins post, requires users to acknowledge, and logs all acknowledgments for compliance.
- Users attempting to bypass notification are prevented until acknowledgment is confirmed.

## 10. Integration and Linked Policies
- See [User Roles and Authentication Requirements](./03-user-roles-and-authentication.md) for detailed ban/restriction flows.
- Enforcement, evidence, and data handling are further defined in [Security, Compliance & Data Privacy Requirements](./13-security-compliance-and-data-privacy.md) and [Business Rules and Validation Requirements](./12-business-rules-and-validation.md).

# Favorites and Personalization Requirement Specification

## Introduction & Scope
This document defines the detailed business requirements for the favorites and personalization features within the shoppingMall backend system. It targets developers responsible for implementing core business logic that allows customers, sellers, and admins to mark and manage favorites (products, inquiries, addresses) and benefit from tailored personalization based on saved states, with a focus on traceability, recoverability, and high-performance integration. All technical implementation decisions (architecture, persistence layer, API format, etc.) remain solely with the backend development team and are out of scope.

## Business Context and Objectives
Personalization is a core driver for user engagement and retention in e-commerce platforms. Providing robust favorites management allows users to track interesting products, previous inquiries, and preferred delivery addresses. Snapshots of state-at-favorite-time ensure business transparency and support display/recovery of information, even as core catalog or user data evolvesâ€”critical for supporting customer trust and frictionless repeat purchase scenarios. Sellers and admins rely on accurate favorite and personalization data for analytics, recommendations, and targeted communications.

## Supported User Roles and Permission Overview

- WHEN a user attempts to interact with an inactive, unpublished, or otherwise obsolete favorite, THE system SHALL inform the user of status and provide recovery or alternate action paths.
- Optional: WHERE user preferences enable periodic reminders, THE system SHALL notify users of "forgotten" or unacted-upon favorites (configurable period, e.g., 30/60/90 days).

## Business and Validation Rules
- THE system SHALL enforce a unique (user, item-type, item) constraint, preventing duplicate favorites.
- THE system SHALL validate the integrity of snapshot dataâ€”rejecting malformed, incomplete, or unauthorized snapshot creations.

## Integration with Other Modules

- THE system SHALL enable tracking and reporting of favorite/personalization statistics by user segment for business insight.

## Introduction and Business Context
Personalization and favorites management are pivotal for user engagement, repeat purchases, and platform stickiness in the shoppingMall backend. These features empower customers and sellers to curate, track, and quickly access preferred products, inquiries, and addresses. Robust snapshot and restoration logic enables trust in personalization features, allowing users to revisit historical states and supporting legal, audit, and business analytics use cases. Admins access all favorites and personalization records for analytics, compliance, and support, but never possess or edit their own favorites.

## User Role Matrix and Permissions

| Feature                   | Customer | Seller  | Admin (View/Analytics) |

| Inquiry Favorites         | âœ… Add/Remove/Restore (Own) | âœ… Add/Remove/Restore (Own) | âœ… View All |
| Address Favorites         | âœ… Add/Remove/Restore (Own) | âœ… Add/Remove/Restore (Own) | âœ… View All |

| Restoration/Recovery      | âœ… Initiate (Own)           | âœ… Initiate (Own)           | âœ… Audit, Restore for Compliance |

- THE system SHALL require authentication for any favorite or personalization access. IF an unauthorized request is made, THEN THE system SHALL deny with error code AUTH_REQUIRED.
- THE system SHALL prevent admins from creating or favoriting items for themselves, enforcing role boundaries.
- WHEN a user is deleted, THE system SHALL remove all their favorite records in compliance with data retention and audit policy.

## Functional Requirements: Favorites for Products, Inquiries, Addresses

### Product Favorites
- WHEN an authenticated customer or seller selects an active product, THE system SHALL allow addition to their product favorites list, assuming maximum count (default 500) is not exceeded.
- WHEN a favorite is created, THE system SHALL snapshot current product fields: product ID, title, main image(s), seller, base price, discount, inventory status, core attributes, and timestamp.
- IF a user removes a product favorite, THEN THE system SHALL mark the relation deleted but retain the snapshot for 30 days (configurable) to enable restoration.
- IF the maximum favorite count is reached, THEN THE system SHALL deny new favorites and return error code MAX_FAVORITES_REACHED.
- WHEN a product is unpublished, delisted, or deleted, THE system SHALL mark corresponding favorites inactive and, at userâ€™s next session or query, trigger a notification with the reason ("Removed by seller", etc.).
- WHEN a user restores a deleted favorite within policy window, THE system SHALL unmark logical deletion and reinstate the favorite snapshot.
- WHERE a product favorite is invalid due to regulatory or compliance event (e.g., fraudulent product removal), THE system SHALL permanently block access and delete all related snapshots after policy-mandated retention period.
- THE system SHALL ensure that each user can only favorite each product once; IF duplicate attempt, THEN return error code DUPLICATE_FAVORITE.

### Inquiry Favorites
- WHEN authenticated, users can mark an inquiry (product Q&A or bulletin) as favorite; THE system SHALL store snapshot: inquiry ID, product ID, question, answer details, responder, creation/answered time.
- WHEN the inquiry content is modified after favoriting, THE system SHALL allow the user to refresh the snapshot to reflect new state, or keep original for history/tracking.
- WHEN an inquiry is deleted, THE system SHALL mark favorite as inactive and notify the user at next relevant interaction.

### Address Favorites
- WHEN a user adds a shipping or delivery address as favorite, THE system SHALL snapshot: address details, label, phone/email contact, default/delivery preferences, and timestamp.
- THE system SHALL enforce maximum favorite addresses per user (default: 10, policy-driven), with error if limit exceeded.
- WHEN an address record is removed or updated, THE system SHALL prompt the user to update the corresponding favorite snapshot or retain the prior version for audit or restoration.
- WHEN a favorite address is deleted, THE system SHALL retain the snapshot for 30 days to allow for user-initiated restoration.
- WHEN address becomes invalid (e.g., jurisdiction change, complaint), THE system SHALL mark the favorite inactive and require explicit action for reactivation.

## Snapshot and State-at-Time-of-Favorite Logic

- WHEN any favorite is created, THE system SHALL store a complete business-level snapshot of all relevant fields, including the referencing context (user ID, item type), and a timestamp.
- THE snapshot SHALL NOT automatically update unless the user explicitly requests a refresh, except for compliance-triggered data correction.
- WHEN presenting favorites to the user, THE system SHALL clearly distinguish between snapshot data (historical, time-of-favoriting) and current, live data (if item is still active), with clear indication of differences (e.g., price change, status change).
- IF a referenced entity (product, inquiry, address) is deleted or hidden, THEN THE system SHALL display snapshot only if permitted by policy, else hide the record and note reason.
- THE system SHALL ensure all snapshots are strictly user-scoped and isolated from other accounts and roles.

## Personalization Logic, Notifications, and Recovery

- WHEN a user's favorites set changes (add/remove/restore), THE system SHALL trigger a recalculation of the user's personalization profile for recommendations, recently used addresses, and related analytics.
- WHEN a significant business event affects a favorited item (price drop, back-in-stock, product delisting), THE system SHALL dispatch notifications to affected users via enabled channels (in-app, email, SMS) respecting communication preferences.
- WHEN a user enables periodic reminders, THE system SHALL check for dormant favorites (no view/use for 30/60/90 days, as configured) and send an informational prompt to encourage action or cleanup.
- WHERE system analytics or admin review identifies mass inactives (e.g., a seller withdrawn 100+ products), THE system SHALL batch notify all affected favorite owners with cause and action options.
- IF notification delivery fails or a user action is not completed, THEN THE system SHALL log all attempts, update status for compliance audit, and optionally retry where permitted.

## Validation, Restoration, and Error Handling

- THE system SHALL validate all favorite creation requests against active status, user authentication, business/pricing policy, and maximum/frequency limits.
- IF validation fails, THEN THE system SHALL return actionable, user-facing error codes and messages (e.g., ITEM_UNAVAILABLE, AUTH_REQUIRED, TOO_MANY_FAVORITES).
- IF favorites or snapshots are corrupted, missing, or out-of-sync with business rules, THEN THE system SHALL provide recovery flows: show alternative actions, allow manual restore, or request update/resync.
- WHEN discrete legal events (user request for erasure, GDPR/CCPA, fraud investigation) occur, THE system SHALL permit admins to audit, quarantine, or erase favorite records as required, preserving all actions with rationale in business audit logs.
- WHEN a user initiates favorite or snapshot restoration within retention policy window, THE system SHALL restore entire business snapshot and status with one action, and return result within 2 seconds for typical set size (â‰¤100 items).
- IF address or item becomes permanently invalid (compliance, fraud, legal order), THEN THE system SHALL block restore, permanently erase associated data as required, and notify all affected roles.

## Performance and Scalability Requirements

- WHEN a user queries their favorite set, THE system SHALL deliver up to 100 favorites with snapshots in â‰¤1s; paginate further queries also â‰¤1s per page.
- WHEN a favorite is added/removed/restored, THE system SHALL process, snapshot, and confirm success or error within 1s for 99% of attempts.
- THE system SHALL support 10,000+ users concurrently managing favorites/personalization, with horizontal scalability as user base grows.
- THE favorites and personalization module SHALL be available with >99.99% uptime, with performance metrics accessible/admin-auditable via analytics.

## Administrative and Business Flows

### Analytics and Monitoring
- THE system SHALL allow admins to generate reports on favorites and personalization usage by role, segment, activity period, or affected item type.
- WHEN generating analytics, THE system SHALL aggregate anonymized favorite counts, restoration rates, notification deltas, and error/exception statistics, compliant with privacy laws.
- WHEN suspicious or fraudulent favorite patterns (e.g., bulk favorites, bot-like behavior) are detected, THE system SHALL alert admins for manual review and potential account action.

### Integration
- THE system SHALL integrate with catalog, inquiry, address, user, notification, and analytics modules with strict referential integrity; failures in integration SHALL trigger error events for admin/correction.
- WHEN a catalog/product or address is updated/deleted, THE system SHALL synchronize favorite status or remove references as per the business rule before displaying results to users.

## Example Workflows and Edge Cases (EARS)
- WHEN a seller makes a bulk product withdrawal, THE system SHALL deactivate related product favorites, batch notify affected users, and offer restoration if/when products are republished.
- IF an attempt is made to favorite an expired or region-restricted item, THEN THE system SHALL reject the attempt and explain the business/legal constraint.
- WHEN a user with a maximum allowed favorites count attempts to favorite another item, THEN THE system SHALL suggest removal of older/unused favorites before continuing.
- IF a favorite creation or restoration fails system-side, THEN THE system SHALL log the error with full context and provide user a support request option.
- WHEN personalization is used to recommend products/inquiries or autofill order address, THE system SHALL prefer current active items but clearly indicate if historical snapshots are used instead.

# Business Context
This requirement analysis report establishes the BUSINESS logic and detailed process rules for user roles and authentication within the AI-driven shoppingMall backend. The purpose is to clarify every business rule related to user roles (customer, seller, admin), permissions, authentication processes, token management, and account lifecycle scenarios without dictating technical implementation.

## User Roles Overview
- customer: End-users accessing the shopping mall for browsing, purchasing, order management, personalization, coupon usage, and communication. Authentication required for all personalized or transactional features.
- seller: Users who manage and list products, oversee customer orders, handle inventory, and customer service for their offerings. May act as customers, but must have verified seller status for product listing and sales management.
- admin: System administrators managing the platform globally, channel operations, compliance, analytics, moderation, and all advanced configuration. Holds maximum authority and access. Authentication via high-security means.

# Detailed Requirement Analysis

## Introduction and Context
THE shoppingMall backend SHALL provide a secure, robust, and flexible authentication and authorization model supporting all defined user roles and business activities, ensuring both regulatory compliance and seamless user experience.

## Role Catalog & Definitions
### Role Definitions

| Role Name | Description | Typical Actions |
|-----------|-------------|-----------------|
| customer  | End-user; shops, manages orders, reviews, accrues loyalty/mileage, communicates, uses favorites | Register, login, browse, purchase, manage account, write reviews, favorite products |
| seller    | Vendor; lists products, manages inventory, handles orders, provides customer service | Register/convert to seller, manage products, process orders, customer communication |
| admin     | Platform admin; full platform control, moderation, configuration, compliance | Manage users, sellers, settings, content moderation, analytics |

### Role Business Rules Using EARS
- THE shoppingMall backend SHALL require authentication for all transactional and personalized actions.

- WHEN a customer registers, THE system SHALL validate email, password, and agreement to terms as mandatory.

- WHEN a seller registers or requests seller privileges, THE system SHALL require additional business verification before seller privileges are granted.

- WHEN an admin account is provisioned, THE system SHALL enforce high-security registration, with multi-factor requirements and explicit role assignment by an existing admin.

- WHERE a user holds multiple roles (e.g., seller as customer), THE system SHALL reflect the union of all applicable permissions in session.

- WHEN a non-authenticated user attempts a restricted action, THE system SHALL deny access and guide the user to authentication.


## Authentication Flows (API-Driven)
### Registration
- WHEN a new user registers, THE system SHALL collect minimum required information:
  - For customer: Email (validated format), password (policy compliant), full name, marketing opt-in (optional), agreement to terms (required)
  - For seller: Above, plus business identification, tax details, business name and address, seller agreement, and verification status
  - For admin: Only existing admin can create; multi-factor enforced; role cannot be self-assigned

- IF registration data is incomplete or invalid, THEN THE system SHALL reject registration and present clear, actionable feedback for every missing/incomplete field.

### Login & Session Creation
- WHEN a user submits login credentials via API, THE system SHALL validate credentials and respond within 2 seconds for 99% of requests.

- IF authentication fails due to bad credentials, THEN THE system SHALL return clear error codes and guidance for password recovery.

- WHEN login succeeds, THE system SHALL generate a new session, issue JWT access and refresh tokens, and log session metadata (device, channel, IP, issued time, expiration).

- WHERE multi-channel access is required, THE system SHALL allow concurrent sessions per device/channel, but enforce session expiration and revocation rules by configuration.

- WHEN a user logs out via API, THE system SHALL immediately revoke active session tokens for that device or channel.

- WHERE abnormal login patterns are detected (multiple failed attempts, impossible travel, flagged IPs), THE system SHALL trigger account lockout or step-up authentication per security policy.

### Password & Credential Management
- WHEN a user requests password reset, THE system SHALL verify email (and, for seller/admin, additional verification step) and issue a time-limited reset token via secure delivery channel.

- WHEN changing password, THE system SHALL enforce password policy (min 10 characters, at least one upper/lower/digit/special char), require old password for confirmation, and require new password differ from last three passwords.

- WHEN a password reset link/token is used, THE system SHALL invalidate the token after a single use or after expiration.

### Account Verification and Role Escalation
- WHEN a seller role is requested, THE system SHALL place the user in a "pending seller" state until external verification (documents provided, validated, and status set to "verified seller").

- WHEN admin privileges are assigned, THE system SHALL require authorization by an existing admin, with all actions fully auditable.

### Session and Token Lifecycle
- THE system SHALL issue JWTs as standard tokens for API authentication. 
- THE access token SHALL expire in 15 minutes; refresh token SHALL expire after 14 days by default.
- THE session SHALL expire immediately upon logout, device de-authentication, or admin revocation.
- WHERE user requests "log out everywhere", THE system SHALL revoke all active sessions and tokens for that user account.

### Cross-Channel Authentication Support
- WHERE a user authenticates on multiple channels (web, mobile app, partner platform), THE system SHALL support independent session tracking per channel, with unified access and synchronized logout where requested.

### Authentication Process Flow (Mermaid Diagram)
```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "User Registration and Login"
    A["Begin Registration"]
    B["Input Required Info"]
    C["Email Validation"]
    D["Seller Verification (if seller)"]
    E["Account Provisioned"]
    F["Login via API"]
    G["Credential Validation"]
    H["Session & Tokens Issued"]
  end
  
  subgraph "Session Maintenance"
    I["Access Control via JWT"]
    J["API Call Authorization"]
    K["Session Expiration/Revocation"]
    L["Logout / Forced Logout"]
  end
  
  A --> B --> C
  C -->|"If seller"| D
  D --> E
  C -->|"Else"| E
  E --> F
  F --> G --> H
  H --> I --> J
  J --> K
  K --> L
```

## Role-based Permission Matrix

| Action                                             | customer | seller | admin |
|----------------------------------------------------|----------|--------|-------|
| Register as user                                  | âœ…       | âœ…     | âŒ    |
| Register/Apply for seller                         | âŒ       | âœ…     | âŒ    |
| Customer login                                    | âœ…       | âœ…*    | âŒ    |
| Seller dashboard access                           | âŒ       | âœ…     | âŒ    |
| Admin dashboard / platform mgmt                   | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Product listing                                   | âŒ       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Order placement (checkout)                        | âœ…       | âœ…*    | âŒ    |
| Order management                                  | âœ…       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Manage own account/profile                        | âœ…       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| View history, reviews, favorites                  | âœ…       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Review posting/moderation                         | âœ…       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Coupon/mileage accrual and redemption             | âœ…       | âœ…     | âŒ    |
| Access to analytics/reports                       | âŒ       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Compliance & content moderation                   | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Configuration of categories, business rules       | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| System-wide user or seller management             | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| JWT refresh & token management                    | âœ…       | âœ…     | âœ…    |

*Seller users may also act as customers, i.e., perform customer actions

## Session, Token, and Security Management

- THE shoppingMall backend SHALL enforce all session, token, and authentication security standards according to current compliance (see [Security, Compliance & Data Privacy](./13-security-compliance-and-data-privacy.md)).

- WHEN a session is established, THE system SHALL securely store session metadata, including device information, authentication time, and channel.

- WHERE a tokenâ€™s integrity is in doubt (e.g., signature mismatch, expired, tampered), THE system SHALL reject the request and prompt re-authentication.

- WHEN a user or admin initiates session revocation, THE system SHALL immediately terminate the affected session(s) and ensure no further access is granted via revoked tokens.

- IF authentication is attempted with a stale or reused refresh token, THEN THE system SHALL flag the account for security review and deny new sessions.

## Account Lifecycle Scenarios

- WHEN user registration is successful, THE system SHALL send a confirmation email or notification.

- IF a userâ€™s email is not confirmed within 48 hours, THEN THE system SHALL restrict access until confirmation.

- WHEN a user deactivates their account, THE system SHALL erase authentication tokens and mark account as inactive; reactivation SHALL require verification.

- WHEN a user is banned or permanently disabled by admin action, THE system SHALL revoke all sessions and display a ban notification on auth attempts.

- WHERE password reset or session recovery is in progress, THE system SHALL restrict other sensitive actions until process completion.

- WHEN business or regulatory rules change (e.g., password policy, onboarding requirements), THE system SHALL apply changes to all affected subsequent authentications.

## Common Error Scenarios and Handling
- IF a user exceeds failed login attempts (e.g., 5 failures within 1 hour), THEN THE system SHALL temporarily lock the account for 15 minutes and notify the user.

- IF role escalation attempts (e.g., customer to seller) are incomplete or falsified, THEN THE system SHALL deny escalation and provide reasoned feedback.

- IF admin login attempts are detected from non-whitelisted IPs or abnormal contexts, THEN THE system SHALL enforce additional approval measures and alert security admins.

## Performance Expectations
- THE shoppingMall backend SHALL perform all authentication and authorization processes, including token issuance and validation, within 2 seconds for 99% of cases.

- THE system SHALL synchronize session revocation and logout actions across devices/channels within 10 seconds.

- Session and token management SHALL support failover and high availability to prevent authentication downtime.

# End of Requirements

# shoppingMall User Roles & Authentication Requirements

## Business Context & Principles
The shoppingMall backend provides the foundation for secure, scalable, and compliant user authentication and role-based authorization, serving as the backbone for all business-critical operations. The business must support multi-role access (customer, seller, admin), channel-agnostic logins, robust trust boundaries, and comprehensive business rule enforcement, all while maintaining world-class response times, traceability, privacy, and regulatory compliance. Authentication processes must be extensible to future business or compliance needs and provide the highest assurance for sensitive operations. This specification establishes all actionable requirements, flows, and validation rules for user roles and authentication, using only clear, non-technical business language suitable for backend developers.

---

## Role Catalog & Definitions

### Role Purpose and Boundaries
| Role      | Purpose & Responsibilities                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           | Unique Business Rules & Limitations                                                                             |
|-----------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Customer  | End-user of the shoppingMall service. Responsible for browsing, searching, ordering, reviewing, using discounts/loyalty, favoriting, and interacting via all business channels. Has visibility and control only over their own orders, profile, and personalization.         | Must be registered and authenticated for all personalized/transactional services. Cannot escalate role unverified. Cannot access seller/admin features. One active account per individual. |
| Seller    | Business partner who lists and manages products, handles inventory, processes orders, and communicates with customers. Can administer their own business logic, campaigns, and channel presence (if authorized). May order as a customer, but has elevated responsibilities on their seller account.         | Must pass business identity vetting before activation. Cannot self-authorize seller status. Role switching is session-based. Limit scope to own products/orders. Seller actions audited.  |
| Admin     | Platform authority for managing users, sellers, content, compliance, analytics, rules, and all configuration. Only trusted staff/founders can hold admin role. Expected to act only on business needs/intervention, not as regular buyer/seller.                             | Requires multi-factor authentication and approval from an existing admin. Cannot self-provision or delegate admin status arbitrarily. All activities are tracked with audit trails.         |

#### Special Business Rules (EARS format)
- THE shoppingMall backend SHALL require successful authentication before allowing any transactional, personalized, or configuration action, except for basic catalog browsing.
- WHEN a new user registers, THE shoppingMall backend SHALL validate all required registration criteria per role, and block on any missing or invalid fields.
- WHEN a seller applies for elevated status, THE shoppingMall backend SHALL place the user in "pending seller" until vetting/approval is finalized by admin.
- WHEN an admin account is created or escalated, THE shoppingMall backend SHALL enforce multi-factor authentication, IP whitelisting, and dual-admin approval for all privilege changes.
- WHERE a single user holds both customer and seller roles (e.g., business buying for self), THE shoppingMall backend SHALL enable the session to reflect combined permissions for each permitted function, enforcing the more restrictive rule where actions overlap.
- IF an unauthenticated user attempts a protected/provisioned resource, THEN THE shoppingMall backend SHALL deny access and provide user guidance toward authentication within 2 seconds.
- IF any role attempts an action outside its business scope, THEN THE system SHALL block the action and present a clear, actionable, business rule error.

---

## Authentication Flows (API-Driven)

### Registration and Onboarding
- WHEN a customer registers, THE shoppingMall backend SHALL require and validate:
    - Unique, valid-format email address (RFC-compliant, business or general address)
    - Password adhering to business complexity policy (minimum 10 characters, at least one upper/lower/digit/special character)
    - Legal name (as appears on valid credentials or payment methods)
    - Explicit agreement to terms, compliance, privacy, and option for marketing consent
    - Immediate email/SMS verification step upon registration
- WHEN a seller applies/registers, THE system SHALL require:
    - All customer data, plus legal business name, business registration/tax identifiers, verifiable business address and phone, consent to seller agreement, and supporting business documents
    - "Pending seller" status is default until admin vetting passes; any missing field or mismatch SHALL present a business-specific error field and remediation instructions
- WHEN an admin is provisioned, THE system SHALL restrict admin creation to dual-admin approval (two existing admins must approve, unless this is the initial bootstrap account), must require multi-factor authentication device setup (SMS, app, or hardware key), and must ensure strong password and unique contact information. Self-registration as admin is prohibited under all circumstances.

### Authentication & Session Creation
- WHEN any user submits log-in credentials via API, THE shoppingMall backend SHALL respond within 2 seconds (99% percentile) to either authenticate and issue an active session or provide a clear actionable denial code (e.g., ERR_INVALID_PASSWORD, ERR_ACCOUNT_LOCKED).
- IF authentication fails, THEN THE system SHALL present tailored error guidance (e.g., password reset flow, unlock after lockout, re-enable after ban) without ever revealing which field (ID vs password) was incorrect (to mitigate account guessing).
- WHEN login completes, THE shoppingMall backend SHALL:
    - Generate JWT access and refresh tokens, tied to the user, role(s), device, and channel
    - Log details for traceability (IP, user agent, time, session fingerprint)
    - Allow concurrent sessions per configured device/channel limits
    - Update internal session state for multi-role (e.g., seller ordering as customer)
    - Enforce session expiration, concurrency, and immediately invalidate/revoke sessions/tokens on logout, ban, or policy action
- WHEN a user requests "log out everywhere," THE shoppingMall backend SHALL invalidate all active sessions and tokens for that account regardless of channel or device (keyup to 10 seconds latency system-wide).

### Multi-Channel and Advanced Authentication Flows
- WHERE a user logs in from multiple channels (web/mobile/partner), THE shoppingMall backend SHALL maintain and track independent session state per channel, enforce synchronized policy and provide an aggregated session management view (on demand per user, always for admin audit view).
- WHEN abnormal login patterns are detected (e.g., >5 failed attempts within 1 hour, login from new/flagged device or geolocation, impossible travel, connection from banned IP), THE shoppingMall backend SHALL immediately lock that account and require re-verification before unlocking; IF attempted as admin/seller, THEN escalate to targeted support/audit queue and require admin action for release.
- WHEN a password reset is initiated, THE backend SHALL send a one-time, expiring reset link (valid 30 minutes) to confirmed email/SMS; for seller or admin, enforce extra identifier (e.g. last four digits of verified business phone, 2FA code, or admin override for recovery).
- WHEN changing password, THE system SHALL require entry of old password, enforce compliance with business password policy (no reuse from last 3), verify new password strength, and ensure process is atomic (either succeed or provide user with a clear error for correction).
- WHEN a password reset token/link or code is used, THE system SHALL expire the token instantly on use (single-use), deny usage after expiration, and log all attempts for audit.

### Detailed Authentication Flow (Mermaid)
```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "User Registration and Login"
    AR["Begin Registration"] --> BR["Input Required Info"]
    BR --> CR["Email/SMS Validation"]
    CR -->|"If seller"| DR["Upload/Review Seller Credentials"]
    CR -->|"Else"| ER["Account Provisioned"]
    DR --> ER
    ER --> FR["Login via API"]
    FR --> GR["Credential Validation"]
    GR -->|"Valid"| HR["Session & JWT Token Issued"]
    GR -->|"Invalid"| IR["Actionable Error & Guidance"]
  end

  subgraph "Session Management"
    JR["Access via JWT"] --> KR["API Call Authorization"]
    KR --> LR["Session Expiry & Revocation"]
    LR --> MR["Logout/Force Logout"]
    MR --> NR["Audit & Traceability"]
  end
```

#### Registration, Login, Password Reset Error Scenarios
- IF customer registration with email/phone already in use, THEN THE system SHALL block registration and require unique credentials for new accounts.
- IF password does not meet business complexity, THEN THE system SHALL deny registration/change and clearly state corrective steps.
- IF login is attempted with deactivated or banned account, THEN THE system SHALL block and inform user of next steps (e.g., reactivate, contact support, permanent ban reason).
- WHEN a reset link is used after expiry or more than once, THE system SHALL deny and require re-initiation of the reset request, with clear status.
- IF admin account is accessed outside allowed IP/country/time/frequency policy, THEN THE system SHALL block, trigger audit, and notify senior admin/security desk immediately.

---

## Role-based Permission Matrix

| Action                                               | Customer | Seller | Admin |
|------------------------------------------------------|----------|--------|-------|
| Register account                                     |    âœ…    |   âœ…   |  âŒ   |
| Register & apply for seller                          |    âŒ    |   âœ…   |  âŒ   |
| User login                                           |    âœ…    |   âœ…*  |  âŒ   |
| Seller dashboard access                              |    âŒ    |   âœ…   |  âŒ   |
| Admin dashboard/configuration                        |    âŒ    |   âŒ   |  âœ…   |
| List/manage products                                 |    âŒ    |   âœ…   |  âœ…   |
| Place order (checkout)                               |    âœ…    |   âœ…*  |  âŒ   |
| Manage orders                                        |    âœ…    |   âœ…   |  âœ…   |
| Manage own account/profile                           |    âœ…    |   âœ…   |  âœ…   |
| View own history, reviews, favorites                  |    âœ…    |   âœ…   |  âœ…   |
| Post/review/moderate reviews/inquiries               |    âœ…    |   âœ…   |  âœ…   |
| Use/accrue coupons, mileage                          |    âœ…    |   âœ…   |  âŒ   |
| Access analytics/reports (own/business/global)       |    âŒ    |   âœ…   |  âœ…   |
| Perform compliance/content moderation                |    âŒ    |   âŒ   |  âœ…   |
| Configure categories/business rules                  |    âŒ    |   âŒ   |  âœ…   |
| Manage users and sellers system-wide                 |    âŒ    |   âŒ   |  âœ…   |
| JWT refresh, token management                        |    âœ…    |   âœ…   |  âœ…   |
| Admin privilege escalation/delegation                |    âŒ    |   âŒ   |  âœ…   |

*Seller can act as customer for purchasing/reviewing

#### Example Scenario Narratives
- WHEN a seller is logged in and visits customer features, THE backend SHALL present only permitted functions and enforce business rule separation (e.g., access to only own orders as seller, all personal orders as customer, but never other sellersâ€™ business data).
- WHERE an admin needs to impersonate a seller or customer for support, THE backend SHALL audit every access and restrict editing beyond remediation scope, to avoid privilege abuse or data leak.

---

## Session, Token, and Security Management

### JWT Usage & Token Lifecycle
- THE shoppingMall backend SHALL use JWT (signed) as access and refresh tokens for all authenticated API calls.
- THE access token SHALL expire within 15 minutes; refresh tokens SHALL default to 14 days, but honor system configuration for stricter policies.
- THE user session SHALL terminate immediately upon explicit logout, device/account deactivation, admin revocation, or policy violation.
- JWT payloads SHALL encode: userId, verified role(s), session metadata (device, channel), issued/expiry, permissions (array or scope claims). Admin tokens SHALL include privilege signatures and issuing admin ID. All tokens SHALL be cryptographically signed, not just encoded.
- Refresh tokens SHALL be single-use; reusing a stale/used refresh token SHALL trigger immediate session termination and account lock pending security review.
- All session/token actions SHALL be fully auditableâ€”THE backend SHALL log every issuance, usage, and revocation, including correlating request metadata.

### Secure Session & Device Management
- WHEN a user attempts login from a new device/channel, THE backend SHALL record fingerprint for future anomaly detection and notify the user (e.g., email/SMS push).
- THE backend SHALL support per-device/channel session management and allow users to review, revoke, and manage their active sessions (mandatory for admin/seller, optional for customer).
- WHERE abnormal session behavior is detected (e.g., concurrent access from locations >1000km apart within 1 hour, usage from known anonymous proxies, flagged device identity), THE backend SHALL force a security review (challenge by known channel, forced logout, audit, notification).

### Integration with Compliance & Security Policy
- All session and token discipline SHALL comply with applicable security requirements (see [Security, Compliance & Data Privacy Requirements](./13-security-compliance-and-data-privacy.md)).
- WHEN legal/regulatory changes require stricter authentication/session policy, THE backend SHALL enforce updated policies for all future logins and require remediation for non-compliant existing sessions.

---

## Account Lifecycle Scenarios

### Account Registration, Activation, and Confirmation
- WHEN user registration is completed, THE backend SHALL send a confirmation message (email/SMS), set registration as "pending verification," and only unlock full access when verified.
- IF a user's email/phone is not confirmed within 48 hours, THEN THE backend SHALL restrict all login or transactional actions and prompt user to complete verification.
- WHEN registration remains incomplete after 7 days (pending verification), THE backend SHALL purge unverified accounts and log for compliance.

### Account Deactivation, Reactivation, and Lockout
- WHEN an active user requests deactivation, THE backend SHALL erase authentication tokens, mark the account as inactive, and present legal compliance messaging (account recovery only via verification).
- WHEN a previously deactivated account requests reactivation, THE backend SHALL require complete re-verification (email/SMS, document as needed for sellers, dual admin approval for admins).
- IF a user or admin bans/disables an account (e.g., fraud, terms violation), THE backend SHALL revoke all sessions and tokens, archive user data, and display a ban notification on all future access attempts. Time-limited bans SHALL auto re-enable accounts when duration elapses and all conditions are met.
- WHERE password reset or sensitive account recovery is in progress, THE backend SHALL suspend all other sensitive actions and alert the user via all verified channels.
- WHEN a role escalation or transition (e.g., customer to seller) is incomplete, failed, or found fraudulent, THE backend SHALL deny or roll back all privilege changes, log evidence, and require admin review for remediation.

### Audit, Review, and Evidence Handling
- All account changes SHALL be fully auditableâ€”THE backend SHALL record:
  - Actor (user/admin), timestamps, nature of event (registration, escalation, lockout, ban, reactivation)
  - Justification, supporting evidence for abnormal events (e.g., admin comments, attached correspondence, legal order)
  - Snapshots of relevant account/session/token state before and after changes, for full forensic traces
- WHERE evidence is required for a dispute, regulatory review, or compliance hold, THE backend SHALL export relevant account/session/journal entries per business policy, retaining logs for minimum retention period (e.g., 7 years or applicable local law)

---

## Performance, Scalability, and Reliability Expectations
- All authentication, session, authorization, and permission validation processes SHALL complete within 2 seconds for 99% of cases under normal load; degradation cases SHALL trigger alerts and business review.
- Session revocation, forced logout, and permission changes SHALL synchronize across all devices, channels, and API nodes within 10 seconds (end-to-end), and SHALL log any delays or failures for escalation.
- Authentication services SHALL support horizontal scalability, failover, and high availability such that no single-point-of-failure jeopardizes account access or security; planned maintenance SHALL provide user-facing notice per business policy.

---

## Error Handling and User-Facing Remediation
- IF a user exceeds 5 failed login attempts within any 1-hour window, THEN THE backend SHALL lock the account for 15 minutes, present a tailored error upon access, and prompt unlock/remediation steps. If repeated lockouts occur within 24 hours, escalate to manual review.
- IF user role escalation is denied due to incomplete vetting or detected fraud, THEN THE backend SHALL record and present actionable error and remediation path (e.g., submit documents/support), and block privilege elevation until resolved.
- IF admin login occurs from an unauthorized device, network, or location, THEN THE backend SHALL block login, alert admin/security, and require 2-factor approval to authorize access or restore admin privileges.
- IF system or integration technical error prevents authentication, THEN THE backend SHALL present a business error message, log technical detail for compliance, and provide retry/remediation information for users within 5 minutes.

---

## Links to Related Business Rules
- For privacy, secure permission, and compliance requirements, see [Security, Compliance & Data Privacy Requirements](./13-security-compliance-and-data-privacy.md).
- For core business model and revenue logic, see [Business Model and Objectives](./02-business-model.md).
- For exhaustive user scenarios, see [User Scenarios and Service Flows](./04-user-scenarios-and-flows.md).
- For product management, see [Product and Category Management Requirements](./05-product-and-category-management.md).

---
