# Security, Compliance & Data Privacy Requirements for shoppingMall Backend

## Personal Data Protection

### Legal Basis for Processing and Consent Management
- WHEN collecting, storing, or processing any user personal data, THE shoppingMall backend SHALL ensure that every data item is processed under a clear legal basis as defined by the corresponding jurisdictionâ€”including user consent, contractual necessity, legal compliance, or legitimate interest.
- WHEN seeking user consent for personal data processing (such as marketing, analytics, or third-party sharing), THE system SHALL present a clear, specific consent interface and SHALL record timestamped, granular consent for each category of data and purpose, in a tamper-evident audit log.
- IF a user declines or withdraws consent for any data category, THEN THE system SHALL immediately cease all related processing and SHALL notify all downstream or third-party data processors of consent withdrawal within 24 hours.
- WHERE processing is based on legitimate interest, THE system SHALL provide users with the means to object and SHALL document the business assessment justifying such processing, available for audit.

### Data Minimization, Retention & Deletion (Right to be Forgotten)
- THE system SHALL only collect and store user data strictly necessary for service delivery, personalization, regulatory compliance, fraud prevention, and business operations. Nonessential or extraneous data SHALL NOT be requested nor retained.
- WHEN a user requests access to or deletion of their personal data (right to access, right to erasure), THE system SHALL verify the userâ€™s identity and SHALL fulfill the request within the timeframes specified by applicable regulation (GDPR: 30 days, CCPA: 45 days, etc.).
- WHEN a deletion/erasure request is granted, THE system SHALL permanently remove or anonymize all user-identifiable records, inform all internal modules and any third parties, and record compliance actions for future audit.
- WHERE legal obligations require data retention (e.g., transaction logs for tax/regulatory reasons), THE system SHALL restrict access and repurpose retained data purely for compliance, clearly separating it from business or marketing workflows.

### Cross-Border Data Transfer and Multi-Jurisdiction Compliance
- WHEN personal data is transferred across jurisdictions (e.g., customer data from EU to US), THE system SHALL enforce all necessary safeguards: standard contractual clauses (SCC), adequacy decisions, or explicit user consent captured and auditable.
- THE system SHALL classify and label all user data by residency and transfer status, ensuring mapping to applicable data protection regulations (GDPR, CCPA, LGPD, PIPEDA, etc.).
- IF data residency or transfer requirements change (e.g., via regulation or case law), THEN THE system SHALL propagate updated restrictions immediately and apply to all subsequent cross-border transfers.

### Specific Rights Implementation and Business Scenarios
- WHEN a user requests rectification or portability of their data, THE system SHALL provide a structured download or update interface including all personal, purchase, and interaction data within regulatory timeframes.
- IF data cannot be provided or erased (e.g., pending refund, legal hold), THEN THE system SHALL explain the reason and give the user a reassessment/resubmission path.
- WHEN handling minor (child) accounts, THE system SHALL require verified parental consent and apply stricter data minimization and erasure standards where age-specific laws (e.g., COPPA, GDPR-kids) apply.

#### Mermaid Diagram: End-to-End Data Subject Rights Lifecycle
```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "Data Subject Request Lifecycle"
    A["User Submits Request (Access/Erase/Rectify)"]
    B["System Validates Identity & Request Type"]
    C{"Is Request Valid/Allowed?"}
    D["Process Request: Data Provided/Updated/Deleted"]
    E["Notify Internal & 3rd-Party Processors"]
    F["Audit Log Entry & Confirmation to User"]
    G["If Not Allowed: Provide Reason & Instructions"]
  end
  A --> B --> C
  C -->|"Yes"| D --> E --> F
  C -->|"No"| G
```

### Performance Expectations
- WHEN processing user data access or deletion requests, THE system SHALL complete all backend actions (confirmation, actual erasure, and compliance notification) within 24 hours for 99% of standard cases; exceptions must provide actionable error feedback to user within the same window.
- THE system SHALL match updates to privacy policies or legal requirements in all active jurisdictions within 7 days of regulatory notice or new market entry.
- WHERE data residency or localization conflicts arise in cross-jurisdiction processing, THE system SHALL flag, block, or queue affected actions and provide a clear business path to resolution through admin interfaces.


## Role-based Access Control (RBAC)

### Permission Structure and Assignment Flows
- THE system SHALL implement role-based access for all authenticated users. Default roles: customer (standard), seller (business), admin (administrator/high-security).
- WHEN a user is assigned or removes a role (e.g., seller added for product listing, admin privileges provisioned), THE system SHALL verify supporting evidence, enforce approval flows, and document the reason, actor, and timestamp for every change.
- WHEN a user attempts to perform a business action beyond their current permission (e.g., refund approval by customer, analytics access by seller, user ban by non-admin), THE system SHALL deny the action, log the attempt, and provide an actionable explanation via user-facing error message.
- WHERE emergency or exceptional escalation is needed (e.g., during a security incident or regulatory request), THE system SHALL require admin override with recorded justification, multi-factor authentication, and an independent audit log.

### Permission Matrix
| Action/Feature                              | Customer | Seller | Admin |
|---------------------------------------------|----------|--------|-------|

### RBAC Business Flows

## Regulatory and Legal Compliance

### Jurisdictional Coverage
- THE shoppingMall backend SHALL enforce compliance with all major global and regional data privacy laws, including but not limited to: GDPR (EU/EEA), CCPA (California/US), LGPD (Brazil), PIPEDA (Canada), PDPA (Singapore), and applicable local consumer protection and e-commerce regulations in all operational geographies.

### Compliance Process Workflows

### Edge Cases and Ongoing Compliance

- WHERE user-generated content (e.g., reviews, inquiries) is involved, THE system SHALL apply the same privacy, retention, and reporting rules as for personal data.

### Performance Requirements
- THE system SHALL generate and provide all mandatory compliance or regulatory reports within 72 hours of request/incident initiation, unless regulatory regime demands faster delivery.
- Incident notification to regulators or affected users SHALL be completed within 72 hours for GDPR-relevant incidents and 7 days for other jurisdictions unless otherwise mandated.

## Audit and Privacy Policy Requirements

### Audit Log Model and Evidence Retention
- THE system SHALL create an immutable, tamper-evident audit record for every business action involving personal data, RBAC change, compliance event, and legal/data subject request.
- All audit logs SHALL record: actor, subject(s), timestamp (ISO 8601 format), action type, legal basis, module/channel, data fields affected, and evidence references (files, signatures, external notification IDs, etc.).
- Audit log entries SHALL be accessible to admin role only, with strict permission enforcement and dual-actor access for sensitive events retrieval.
- WHERE user rights afford review of audit logs (e.g., data access or processing history), THE system SHALL provide a user-centric interface with actionable logs and clear explanations.
- WHERE legal requirements specify, THE system SHALL retain audit logs and evidence for a minimum of 5 years, unless a longer period is mandated by jurisdiction or transaction type.
- WHEN a compliance hold or legal request is received (e.g., investigation, court order), THE system SHALL lock affected audit records for the event duration and notify all responsible stakeholders/admins.
- IF an audit log error or corruption is detected, THEN THE system SHALL escalate instantly to admin and block related actions until restoration or legal signoff.

### Audit Review, Notification, and Incident Response Timelines
- WHEN a business rule, privacy policy, or regulatory requirement is updated, THE system SHALL require complete policy review by compliance admins and document a signed approval before business logic is allowed to process new or modified personal data categories.
- IF a privacy incident is detected, THEN THE system SHALL initiate incident response workflows, preserve all evidence, and ensure all required notifications, corrective actions, and closure of evidence are performed as per business and regulatory obligations.
- Audit logs SHALL be reviewed at least annually and after each significant compliance incident, with remediation actions digitally recorded and certified by the responsible admin.

```mermaid

```

### Privacy Policy Management and Communication
- WHEN privacy policy changes occur or new regulations come into force, THE system SHALL update all policy content in user interfaces, communicate the changes to all users and stakeholders within 3 days, and capture individual user consents or objections as required by law.
- THE system SHALL record and version every privacy policy and update event for legal auditability; historic versions SHALL remain accessible to compliance admins for at least 10 years.
- WHEN a user objects to a privacy policy change, THE system SHALL restrict further data processing for that user and provide business flows for either policy negotiation or user account exit per regulation.

### Compliance Validation & Continuous Improvement
- THE compliance team SHALL review, test, and validate all data protection and audit log business logic: annually, following any major incident, and after each regulatory update.
- WHEN audit gaps or compliance failures are detected, THE system SHALL record all remediation actions and evidence in a linked compliance log and restrict affected operations until a signed-off resolution is achieved.

## 1. Extensibility Needs (Channels, Payments, APIs)

### Channel Expansion
- THE system SHALL permit onboarding and configuration of new sales channels (e.g., mobile app, POS, third-party marketplaces) without disrupting existing channels.
- WHEN a new channel is added, THE system SHALL enable role-based permissions and tracking for all user activities within that channel.
- THE system SHALL allow each channel to be managed independently, supporting unique business rules, payment methods, and content.

### Payment Integration
- THE system SHALL support adding new payment gateway providers (e.g., credit card, PayPal, crypto, local methods) without downtime or loss of previous functionality.
- WHEN onboarding a new payment integration, THE system SHALL provide clear mapping of transaction data, user-facing status updates, and escalation for failed payments.
- THE system SHALL allow for role-driven control and reporting of payments per channel and seller.

### API-Driven Expansion
- THE system SHALL offer business logic through APIs enabling partner integrations (e.g., shipping, analytics, chatbots, accounting) with strict version and permission control.
- WHERE business operations expand, THE system SHALL support exposing new APIs or endpoints without breaking existing integrations.
- IF a new API function is introduced, THEN THE system SHALL require explicit versioning and rollback processes.

### Data Extensibility and Schema Evolution
- WHEN a new business attribute (e.g., product option, user property) is needed, THE system SHALL permit schema extension without breaking existing features or causing data loss.
- THE system SHALL maintain integrity when extending entities (products, users, orders) to support personalization, promotions, or new business logic.
- THE system SHALL allow for migration of legacy data/integrations with well-defined feature flags and migration windows.

## 2. Performance Optimization Expectations

### User-Facing Responsiveness
- WHEN a customer browses product lists, completes checkout, or interacts with their account, THE system SHALL respond or update status within 2 seconds for 99% of all requests under normal operational load.
- WHERE personalized features are used (recommendations, favorites), THE system SHALL not degrade response below the defined performance SLA.
- WHEN a seller updates product, inventory, or order data, THE system SHALL reflect changes to relevant parties instantly or within 2 seconds of successful operation.

### Automated Scaling
- IF business activity increases suddenly (e.g., events, sales, campaigns), THEN THE system SHALL automatically scale to maintain operational SLAs for all users and roles, without requiring manual intervention.
- WHERE seller or channel onboarding expands, THE system SHALL adjust resource allocation to sustain performance KPIs.

### Concurrent Operation & Load
- THE system SHALL support simultaneous activities by thousands of users (shoppers, sellers, admins) and hundreds of business operations per second, including at peak sales periods.
- WHEN batch operations (e.g., mass coupon issuance, bulk uploads, major inventory syncs) occur, THE system SHALL not degrade the experience for ongoing customer activities.

## 3. Backwards Compatibility & Versioning

### Safe Upgrades and Legacy Support
- WHEN upgrading a business process, logic, or endpoint, THE system SHALL allow existing users and integrations to continue operating without breaking changes or data loss for a minimum of 12 months post-upgrade.
- THE system SHALL maintain documentation of all active and deprecated business interfaces, including version history, status, and supported channels.
- WHERE multiple API or data schema versions coexist, THE system SHALL enforce version-specific business logic and role permissions.

### Required Communication
- WHEN a breaking or substantial change is introduced, THE system SHALL notify all impacted users (customers, sellers, admins) in advance, describing the change, migration period, and fallback options.
- THE system SHALL provide migration windows and dual-run support where possible, with clear timing and responsibility assignment for each party.

## 4. Business Continuity & Expansion Scenarios

### Failover and Recovery
- IF a critical service fails (e.g., payment processor, order management, inventory sync), THEN THE system SHALL continue core business operations by auto-switching to alternate providers or fallback strategies within 30 seconds.
- THE system SHALL ensure data consistency and durability across all expansion and disaster/scenario recovery actions.
- THE system SHALL keep an audit trail of all failover, migration, and disaster recovery activities for business verification.

### Expansion and Migration
- WHEN expanding to a new geography, language, or regulatory domain, THE system SHALL allow for localized configuration, compliance enforcement, and audit logging without impacting global operation.
- THE system SHALL support cross-border payment, tax, shipping, and returns logic per each expansion area.
- WHERE business demand requires, THE system SHALL support live data migration with zero or near-zero downtime (less than 5 minutes of unavailability).

### High Availability and Maintenance
- THE system SHALL ensure high availability (>99.95% uptime per channel/role) and schedule maintenance windows with prior notice to all stakeholders.
- WHEN scheduled or unscheduled maintenance occurs, THE system SHALL redirect users to clear service status updates and, where possible, provide alternative functions (e.g., order viewing if checkout is unavailable).

### Growth Ready
- WHERE additional business models (B2B, subscriptions, white-labeled malls) are introduced, THE system SHALL support isolated management and permission schemes for each model without compromising data integrity or security.
- THE system SHALL allow for business units (sellers, channels, regional managers) to autonomously manage their expansion within assigned permissions.

## Mermaid Diagram: Extensibility & Failover Flow

```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "Scalability & Expansion"
    A["New Channel or Payment Integration"] --> B{"Disrupts Existing?"}
    B -->|"No"| C["Auto Onboarding"]
    B -->|"Yes"| D["Run Migration Process"]
    D --> E{"Fallback Ready?"}
    E -->|"Yes"| F["Enable Failover"]
    E -->|"No"| G["Business Alert & Rollback"]
  end

  subgraph "Performance"
    H["User Surge (Event, Promotion)"] --> I{"Can Scale?"}
    I -->|"Yes"| J["Auto Scale Resources"]
    I -->|"No"| K["Prioritize Critical Paths"]
  end

  A --> H
```

## Requirements Summary Table

| Requirement Category                | EARS Compliance Example                                                                                           |
|-------------------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Extensibility (Channels)            | WHEN new sales channels are onboarded, THE system SHALL provision unique settings, roles, and rules per channel. |
| Payment Integration                 | WHEN new payment providers are added, THE system SHALL enable mappings and extend business reporting instantly.   |
| Performance (Web, API, Batch)       | THE system SHALL respond to user interactions within 2 seconds for 99% of requests under normal load.            |
| Scaling (Events, Bulk Ops)          | IF business demand spikes, THEN THE system SHALL maintain SLAs via automated resource scaling.                    |
| Compatibility (Upgrades)            | WHEN a breaking change is shipped, THE system SHALL provide dual-run and migration support for >=12 months.       |
| Continuity (Failover, Expansion)    | IF a service fails, THEN THE system SHALL route to preconfigured backup channels within 30 seconds.               |

## Error Handling and Edge Scenarios
- IF a payment integration fails during transaction processing, THEN THE system SHALL offer an alternate payment method and notify both the user and seller.
- IF legacy data or integrations cannot be migrated, THEN THE system SHALL maintain legacy endpoints or features until full transition is verified.
- IF regional expansion impacts regulatory compliance, THEN THE system SHALL block non-compliant business functions and inform responsible parties.

## Performance Requirements (User Experience Terms)
- Product discovery, order placement, and listing management responses SHALL be delivered within 2 seconds 99% of the time.
- Bulk actions (batch order exports, coupon distribution) SHALL not interrupt normal transaction and browsing experiences.
- Unplanned downtime for maintenance, upgrade, or expansion SHALL not exceed 5 minutes per event.
- All failover operations SHALL complete within 30 seconds without loss of transactional or audit data.

---

This document provides business requirements only. All technical implementation decisions belong to developers. Developers have full autonomy over architecture, APIs, and database design. The document describes WHAT the system should do, not HOW to build it.

Permission matrix is enforced by role at all business logic touchpoints. See the [User Roles and Authentication Requirements Guide](./03-user-roles-and-authentication.md) for further detail.


## Mermaid Diagram: Business Expansion & Failover Flows

```mermaid

    K --> L
  end

```

## Error Handling & Edge Scenarios
IF payment, channel, or API onboarding fails, THEN THE system SHALL:
- Trigger business and technical incident logging (with role specificity)
- Notify affected role groups within 2 seconds by preferred channel (UI, push, email)
- Offer actionable user/seller fallback options
- Route admin to incident management console for evidence review and rollback
- Ensure all records of failed/partial actions are reviewable in compliance/reporting tools

IF legacy system or data cannot be migrated, THEN THE system SHALL maintain legacy endpoints until verified full transition, with scheduled reviews and sunset dates.

IF regional expansion raises compliance concerns, THEN THE system SHALL deny at-risk business activity in the target zone and escalate for legal/business review before activation.

All failover, migration, or rescue events SHALL be audit-trailed and business owners provided pre- and post-event analysis.

## Performance Requirements (User Experience Terms)
- All customer or seller interaction flows (browse, order, inventory, reporting, personalization) SHALL return in â‰¤2 seconds under normal operations, â‰¤4 seconds under documented performance degradation events
- Bulk operations or migrations SHALL not degrade standard transactions by more than 2x normal latency limits for any role
- Unplanned business downtime (emergency, migration, expansion) SHALL not exceed 5 minutes/event for production operations
- Scheduled downtime SHALL be communicated at least 24 hours prior and does not exceed 30 minutes
- All failover or expansion events SHALL complete in â‰¤30 seconds for business continuity
- Role-based notification and support required for all users affected by downtime/reversion

## Success Metrics and KPIs
WHEN expansion, scaling, or continuity requirements are exercised, THE system SHALL capture the following KPIs per channel, region, and role:
- Channel onboarding/removal time (mins)
- Payment integration launch/rollback duration (secs)
- Peak concurrent users/transactions/DB writes sustained during event
- SLA breaches by operation type/role
- Average notification/alert response time by user group
- Audit log completeness for migrations, failovers, reversions

THE system SHALL support executive, admin, and seller reporting dashboards to monitor all metrics and proactively recommend remediation where business risk is flagged.

## Business Linkages and Role Obligations
For comprehensive requirements on user and role management, permission inheritance, and security, reference the [User Roles and Authentication Requirements Guide](./03-user-roles-and-authentication.md) and the [Security, Compliance, and Data Privacy Rules](./13-security-compliance-and-data-privacy.md). All product/category, order, and discount management requirements are extended to multi-channel and regional expansion per this guidance.

All requirements herein are business requirements only. All technical implementation decisions belong to developers. Developers have full autonomy over architecture, APIs, and database design. The content describes WHAT the system should do, not HOW to build it.

# Attachment File Management Requirements for shoppingMall Backend

## Attachment Support Scenarios

Attachment management in shoppingMall is designed to support a wide variety of file types and business use cases across all user roles (customer, seller, admin). Attachments are integral to business processes such as product management (product images, videos, documentation), customer orders (invoices, receipts), reviews (review photos and videos), customer service (inquiry documents), marketing (banner and campaign media), legal compliance (evidence files, contracts), and administrative record-keeping (audit snapshots, reporting downloads).

### Supported File Types and Size Limitations
- THE system SHALL support the following file types for upload and download: images (JPEG, PNG, GIF, BMP, WebP), videos (MP4, MOV, AVI, WebM), documents (PDF, TXT, DOC/DOCX, XLS/XLSX, PPT/PPTX), audio (MP3, WAV), and compressed archives (ZIP, RAR, 7z).
- WHERE new file types or extensions are required by regulatory or business needs, THE system SHALL support business-driven extensibility approval processes.
- THE maximum file size for uploads SHALL be configurable by business policy, defaulting to:
  - Images: 10MB per file
  - Videos: 200MB per file
  - Documents: 30MB per file
  - Audio: 20MB per file
  - Archives: 50MB per file
- WHERE attachment size exceeds the allowed threshold, THE system SHALL reject the file and deliver a clear, actionable error message to the user.
- WHERE upload occurs, THE system SHALL validate file type and size before accepting the file. IF a file is of an unsupported type or contains disallowed extensions, THEN THE system SHALL prevent upload and inform the user of accepted types.
- THE number of attachments per object (e.g., product, review) SHALL be limited by business rules; for example, products may hold up to 15 images or 2 videos; reviews up to 5 images and 1 video; receipts/invoices 1 per order.
- THE system SHALL support multi-file and batch uploads, provided limits are respected.

### Business Workflows per User Role
- WHEN a customer places an order, THE system SHALL enable upload and storage of attachments such as payment receipts, delivery instructions, or post-purchase review media.
- WHERE sellers manage products, THE system SHALL allow for attachment of multiple product images, promotional videos, and downloadable documentation to each product record.
- WHEN a review is posted, THE system SHALL permit customers to upload images and videos as attachments, subject to limits and automated business validation.
- WHEN a seller or admin needs to provide evidence for compliance, THE system SHALL support upload and timestamped linking of legal documents to the relevant case, product, or business event.
- WHEN administrators publish a banner or campaign, THE system SHALL require upload and management of image or video files tied to campaign/section/channel objects.
- WHEN a file is uploaded, THE system SHALL link it to its owning object (e.g., product, order, customer profile, review, support inquiry) by business ID and role metadata.

### Attachment Lifecycle
- WHEN an object with attached files is deleted (e.g., product, order), THE system SHALL evaluate if the attachment must be retained for compliance or business audit, and act accordingly.
- IF attachments become orphaned (no linked object exists or retention expires), THEN THE system SHALL remove them from active access and schedule for permanent deletion based on business policy.
- WHEN a file reaches its business-defined retention expiration (e.g., 5 years for invoices, 1 year for customer uploads), THE system SHALL remove the file from the platform and log all removal actions for audit.

### Error and Validation Scenarios
- IF an upload fails validation (type, size, virus/malware detection), THEN THE system SHALL block the file and provide the uploader with an error code and remediation steps.
- IF a user attempts to access a file without sufficient role permissions, THEN THE system SHALL deny the action and log an access violation for audit.
- IF an object is deleted but its attachments are under legal hold, THEN THE system SHALL retain the files and flag them for compliance review.

## File Metadata & Access Permissions

Accurate, auditable metadata is captured and required for all attachments in the system. Access and permissions are determined by role, object linkage, and lifecycle state.

### Required Metadata for Attachments
| Metadata Field            | Description                                                      |
|--------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------------|
| File Name                 | Name as uploaded                                                 |
| File Type / Extension     | MIME type and extension                                          |
| File Size (MB)            | Size of file at upload                                           |
| Upload Timestamp          | ISO 8601 upload time                                             |
| Uploaded By (Role, User)  | Role (customer/seller/admin) and user ID of uploader             |
| Linked Object             | Type and unique ID of business object file is attached to         |
| Attachment Purpose/Type   | e.g., product image, review video, invoice, legal evidence        |
| Retention Policy          | Business logic: default duration, legal/compliance flag           |
| Version Number            | Attachment version for updates/re-uploads                        |
| Checksum/Hash             | Integrity verification (e.g., SHA-256)                           |
| Status                    | Active, quarantined, flagged, pending moderation, deleted         |
| Deletion Timestamp        | Scheduled or completed deletion time (when applicable)            |
| DMCA/Compliance Status    | DMCA/takedown/appeal/litigation state as relevant                 |

### Business Rules for Metadata
- THE system SHALL require the assignment of all required metadata upon attachment upload.
- WHEN a file is updated or replaced, THE system SHALL increment its version number, link both old and new versions for audit, and enforce prior version purging per retention policy.
- IF metadata is malformed, missing, or inconsistent (e.g., missing object link), THEN THE system SHALL block the attachment, notify relevant user/admin, and flag for resolution.
- WHERE hash/checksum validation fails, THE system SHALL reject the file and provide a user-facing message explaining the cause.

### Role-Based Access Matrix (Sample)
| Action         | Customer | Seller | Admin |
|----------------|----------|--------|-------|
| Upload         | âœ… (own)  | âœ… (own/products) | âœ… (any object) |
| View/Download  | âœ… (own)  | âœ… (own/sales)    | âœ… (all)        |
| Delete         | âœ… (own)  | âœ… (own/products) | âœ… (all)        |
| Replace/Update | âœ… (own)  | âœ… (own/products) | âœ… (all)        |
| Quarantine     | âŒ        | âŒ              | âœ…              |
| Restore        | âŒ        | âŒ              | âœ…              |
| Audit/View Log | âŒ        | âŒ              | âœ…              |

- WHERE a seller uploads on behalf of a customer (e.g., order docs), THE system SHALL attribute both uploader and subject in metadata.
- WHEN access is required across multiple roles (e.g., admin reviewing sellerâ€™s attachments), THE system SHALL enforce business permissions and log access events.

### Attachment Linking and Orphan Handling
- WHEN an object is deleted, THE system SHALL evaluate attachment retention policy and move files to â€œpending deletionâ€/archived status if retention is required; otherwise, permanently delete.
- WHERE attachments are orphaned due to object purge, THE system SHALL log evidence and follow compliance protocol for data disposition.

### Error and Edge Conditions
- IF a user attempts to modify, delete, or access an attachment not owned or beyond permissions, THEN THE system SHALL block the action, record the event, and notify the user.
- IF a required attachment (e.g., product image) is missing or removed, THEN THE system SHALL flag the parent object as incomplete until restored.
- WHEN a fileâ€™s retention window has expired, THE system SHALL auto-purge file and record all reference removals for audit.

### Performance & Business Expectation
- WHEN a user requests access/download of a permitted attachment, THE system SHALL deliver the file within 2 seconds in 99% of cases for files under 20MB.
- WHEN a batch operation is performed (mass download, removal), THE system SHALL complete processing within business SLA targets and log all changes for audit.

## Threat Mitigation & Secure Delivery

Ensuring safe, compliant, and secure management of file attachments is essential for platform trust and legal alignment.

### Content Moderation & Threat Detection
- WHEN a file is uploaded, THE system SHALL perform automated and/or manual content review according to business policy, including virus/malware scanning, content moderation (e.g., prohibited imagery, copyright checks), and compliance validation.
- IF an attachment is flagged by automated or user report (e.g., suspected copyright, illegal, abusive, or malware content), THEN THE system SHALL move file to â€œquarantinedâ€ status, restrict access, and notify designated admins for review.
- WHERE legal hold or compliance probe is triggered (e.g., DMCA, fraud investigation), THE system SHALL preserve impacted files in non-modifiable state until issue is resolved.
- WHEN a takedown or report is resolved (approved, rejected, escalated), THE system SHALL update attachment status and notify all parties with appropriate business information.
- WHEN attachments are determined to violate business or legal policy, THE system SHALL enforce evidence snapshot, flag all links, and block future access/download. Record full trail for audit.
- WHERE recurring misuse by a user or role is detected (multiple flagged or banned file uploads), THE system SHALL temporarily suspend their upload privileges and inform them of the suspension reason.
- THE system SHALL provide admin and compliance dashboards to review, track, and resolve all flagged or quarantined attachments, with complete audit logs.

### Secure Access and Delivery Workflows
- WHEN a permitted user requests to access or download an attachment, THE system SHALL generate business-compliant, time-limited secure access token or download link, audit access event, and enforce role-based visibility.
- IF a download token or link expires or is used by an unauthorized party, THEN THE system SHALL block the attempt and record an incident for security review.
- WHERE device, session, or network anomaly is detected during file access, THE system SHALL require additional authentication or block the transaction per business rules.
- THE system SHALL ensure no attachment is accessible except through authenticated and authorized session, regardless of device or channel.
- WHEN a file is deleted, updated, or placed under legal hold, THE system SHALL immediately invalidate all outstanding tokens or download links to that file.
- THE system SHALL support audit logs of all download, access, modification, quarantine, and removal events, visible to authorized admins for compliance needs.

### Evidence and Audit Trail Requirements
- WHEN a file enters or leaves the threat mitigation process (flagged/quarantined/released/deleted), THE system SHALL log all actions, actors, and relevant context for compliance and future audit.
- THE system SHALL support exporting audit logs of attachment lifecycle events (upload, update, access, moderation, deletion) matching business needs and retention laws.

## Mermaid Diagram: Attachment Lifecycle and Security Flow
```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "Attachment Upload & Validation"
    A["File Selected by User"] --> B["Validate File Type & Size"]
    B -->|"Valid"| C["Scan for Virus/Threat"]
    B -->|"Invalid"| D["Block Upload & Notify User"]
    C -->|"Clean"| E["Store File and Metadata"]
    C -->|"Threat Detected"| F["Quarantine File, Notify Admin"]
  end

  subgraph "Business Process Linkage"
    E --> G["Link File to Business Object"]
    G --> H["Update Object State (e.g., Product/Order/Review)"]
  end

  subgraph "Access & Download"
    I["User Requests Attachment"] --> J["Check Role Permission"]
    J -->|"Allowed"| K["Issue Secure Token/Link"]
    J -->|"Denied"| L["Block Access & Log Attempt"]
    K --> M["Audit Access Event"]
    M --> N["Deliver File"]
  end

  subgraph "Moderation & Removal"
    O["Attachment Flagged or Expired"] --> P["Update Status (Quarantined/Deleted)"]
    P --> Q["Notify Stakeholders"]
    Q --> R["Archive or Remove File"]
    Q --> S["Export Audit Trail"]
  end

  F --> P
  N --> O
  R --> S
```

## Success and Compliance Criteria
- THE system SHALL maintain at least 99.99% data integrity for file links and metadata across all object lifecycles, excluding explicit deletion/compliance actions.
- THE system SHALL support role-based attachment management in accordance with data privacy and legal mandates, supporting rapid incident investigation and user notification within 24 hours of policy or law trigger.
- THE system SHALL deliver files within 2 seconds under normal loads and flag/notify when SLA cannot be met.
- WHEN process or role changes impact attachment business rules, THE system SHALL update policy and notify all affected stakeholders.

All requirements articulated in this document represent business rules only. All technical implementation decisions, including but not limited to architecture, storage, API, and database structure, belong to the development team. The document describes WHAT the system should do, not HOW to build it.

file.content:
# Introduction and Scope
This requirements document addresses all business rules and scenarios for promotional discounts, coupon management, deposit payment options, and mileage/loyalty programs for the shoppingMall backend. It defines how each system is created, how eligibility is validated, how redemption/usage is tracked, and the rules for expiry, stacking, and reporting. The document provides actionable requirements in EARS format and specifies role-based permissions for customers, sellers, and admins.

# Overview of Discounts, Coupons, and Loyalty Features
The shoppingMall backend must enable multiple types of promotional benefits:
- Coupon codes and discount vouchers issued to customers (or groups) under set conditions
- Application of coupons during cart/order flow, subject to eligibility, usage limit, and concurrency rules
- Deposit (prepaid balance) systems for flexible, secure payments
- Mileage/loyalty point accrual, redemption, adjustment, and expiry
The system must ensure robust tracking, audit trails, and user feedback for all benefit-related actions.

# Coupon Types & Issuance
## Types of Coupons
THE system SHALL support the following coupon types:
| Coupon Type              | Description                                             |
|-------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------|
| Order Amount Discount   | Discount off total order value (fixed or percentage)    |
| Product-specific Coupon | Discount applies only to specific products/categories   |
| Seller-issued Coupon    | Coupons issued by sellers for their own products        |
| Platform Coupon         | Issued centrally by admin for use across platform       |
| First-purchase Coupon   | Specific to first order/opportunity for new customers   |
| Birthday/Anniversary    | Special date-based coupons (personalized events)        |
| Free Shipping Coupon    | Waives delivery fee, product/category specific option   |

## Coupon Creation and Distribution Rules
- WHEN an admin or eligible seller requests coupon creation, THE system SHALL validate coupon parameters (amount, type, validity period, target group, usage conditions) prior to issuance.
- WHEN a coupon is created, THE system SHALL apply unique identifiers, usage tracking, and define eligibility criteria at issuance.
- WHERE coupons are distributed in bulk, THE system SHALL atomically create all codes and maintain a full issuance audit log.
- WHEN a customer receives a coupon, THE system SHALL notify the customer via their preferred notification channel within 1 minute.

# Application Conditions & Restrictions
## Eligibility Requirements
- WHEN a customer attempts to redeem a coupon, THE system SHALL validate that:
  - Customer status, role, and group match the coupon eligibility definition.
  - Coupon is within issuance and usage validity period.
  - Coupon has available uses (not exhausted for user or globally).
  - Coupon applies to selected products/channels/orders as specified in rules.
- WHERE coupons are single-use, THE system SHALL prevent further redemption after the initial use.
- WHERE coupons have a minimum spend, THE system SHALL only allow use if cart/order meets that minimum.

## Application and Usage Logic
- WHEN applying a coupon in the cart/order flow, THE system SHALL calculate the applicable discount and show the user net payable, savings, and coupon code applied.
- WHERE multiple coupons are present, THE system SHALL enforce stacking (combinability)/exclusivity rules as defined by the coupon property (e.g., non-stackable, stackable with restrictions).

## Constraints and Validation Rules
- THE system SHALL enforce the maximum number of coupons per order as per business policy.
- WHEN applying both seller and platform coupons, THE system SHALL enforce concurrency rules (e.g., allow/disallow simultaneous use).
- IF an invalid or expired coupon is applied, THEN THE system SHALL display an error with code COUPON_INVALID or COUPON_EXPIRED and block submission.
- WHEN the coupon has product/category/channel restrictions, THE system SHALL evaluate all line items and only apply the discount where valid.
- WHEN a coupon is revoked before redemption, THE system SHALL invalidate its code and notify affected recipients instantly.

## Error Handling and Edge Cases
- IF network or system errors occur during coupon application, THEN THE system SHALL preserve atomicity (rollback discounts added to cart/order) and log all failed attempts for audit.
- IF a customer repeatedly fails coupon eligibility within a short window (e.g., 3 times in 10 minutes), THEN THE system SHALL temporarily block further attempts and recommend contacting support.

# Deposit and Mileage Management
## Deposit System Rules
- THE system SHALL allow customers to top up an account with deposits (prepaid, cash card, gift card, etc.)
- WHEN a deposit-based payment is used for an order, THE system SHALL deduct the correct balance at order confirmation, and confirm the deduction in under 1 second.
- IF a deposit transaction fails, THEN THE system SHALL return the full amount to the customer balance and provide an explanation.
- THE system SHALL provide a full ledger of deposit transactions (top-ups, payments, refunds, expiries) accessible by the customer and admin.

## Mileage/Loyalty Point Accrual
- WHEN a qualifying order is completed, THE system SHALL credit mileage/loyalty points based on business-defined rules (amount, promotion, event, order value, exclusions).
- WHEN a customer returns part or all of an order, THE system SHALL deduct already-credited mileage proportional to the returned items.
- WHERE there are promotional events (double points, limited time offers), THE system SHALL support variable point multipliers during their active window.

## Redemption and Deduction Scenarios
- WHEN redeeming mileage/points, THE system SHALL apply the points to the order total in real-time, ensuring points cannot exceed order value minus excluded items.
- WHERE both mileage and coupon are present, THE system SHALL enforce business rules for combination or exclusivity.
- THE system SHALL provide a clear breakdown (amount redeemed, reward type, expiry) at checkout and in order history.
- WHEN the customer is short of points for redemption, THE system SHALL prompt the exact additional points required and recommend alternative payment if necessary.

## Expiry and Adjustment Logic
- THE system SHALL support per-point expiration, batch-based expiry, and global expiry events (e.g., at year-end).
- WHEN mileage or deposits near expiry (within 30 days), THE system SHALL notify the customer by preferred channel at least twice before actual expiry.
- WHEN points or deposits expire, THE system SHALL remove expired balances, record the event for compliant reporting, and notify the customer.
- WHERE promotional points are adjusted due to system errors or fraud, THE system SHALL require admin-level authorization and record a traceable adjustment entry.

# Redemption and Expiry Processes
## Expiry Dates and User Notification
- WHEN creating coupons, THE system SHALL set issue and expiry dates by business logic, with support for both rolling (e.g., valid for 7 days from issue) and fixed-date models.
- THE system SHALL notify users of expiring coupons/mileage at least twice (7 days and 1 day prior, via default channel).
- WHERE coupons/benefits expire unused, THE system SHALL automatically mark as expired and remove from user entitlement.

## Redemption Flows
- THE system SHALL atomically apply coupons, deposits, and mileage at order commitment and show itemized breakdown to the user.
- IF an error is detected after order submission, THEN THE system SHALL reverse the redemption, restore unused benefits, and notify all affected parties.

## Cascading Use (Combinations, Exclusivity)
- THE system SHALL enforce all combinability/exclusivity logic set at the benefit-definition level (e.g., "Cannot combine this coupon with mileage"), and validate mutual exclusivity at runtime.
- WHERE business rules change, THE system SHALL update future redemptions and notify users for currently entitled but not-yet-used benefits.

## Reporting and Auditing Considerations
- THE system SHALL record every issuance, redemption, adjustment, and expiry event with a traceable audit log including timestamps, responsible actor, affected user, order, and action type.
- THE system SHALL enable admins to generate benefit usage reports filtered by date, user, seller, benefit type, and outcome status (success/failure/expired).

# Role-based Permissions and Access Matrix
## User Functions
| Action                               | Customer | Seller | Admin |
|--------------------------------------|----------|--------|-------|
| Receive assigned coupons             | âœ…       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Redeem coupon at checkout            | âœ…       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Issue coupons (to customers)         | âŒ       | âœ…*    | âœ…    |
| Create/edit coupon templates         | âŒ       | âœ…*    | âœ…    |
| Adjust/revoke coupons post-issue     | âŒ       | âœ…*    | âœ…    |
| Issue/adjust mileage or deposits     | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Approve adjustments for fraud/errors | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| View audit/reports for own actions   | âœ…       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| * Seller authority limited to own products, subject to compliance checks  |

## JWT Payload Structure for Entitled Benefits
- userId (string, required)
- role (enum: customer, seller, admin)
- entitlements (array of assigned coupon/mileage/deposit IDs plus type, expiry, status)
- permissions array as per the above matrix

# Performance and User Experience Expectations
- THE system SHALL complete coupon/deposit/mileage redemption and order pricing calculations in under 2 seconds.
- THE system SHALL synchronize benefit state changes (e.g., usage, expiry) to user-facing apps within 5 seconds.
- All user-facing validation errors SHALL be returned as code-value pairs with human-readable message, for effective UI display.
- User notifications for benefit changes SHALL be queued for immediate dispatch, with retry/redundancy to ensure delivery.

# Mermaid Diagram: Coupon Application Flow (example)
```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "Coupon Redemption Flow"
    A["Start Checkout"] --> B["Enter/Select Coupon Code"]
    B --> C{"Is Coupon Valid?"}
    C -->|"Yes"| D["Apply Discount"]
    C -->|"No"| E["Show Error Message"]
    D --> F["Complete Order"]
    E --> F
    F --> G["Update Usage Record"]
    G --> H["Notify User"]
  end
```

# Glossary
- Coupon: Digital voucher for specific order/product discount
- Mileage: Loyalty points accrued for purchases; redeemable for future discounts
- Deposit: Prepaid account balance; can be used as order payment

# References
- [User Roles and Authentication Requirement Document](./03-user-roles-and-authentication.md)
- [Cart and Order Processing Requirement Document](./07-cart-and-order-processing.md)

# Success and Compliance Criteria
- All requirements above are mandatory for the shoppingMall backend
- Edge cases, exception handling, and audit logging are critical for business compliance
- Developers retain autonomy on technical implementation; the business logic herein must be enforced as specified

# Introduction and Scope
This requirements document addresses all business rules and scenarios for promotional discounts, coupon management, deposit payment options, and mileage/loyalty programs for the shoppingMall backend. It defines how each system is created, how eligibility is validated, how redemption/usage is tracked, and the rules for expiry, stacking, and reporting. Actionable requirements in EARS format are provided, specifying role-based permissions for customers, sellers, and admins, and ensuring the system delivers a robust, traceable, and user-focused loyalty and benefits experience.

# Overview of Discounts, Coupons, and Loyalty Features
The shoppingMall backend supports multiple forms of promotional and loyalty benefits:
- Coupon codes and discount vouchers issued to specific users or to cohorts via strictly defined business events and triggers
- Application of coupons during all cart and order flows, subject to explicit eligibility, usage ceilings, and combinability rules
- Deposit (prepaid balance) payment methods, supporting both platform and 3rd-party top-ups, traceable transaction ledgers, and robust security controls
- Mileage and loyalty point accrual and redemption, covering direct reward, promotional multipliers, proportional deduction, expiry and compliance-driven adjustment

System processes must guarantee atomicity, full auditability, user feedback, and support for business-driven promotional strategies, edge case handling, and compliance reporting, without ever exposing technical implementation detail.

# Coupon Types & Issuance
## Types of Coupons Supported
THE system SHALL enable, at a minimum, all of the following coupon types:
| Coupon Type                 | Description                                                   |
|----------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------|
| Order Amount Discount       | Discount applied to total order amount, either fixed or percent|
| Product-specific Coupon     | Applies only to designated products or categories             |
| Seller-issued Coupon        | Issued exclusively by sellers, redeemable only for seller's items|
| Platform (Admin) Coupon     | Created/administered by platform for use across all sellers   |
| First-purchase Coupon       | Eligible for new customers on first completed order           |
| Birthday/Anniversary Coupon | Issued on special user-defined dates (e.g., birthday, signup) |
| Free Shipping Coupon        | Waives all or part of delivery fee, scoped by business rule   |
| Flash/Event Coupon          | Issued for time-limited or quantity-limited campaigns         |

## Coupon Creation, Distribution, and Tracking
- WHEN a seller or admin initiates coupon creation, THE system SHALL validate coupon attributes: discount value (absolute/percentage, min/max boundaries), type, applicable products or categories, usage window (start/end), usage quota (per user/total), combinability, and intended recipient(s).
- WHEN a coupon is issued, THE system SHALL assign a globally unique code or identifier, store all conditions, track per-assignment entitlement, and log full history with timestamp, actor, and distribution channel.
- WHERE bulk coupon issuance is requested, THE system SHALL generate all coupons atomically, ensure no duplication, and create a persistent issuance audit record.
- WHEN a user (customer/seller/admin) is assigned a coupon, THE system SHALL notify them via their preferred channel (mobile app, email, SMS, etc.) within 1 minute, with business event source stored.
- WHERE coupons are revoked prior to use (manual or automated revocation), THE system SHALL block future use, update the user benefit entitlement list, remove from all redemption interfaces, and deliver instant notification.

# Application Conditions & Restrictions
## Eligibility, Application, and Usage Rules
- WHEN a user attempts to redeem any coupon during checkout, THE system SHALL enforce and validate:
  - Role and account status (role/group eligibility check)
  - Coupon validity window (current datetime >= issue and <= expiry)
  - Global and per-user usage limits (not exhausted overall or individually)
  - Applicability to the products, categories, order value, sales channel, and business context of the purchase
  - Any further business-defined prerequisites (e.g., min. spend, region, channel restrictions)
- WHERE a coupon is single-use, THE system SHALL permanently retire it for both the user and the code after one redemption
- WHERE coupon minimum spend or eligibility requirements are not met, THE system SHALL block redemption and return a code-value explanation (e.g., COUPON_MINSPEND_FAIL)
- WHERE multiple coupons are presented, THE system SHALL evaluate defined stackability (combinability) rules: which, if any, coupons may be jointly applied by order of business priority (e.g., seller + platform, or coupon stacks with mileage), and enforce exclusive/priority logic as defined by benefit parameters
- WHEN applying both seller-issued and platform coupons, THE system SHALL accept or reject concurrent usage precisely per configured business rules, and always log every application, rejection, and cause

## Error and Exception Handling
- IF a user applies a coupon that is expired, revoked, or not eligible, THEN THE system SHALL return clear error codes (COUPON_EXPIRED, COUPON_REVOKED, COUPON_INELIGIBLE) and prevent order submission
- IF redemption is attempted for a coupon or benefit outside the valid spend or product/channel scope, THEN THE system SHALL block application and provide a message describing the specific violation condition
- IF system or network error interrupts coupon application, THEN THE system SHALL roll back any provisional pricing, restore benefit entitlements, and log all failed attempts with context for audit
- IF a user triggers more than N consecutive failed redemption attempts (configurable default: 3 in 10 minutes), THEN THE system SHALL temporarily lock coupon use for 30 minutes, notify the user, and suggest customer support contact
- WHEN coupons are voided post-issuance due to fraud, system error, or compliance issue, THE system SHALL track all affected users/orders and block retroactively, ensuring non-blocking for unaffected entitlements

## User-facing Validation and Display
- WHEN a coupon is successfully applied, THE system SHALL update the UI in real-time to reflect pre- and post-discount amounts, identify the discount type, show code used, and expected remaining user entitlements for that coupon
- IF coupons applied are not combinable, THE system SHALL visibly disable the excluded coupons and show the business reason
- WHEN coupon application rules change (e.g., business policy updates), THE system SHALL enforce new rules only for coupons created after policy change, unless explicitly marked for retroactivity

# Deposit and Mileage Management
## Deposit (Prepaid Balance) Rules
- THE system SHALL enable customers and sellers to top up their deposit balance by multiple payment methods (cash wire, credit card, gift card redemption, 3rd-party voucher)
- WHEN a deposit is used for order payment, THE system SHALL deduct the exact amount atomically at order confirmation, with pricing, order ID, and traceable ledger entry persisted. THE system SHALL always confirm deduction or provide precise failure feedback within 1 second
- IF a deposit deduction fails at any step (due to concurrency, policy constraints, or system error), THEN THE system SHALL revert all debits, restore original balance, notify affected user(s) and admin, and log the full event for compliance review
- THE full deposit ledger (top-ups, payments, refunds, expiries, adjustments) SHALL be accessible via user dashboards and admin analytics, filterable by time, order, event, and status
- WHERE negative deposits (overdrawn balance) are not permitted, THE system SHALL block orders that would drive negative balance and return exact shortfall amount needed

## Mileage/Loyalty Point Accrual and Redemption
- WHEN a qualifying business event completes (order fulfillment without cancellation or return), THE system SHALL credit mileage/loyalty points to the user's balance based on order value, promotional multiplier, and current business rules (minimums, exclusions, campaign rates)
- WHERE sellers offer individual rewards (mileage boost, event-specific), THE system SHALL tag awarded points by origin for audit, reporting, and possible revocation in fraud/error cases
- WHEN a user returns order items, THE system SHALL proportionally deduct previously awarded mileage for refunded line items
- WHERE a point promotion (double points, limited time) applies, THE system SHALL apply multiplier only for orders confirmed during the promotional window, as determined by order timestamp
- WHERE both mileage and coupon are present at checkout, THE system SHALL strictly enforce business logic for stacking, exclusivity, and minimum thresholds, always displaying applied business rule outcome to the user

## Expiry, Deduction, Adjustment Logic
- THE system SHALL support per-point (FIFO), batch, or global expiry windows for mileage/loyalty and deposit balances, customizable by business administrator
- WHEN miles or deposits are within 30 days of expiry, THE system SHALL notify users by preferred channel at D-30 and D-7, including visual dashboard notices and push/email/SMS notifications as opted-in
- WHEN points/deposits expire, THE system SHALL synchronize updated balances across all interfaces within 5 seconds, log expiry event with actor (system), and retain event for reporting
- WHEN adjusting points/deposits for compliance, fraud, or error correction, THE system SHALL require admin authorization, produce a detailed correction audit, and instantly notify all affected users of cause, amount, and impact

# Redemption and Expiry Processes
## Coupon/Mileage/Deposit Expiry Assignment and User Notices
- WHEN coupons or benefits are created, THE system SHALL enforce rolling or fixed expiry as defined, store exact expiry, and expose all expiry dates to users in every interface and notification
- WHEN a benefit is within 7 days of expiry, THE system SHALL push at least two user alerts (at D-7 and D-1), including actionable links and information on how to redeem or avoid loss
- WHEN a benefit expires unused, THE system SHALL immediately mark as expired, revoke entitlement from the user, and log expiry event for legal and analytics purposes

## Redemption and Error/Recovery Flows
- WHEN benefit application (coupon, mileage, deposit) is successful during checkout, THE system SHALL lock applied benefit(s) atomically, display an itemized cost breakdown, and preserve a point-in-time snapshot of benefit usage in order history
- IF post-submission system or fulfillment error invalidates the order, THEN THE system SHALL roll back the redemption, restore all benefit balances, notify affected users, and record the full rollback chain in the audit trail
- WHEN redemption rules or eligibility are adjusted after benefit assignment but before use, THE system SHALL ensure all future redemptions follow the updated rules, and provide forced notice to all affected users if any entitlement is changed
- WHERE business rules for benefit stacking or exclusivity change, THE system SHALL guarantee runtime validation for all future redemptions and supply user-impact reports

## Audit and Reporting
- ALL benefit events (issuance, redemption, expiry, adjustment, error) SHALL be written to a tamper-evident audit trail, indexed by actor, benefit type, entity, user, and order, with full timestamp granularity (to millisecond if feasible)
- Admins SHALL be able to generate comprehensive benefit usage, error, and expiry reports by date, benefit category, user, seller, status, channel, and business event type
- System-generated analytics SHALL surface trends in benefit success/failure, average benefit uptake, and exception/fraud patterns, always linked unambiguously to business events

# Role-based Permissions and Access Matrix
## Permission Matrix
| Action                               | Customer | Seller | Admin |
|--------------------------------------|----------|--------|-------|
| Receive assigned coupons             | âœ…       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Redeem coupon at checkout            | âœ…       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Issue coupons (to customers)         | âŒ       | âœ…*    | âœ…    |
| Create/edit coupon templates         | âŒ       | âœ…*    | âœ…    |
| Adjust/revoke coupons post-issue     | âŒ       | âœ…*    | âœ…    |
| Issue/adjust mileage or deposits     | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Approve adjustments for fraud/errors | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| View audit/reports for own actions   | âœ…       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| *Seller actions limited to own products; subject to compliance checks  |

## JWT Payload Structure for Entitled Benefits
- userId (string, required)
- role (enum: customer, seller, admin)
- entitlements: array (coupon/mileage/deposit objects: id, type, assigned_at, expires_at, status)
- permissions: array, as mapped per above table

Business rules for each role:
- Customers: may receive and redeem, but not issue/modify benefits; view audit of personal actions
- Sellers: may issue/adjust coupons for own products subject to compliance; may not control platform coupons or global rules
- Admins: may issue, adjust, or revoke any benefit; audit and report on all events; approve all compliance adjustments

# Performance and User Experience Expectations
- THE system SHALL process and reflect all benefit application, deduction, and refund transactions (deposit, mileage, coupon) and update UI within 2 seconds in 99% of typical cases; all state and entitlement synchronizations SHALL complete across channels within 5 seconds
- WHEN errors occur, all validation SHALL return actionable error codes/messages, including code, field, human-readable message, context, and recovery options suited to the business process
- BENEFIT notification events (coupon issued/expiring/expired, point adjustments, ledger updates) SHALL be delivered to the userâ€™s selected channel(s) within 2 minutes, with at least 2 redundant delivery attempts
- Bulk processes (mass coupon issuance, batch expiry, account-wide adjustment) SHALL NOT degrade user-facing benefit calculations or trigger timeouts for end-users during peak events
- System SLA: >99.95% uptime for all benefit eligibility, redemption, expiration flows

# Mermaid Diagram: Comprehensive Benefit Redemption and Error Flow
```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "Benefit Redemption & Error Handling"
    A["Checkout Start"] --> B["User Selects Coupon or Benefit"]
    B --> C{"Eligible/Valid Coupon?"}
    C -->|"Yes"| D["Apply Discount/Redemption"]
    D --> E["Commit Order and Lock Benefits"]
    E --> F["Success: Update Benefit Ledger"]
    C -->|"No"| G["Show Error Message (Reason)"]
    G --> H["Block/Retry/Explain"]
    E --> I{"System Error After Commit?"}
    I -->|"No"| J["Order & Benefit Confirmed"]
    I -->|"Yes"| K["Reversal/Rollback Process"]
    K --> L["Restore All Entitlements"]
    L --> M["Audit and User Notification"]
  end
```

# Glossary
- Coupon: Digitally assigned privilege, code or offer for discounts, free shipping, or special terms
- Mileage: Loyalty points/procedural credits accrued by fulfilling defined business-flow (e.g., purchase, promo), redeemable in future
- Deposit: Prepaid financial balance held at user account, used as direct payment (must be auditable and refundable)
- Entitlement: Any benefit assigned to a userâ€”coupon, mileage point, or deposit

# Related Document References
- [Detailed User Roles and Authentication Requirements](./03-user-roles-and-authentication.md)
- [Cart and Order Processing Business Requirements](./07-cart-and-order-processing.md)
- [Business Rules and Validation Policies](./12-business-rules-and-validation.md)

# Success and Compliance Criteria
- Every business rule, eligibility condition, and behavior outlined here is mandatory for all shoppingMall backend deployments
- All edge and exception cases must be treated with atomicity and auditability, as specified
- Developers possess full autonomy in technical implementation (architecture, APIs, database design) provided business logic is stringently enforced
- Future changes to benefit logic, stacking, or eligibility must be governed by auditable rule change notifications to all affected user base

# Business Model Overview
The "shoppingMall" platform is designed as an intelligent AI-driven multi-channel e-commerce hub enabling seamless transactions between customers, sellers, and administrators. Its purpose is to address evolving consumer demand for efficiency, personalization, and trust in online retailâ€”bridging the gap between traditional and digital shopping experiences with automation and data-driven decision making.

Key market needs include:
- Facilitating secure, convenient shopping journeys in a fragmented e-commerce landscape
- Helping retailers of all sizes manage products, orders, and customers under one unified system
- Leveraging AI to provide better recommendations, dynamic pricing, fraud detection, and proactive customer support
- Delivering transparency, compliance, and reliability at scale

Differentiation lies in:
- Full-cycle operational automation for sellers (from onboarding to inventory, to analytics)
- Personalization for customers via advanced recommendation engines
- Administrative tools and analytics for platform optimization
- Integrated loyalty, coupon, and review systems for community and retention
- Scalable architecture for omnichannel expansion

# Monetization Strategy
Revenue is generated via multiple streams:
- Transaction fees on sales completed through the platform
- Subscription tiers for sellers (with premium features such as advanced analytics or support)
- Commission from value-added services (promoted listings, ads, fulfillment handling)
- Integration partnerships and API access for third parties
- Potential premium account options and upselling to end-users

Additional strategies include platform-agnostic coupon/loyalty program alliances, and market insight reporting subscriptions. The business model is adaptable for B2B, B2C, and hybrid commerce.

# Customer Acquisition & Retention
Customer growth is achieved through channel diversification (web, app, external API), AI-powered marketing, and viral community-building features. Retention is driven by:
- Continuous personalization using behavioral data and feedback
- Loyalty points, targeted discounts, and mileage/reward systems
- Responsive support, transparent policies, and trust-building mechanisms
- Dynamic engagement through reviews, Q&A, and community sections
- Lifecycle-based CRM ensuring re-engagement at trigger moments

# AI & Data Utilization in Growth
AI is utilized throughout:
- Real-time recommendation for products, search, and content
- Dynamic pricing models adjusting inventory based on demand
- Fraud detection in payments, reviews, and account creation
- Sales forecasting for sellers and administrative planning
- Behavior analytics for cohort targeting and campaign optimization
- Automated moderation for reviews, inquiries, and content

Data is aggregated ethically and in compliance with privacy laws, supporting advanced analytics for both platform and sellers, and driving continuous improvement of algorithms and business decision-making.

# KPIs & Evaluation Measures
Performance is gauged by clear, consistent metrics, including:
- Monthly active users (MAU) and daily active users (DAU) growth
- Gross merchandise value (GMV) and average order value (AOV)
- Seller/shop activation/retention rates
- Customer repeat purchase rate and NPS
- Cart conversion rates and order fulfillment efficiency
- Community engagement rates (reviews, Q&A, content posted)
- AI-driven feature adoption and accuracy rates
- Compliance to SLA on performance, error rates, and data security

# EARS-Format Sample Requirements
- THE platform SHALL deliver personalized product recommendations to each user session based on behavioral and historical data.
- WHEN a transaction is completed through the marketplace, THE system SHALL record the associated fee and commission automatically.
- WHERE a seller subscribes to premium features, THE system SHALL grant access to advanced analytics dashboards and support tools.
- IF suspicious activity is detected in customer reviews, THEN THE system SHALL flag the content for moderation and potential removal.
- WHEN AI-driven promotional campaigns are launched, THE platform SHALL track conversion metrics per defined KPI set.
