# Business Model Overview
The shoppingMall platform functions as an AI-driven, multi-channel e-commerce ecosystem facilitating seamless connections and secure transactions among customers, sellers, and administrators. Its purpose is to revolutionize digital commerce through advanced automation, data-driven personalization, and operational excellence at scale, addressing the shortcomings of fragmented legacy shopping channels.

Market demand is driven by:
- The need for frictionless, secure, and omnichannel shopping experiences.
- Retailers and brands seeking centralized management of products, orders, logistics, and customer relationships.
- The imperative for AI-powered enhancements in recommendations, pricing, support, and trust signals.
- Regulatory and consumer expectations around transparency, compliance, and data security.

Unique differentiation comes from:
- System-wide automation for sellers (from onboarding and catalog to order management and analytics).
- Deep customer personalization powered by AI-based recommender, search, and targeting engines.
- Real-time community features (reviews, Q&A, community engagement) integrated with seller analytics.
- Administrative tools for system oversight, compliance monitoring, and actionable insights.
- An extensible, scalable architecture ready for future omnichannel, cross-border, and vertical expansion.

WHEN a new market or user segment is targeted, THE platform SHALL enable rapid onboarding and localization of all commerce processes, ensuring the business model flexibly adapts to new revenue and operational scenarios.

## Monetization Strategy
The shoppingMall platform generates revenue through a diverse, scalable, and adaptable set of business streams:

- Transaction fees: THE platform SHALL collect a percentage-based fee on every completed sale, calculated per order and tracked for settlement.
- Subscription fees: Sellers can subscribe to premium service tiersâ€”THE system SHALL enable upgrades, recurring billing, and feature access control based on plan.
- Value-added service commissions: THE platform SHALL offer services such as featured listings, advertisement modules, fulfillment, and analytics dashboards to sellers and brands, charging a commission per usage.
- Integration fees: Third-party partners accessing core APIs, analytics, or components pay recurring fees for integrationâ€”THE system SHALL manage access, limits, and settlement.
- Customer premium features: THE system SHALL support paid customer options such as premium accounts, personalized support, and exclusive deals.
- Loyalty and insight programs: THE platform SHALL offer cross-channel coupon/loyalty alliances and market reporting subscriptions, optionally monetized to both merchants and business intelligence partners.

WHEN a transaction is completed, THE system SHALL immediately record the fee or commission, itemize it in accounting snapshots, and make it accessible via admin dashboards for real-time reporting.

WHERE a seller or customer upgrades to a paid tier or premium feature, THE system SHALL process payment, activate entitlements instantly, and track usage for ongoing billing.

WHEN a third-party partner requests data/API access, THE system SHALL enforce business validation (entitlement, quota) before billing and exposing any resource, ensuring compliance and auditability.

IF a monetization event fails (e.g., payment declined, partner over quota), THEN THE system SHALL issue clear error messaging, log the failure, and prompt remediation or escalation workflows.

All revenue channels are tracked, auditable, and configurable by administrators in real-time to support new monetization and partnership models as the business grows.

## Customer Acquisition & Retention
THE shoppingMall backend supports growth through:
- Channel expansion: web, mobile, external API partners, branded channels
- AI-targeted advertising: performance-based campaigns and segmentation across regions and cohorts
- Viral community engagement: sharing, reviews, Q&A, gamification (e.g., badges, loyalty tiers)
- Seller enablement: frictionless onboarding, catalog tools, fulfillment automation, analytics

WHEN a new customer or seller accesses the service for the first time, THE system SHALL streamline registration, onboarding, and initial personalization, minimizing barriers and maximizing the chance of conversion.

WHILE a user remains active, THE system SHALL continuously adapt experience and marketing based on real-time behavioral data, including personalized offers, notifications, and lifecycle-triggered retention actions.

WHEN a loyalty or discount program is launched, THE system SHALL assign, track usage, and expire rewards automatically, with full transparency to users in their dashboard and history.

IF a user is inactive or at risk of churn (predicted by AI or business rule), THEN THE system SHALL trigger targeted re-engagement actions such as tailored discounts, milestone rewards, or reminder messaging.

Customers and sellers benefit from robust account management, responsive support, transparent policies, and trust-building mechanisms (e.g., verified seller badges, dispute resolution, evidence snapshotting), all documented in [User Scenarios and Flows](./04-user-scenarios-and-flows.md).

## AI & Data Utilization in Growth
AI and big data are foundational to the shoppingMall business model:

- Product and search recommendations: THE system SHALL use customer context, browsing/buying history, and community trends to present real-time, session-personalized recommendations at all major journey points.
- Dynamic pricing: THE platform SHALL analyze inventory, demand, competitor trends, and seller-specified rules to suggest optimal product pricing, supporting price automation for sellers where enabled.
- Fraud and risk controls: THE system SHALL monitor patterns in payments, reviews, user registrations, and account activity, triggering fraud-detection and adaptive interventions when needed.
- Automated support and moderation: AI SHALL triage inquiries, flag suspicious content, and guide escalation flows for community content and customer service.
- Sales and trend analytics: THE system SHALL deliver actionable, AI-powered dashboards and performance predictions to sellers and admins.
- Cohort and campaign targeting: THE AI engine SHALL identify and segment users for targeted marketing, loyalty, and reactivation campaigns, enforcing compliance with privacy laws.

WHEN data is aggregated or used for model training/analysis, THE system SHALL ensure alignment with user privacy settings and all relevant data protection regulations, as described in [Security, Compliance & Data Privacy Requirements](./13-security-compliance-and-data-privacy.md).

All AI-driven features are designed for adaptability, continuous self-improvement, and ethical, transparent use, with clear opt-ins and user controls.

## KPIs & Evaluation Measures
Business performance is evaluated using the following measurable indicators, each tracked continuously and available for real-time and periodic analysis:

| KPI                                  | Definition                                                            | Target / SLA                             |
|--------------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------|------------------------------------------|
| Monthly active users (MAU)           | Number of unique authenticated accounts active per month             | +15% YoY growth                          |
| Daily active users (DAU)             | Unique users per day (all roles)                                     | +5% MoM growth                           |
| Gross merchandise value (GMV)        | Total value of goods sold per unit time                              | Customizable per business goals          |
| Average order value (AOV)            | GMV / number of orders                                               | Set per segment: $100+, configurable     |
| Seller activation/retention rate     | Onboarded sellers & % retained quarterly                             | Onboarding: +20% QoQ; Retention > 75%    |
| Customer repeat purchase rate        | % of customers with >1 purchase in last 3/6/12 months                | Industry-leading, with tiered incentives |
| Net Promoter Score (NPS)             | Promoter-detractor ratio from periodic surveys                       | > 60                                     |
| Cart conversion rate                  | % carts converted to completed orders per channel                    | > 45%                                    |
| Order fulfillment efficiency         | % orders fulfilled within SLA (e.g., 48h for seller dispatch)        | 98%+                                     |
| Community engagement rate            | Activity in reviews, Q&A, community posts per 1,000 users            | > 25% monthly participation              |
| AI feature adoption/accuracy rate    | Utilization/accuracy of recommenders, auto-pricing, moderation       | Monitored per AI module                  |
| SLA compliance (performance, errors) | % of requests/ops meeting <2s response, error <0.1%, security pass   | 99.95%+ uptime, <0.1% critical errors    |

WHEN a KPI deteriorates below target levels, THEN THE system SHALL trigger notification workflows, assign analytic investigations to admins, and propose automated or manual improvement actions.

WHERE critical business or regulatory incidents are detected (e.g., data breach, order fulfillment failure, fraud spike), THE system SHALL escalate to admin, immobilize affected transactions, and generate evidence logs for compliance.

All KPI measurement, reporting, and improvement activity is transparent, auditable, and integrated with both admin dashboards and business intelligence partners.

## Value Generation and Stakeholder Flows (Mermaid Diagram)
```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "Customer Experience"
    A["Browse/Search Products"] --> B["Personalized AI Recommender"]
    B --> C["Order Placement"]
    C --> D["Payment and Checkout"]
    D --> E["Earn Loyalty/Mileage"]
    E --> F["Feedback: Review/QA/Community"]
  end

  subgraph "Seller Experience"
    G["Seller Onboarding"] --> H["Product/Offer Management"]
    H --> I["AI Analytics Dashboard"]
    I --> J["Sales, Orders, Fulfillment"]
    J --> K["Fee, Subscriptions, Commissions"]
  end

  A -.->|"Questions/Inquiries"| H
  F -.->|"Community Signals"| I

  subgraph "Admin/Platform"
    L["Compliance & Moderation"] --> M["Monetization Settlement"]
    M --> N["KPI Monitoring"]
    N --> O["AI Model Optimization"]
  end

  K --> M
  N -->|"Actionable Insights"| I
```

## EARS-Format Business Requirements Summary
- THE platform SHALL deliver session-personalized product and content recommendations to users based on behavioral and historical signals.
- WHEN a sale is completed, THE system SHALL immediately record all associated fees and commissions for subsequent settlement and reporting.
- WHERE a seller subscribes to a premium tier, THE system SHALL enable advanced analytics, higher product quotas, and prioritized support.
- IF AI systems detect suspicious or prohibited activity (e.g., fraud, abusive content), THEN THE system SHALL flag, quarantine, and escalate for review within 5 minutes.

# AI Shopping Mall Backend: Service Vision & Value Proposition

## Project Purpose & Market Need

The AI Shopping Mall backend is designed to address critical deficiencies in the current e-commerce marketplace, providing a transformative solution for all stakeholdersâ€”customers, sellers, administrators, and technology partners. As digital commerce evolves, generic, fragmented, and rigid backend platforms are unable to deliver the instantly-responsive, highly-personalized, and adaptive experiences todayâ€™s users and business operators demand. Legacy systems suffer from inflexible integrations, poor data utilization, lack of automated intelligence, and a reactive approach to risk and service delivery.

### Key Market Needs and Market Gaps
- Users (customers) require a unified, cross-device journey, adaptive discovery (smart recommendations), real-time order status, transparent pricing, and trustworthy transactions. Friction in search, irrelevant content, and cumbersome service reduce customer retention and satisfaction.
- Sellers face challenges onboarding rapidly, efficiently managing catalogs across multiple channels, and accessing actionable sales analytics. Most platforms lack seller-friendly, automated tools for engagement, fulfillment, and risk management, leading to wasted effort and lost growth.
- Admins and business owners demand granular oversight, proactive compliance, automated fraud and abuse detection, and integrated analytics to drive innovation and channel expansion. Traditional solutions fall short on scalability, policy enforcement, and rapid localization.

The project targets gaps in:
- Personalization at true scale
- Empowering sellers/micro-brands through automation
- Instant, actionable analytics and feedback loops
- Predictive (AI/ML) support for risk mitigation, recommendations, and dynamic pricing
- Unified, seamless operations across web, mobile, and 3rd-party/offline channels

### EARS Requirements: Market and Purpose
- WHEN a customer browses, THE system SHALL deliver personalized recommendations and content, tailored to behavior, purchase history, and segment.
- WHEN a seller registers, THE system SHALL prompt, validate, and activate seller tools and onboarding with AI-driven guidance within 5 minutes of successful verification.
- WHEN an admin monitors the system, THE backend SHALL aggregate risk, compliance, and performance events in real time, highlighting actionable anomalies.
- WHEN a user engages with shoppingMall from multiple devices/channels, THE backend SHALL maintain a coherent session and unified experience, preserving their state and preferences.

## Business Opportunity & Differentiators

A competitive edge is established by embedding AI in every key process, from discovery through post-purchase engagement. Key differentiators include:
- Embedded AI in customer recommendations, pricing, fraud detection, and even product curation/SEO
- Proprietary automation for rapid seller onboarding, catalog verification, and campaign setupâ€”requiring minimal manual effort and enabling micro-sellers/brands to thrive
- Continuous feedback analytics loops, enabling AI and business logic to improve and personalize the experience over time
- Real-time, multi-channel inventory and order management with predictive alerts, fulfillment anomaly detection, and channel-optimized operations
- Robust loyalty, rewards, and community engagement systems powered by data insights and behavioral metrics

### EARS Requirements: Differentiation
- WHEN a new seller account is established, THE system SHALL assess the seller category, recommend product verticals, and automate catalog import if supported, all within 10 minutes of registration confirmation.
- WHEN the platform detects unusual account or transaction behavior, THE backend SHALL initiate fraud risk evaluation and route high-risk events for admin action within 30 seconds.
- WHEN new regulatory requirements or localization changes emerge, THE backend SHALL enable configurable channel/rules updates and content localization within 48 hours to meet regional compliance.

## Stakeholder Goals

| Stakeholder           | Primary Goals                                                                                                                                                                   |
|----------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Customers            | Effortless, engaging, and secure shopping, relevant offers and search, trusted peer-reviewed transactions, unified account/profile, instant and reliable support, transparent pricing |
| Sellers              | Fast onboarding, AI-powered marketing tools, seamless multi-channel inventory/order management, transparent business analytics, customer engagement, and automated compliance        |
| Admins               | Global oversight, granular control, continuous compliance/risk monitoring, automated content moderation, and channel/localization management                                         |
| Business Executives  | Accelerated growth, AI-based business innovation, diversified and recurring revenue, market leadership, and high user retention                                                    |
| Technology Partners  | Simple, well-documented integration/APIs, analytics data access, consistent updates, and rapid onboarding                                                                         |

### Roles and Role-specific EARS Requirements
- WHEN a customer requests support, THE backend SHALL provide intelligent self-service options and escalate inquiries to live assistance within 2 minutes if unresolved.
- WHEN a seller updates product details, THE backend SHALL propagate validated updates to all active channels/marketplaces within 10 seconds.
- WHEN an admin initiates a compliance check or audit, THE backend SHALL deliver a consolidated compliance and anomaly report within 5 minutes of request.
- WHEN a business executive reviews KPIs, THE backend SHALL generate up-to-date, role-specific dashboards with exportable/filtered performance data within 30 seconds of query.

## AI-driven Value Proposition

AI is applied end-to-end to maximize stakeholder value:
- Personalized recommendations for products, content, and offers, realigned in real-time per user journey
- Dynamic, predictive pricing models optimizing conversion, lifetime value, and inventory churn automatically
- Behavior anomaly modeling for fraud/abuse prevention, with real-time account and transaction risk assessment
- Automated customer and seller support: chatbots, smart inquiry and escalation flows, 24/7 omnichannel coverage
- AI-enablement for seller dashboards: predictive sales, inventory alerts, and campaign optimization suggestions
- Data-powered loyalty systems: precision targeting for rewards, gamified experiences, churn prediction, and reward conversion optimization

### AI EARS Requirements and Error/Performance Handling
- WHEN real-time anomaly detection identifies high-risk logins or purchases, THE backend SHALL suspend critical actions pending user/role verification and notify all affected parties within 1 minute.
- WHEN a customer receives a recommendation, THE system SHALL ensure the result is returned within 1 second for standard queries; if AI models are unavailable, THE backend SHALL provide default popular/recent product suggestions and log the incident.
- WHEN a seller dashboard page is loaded, THE AI-driven analytics SHALL render personalized insights within 2 seconds in 99% of cases.
- IF supported chatbot/AI-powered inquiry handling fails, THEN THE backend SHALL automatically escalate to a human agent and notify the customer.
- WHEN AI suggests a targeted campaign or loyalty offer, THE backend SHALL log all business outcomes (clicks, conversions, redemptions) for analytics.

## Success Metrics

Performance and success are measured through quantifiable operational and business KPIs:

| Metric                      | Definition                                                                                           |
|-----------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Monthly Active Users (MAU)  | Unique active user accounts (all roles) with monthly engagement                                      |
| Customer Satisfaction (CSAT)| Aggregated customer satisfaction: feedback scores from surveys, support resolutions (>85% required) |
| Seller Growth Rate          | Percentage growth in active onboarding sellers each quarter (target: 10% month over month)           |
| Order Conversion Rate       | Sales order completions/unique browsing sessions; must exceed industry benchmarks                    |
| Fraud Incident Rate         | Verified fraud events per 1,000 orders (target: <0.1)                                                |
| Platform Uptime             | Measured backend availability across all channels (target: 99.95% or greater)                        |
| Feature Adoption            | Utilization of AI-enabled features, measured monthly by roll-up activation rates per role            |
| Support Resolution Time     | Median time to resolve user/seller support (target: <2 hours)                                        |
| Revenue Per Active Seller   | Mean revenue from active sellers; measures monetization effectiveness and seller success             |
| Channel Time-to-Market      | Days from signup to first live product sale per channel (target: <3 days median)                     |

### Monitoring, Exception, and Reporting EARS
- WHEN a monitored metric breaches critical threshold (e.g., uptime, fraud, support delay), THE backend SHALL trigger automated alerting and generate root-cause analysis for admin review within 15 minutes.
- WHEN feature adoption or KPI lags against targets by more than 10% over a rolling 30-day window, THE backend SHALL initiate an executive summary and recommend remedial actions.
- WHEN business stakeholders request historical/exportable KPI data, THE backend SHALL provide downloadable data within 1 minute for standard time ranges (â‰¤1 year).

## Business Model Integration

### Business Model Overview
- The platform exists to accelerate and monetize AI-driven e-commerce, powering seller growth, customer engagement, and market expansion through continuous innovation and robust operational reliability.
- Revenue is derived from transaction fees, seller subscription tiers, value-added features (analytics, promotions), and data-driven partner integrations.
- Monetization adapts to segment needs: premium seller features, international/localized transaction fees, community and AI/analytics service upsells, and targeted performance-based advertising.

### Revenue and Growth Strategies
- WHEN new premium seller features are piloted, THE backend SHALL meter usage and report conversion to business analytics for expansion decisions.
- WHEN markets are expanded or new channels (e.g., cross-border, affiliate) are added, THE backend SHALL enable rapid configuration, policy localization, and full user/business flow onboarding within 2 weeks or less.
- Customer acquisition leverages AI-based marketing, viral community/referral mechanics, and churn prediction to inform targeted retention/re-engagement campaigns.

## Compliance, Security, and Data Privacy Objectives
- WHEN new privacy or data protection law impacts the platform, THE backend SHALL enforce all required flow updates, evidence logs, and notification templates for users within 72 hours of enforcement.
- WHEN account, product, or transactional data is modified or deleted by a user/role, THE backend SHALL retain compliance audit snapshots and allow regulatory retrieval for a legally-mandated retention period (default: 5 years, configurable per region).

## Related Documentation Reference

Full business model strategy and monetization logic are detailed in the [Business Model Overview and Monetization Guide](./02-business-model.md). Authentication process, user role definitions, and permission enforcement are specified in the [User Roles and Authentication Specification](./03-user-roles-and-authentication.md). End-to-end user journeys, error handling, and workflow specifics are elaborated in the [End-to-End User Workflows and Use Cases Document](./04-user-scenarios-and-flows.md). For advanced metrics, compliance, and future expansion details, refer to related business rules, security, and scaling documentation.

# Business Model Overview
The shoppingMall platform functions as an AI-driven, multi-channel e-commerce ecosystem facilitating seamless connections and secure transactions among customers, sellers, and administrators. Its purpose is to revolutionize digital commerce through advanced automation, data-driven personalization, and operational excellence at scale, addressing the shortcomings of fragmented legacy shopping channels.

Market demand is driven by:
- The need for frictionless, secure, and omnichannel shopping experiences.
- Retailers and brands seeking centralized management of products, orders, logistics, and customer relationships.
- The imperative for AI-powered enhancements in recommendations, pricing, support, and trust signals.
- Regulatory and consumer expectations around transparency, compliance, and data security.

Unique differentiation comes from:
- System-wide automation for sellers (from onboarding and catalog to order management and analytics).
- Deep customer personalization powered by AI-based recommender, search, and targeting engines.
- Real-time community features (reviews, Q&A, community engagement) integrated with seller analytics.
- Administrative tools for system oversight, compliance monitoring, and actionable insights.
- An extensible, scalable architecture ready for future omnichannel, cross-border, and vertical expansion.

WHEN a new market or user segment is targeted, THE platform SHALL enable rapid onboarding and localization of all commerce processes, ensuring the business model flexibly adapts to new revenue and operational scenarios.

## Monetization Strategy
The shoppingMall platform generates revenue through a diverse, scalable, and adaptable set of business streams:

- Transaction fees: THE platform SHALL collect a percentage-based fee on every completed sale, calculated per order and tracked for settlement.
- Subscription fees: Sellers can subscribe to premium service tiersâ€”THE system SHALL enable upgrades, recurring billing, and feature access control based on plan.
- Value-added service commissions: THE platform SHALL offer services such as featured listings, advertisement modules, fulfillment, and analytics dashboards to sellers and brands, charging a commission per usage.
- Integration fees: Third-party partners accessing core APIs, analytics, or components pay recurring fees for integrationâ€”THE system SHALL manage access, limits, and settlement.
- Customer premium features: THE system SHALL support paid customer options such as premium accounts, personalized support, and exclusive deals.
- Loyalty and insight programs: THE platform SHALL offer cross-channel coupon/loyalty alliances and market reporting subscriptions, optionally monetized to both merchants and business intelligence partners.

WHEN a transaction is completed, THE system SHALL immediately record the fee or commission, itemize it in accounting snapshots, and make it accessible via admin dashboards for real-time reporting.

WHERE a seller or customer upgrades to a paid tier or premium feature, THE system SHALL process payment, activate entitlements instantly, and track usage for ongoing billing.

WHEN a third-party partner requests data/API access, THE system SHALL enforce business validation (entitlement, quota) before billing and exposing any resource, ensuring compliance and auditability.

IF a monetization event fails (e.g., payment declined, partner over quota), THEN THE system SHALL issue clear error messaging, log the failure, and prompt remediation or escalation workflows.

All revenue channels are tracked, auditable, and configurable by administrators in real-time to support new monetization and partnership models as the business grows.

## Customer Acquisition & Retention
THE shoppingMall backend supports growth through:
- Channel expansion: web, mobile, external API partners, branded channels
- AI-targeted advertising: performance-based campaigns and segmentation across regions and cohorts
- Viral community engagement: sharing, reviews, Q&A, gamification (e.g., badges, loyalty tiers)
- Seller enablement: frictionless onboarding, catalog tools, fulfillment automation, analytics

WHEN a new customer or seller accesses the service for the first time, THE system SHALL streamline registration, onboarding, and initial personalization, minimizing barriers and maximizing the chance of conversion.

WHILE a user remains active, THE system SHALL continuously adapt experience and marketing based on real-time behavioral data, including personalized offers, notifications, and lifecycle-triggered retention actions.

WHEN a loyalty or discount program is launched, THE system SHALL assign, track usage, and expire rewards automatically, with full transparency to users in their dashboard and history.

IF a user is inactive or at risk of churn (predicted by AI or business rule), THEN THE system SHALL trigger targeted re-engagement actions such as tailored discounts, milestone rewards, or reminder messaging.

Customers and sellers benefit from robust account management, responsive support, transparent policies, and trust-building mechanisms (e.g., verified seller badges, dispute resolution, evidence snapshotting), all documented in [User Scenarios and Flows](./04-user-scenarios-and-flows.md).

## AI & Data Utilization in Growth
AI and big data are foundational to the shoppingMall business model:

- Product and search recommendations: THE system SHALL use customer context, browsing/buying history, and community trends to present real-time, session-personalized recommendations at all major journey points.
- Dynamic pricing: THE platform SHALL analyze inventory, demand, competitor trends, and seller-specified rules to suggest optimal product pricing, supporting price automation for sellers where enabled.
- Fraud and risk controls: THE system SHALL monitor patterns in payments, reviews, user registrations, and account activity, triggering fraud-detection and adaptive interventions when needed.
- Automated support and moderation: AI SHALL triage inquiries, flag suspicious content, and guide escalation flows for community content and customer service.
- Sales and trend analytics: THE system SHALL deliver actionable, AI-powered dashboards and performance predictions to sellers and admins.
- Cohort and campaign targeting: THE AI engine SHALL identify and segment users for targeted marketing, loyalty, and reactivation campaigns, enforcing compliance with privacy laws.

WHEN data is aggregated or used for model training/analysis, THE system SHALL ensure alignment with user privacy settings and all relevant data protection regulations, as described in [Security, Compliance & Data Privacy Requirements](./13-security-compliance-and-data-privacy.md).

All AI-driven features are designed for adaptability, continuous self-improvement, and ethical, transparent use, with clear opt-ins and user controls.

## KPIs & Evaluation Measures
Business performance is evaluated using the following measurable indicators, each tracked continuously and available for real-time and periodic analysis:

| KPI                                  | Definition                                                            | Target / SLA                             |
|--------------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------|------------------------------------------|
| Monthly active users (MAU)           | Number of unique authenticated accounts active per month             | +15% YoY growth                          |
| Daily active users (DAU)             | Unique users per day (all roles)                                     | +5% MoM growth                           |
| Gross merchandise value (GMV)        | Total value of goods sold per unit time                              | Customizable per business goals          |
| Average order value (AOV)            | GMV / number of orders                                               | Set per segment: $100+, configurable     |
| Seller activation/retention rate     | Onboarded sellers & % retained quarterly                             | Onboarding: +20% QoQ; Retention > 75%    |
| Customer repeat purchase rate        | % of customers with >1 purchase in last 3/6/12 months                | Industry-leading, with tiered incentives |
| Net Promoter Score (NPS)             | Promoter-detractor ratio from periodic surveys                       | > 60                                     |
| Cart conversion rate                  | % carts converted to completed orders per channel                    | > 45%                                    |
| Order fulfillment efficiency         | % orders fulfilled within SLA (e.g., 48h for seller dispatch)        | 98%+                                     |
| Community engagement rate            | Activity in reviews, Q&A, community posts per 1,000 users            | > 25% monthly participation              |
| AI feature adoption/accuracy rate    | Utilization/accuracy of recommenders, auto-pricing, moderation       | Monitored per AI module                  |
| SLA compliance (performance, errors) | % of requests/ops meeting <2s response, error <0.1%, security pass   | 99.95%+ uptime, <0.1% critical errors    |

WHEN a KPI deteriorates below target levels, THEN THE system SHALL trigger notification workflows, assign analytic investigations to admins, and propose automated or manual improvement actions.

WHERE critical business or regulatory incidents are detected (e.g., data breach, order fulfillment failure, fraud spike), THE system SHALL escalate to admin, immobilize affected transactions, and generate evidence logs for compliance.

All KPI measurement, reporting, and improvement activity is transparent, auditable, and integrated with both admin dashboards and business intelligence partners.

## EARS-Format Business Requirements Summary

- WHERE a seller subscribes to a premium tier, THE system SHALL enable advanced analytics, higher product quotas, and prioritized support.

# shoppingMall User Roles & Authentication Requirements

## Business Context & Principles
The shoppingMall backend provides the foundation for secure, scalable, and compliant user authentication and role-based authorization, serving as the backbone for all business-critical operations. The business must support multi-role access (customer, seller, admin), channel-agnostic logins, robust trust boundaries, and comprehensive business rule enforcement, all while maintaining world-class response times, traceability, privacy, and regulatory compliance. Authentication processes must be extensible to future business or compliance needs and provide the highest assurance for sensitive operations. This specification establishes all actionable requirements, flows, and validation rules for user roles and authentication, using only clear, non-technical business language suitable for backend developers.

---

## Role Catalog & Definitions

### Role Purpose and Boundaries
| Role      | Purpose & Responsibilities                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           | Unique Business Rules & Limitations                                                                             |
|-----------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Customer  | End-user of the shoppingMall service. Responsible for browsing, searching, ordering, reviewing, using discounts/loyalty, favoriting, and interacting via all business channels. Has visibility and control only over their own orders, profile, and personalization.         | Must be registered and authenticated for all personalized/transactional services. Cannot escalate role unverified. Cannot access seller/admin features. One active account per individual. |
| Seller    | Business partner who lists and manages products, handles inventory, processes orders, and communicates with customers. Can administer their own business logic, campaigns, and channel presence (if authorized). May order as a customer, but has elevated responsibilities on their seller account.         | Must pass business identity vetting before activation. Cannot self-authorize seller status. Role switching is session-based. Limit scope to own products/orders. Seller actions audited.  |
| Admin     | Platform authority for managing users, sellers, content, compliance, analytics, rules, and all configuration. Only trusted staff/founders can hold admin role. Expected to act only on business needs/intervention, not as regular buyer/seller.                             | Requires multi-factor authentication and approval from an existing admin. Cannot self-provision or delegate admin status arbitrarily. All activities are tracked with audit trails.         |

#### Special Business Rules (EARS format)
- THE shoppingMall backend SHALL require successful authentication before allowing any transactional, personalized, or configuration action, except for basic catalog browsing.
- WHEN a new user registers, THE shoppingMall backend SHALL validate all required registration criteria per role, and block on any missing or invalid fields.
- WHEN a seller applies for elevated status, THE shoppingMall backend SHALL place the user in "pending seller" until vetting/approval is finalized by admin.
- WHEN an admin account is created or escalated, THE shoppingMall backend SHALL enforce multi-factor authentication, IP whitelisting, and dual-admin approval for all privilege changes.
- WHERE a single user holds both customer and seller roles (e.g., business buying for self), THE shoppingMall backend SHALL enable the session to reflect combined permissions for each permitted function, enforcing the more restrictive rule where actions overlap.
- IF an unauthenticated user attempts a protected/provisioned resource, THEN THE shoppingMall backend SHALL deny access and provide user guidance toward authentication within 2 seconds.
- IF any role attempts an action outside its business scope, THEN THE system SHALL block the action and present a clear, actionable, business rule error.

---

## Authentication Flows (API-Driven)

### Registration and Onboarding
- WHEN a customer registers, THE shoppingMall backend SHALL require and validate:
    - Unique, valid-format email address (RFC-compliant, business or general address)
    - Password adhering to business complexity policy (minimum 10 characters, at least one upper/lower/digit/special character)
    - Legal name (as appears on valid credentials or payment methods)
    - Explicit agreement to terms, compliance, privacy, and option for marketing consent
    - Immediate email/SMS verification step upon registration
- WHEN a seller applies/registers, THE system SHALL require:
    - All customer data, plus legal business name, business registration/tax identifiers, verifiable business address and phone, consent to seller agreement, and supporting business documents
    - "Pending seller" status is default until admin vetting passes; any missing field or mismatch SHALL present a business-specific error field and remediation instructions
- WHEN an admin is provisioned, THE system SHALL restrict admin creation to dual-admin approval (two existing admins must approve, unless this is the initial bootstrap account), must require multi-factor authentication device setup (SMS, app, or hardware key), and must ensure strong password and unique contact information. Self-registration as admin is prohibited under all circumstances.

### Authentication & Session Creation
- WHEN any user submits log-in credentials via API, THE shoppingMall backend SHALL respond within 2 seconds (99% percentile) to either authenticate and issue an active session or provide a clear actionable denial code (e.g., ERR_INVALID_PASSWORD, ERR_ACCOUNT_LOCKED).
- IF authentication fails, THEN THE system SHALL present tailored error guidance (e.g., password reset flow, unlock after lockout, re-enable after ban) without ever revealing which field (ID vs password) was incorrect (to mitigate account guessing).
- WHEN login completes, THE shoppingMall backend SHALL:
    - Generate JWT access and refresh tokens, tied to the user, role(s), device, and channel
    - Log details for traceability (IP, user agent, time, session fingerprint)
    - Allow concurrent sessions per configured device/channel limits
    - Update internal session state for multi-role (e.g., seller ordering as customer)
    - Enforce session expiration, concurrency, and immediately invalidate/revoke sessions/tokens on logout, ban, or policy action
- WHEN a user requests "log out everywhere," THE shoppingMall backend SHALL invalidate all active sessions and tokens for that account regardless of channel or device (keyup to 10 seconds latency system-wide).

### Multi-Channel and Advanced Authentication Flows
- WHERE a user logs in from multiple channels (web/mobile/partner), THE shoppingMall backend SHALL maintain and track independent session state per channel, enforce synchronized policy and provide an aggregated session management view (on demand per user, always for admin audit view).
- WHEN abnormal login patterns are detected (e.g., >5 failed attempts within 1 hour, login from new/flagged device or geolocation, impossible travel, connection from banned IP), THE shoppingMall backend SHALL immediately lock that account and require re-verification before unlocking; IF attempted as admin/seller, THEN escalate to targeted support/audit queue and require admin action for release.
- WHEN a password reset is initiated, THE backend SHALL send a one-time, expiring reset link (valid 30 minutes) to confirmed email/SMS; for seller or admin, enforce extra identifier (e.g. last four digits of verified business phone, 2FA code, or admin override for recovery).
- WHEN changing password, THE system SHALL require entry of old password, enforce compliance with business password policy (no reuse from last 3), verify new password strength, and ensure process is atomic (either succeed or provide user with a clear error for correction).
- WHEN a password reset token/link or code is used, THE system SHALL expire the token instantly on use (single-use), deny usage after expiration, and log all attempts for audit.

### Detailed Authentication Flow (Mermaid)
```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "User Registration and Login"
    AR["Begin Registration"] --> BR["Input Required Info"]
    BR --> CR["Email/SMS Validation"]
    CR -->|"If seller"| DR["Upload/Review Seller Credentials"]
    CR -->|"Else"| ER["Account Provisioned"]
    DR --> ER
    ER --> FR["Login via API"]
    FR --> GR["Credential Validation"]
    GR -->|"Valid"| HR["Session & JWT Token Issued"]
    GR -->|"Invalid"| IR["Actionable Error & Guidance"]
  end

  subgraph "Session Management"
    JR["Access via JWT"] --> KR["API Call Authorization"]
    KR --> LR["Session Expiry & Revocation"]
    LR --> MR["Logout/Force Logout"]
    MR --> NR["Audit & Traceability"]
  end
```

#### Registration, Login, Password Reset Error Scenarios
- IF customer registration with email/phone already in use, THEN THE system SHALL block registration and require unique credentials for new accounts.
- IF password does not meet business complexity, THEN THE system SHALL deny registration/change and clearly state corrective steps.
- IF login is attempted with deactivated or banned account, THEN THE system SHALL block and inform user of next steps (e.g., reactivate, contact support, permanent ban reason).
- WHEN a reset link is used after expiry or more than once, THE system SHALL deny and require re-initiation of the reset request, with clear status.
- IF admin account is accessed outside allowed IP/country/time/frequency policy, THEN THE system SHALL block, trigger audit, and notify senior admin/security desk immediately.

---

## Role-based Permission Matrix

| Action                                               | Customer | Seller | Admin |
|------------------------------------------------------|----------|--------|-------|
| Register account                                     |    âœ…    |   âœ…   |  âŒ   |
| Register & apply for seller                          |    âŒ    |   âœ…   |  âŒ   |
| User login                                           |    âœ…    |   âœ…*  |  âŒ   |
| Seller dashboard access                              |    âŒ    |   âœ…   |  âŒ   |
| Admin dashboard/configuration                        |    âŒ    |   âŒ   |  âœ…   |
| List/manage products                                 |    âŒ    |   âœ…   |  âœ…   |
| Place order (checkout)                               |    âœ…    |   âœ…*  |  âŒ   |
| Manage orders                                        |    âœ…    |   âœ…   |  âœ…   |
| Manage own account/profile                           |    âœ…    |   âœ…   |  âœ…   |
| View own history, reviews, favorites                  |    âœ…    |   âœ…   |  âœ…   |
| Post/review/moderate reviews/inquiries               |    âœ…    |   âœ…   |  âœ…   |
| Use/accrue coupons, mileage                          |    âœ…    |   âœ…   |  âŒ   |
| Access analytics/reports (own/business/global)       |    âŒ    |   âœ…   |  âœ…   |
| Perform compliance/content moderation                |    âŒ    |   âŒ   |  âœ…   |
| Configure categories/business rules                  |    âŒ    |   âŒ   |  âœ…   |
| Manage users and sellers system-wide                 |    âŒ    |   âŒ   |  âœ…   |
| JWT refresh, token management                        |    âœ…    |   âœ…   |  âœ…   |
| Admin privilege escalation/delegation                |    âŒ    |   âŒ   |  âœ…   |

*Seller can act as customer for purchasing/reviewing

#### Example Scenario Narratives
- WHEN a seller is logged in and visits customer features, THE backend SHALL present only permitted functions and enforce business rule separation (e.g., access to only own orders as seller, all personal orders as customer, but never other sellersâ€™ business data).
- WHERE an admin needs to impersonate a seller or customer for support, THE backend SHALL audit every access and restrict editing beyond remediation scope, to avoid privilege abuse or data leak.

---

## Session, Token, and Security Management

### JWT Usage & Token Lifecycle
- THE shoppingMall backend SHALL use JWT (signed) as access and refresh tokens for all authenticated API calls.
- THE access token SHALL expire within 15 minutes; refresh tokens SHALL default to 14 days, but honor system configuration for stricter policies.
- THE user session SHALL terminate immediately upon explicit logout, device/account deactivation, admin revocation, or policy violation.
- JWT payloads SHALL encode: userId, verified role(s), session metadata (device, channel), issued/expiry, permissions (array or scope claims). Admin tokens SHALL include privilege signatures and issuing admin ID. All tokens SHALL be cryptographically signed, not just encoded.
- Refresh tokens SHALL be single-use; reusing a stale/used refresh token SHALL trigger immediate session termination and account lock pending security review.
- All session/token actions SHALL be fully auditableâ€”THE backend SHALL log every issuance, usage, and revocation, including correlating request metadata.

### Secure Session & Device Management
- WHEN a user attempts login from a new device/channel, THE backend SHALL record fingerprint for future anomaly detection and notify the user (e.g., email/SMS push).
- THE backend SHALL support per-device/channel session management and allow users to review, revoke, and manage their active sessions (mandatory for admin/seller, optional for customer).
- WHERE abnormal session behavior is detected (e.g., concurrent access from locations >1000km apart within 1 hour, usage from known anonymous proxies, flagged device identity), THE backend SHALL force a security review (challenge by known channel, forced logout, audit, notification).

### Integration with Compliance & Security Policy
- All session and token discipline SHALL comply with applicable security requirements (see [Security, Compliance & Data Privacy Requirements](./13-security-compliance-and-data-privacy.md)).
- WHEN legal/regulatory changes require stricter authentication/session policy, THE backend SHALL enforce updated policies for all future logins and require remediation for non-compliant existing sessions.

---

## Account Lifecycle Scenarios

### Account Registration, Activation, and Confirmation
- WHEN user registration is completed, THE backend SHALL send a confirmation message (email/SMS), set registration as "pending verification," and only unlock full access when verified.
- IF a user's email/phone is not confirmed within 48 hours, THEN THE backend SHALL restrict all login or transactional actions and prompt user to complete verification.
- WHEN registration remains incomplete after 7 days (pending verification), THE backend SHALL purge unverified accounts and log for compliance.

### Account Deactivation, Reactivation, and Lockout
- WHEN an active user requests deactivation, THE backend SHALL erase authentication tokens, mark the account as inactive, and present legal compliance messaging (account recovery only via verification).
- WHEN a previously deactivated account requests reactivation, THE backend SHALL require complete re-verification (email/SMS, document as needed for sellers, dual admin approval for admins).
- IF a user or admin bans/disables an account (e.g., fraud, terms violation), THE backend SHALL revoke all sessions and tokens, archive user data, and display a ban notification on all future access attempts. Time-limited bans SHALL auto re-enable accounts when duration elapses and all conditions are met.
- WHERE password reset or sensitive account recovery is in progress, THE backend SHALL suspend all other sensitive actions and alert the user via all verified channels.
- WHEN a role escalation or transition (e.g., customer to seller) is incomplete, failed, or found fraudulent, THE backend SHALL deny or roll back all privilege changes, log evidence, and require admin review for remediation.

### Audit, Review, and Evidence Handling
- All account changes SHALL be fully auditableâ€”THE backend SHALL record:
  - Actor (user/admin), timestamps, nature of event (registration, escalation, lockout, ban, reactivation)
  - Justification, supporting evidence for abnormal events (e.g., admin comments, attached correspondence, legal order)
  - Snapshots of relevant account/session/token state before and after changes, for full forensic traces
- WHERE evidence is required for a dispute, regulatory review, or compliance hold, THE backend SHALL export relevant account/session/journal entries per business policy, retaining logs for minimum retention period (e.g., 7 years or applicable local law)

---

## Performance, Scalability, and Reliability Expectations
- All authentication, session, authorization, and permission validation processes SHALL complete within 2 seconds for 99% of cases under normal load; degradation cases SHALL trigger alerts and business review.
- Session revocation, forced logout, and permission changes SHALL synchronize across all devices, channels, and API nodes within 10 seconds (end-to-end), and SHALL log any delays or failures for escalation.
- Authentication services SHALL support horizontal scalability, failover, and high availability such that no single-point-of-failure jeopardizes account access or security; planned maintenance SHALL provide user-facing notice per business policy.

---

## Error Handling and User-Facing Remediation
- IF a user exceeds 5 failed login attempts within any 1-hour window, THEN THE backend SHALL lock the account for 15 minutes, present a tailored error upon access, and prompt unlock/remediation steps. If repeated lockouts occur within 24 hours, escalate to manual review.
- IF user role escalation is denied due to incomplete vetting or detected fraud, THEN THE backend SHALL record and present actionable error and remediation path (e.g., submit documents/support), and block privilege elevation until resolved.
- IF admin login occurs from an unauthorized device, network, or location, THEN THE backend SHALL block login, alert admin/security, and require 2-factor approval to authorize access or restore admin privileges.
- IF system or integration technical error prevents authentication, THEN THE backend SHALL present a business error message, log technical detail for compliance, and provide retry/remediation information for users within 5 minutes.

---

## Links to Related Business Rules
- For privacy, secure permission, and compliance requirements, see [Security, Compliance & Data Privacy Requirements](./13-security-compliance-and-data-privacy.md).
- For core business model and revenue logic, see [Business Model and Objectives](./02-business-model.md).
- For exhaustive user scenarios, see [User Scenarios and Service Flows](./04-user-scenarios-and-flows.md).
- For product management, see [Product and Category Management Requirements](./05-product-and-category-management.md).

---

PREFIX: shoppingMall
ROLES:
- customer: end-users for shopping mall, with registration, personalization, order, favorites, coupon, mileage, and multi-channel access.
- seller: manages product listing, inventory, order fulfillment, customer management, coupon administration, and must pass verification procedures.
- admin: oversees the entire platform (users, sellers, products, channels), configures policies, monitors compliance, and oversees analytics.

Document Objective:
To give the backend development team a full set of detailed, actionable requirements on all aspects of user journeys: buyer, seller, admin. Includes personalization, error handling, business validation logic, user-facing feedback, and business workflow EARS requirements only (no technical, API, database, or UI).

Note: Related documents exist (roles/authentication; product/category; cart/order; discounts/coupons/loyalty; favorites/personalization; community; business rules/validation, etc.) that should be referenced in link form with descriptive labels.

Assumptions:
- All users authenticate via the roles described and experience the system contextually
- User experience is omnichannel (web, mobile, partner), EARS rules ensure channel-portable logic
- Personalization, order, favorite, and error recovery scenarios are prioritized
- Admins can impersonate (view as) other roles for troubleshooting
- Transactions and workflows must meet measurable performance and reliability thresholds

Constraints:

- All business rules, validation, and error scenarios must use EARS statements where applicable
- Only develop content for this single document (04-user-scenarios-and-flows.md)

files.reason: To comprehensively describe requirements for managing products, categories, and content for dynamic e-commerce sales, supporting advanced product configurations and AI-driven search.
keyQuestions: How are products managed?
How are categories structured?
What business logic governs product changes?
files.content:
## 1. Introduction and Scope
This document specifies, in natural language and EARS format, the comprehensive set of business requirements for managing products, product options, categories, tags, and related content within the shoppingMall backend system. The requirements span the entire product lifecycle, cover advanced product configuration, and ensure the support of AI-driven search and change tracking. This document is foundational for system implementers to design backend services that fulfill e-commerce business needs, regulatory standards, and advanced user experience expectations.

Product management in shoppingMall is central to sales, search, and operations. Sellers, admins, and customers interact with products throughout their lifecycle, making precise, role-based specification critical to platform integrity and growth.

## 2. Product Registration & Lifecycle
### 2.1 Product Creation
- WHEN a seller initiates product registration, THE system SHALL present required business fields, including: product name, description, base price, availability status, SKU code, option configuration, images, categories/tags, seller ID, shipping information, and compliance markers.
- THE system SHALL validate that all mandatory fields are provided before product registration is accepted.
- IF a seller attempts to register a product with missing or invalid information, THEN THE system SHALL reject the registration and return a detailed error specifying the missing or invalid fields.
- WHERE an admin creates a product on behalf of a seller, THE system SHALL require explicit role authorization and audit the creation event.
- THE system SHALL assign a unique product identifier and track the creator, timestamp, and version of each product entry.
- THE system SHALL support multi-language and multi-channel product registration to allow international sales and cross-channel publishing.

### 2.2 Product Updates & Revision
- WHEN a seller or admin submits product updates, THE system SHALL validate all changed fields against current business rules and maintain record of prior versions for audit.
- IF an update attempts to alter immutable fields (e.g., product ID), THEN THE system SHALL reject the update and log the attempt as a validation error.
- THE system SHALL maintain a full revision history (snapshots) of product data for traceability, with access permissions based on role.
- WHEN a product is updated, THE system SHALL trigger re-indexing for AI search and notify impacted business units (e.g., inventory, channel managers).

### 2.3 Product Activation, Deactivation, and Deletion
- Sellers can activate/deactivate their own products. Admins can do so for any product.
- WHEN a product is deactivated, THE system SHALL immediately hide it from customer-facing interfaces and mark its state as inactive.
- IF a product tied to active orders is deleted or deactivated, THEN THE system SHALL block the operation and explain the order dependency.
- THE system SHALL allow soft deletion (logical removal) â€“ physical data is preserved for compliance and analysis unless legal removal is ordered by admin with proper evidence.

### 2.4 Product Suspension & Compliance Locking
- WHERE a product is in breach of compliance or reported, THE system SHALL enable admins to suspend listing and tag the case for further review.
- IF a product is locked for investigation, THEN THE system SHALL prohibit all modifications except by authorized compliance roles.

## 3. Option & Inventory Management
### 3.1 Product Options
- Sellers can create products with variable options (e.g., color, size, bundle configurations).
- WHEN a seller configures product options, THE system SHALL support nested options, dependent selections, and distinct SKU assignment per option.
- THE system SHALL enforce that every valid product variant has a unique SKU, and that SKUs comply with marketplace conventions.
- IF a seller defines overlapping or conflicting SKUs, THEN THE system SHALL block the configuration and provide a resolution guide.

### 3.2 Inventory and Stock Logic
- THE system SHALL allow sellers to set and update inventory levels (stock quantities) per option, with threshold-based alerts for low or out-of-stock states.
- WHEN a product or option is set out of stock, THE system SHALL prevent new orders and display a configurable out-of-stock message to customers.
- Inventory updates must be atomic and reflect immediately across all customer and admin interfaces.
- IF the same SKU is updated concurrently by multiple processes, THEN THE system SHALL detect the conflict and require manual resolution by sellers or admins.
- THE system SHALL maintain inventory change logs, showing the adjusting role (seller, admin) and timestamps.

### 3.3 Inventory Reservation, Adjustment, and Reconciliation
- WHEN a customer places an order, THE system SHALL reserve (deduct) inventory for all corresponding SKUs and options at order time.
- IF payment or order completion fails, THEN THE system SHALL release previously reserved inventory without delay.
- THE system SHALL support manual and scheduled reconciliation processes to ensure stock consistency across all sales channels.

## 4. Category & Tag Systems
### 4.1 Category Management
- Admins manage master category structures. Sellers can request sub-categories or tag products within allowed categories.
- WHEN a category is added, changed, or removed, THE system SHALL validate structural integrity, uniqueness, and block removal of non-empty categories (categories with live products or children).
- THE system SHALL allow nesting and depth limitation of categories configurable by admin business rules.
- WHERE cross-channel consistency is required, THE system SHALL synchronize category structures and mapping tables between channels.

### 4.2 Tagging and Classification
- Sellers, with optional admin review, can tag products for marketing, AI search, event campaigns, or overlays.
- THE system SHALL enforce restrictions on reserved tags, prohibited keywords, or redundant labels across the marketplace.
- IF a tag is blacklisted or banned, THEN THE system SHALL reject tag application and notify the assigning role with reasoning.

## 5. Content/SEO Management
### 5.1 Product Content & Rich Media
- Sellers must provide structured product content (names, descriptions, features) and media (images, videos, attachments) in compliance with quality guidelines.
- THE system SHALL validate image dimensions, format, media count limits, and non-duplication before acceptance.
- THE system SHALL support auto-generation or AI suggestion for content fields (e.g., SEO titles, search keywords) where configured.

### 5.2 SEO Metadata & AI Search Fields
- THE system SHALL enable sellers and admins to specify or review SEO-relevant metadata for each product, including meta title, description, open graph tags, and AI-search contexts.
- WHEN SEO data is missing or suboptimal, THE system SHALL flag products and offer recommendations for improvement.
- IF a product is flagged for low-quality or duplicate SEO, THEN THE system SHALL restrict its eligibility for search campaigns or ad boosts until resolved.

## 6. Snapshot & Change Tracking
- THE system SHALL log every change to product, option, category, and content data including actor (role), fields changed, before/after values, and timestamp.
- Snapshots must be accessible with proper authorization for auditing, conflict resolution, and regulatory review.
- WHEN requested, THE system SHALL export historical product/category data for specific time ranges in standard formats (e.g., CSV, JSON).

## 7. Business Rules & Validation
- All product, option, category, tag, and content management must honor business validation logic defined in the [Business Rules and Validation Document](./12-business-rules-and-validation.md).
- THE system SHALL enforce role-based access controls â€“ only authorized roles may perform creation, update, deactivation, promotion, or removal actions as enumerated in [User Roles and Authentication](./03-user-roles-and-authentication.md).
- Validation rules include, but are not limited to: field format checks, uniqueness, mandatory status, prohibited value lists, compliance with product policy, and logical consistency (e.g., non-negative inventory, valid category path).
- All validation errors must be actionable and user-facing, indicating rectification steps where possible.

## 8. Error Handling and Recovery Scenarios
- IF a requested product, option, or category is not found, THEN THE system SHALL display a clear not-found error and log the lookup failure context.
- IF a business rule failure or validation error occurs, THEN THE system SHALL block the operation, return the specific error code, and explain corrective steps in natural language.
- IF concurrent modification or synchronization errors arise, THEN THE system SHALL detect conflict, halt non-idempotent actions, and require user choice to override or abort.
- Manual recovery flows must be defined for unrecoverable or ambiguous product states.

## 9. Performance and User Experience Constraints
- WHEN listing products, categories, or inventory status, THE system SHALL respond within 2 seconds for standard result sets (â‰¤100 items) under normal load.
- WHEN product data is updated, THE system SHALL propagate changes to all relevant modules and channels within 10 seconds.
- THE system SHALL provide instant, consistent inventory status for any product option visible to customers.
- THE system SHALL allow bulk uploads/edits and handle files up to 100MB with progress tracking and error recovery.

## 10. Relationships with Other Documents
- For detailed user flows and error scenarios, refer to the [User Scenarios and Flows Document](./04-user-scenarios-and-flows.md).
- For comprehensive business validation logic, see [Business Rules and Validation Document](./12-business-rules-and-validation.md).

---

  subgraph "Product Registration"
    A["Seller/Admin Initiates Product Creation"]
    B["Input Validation & Image Upload"]
    C{"Validation Success?"}
    D["Product Registered & ID Issued"]
    E["Validation Error: Block & Respond"]
  end
  
  subgraph "Option & Inventory"
    F["Configure Product Options/SKUs"]
    G["Set Inventory per Option"]
    H["Atomic Inventory Update"]
  end

  subgraph "Category & Tag Ops"
    I["Admin/Seller Manages Category/Tags"]

    L["Block: Compliance/Error"]
  end

  A --> B
  B --> C

  C -->|"No"| E
  D --> F
  F --> G
  G --> H
  D --> I
  I --> J
  J -->|"Yes"| K
  J -->|"No"| L
```
