# Inquiry, Review, and Bulletin Management Requirement Specification

## 1. Post, Inquiry & Review Management
### 1.1 Overview
Posting, inquiry, and review management in shoppingMall enables customers, sellers, and admins to engage in transparent questions, feedback, and shared knowledge about products, services, and the broader community. The goal is to foster trust, augment purchase confidence, and prevent fraud or abuseâ€”while ensuring contributors are recognized, and negative actors quickly contained. Features are structured to comply with privacy, evidence, and moderation requirements.

### 1.2 Key Definitions
- **Inquiry (Q&A)**: Customer questions about products; sellers/admins provide answers.
- **Review**: Feedback, ratings, text, and media about a previously purchased product/order.
- **Bulletin Post**: Community postsâ€”announcements, topics of interest, policy updates; not tied to a single product.

## 1.3 Business Requirements (EARS)
### Inquiries (Q&A)
- WHEN a customer authenticates and views a product detail page, THE system SHALL display all public inquiries and answers, sorted newest first, and indicate unanswered questions separately.
- WHEN a customer posts a new inquiry, THE system SHALL validate input (length: 10-1000 chars, no prohibited expressions, references a valid/active product, one active inquiry per product per user) before accepting submission.
- IF an inquiry fails validation, THEN THE system SHALL provide an actionable error message, identifying the rule(s) violated and offering resubmission guidance.
- WHEN a seller receives a product inquiry, THE system SHALL generate a real-time notification and allow the seller or designated admin to post one formal answer.
- WHEN an inquiry is answered, THE system SHALL mark it as "answered"; WHERE it remains unanswered 72h, THE system SHALL alert admins and re-notify seller.
- IF a customer edits or deletes their inquiry, THEN THE system SHALL allow changes only within 24 hours and only if unanswered. All edits/deletions SHALL be logged with before/after snapshots accessible to admins.
- WHEN an admin, seller, or moderator reviews an inquiry, THE system SHALL allow evidence snapshot downloads (both original and modified states; timestamp, actor included).
- Performance: THE system SHALL respond to all inquiry requests in under 1 second for 95% of traffic, and under 2 seconds at peak loads.

### Reviews
- WHEN a customer completes a purchase (order status "delivered" or "completed"), THE system SHALL enable review for that purchased item (text: 10-2000 chars, 1-5 star rating, optionally up to 5 images/videos, single review per product per order).
- WHEN submitting a review, THE system SHALL validate content for prohibited expressions, duplicate reviews, rating scale, and file limits (max 10MB/file).
- IF a review is flagged for abuse, THEN THE system SHALL quarantine it from public display, notify moderators, and provide the customer with the status and appeal mechanism in <10 minutes.
- WHEN sellers or admins reply to a review, THE system SHALL allow one official response per review; original author is notified via their preferred channel and may not further edit the original review after this response.
- WHERE a customer edits or deletes their review, THE system SHALL permanently snapshot the prior version for admin dispute review.
- WHERE a review is flagged by >3 unrelated users or by AI moderation, THE system SHALL queue it for moderator review and withhold publication until resolved.
- Performance: THE system SHALL render reviews, responses, and related content within 1.5 seconds for 97% of requests.

### Bulletins
- WHERE an admin creates a bulletin post, THE system SHALL automatically pin the post atop bulletin listings and notify all authenticated users, unless a user has opted out of such communications in preferences.
- WHEN customers or sellers create bulletin posts (if enabled), THE system SHALL validate content using both keyword/AI checks and enforce guidelines for allowable topics; posts containing flagged content are held for moderator approval prior to publication.
- IF content is removed, THEN THE system SHALL provide a clear rationale and audit trail for the affected user(s), accessible via user dashboard.
- WHERE bulletins relate to legal or policy changes, THE system SHALL ensure users cannot dismiss/ignore the announcement until it is read.

#### Edge Cases and Exceptions
- IF product is de-listed or hidden, THEN THE system SHALL hide related inquiries and reviews from public search, but retain them for authorized audit.
- WHEN a user is placed in restricted or suspended status, THE system SHALL deny post/inquiry/review creation and display a status-specific message (see [User Roles and Authentication Requirements](./03-user-roles-and-authentication.md)).
- IF a review or inquiry is under legal hold (court order, dispute), THEN THE system SHALL lock edits/deletions and retain all versions until formal resolution.

### Workflow Examples
```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "Customer Inquiry Submission"
    A["View Product Page"] --> B["Click 'Ask a Question'"]
    B --> C["Write Question & Submit"]
    C --> D{"Passes Validation?"}
  end
  D -->|"Yes"| E["Inquiry Saved & Seller Notified"]
  D -->|"No"| F["Show Validation Error Message"]
  E --> G["Seller Posts Answer"]
  G --> H["Inquiry marked as Answered"]
  H --> I["Visible to All Customers"]
  F --> J["Allow Edit/Retry"]
```

## 2. Comment and Reply Handling
### 2.1 Overview
All users (customer, seller, admin) may comment on inquiries, reviews, or bulletins they are authorized to view; replies are fully threaded, and top-level comments may anchor discussions.

### 2.2 Functional Requirements (EARS)
- WHEN a user submits a comment or reply, THE system SHALL check length (1-500 chars), spam/profanity, and enforce one comment per minute per thread per user (burst up to 5/minute system-wide).
- WHERE a comment or reply is flagged by more than 3 unique users or by AI moderation within 24h, THE system SHALL temporarily hide it pending moderator decision.
- IF a comment or reply is deleted, THEN THE system SHALL retain a snapshot for 30 days for admin review, and indicate to remaining users that a reply has been removed.
- WHEN a thread exceeds 50 items, THE system SHALL archive the oldest comments but provide an option to "view more" or load history.
- Performance: THE system SHALL respond to comment/reply actions within 1 second for 98% of user requests.

### 2.3 Edge Cases
- IF a parent post is removed for abuse, all child comments are hidden but retained for compliance.
- IF an admin closes a thread (e.g., after dispute), THE system SHALL block further comments and indicate closure reason.

## 3. Moderation & Evidence Snapshots
### 3.1 Multi-tier Moderation
Moderation occurs at three levels:
- **Automated (AI/rule-based) first pass**
- **Seller/admin review (for their products or categories)**
- **Full admin/judicial intervention (appeals, escalations, legal holds)**

### 3.2 Business Requirements (EARS)
- WHEN any community content (inquiry, review, comment, bulletin) is submitted, THE system SHALL screen via AI for offensive, abusive, or fraudulent content, flagging items as needed for rapid evaluation.
- WHEN flagged content meets escalation criteria, THE system SHALL quarantine it, notify affected actors, and restrict further visibility except to reviewers.
- WHEN a moderator reviews flagged content, THE system SHALL present a timeline of all edits, flags, moderation actions, and evidence snapshots; every moderation decision (accept, remove, escalate) SHALL be logged with reason, reviewer, and timestamp.
- IF an item is flagged for legal hold by court or compliance, THEN THE system SHALL override normal retention and preservation limits and prevent action until release.
- WHEN moderation action is taken, THE system SHALL notify all affected users, log actions, and update visibility in <5 minutes.
- Performance: THE system SHALL process each moderation queue item within 10 seconds; audit trail for every content event must be queryable by admins and legal as required.

### 3.3 Evidence and Audit Snapshots
- THE system SHALL retain detailed audit trails for all content modifications, deletions, and flagged actions; these trails are accessible by admins and subject to right of erasure (see [Security, Compliance & Data Privacy Requirements](./13-security-compliance-and-data-privacy.md)).
- WHEN any evidence snapshot is downloaded, THE system SHALL log the request with metadata (actor, timestamp, purpose).
- WHERE a dispute or formal review is underway, THE system SHALL keep all evidence snapshots immutable until closure and record any access or download events.

### 3.4 Example: Moderation Process
```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "Moderation Flow"
    A["User Content Submitted"] --> B["AI Rule-Check"]
    B --> C{"Flagged as Problematic?"}
    C -->|"No"| D["Published Immediately"]
    C -->|"Yes"| E["Quarantine & Notify Moderators"]
    E --> F["Moderator Reviews Timeline & Snapshots"]
    F --> G{"Action Taken?"}
    G -->|"Approve"| D
    G -->|"Remove"| H["Content Blocked; User Notified"]
    G -->|"Escalate"| I["Legal/Admin Review"]
  end
```

## 4. Community Engagement Rules
### 4.1 Participation Requirements
All continued participation in posting/review/discussion is governed by:
- Minimum account age (24h from registration for new users)
- No duplicate inquiries, reviews, or bulletins per topic/product/order
- Single review per product/order
- Posting restricts for flagged or suspended users (dynamic updates)
- Automated and admin-moderated recognition of quality contributions (badges, featured placement, periodic rewards for engagement/positive impact)
- Transparent, actionable communication of all rule enforcement or status changes

### 4.2 EARS Engagement Requirements
- WHEN any user attempts to post content, THE system SHALL check minimum account age and posting rights; IF not satisfied, THEN block with reason.
- WHEN duplicate content is detected, THE system SHALL reject submission and provide recourse instructions.
- WHEN a user's content is repeatedly marked as abusive (>3 times in 3 separate threads in 72h), THE system SHALL suspend posting privileges for 72h and notify the user with appeal options.
- WHERE repeated violations occur from a seller or from customers under business review, THE system SHALL escalate to admin for longer suspension or permanent ban.
- WHEN positive contributions (as identified by admin, moderator, or AI) accrue, THE system SHALL reward the user and/or surface their posts (featured, badge, leaderboard, community announcements, etc.).
- Performance: THE system SHALL maintain all community engagement features at 99.95%+ uptime and ensure interaction latency does not exceed 2 seconds for any typical operation.

### 4.3 Example: Recognition and Restriction
```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "Contribution Feedback"
    A["User Posts or Replies"] --> B["Community, AI, Admin Evaluate"]
    B --> C{"Positive?"}
    C -->|"Yes"| D["Add Badge, Feature Post"]
    C -->|"No"| E{"Violates Community?"}
    E -->|"Yes"| F["Suspend or Escalate User"]
    E -->|"No"| G["No Action"]
  end
```

## 5. Role-Based Permission Matrix
| Action                                    | Customer | Seller | Admin |
|-------------------------------------------|----------|--------|-------|
| Submit product inquiry                    | âœ…       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Answer product inquiry                    | âŒ       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Post review (purchased product only)      | âœ…       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Respond to review                         | âŒ       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Create bulletin post                      | âœ…       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Moderate content (approve, block)         | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Feature/Hide community content            | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Download evidence snapshots               | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Flag/report community content             | âœ…       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Access flagged or hidden content          | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| View moderation/audit logs                | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Appeal moderation decisions               | âœ…       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Access historical content on legal hold   | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Be suspended or restricted                | âœ…       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Participate if under suspension           | âŒ       | âŒ     | âŒ    |
| Be rewarded/featured                      | âœ…       | âœ…     | âœ…    |

## 6. Error Handling and Performance
- IF any posting, review, or moderation action is invalidated (e.g., submitting while suspended, duplicate, or against policy), THEN THE system SHALL return a detailed, actionable error, citing rule violated, with clear recovery steps.
- WHEN data or evidence access fails (system error/unavailable/legal block), THE system SHALL display a descriptive failure message, log for admin review, and attempt auto-recovery where feasible in <2 seconds.
- WHEN network or storage conditions degrade, THE system SHALL queue actions for retry and provide status.
- Performance and latency metrics for all endpoints SHALL be logged and available for admin review to ensure SLA compliance.

## 7. AI, Analytics, and Transparency
- THE system SHALL offer dashboards to admins and sellers summarizing workload, content backlog, moderation outcomes, flagged/featured contributions, and community engagement trendsâ€”updated daily.
- WHEN suspected AI-generated or manipulated content is encountered, THE system SHALL mark/annotate for full transparency and generate a dedicated AI review flag; if thresholds are crossed, escalate to admin.
- WHERE anonymized, aggregate analytics are used, THE system SHALL provide opt-out (where required by policy) and follow data governance guidelines per [Security, Compliance & Data Privacy Requirements](./13-security-compliance-and-data-privacy.md).

## 8. Compliance, Data Integrity, and Related Policies
- THE system SHALL align all retention, privacy, and evidence policies with [Security, Compliance & Data Privacy Requirements](./13-security-compliance-and-data-privacy.md), including right of erasure, legal hold, and audit retention periods.
- All cross-referenced content access and data downloads SHALL be logged per security requirements.
- All audit and evidence requirements apply equally to routine, escalated, or legal case handling.

## 9. Illustrative User Scenarios
### Scenario 1: Customer Posts Inquiry
- Customer browses to product page, clicks â€œAsk a Questionâ€, submits inquiry. System validates input and, if approved, posts inquiry and notifies seller.
- Seller answers in dashboard, marking question resolved. System notifies customer and displays answer under product.
- If no answer after 72 hours, system escalates to admin for review or follow-up.

### Scenario 2: Review Moderation Edge Case
- After a customer posts a review, it receives several abuse flags. AI detects potentially manipulated language and holds review for moderator check.
- Moderator reviews audit log, sees similar abuse in other reviews from same user, and chooses to suspend account for 72 hours, preserving all evidence snapshots.
- If the review was accurate and abuse flags unfounded, moderator can restore visibility, and system notifies all involved parties of the outcome.

### Scenario 3: Bulletin Legal/Policy Update
- Admin posts a critical legal update via bulletin. System automatically pins post, requires users to acknowledge, and logs all acknowledgments for compliance.
- Users attempting to bypass notification are prevented until acknowledgment is confirmed.

## 10. Integration and Linked Policies
- See [User Roles and Authentication Requirements](./03-user-roles-and-authentication.md) for detailed ban/restriction flows.
- Enforcement, evidence, and data handling are further defined in [Security, Compliance & Data Privacy Requirements](./13-security-compliance-and-data-privacy.md) and [Business Rules and Validation Requirements](./12-business-rules-and-validation.md).

What are the main steps and failure modes?
files.content:
# 1. Introduction
A comprehensive specification for cart and order processing within the shoppingMall service, detailing all business flows, rules, role logic, exception handling, and validation requirements required for immediate backend implementation.

# 2. Cart Functionality & Templates

## 2.1 Core Cart Features
- WHEN a customer with a valid authenticated session accesses the service via any supported channel, THE shoppingMall SHALL initialize or recall a persistent cart associated with the customerâ€™s account.
- WHEN a non-authenticated customer accesses the service, THE shoppingMall SHALL provide a temporary, session-bound cart, with the ability to merge or migrate the session cart upon future authentication.
- THE shoppingMall SHALL support the creation, update (increase/decrease quantity, change product options/SKUs), and removal of products within the cart by the customer, subject to validation of product existence, SKU/option availability, customer eligibility, and permitted maximum quantity (default: min 1, max per business policy).
- WHERE cross-channel shopping is enabled (e.g., web and mobile apps), THE shoppingMall SHALL maintain separate cart contexts per channel, preventing item leakage but permitting explicit cross-channel cart aggregation upon customer request.
- WHEN a customer performs a bulk operation (multi-add, multi-update, or multi-remove), THE shoppingMall SHALL validate each operation atomically and return per-item success/failure, never permitting partial success within a single business operation.

## 2.2 Cart Item Business Rules
- WHEN a product is added to the cart, THE shoppingMall SHALL save a snapshot of product metadata (name, base price, discounts, applied coupons, available options/SKUs, seller info) current at the time of addition for order audit and recovery.
- WHERE any product in the cart subsequently becomes unavailable (e.g., out of stock, delisted, or seller store paused), THE shoppingMall SHALL automatically mark that item as invalid, preventing any attempted order on the invalid item and indicating the reason in cart retrieval responses.
- IF pricing, discounts, or eligibility change between the time of cart addition and checkout, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL highlight changes and require explicit customer confirmation before order can proceed.
- THE cart summary as presented to the user SHALL always include calculation of active promotions, shipping costs, applicable coupons, and expected delivery timeframes, using real-time business logic.
- WHEN seller or admin updates a product, option, or inventory, THE shoppingMall SHALL synchronize changes to all active carts containing affected items within 10 seconds and provide reconciliation upon next cart view or submit.

## 2.3 Edge Cases
- IF maximum distinct cart items or per-item/max total quantity is exceeded (business configurable), THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL deny the operation and issue a business error with actionable feedback, including current limit values and suggestions.
- WHEN a product option is deprecated or removed, or a seller store is closed while a cart contains affected items, THE shoppingMall SHALL mark those cart items as invalid, block their checkout, and recommend removing or replacing the offending items.
- THE shoppingMall SHALL persist abandoned carts for authenticated customers for at least 30 days, and present recovery or reminder prompts when customers return.
- IF a customer or seller attempts to manipulate the cart by programmatic means (automation abuse, bot patterns), THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL log the event, restrict further operations, and notify the security/admin team as defined in platform security policies.

# 3. Order Application & Fulfillment

## 3.1 Cart-to-Order Process
- WHEN a customer triggers the checkout process, THE shoppingMall SHALL execute a complete, synchronous validation of all cart contents, including real-time stock availability, current pricing, discount/coupon eligibility, shipping address/option validation, and customer authentication.
- IF any item or business rule fails during validation, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL block order initiation, itemize the reasons per item, and offer customer the option to retry or modify cart contents before proceeding.
- WHERE platform policy or customer intent does not require full-cart checkout, THE shoppingMall SHALL allow partial checkout flow, enabling selection of a subset of valid cart items for order placement.
- AFTER customer confirmation, THE shoppingMall SHALL lock all cart items participating in the order for a defined business time window (e.g., payment window expiry), atomically initiate order record creation, and deduct inventory on success.
- THE shoppingMall SHALL prevent cart and order tampering during checkout by authenticating all submissions and maintaining per-operation audit trails.

## 3.2 Order Creation
- WHEN an order is committed, THE shoppingMall SHALL persist a business record with order ID, item snapshots (metadata at order time), user and seller info, originating channel, all applied discounts/coupons, shipping/delivery info, payment method/status, and system-calculated delivery estimate.
- WHERE a single cart checkout includes items from multiple sellers, THE shoppingMall SHALL atomically split and create one sub-order per seller, each with its own fulfillment and status tracking, but grouped under a master order ID.
- THE shoppingMall SHALL log every attempted, failed, and finalized order transaction with full business and actor context, enabling traceable, immutable order provenance.

## 3.3 Fulfillment Workflow
- WHEN order record creation succeeds, THE shoppingMall SHALL immediately transition to payment or reservation (if pre-payment, reservation, or cash-on-delivery flows), and initiate fulfillment.
- AFTER payment clearance or reservation, order status SHALL advance to "payment confirmed", triggering the downstream fulfillment; seller receives prompt notification to begin processing (packing, shipping, etc.).
- THE shoppingMall SHALL provide synchronized, near real-time status updates (â‰¤5 seconds) for all major transitions to customers (order status page, notification), sellers (dashboard/alerts), and admins (audit logs).
- WHEN external fulfillment milestones (e.g., courier pick-up, shipment tracking updates) are reported, THE shoppingMall SHALL update the relevant order status, recalculate estimated delivery times, and notify stakeholders within 10 seconds.

# 4. Payment Method Support

## 4.1 Supported Methods
- THE shoppingMall SHALL support the following payment instruments and flows for order completion: credit/debit card, virtual account (bank transfer), e-wallet, direct bank transfer, cash on delivery, and platform credits (coupons, mileage/reward points, deposit balances).
- WHEN a selected payment method is not available for specific user, order value, item, or region (per business rules), THE shoppingMall SHALL reject the payment attempt and present an explicit reason and substitute options to the user.
- WHERE business policy allows, THE shoppingMall SHALL support split/combined payment flows (e.g., combining coupons, mileage, and card), and hybrid payment forms in a single order.
- THE shoppingMall SHALL validate all payment initiations, including anti-fraud controls, method eligibility, and value normalization, prior to external processor forwarding.
- WHEN engaging external payment services, THE shoppingMall SHALL synchronize order/payment status with external processor responses in real time, including retries and asynch notifications, and mark orders as "payment pending/failed/confirmed" accordingly.
- WHEN payment is fully confirmed, all transactional and user-facing states SHALL reflect the paid status atomically and immediately; partial payments SHALL trigger a distinct partial/hold status.

## 4.2 Payment Exception Handling
- IF payment gateway or network fails during initiation or confirmation, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL present actionable error messages, allow payment retrial or method switching, and preserve all intermediate business state in audit logs.
- WHERE payment status is ambiguous (e.g., confirmation lag, reconciliation delay, processor error), THE shoppingMall SHALL place the order in a "pending" state, notify the admin/seller for manual intervention if the issue is unresolved for more than a configurable threshold (default: 15 minutes), and inform the customer of the expected resolution process.
- IF payment is subsequently revealed as invalid (e.g., suspected fraud, unauthorized chargeback), THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL change order status to "on hold" or "under dispute", restrict further fulfillment or payment-related flows, and escalate to admin resolution.
- WHEN payment is corrected after an initial failure, THE shoppingMall SHALL automatically resume the correct order state and notify all affected parties.

# 5. Order Lifecycle & Status Transitions

## 5.1 Primary Order States
- Cart (open/unsubmitted)
- Pending Payment
- Payment Confirmed
- Preparing for Shipment
- Shipped/In Transit
- Delivered
- Completed (user confirmed receipt or elapsed timeline)
- Cancelled (with reason; customer, seller, or admin-initiated)
- Returned/Refunded/Partial Fulfillment
- On Hold/Disputed
- Partially Paid/Partially Fulfilled (if supported)

## 5.2 State Transitions
- WHEN a business process attempts a state transition not authorized by workflow rules (e.g., shipment before payment), THE shoppingMall SHALL block the transition and log the violation attempt with actor and reason.
- WHEN an external confirmation or business event (e.g., payment receipt, courier scan, return receipt) occurs, THE shoppingMall SHALL advance state only on verified event and update all linked business and audit objects.
- WHERE a transaction is manually (admin) overridden, THE shoppingMall SHALL require justification and create a full change audit trail.
- WHEN time-based or business-based auto-transitions should occur (e.g., auto-cancel after payment window, auto-complete after delivery elapsed), THE shoppingMall SHALL execute and log the auto-action and notify all affected roles.

## 5.3 Role-based Actions
- Customers: Place orders, cancel pending orders (within policy timeframes/status), request returns/refunds, track order status at all stages, confirm final receipt, and communicate directly with sellers on order issues.
- Sellers: Accept/acknowledge new orders, prepare packages, mark as shipped (with fulfillment details), handle returns/exceptions, update delivery status, provide communication threads for order-related issues.
- Admins: View, override, intervene, or audit any order/business state, forcibly change order/payment/fulfillment status for compliance or fraud, access all audit logs, unlock held/disputed orders after due process.
- WHERE a seller is also a customer (dual role), both permissions and responsibilities of each SHALL apply per business context.

# 6. Error, Exception & Partial Fulfillment Scenarios

## 6.1 Standard Error Handling
- IF a system-level, integration, or process error occurs during checkout or payment, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL roll back all partial business actions, retain an immutable audit snapshot, and instantly present a clear, actionable error to the customer, including recovery paths such as retry, contact support, or alternative methods.
- WHEN only part of an order can be fulfilled (e.g., some items unavailable post-payment), THE shoppingMall SHALL detect the condition before fulfillment, allow the customer a choice of splitting shipping, await all, or cancel/refund, and ensure the business action is documented.
- THE shoppingMall SHALL automate error notifications to all parties (customer, seller, admin) via their preferred channels within 10 seconds of detection.

## 6.2 Edge Cases
- IF seller inventory is depleted after order confirmation, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL offer refund, product exchange, or delayed shipping options to the customer as per configurable policy and document the customerâ€™s selected resolution.
- IF a payment or delivered product enters dispute (chargebacks, customer claim, external fraud report), THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL transition the order to "on hold/disputed", halt further fulfillment, restrict subsequent related operations, and alert admin for manual review.
- WHEN legal or compliance factors (e.g., embargo, legal order) require stopping fulfillment, THE shoppingMall SHALL lock the order and archive all associated evidence for regulatory access.

# 7. Business Rules, Validation & Performance Requirements

## 7.1 Input and Validation
- THE shoppingMall SHALL validate all user-supplied data (cart changes, order entry, payment details) for type, existence, format, value ranges, cross-field dependencies, and per-role eligibility before any state change is committed to business records.
- WHEN possible, all cart/order updates SHALL be atomic and transactional, ensuring data consistency with no partial or lost updates, and logged by actor, timestamp, and context.
- WHEN address or delivery data is provided, THE shoppingMall SHALL validate for geographic, regulatory, and delivery eligibility in real time before order can proceed.

## 7.2 System Constraints
- Maximum cart items per user/channel: business-configurable (default 100).
- Maximum order value per transaction: business-configurable (e.g., $10,000); orders above threshold SHALL be denied with clear rationale and escalation path.
- Payment windows for order completion: default 30 minutes from initiation; THE shoppingMall SHALL cancel unpaid orders automatically upon window expiry and notify all involved parties with recovery next-steps.
- Returns/cancellation eligibility: customers may initiate within configured business rules (e.g., before shipment, within 7 days of delivery); THE shoppingMall SHALL enforce timing, payment, and order state rules.
- Minimum and maximum quantity per item: per product and business policy, checked at every cart/add and checkout validation.
- Cart abandonment: carts persisted for a minimum (30 days for authenticated customers), session-length for non-authenticated users.

## 7.3 Error Messaging & Communication
- THE shoppingMall SHALL generate all customer- and seller-facing errors in clear, actionable language, specifying error code, cause, and recovery; all such events SHALL be traceable in support and admin logs.
- System and admin errors SHALL be assigned unique trace codes linked to audit records; errors impacting a financial or regulatory commitment SHALL be escalated per business escalation protocol.

## 7.4 Performance Expectations
- WHEN a customer adds, removes, or updates cart items, THE shoppingMall SHALL respond within 1 second for 99% of requests under normal system load.
- WHEN a customer initiates checkout, THE shoppingMall SHALL validate cart and offer a full summary screen in â‰¤2 seconds for up to 50 items; bulk or high-value orders SHALL scale accordingly with user notification if additional time is required.
- WHEN an order is created and payment confirmed, THE updated status SHALL propagate to all affected parties within 5 seconds.
- Under load, the shoppingMall SHALL maintain atomicity and consistency, never resulting in partial orders, orphaned items, or lost payments.
- Bulk/batch cart and checkout operations (â‰¥20 items at once) SHALL preserve full business rollback and per-item feedback within 5 seconds for typical usage.

# 8. Diagrams & Visual Workflow

## 8.1 Cart-to-Order Flow

```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "Cart Session"
    A["Customer Browses Products"] --> B["Add to Cart"]
    B --> C["Cart Validation(SKU/Price/Stock)"]
    C --> D["Modify/Remove Items"]
    D --> E["Initiate Checkout"]
  end

  subgraph "Order Creation"
    E --> F["Confirm Cart & Delivery Details"]
    F --> G{"All Valid?"}
    G -->|"Yes"| H["Order Record Created"]
    G -->|"No"| I["Abort & Inform User"]
    H --> J["Payment Initiation"]
    J --> K{"Payment Succeeds?"}
    K -->|"Yes"| L["Advance to Fulfillment"]
    K -->|"No"| I
  end

  subgraph "Fulfillment & Completion"
    L --> M["Packing/Shipping"]
    M --> N["Delivery Confirmation"]
    N --> O["Order Completed"]
  end
```

## 8.2 Order Status State Machine

```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
  ["Pending Payment"] --> ["Payment Confirmed"]
  ["Payment Confirmed"] --> ["Preparing Shipment"]
  ["Preparing Shipment"] --> ["Shipped"]
  ["Shipped"] --> ["Delivered"]
  ["Delivered"] --> ["Completed"]
  ["Pending Payment"] --> ["Cancelled"]
  ["Payment Confirmed"] --> ["Cancelled"]
  ["Preparing Shipment"] --> ["Cancelled"]
  ["Shipped"] --> ["Returned"]
  ["Delivered"] --> ["Returned"]
  ["Returned"] --> ["Refunded"]
  ["*"] --> ["On Hold"]
  ["On Hold"] --> ["Pending Payment"]
  ["On Hold"] --> ["Cancelled"]
```

# 9. Conclusion
All requirements and flows specified herein are presented in business-focused, unambiguous language, using EARS format for expressivity and testability. Full coverage of user, seller, and admin scenarios, along with edge cases and performance tolerances, enables shoppingMall backend developers to implement robust, scalable, and user-friendly cart and order processing functionalities. Technical implementation (code, schema, API) is at developer discretion; only business rules and requirements are prescribed herein.

files.content:
# Introduction and Scope
This requirements document addresses all business rules and scenarios for promotional discounts, coupon management, deposit payment options, and mileage/loyalty programs for the shoppingMall backend. It defines how each system is created, how eligibility is validated, how redemption/usage is tracked, and the rules for expiry, stacking, and reporting. Actionable requirements in EARS format are provided, specifying role-based permissions for customers, sellers, and admins, and ensuring the system delivers a robust, traceable, and user-focused loyalty and benefits experience.

# Overview of Discounts, Coupons, and Loyalty Features
The shoppingMall backend supports multiple forms of promotional and loyalty benefits:
- Coupon codes and discount vouchers issued to specific users or to cohorts via strictly defined business events and triggers
- Application of coupons during all cart and order flows, subject to explicit eligibility, usage ceilings, and combinability rules
- Deposit (prepaid balance) payment methods, supporting both platform and 3rd-party top-ups, traceable transaction ledgers, and robust security controls
- Mileage and loyalty point accrual and redemption, covering direct reward, promotional multipliers, proportional deduction, expiry and compliance-driven adjustment

System processes must guarantee atomicity, full auditability, user feedback, and support for business-driven promotional strategies, edge case handling, and compliance reporting, without ever exposing technical implementation detail.

# Coupon Types & Issuance
## Types of Coupons Supported
THE system SHALL enable, at a minimum, all of the following coupon types:
| Coupon Type                 | Description                                                   |
|----------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------|
| Order Amount Discount       | Discount applied to total order amount, either fixed or percent|
| Product-specific Coupon     | Applies only to designated products or categories             |
| Seller-issued Coupon        | Issued exclusively by sellers, redeemable only for seller's items|
| Platform (Admin) Coupon     | Created/administered by platform for use across all sellers   |
| First-purchase Coupon       | Eligible for new customers on first completed order           |
| Birthday/Anniversary Coupon | Issued on special user-defined dates (e.g., birthday, signup) |
| Free Shipping Coupon        | Waives all or part of delivery fee, scoped by business rule   |
| Flash/Event Coupon          | Issued for time-limited or quantity-limited campaigns         |

## Coupon Creation, Distribution, and Tracking
- WHEN a seller or admin initiates coupon creation, THE system SHALL validate coupon attributes: discount value (absolute/percentage, min/max boundaries), type, applicable products or categories, usage window (start/end), usage quota (per user/total), combinability, and intended recipient(s).
- WHEN a coupon is issued, THE system SHALL assign a globally unique code or identifier, store all conditions, track per-assignment entitlement, and log full history with timestamp, actor, and distribution channel.
- WHERE bulk coupon issuance is requested, THE system SHALL generate all coupons atomically, ensure no duplication, and create a persistent issuance audit record.
- WHEN a user (customer/seller/admin) is assigned a coupon, THE system SHALL notify them via their preferred channel (mobile app, email, SMS, etc.) within 1 minute, with business event source stored.
- WHERE coupons are revoked prior to use (manual or automated revocation), THE system SHALL block future use, update the user benefit entitlement list, remove from all redemption interfaces, and deliver instant notification.

# Application Conditions & Restrictions
## Eligibility, Application, and Usage Rules
- WHEN a user attempts to redeem any coupon during checkout, THE system SHALL enforce and validate:
  - Role and account status (role/group eligibility check)
  - Coupon validity window (current datetime >= issue and <= expiry)
  - Global and per-user usage limits (not exhausted overall or individually)
  - Applicability to the products, categories, order value, sales channel, and business context of the purchase
  - Any further business-defined prerequisites (e.g., min. spend, region, channel restrictions)
- WHERE a coupon is single-use, THE system SHALL permanently retire it for both the user and the code after one redemption
- WHERE coupon minimum spend or eligibility requirements are not met, THE system SHALL block redemption and return a code-value explanation (e.g., COUPON_MINSPEND_FAIL)
- WHERE multiple coupons are presented, THE system SHALL evaluate defined stackability (combinability) rules: which, if any, coupons may be jointly applied by order of business priority (e.g., seller + platform, or coupon stacks with mileage), and enforce exclusive/priority logic as defined by benefit parameters
- WHEN applying both seller-issued and platform coupons, THE system SHALL accept or reject concurrent usage precisely per configured business rules, and always log every application, rejection, and cause

## Error and Exception Handling
- IF a user applies a coupon that is expired, revoked, or not eligible, THEN THE system SHALL return clear error codes (COUPON_EXPIRED, COUPON_REVOKED, COUPON_INELIGIBLE) and prevent order submission
- IF redemption is attempted for a coupon or benefit outside the valid spend or product/channel scope, THEN THE system SHALL block application and provide a message describing the specific violation condition
- IF system or network error interrupts coupon application, THEN THE system SHALL roll back any provisional pricing, restore benefit entitlements, and log all failed attempts with context for audit
- IF a user triggers more than N consecutive failed redemption attempts (configurable default: 3 in 10 minutes), THEN THE system SHALL temporarily lock coupon use for 30 minutes, notify the user, and suggest customer support contact
- WHEN coupons are voided post-issuance due to fraud, system error, or compliance issue, THE system SHALL track all affected users/orders and block retroactively, ensuring non-blocking for unaffected entitlements

## User-facing Validation and Display
- WHEN a coupon is successfully applied, THE system SHALL update the UI in real-time to reflect pre- and post-discount amounts, identify the discount type, show code used, and expected remaining user entitlements for that coupon
- IF coupons applied are not combinable, THE system SHALL visibly disable the excluded coupons and show the business reason
- WHEN coupon application rules change (e.g., business policy updates), THE system SHALL enforce new rules only for coupons created after policy change, unless explicitly marked for retroactivity

# Deposit and Mileage Management
## Deposit (Prepaid Balance) Rules
- THE system SHALL enable customers and sellers to top up their deposit balance by multiple payment methods (cash wire, credit card, gift card redemption, 3rd-party voucher)
- WHEN a deposit is used for order payment, THE system SHALL deduct the exact amount atomically at order confirmation, with pricing, order ID, and traceable ledger entry persisted. THE system SHALL always confirm deduction or provide precise failure feedback within 1 second
- IF a deposit deduction fails at any step (due to concurrency, policy constraints, or system error), THEN THE system SHALL revert all debits, restore original balance, notify affected user(s) and admin, and log the full event for compliance review
- THE full deposit ledger (top-ups, payments, refunds, expiries, adjustments) SHALL be accessible via user dashboards and admin analytics, filterable by time, order, event, and status
- WHERE negative deposits (overdrawn balance) are not permitted, THE system SHALL block orders that would drive negative balance and return exact shortfall amount needed

## Mileage/Loyalty Point Accrual and Redemption
- WHEN a qualifying business event completes (order fulfillment without cancellation or return), THE system SHALL credit mileage/loyalty points to the user's balance based on order value, promotional multiplier, and current business rules (minimums, exclusions, campaign rates)
- WHERE sellers offer individual rewards (mileage boost, event-specific), THE system SHALL tag awarded points by origin for audit, reporting, and possible revocation in fraud/error cases
- WHEN a user returns order items, THE system SHALL proportionally deduct previously awarded mileage for refunded line items
- WHERE a point promotion (double points, limited time) applies, THE system SHALL apply multiplier only for orders confirmed during the promotional window, as determined by order timestamp
- WHERE both mileage and coupon are present at checkout, THE system SHALL strictly enforce business logic for stacking, exclusivity, and minimum thresholds, always displaying applied business rule outcome to the user

## Expiry, Deduction, Adjustment Logic
- THE system SHALL support per-point (FIFO), batch, or global expiry windows for mileage/loyalty and deposit balances, customizable by business administrator
- WHEN miles or deposits are within 30 days of expiry, THE system SHALL notify users by preferred channel at D-30 and D-7, including visual dashboard notices and push/email/SMS notifications as opted-in
- WHEN points/deposits expire, THE system SHALL synchronize updated balances across all interfaces within 5 seconds, log expiry event with actor (system), and retain event for reporting
- WHEN adjusting points/deposits for compliance, fraud, or error correction, THE system SHALL require admin authorization, produce a detailed correction audit, and instantly notify all affected users of cause, amount, and impact

# Redemption and Expiry Processes
## Coupon/Mileage/Deposit Expiry Assignment and User Notices
- WHEN coupons or benefits are created, THE system SHALL enforce rolling or fixed expiry as defined, store exact expiry, and expose all expiry dates to users in every interface and notification
- WHEN a benefit is within 7 days of expiry, THE system SHALL push at least two user alerts (at D-7 and D-1), including actionable links and information on how to redeem or avoid loss
- WHEN a benefit expires unused, THE system SHALL immediately mark as expired, revoke entitlement from the user, and log expiry event for legal and analytics purposes

## Redemption and Error/Recovery Flows
- WHEN benefit application (coupon, mileage, deposit) is successful during checkout, THE system SHALL lock applied benefit(s) atomically, display an itemized cost breakdown, and preserve a point-in-time snapshot of benefit usage in order history
- IF post-submission system or fulfillment error invalidates the order, THEN THE system SHALL roll back the redemption, restore all benefit balances, notify affected users, and record the full rollback chain in the audit trail
- WHEN redemption rules or eligibility are adjusted after benefit assignment but before use, THE system SHALL ensure all future redemptions follow the updated rules, and provide forced notice to all affected users if any entitlement is changed
- WHERE business rules for benefit stacking or exclusivity change, THE system SHALL guarantee runtime validation for all future redemptions and supply user-impact reports

## Audit and Reporting
- ALL benefit events (issuance, redemption, expiry, adjustment, error) SHALL be written to a tamper-evident audit trail, indexed by actor, benefit type, entity, user, and order, with full timestamp granularity (to millisecond if feasible)
- Admins SHALL be able to generate comprehensive benefit usage, error, and expiry reports by date, benefit category, user, seller, status, channel, and business event type
- System-generated analytics SHALL surface trends in benefit success/failure, average benefit uptake, and exception/fraud patterns, always linked unambiguously to business events

# Role-based Permissions and Access Matrix
## Permission Matrix
| Action                               | Customer | Seller | Admin |
|--------------------------------------|----------|--------|-------|
| Receive assigned coupons             | âœ…       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Redeem coupon at checkout            | âœ…       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Issue coupons (to customers)         | âŒ       | âœ…*    | âœ…    |
| Create/edit coupon templates         | âŒ       | âœ…*    | âœ…    |
| Adjust/revoke coupons post-issue     | âŒ       | âœ…*    | âœ…    |
| Issue/adjust mileage or deposits     | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Approve adjustments for fraud/errors | âŒ       | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| View audit/reports for own actions   | âœ…       | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| *Seller actions limited to own products; subject to compliance checks  |

## JWT Payload Structure for Entitled Benefits
- userId (string, required)
- role (enum: customer, seller, admin)
- entitlements: array (coupon/mileage/deposit objects: id, type, assigned_at, expires_at, status)
- permissions: array, as mapped per above table

Business rules for each role:
- Customers: may receive and redeem, but not issue/modify benefits; view audit of personal actions
- Sellers: may issue/adjust coupons for own products subject to compliance; may not control platform coupons or global rules
- Admins: may issue, adjust, or revoke any benefit; audit and report on all events; approve all compliance adjustments

# Performance and User Experience Expectations
- THE system SHALL process and reflect all benefit application, deduction, and refund transactions (deposit, mileage, coupon) and update UI within 2 seconds in 99% of typical cases; all state and entitlement synchronizations SHALL complete across channels within 5 seconds
- WHEN errors occur, all validation SHALL return actionable error codes/messages, including code, field, human-readable message, context, and recovery options suited to the business process
- BENEFIT notification events (coupon issued/expiring/expired, point adjustments, ledger updates) SHALL be delivered to the userâ€™s selected channel(s) within 2 minutes, with at least 2 redundant delivery attempts
- Bulk processes (mass coupon issuance, batch expiry, account-wide adjustment) SHALL NOT degrade user-facing benefit calculations or trigger timeouts for end-users during peak events
- System SLA: >99.95% uptime for all benefit eligibility, redemption, expiration flows

# Mermaid Diagram: Comprehensive Benefit Redemption and Error Flow
```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "Benefit Redemption & Error Handling"
    A["Checkout Start"] --> B["User Selects Coupon or Benefit"]
    B --> C{"Eligible/Valid Coupon?"}
    C -->|"Yes"| D["Apply Discount/Redemption"]
    D --> E["Commit Order and Lock Benefits"]
    E --> F["Success: Update Benefit Ledger"]
    C -->|"No"| G["Show Error Message (Reason)"]
    G --> H["Block/Retry/Explain"]
    E --> I{"System Error After Commit?"}
    I -->|"No"| J["Order & Benefit Confirmed"]
    I -->|"Yes"| K["Reversal/Rollback Process"]
    K --> L["Restore All Entitlements"]
    L --> M["Audit and User Notification"]
  end
```

# Glossary
- Coupon: Digitally assigned privilege, code or offer for discounts, free shipping, or special terms
- Mileage: Loyalty points/procedural credits accrued by fulfilling defined business-flow (e.g., purchase, promo), redeemable in future
- Deposit: Prepaid financial balance held at user account, used as direct payment (must be auditable and refundable)
- Entitlement: Any benefit assigned to a userâ€”coupon, mileage point, or deposit

# Related Document References
- [Detailed User Roles and Authentication Requirements](./03-user-roles-and-authentication.md)
- [Cart and Order Processing Business Requirements](./07-cart-and-order-processing.md)
- [Business Rules and Validation Policies](./12-business-rules-and-validation.md)

# Success and Compliance Criteria
- Every business rule, eligibility condition, and behavior outlined here is mandatory for all shoppingMall backend deployments
- All edge and exception cases must be treated with atomicity and auditability, as specified
- Developers possess full autonomy in technical implementation (architecture, APIs, database design) provided business logic is stringently enforced
- Future changes to benefit logic, stacking, or eligibility must be governed by auditable rule change notifications to all affected user base

# Favorites and Personalization Requirements â€“ shoppingMall

## Introduction and Business Context
Personalization and favorites management are pivotal for user engagement, repeat purchases, and platform stickiness in the shoppingMall backend. These features empower customers and sellers to curate, track, and quickly access preferred products, inquiries, and addresses. Robust snapshot and restoration logic enables trust in personalization features, allowing users to revisit historical states and supporting legal, audit, and business analytics use cases. Admins access all favorites and personalization records for analytics, compliance, and support, but never possess or edit their own favorites.

## User Role Matrix and Permissions

| Feature                   | Customer | Seller  | Admin (View/Analytics) |
|---------------------------|----------|---------|-----------------------|
| Product Favorites         | âœ… Add/Remove/Restore (Own) | âœ… Add/Remove/Restore (Own) | âœ… View All |
| Inquiry Favorites         | âœ… Add/Remove/Restore (Own) | âœ… Add/Remove/Restore (Own) | âœ… View All |
| Address Favorites         | âœ… Add/Remove/Restore (Own) | âœ… Add/Remove/Restore (Own) | âœ… View All |
| Personalization Updates   | âœ… Manage (Own)             | âœ… Manage (Own)             | âœ… Analyze/Report |
| Analytics/Notification    | âœ… Receive                  | âœ… Receive                  | âœ… Initiate/Review |
| Restoration/Recovery      | âœ… Initiate (Own)           | âœ… Initiate (Own)           | âœ… Audit, Restore for Compliance |

- THE system SHALL require authentication for any favorite or personalization access. IF an unauthorized request is made, THEN THE system SHALL deny with error code AUTH_REQUIRED.
- THE system SHALL prevent admins from creating or favoriting items for themselves, enforcing role boundaries.
- WHEN a user is deleted, THE system SHALL remove all their favorite records in compliance with data retention and audit policy.

## Functional Requirements: Favorites for Products, Inquiries, Addresses

### Product Favorites
- WHEN an authenticated customer or seller selects an active product, THE system SHALL allow addition to their product favorites list, assuming maximum count (default 500) is not exceeded.
- WHEN a favorite is created, THE system SHALL snapshot current product fields: product ID, title, main image(s), seller, base price, discount, inventory status, core attributes, and timestamp.
- IF a user removes a product favorite, THEN THE system SHALL mark the relation deleted but retain the snapshot for 30 days (configurable) to enable restoration.
- IF the maximum favorite count is reached, THEN THE system SHALL deny new favorites and return error code MAX_FAVORITES_REACHED.
- WHEN a product is unpublished, delisted, or deleted, THE system SHALL mark corresponding favorites inactive and, at userâ€™s next session or query, trigger a notification with the reason ("Removed by seller", etc.).
- WHEN a user restores a deleted favorite within policy window, THE system SHALL unmark logical deletion and reinstate the favorite snapshot.
- WHERE a product favorite is invalid due to regulatory or compliance event (e.g., fraudulent product removal), THE system SHALL permanently block access and delete all related snapshots after policy-mandated retention period.
- THE system SHALL ensure that each user can only favorite each product once; IF duplicate attempt, THEN return error code DUPLICATE_FAVORITE.

### Inquiry Favorites
- WHEN authenticated, users can mark an inquiry (product Q&A or bulletin) as favorite; THE system SHALL store snapshot: inquiry ID, product ID, question, answer details, responder, creation/answered time.
- WHEN the inquiry content is modified after favoriting, THE system SHALL allow the user to refresh the snapshot to reflect new state, or keep original for history/tracking.
- WHEN an inquiry is deleted, THE system SHALL mark favorite as inactive and notify the user at next relevant interaction.

### Address Favorites
- WHEN a user adds a shipping or delivery address as favorite, THE system SHALL snapshot: address details, label, phone/email contact, default/delivery preferences, and timestamp.
- THE system SHALL enforce maximum favorite addresses per user (default: 10, policy-driven), with error if limit exceeded.
- WHEN an address record is removed or updated, THE system SHALL prompt the user to update the corresponding favorite snapshot or retain the prior version for audit or restoration.
- WHEN a favorite address is deleted, THE system SHALL retain the snapshot for 30 days to allow for user-initiated restoration.
- WHEN address becomes invalid (e.g., jurisdiction change, complaint), THE system SHALL mark the favorite inactive and require explicit action for reactivation.

## Snapshot and State-at-Time-of-Favorite Logic

- WHEN any favorite is created, THE system SHALL store a complete business-level snapshot of all relevant fields, including the referencing context (user ID, item type), and a timestamp.
- THE snapshot SHALL NOT automatically update unless the user explicitly requests a refresh, except for compliance-triggered data correction.
- WHEN presenting favorites to the user, THE system SHALL clearly distinguish between snapshot data (historical, time-of-favoriting) and current, live data (if item is still active), with clear indication of differences (e.g., price change, status change).
- IF a referenced entity (product, inquiry, address) is deleted or hidden, THEN THE system SHALL display snapshot only if permitted by policy, else hide the record and note reason.
- THE system SHALL ensure all snapshots are strictly user-scoped and isolated from other accounts and roles.

## Personalization Logic, Notifications, and Recovery

- WHEN a user's favorites set changes (add/remove/restore), THE system SHALL trigger a recalculation of the user's personalization profile for recommendations, recently used addresses, and related analytics.
- WHEN a significant business event affects a favorited item (price drop, back-in-stock, product delisting), THE system SHALL dispatch notifications to affected users via enabled channels (in-app, email, SMS) respecting communication preferences.
- WHEN a user enables periodic reminders, THE system SHALL check for dormant favorites (no view/use for 30/60/90 days, as configured) and send an informational prompt to encourage action or cleanup.
- WHERE system analytics or admin review identifies mass inactives (e.g., a seller withdrawn 100+ products), THE system SHALL batch notify all affected favorite owners with cause and action options.
- IF notification delivery fails or a user action is not completed, THEN THE system SHALL log all attempts, update status for compliance audit, and optionally retry where permitted.

## Validation, Restoration, and Error Handling

- THE system SHALL validate all favorite creation requests against active status, user authentication, business/pricing policy, and maximum/frequency limits.
- IF validation fails, THEN THE system SHALL return actionable, user-facing error codes and messages (e.g., ITEM_UNAVAILABLE, AUTH_REQUIRED, TOO_MANY_FAVORITES).
- IF favorites or snapshots are corrupted, missing, or out-of-sync with business rules, THEN THE system SHALL provide recovery flows: show alternative actions, allow manual restore, or request update/resync.
- WHEN discrete legal events (user request for erasure, GDPR/CCPA, fraud investigation) occur, THE system SHALL permit admins to audit, quarantine, or erase favorite records as required, preserving all actions with rationale in business audit logs.
- WHEN a user initiates favorite or snapshot restoration within retention policy window, THE system SHALL restore entire business snapshot and status with one action, and return result within 2 seconds for typical set size (â‰¤100 items).
- IF address or item becomes permanently invalid (compliance, fraud, legal order), THEN THE system SHALL block restore, permanently erase associated data as required, and notify all affected roles.

## Performance and Scalability Requirements

- WHEN a user queries their favorite set, THE system SHALL deliver up to 100 favorites with snapshots in â‰¤1s; paginate further queries also â‰¤1s per page.
- WHEN a favorite is added/removed/restored, THE system SHALL process, snapshot, and confirm success or error within 1s for 99% of attempts.
- THE system SHALL support 10,000+ users concurrently managing favorites/personalization, with horizontal scalability as user base grows.
- THE favorites and personalization module SHALL be available with >99.99% uptime, with performance metrics accessible/admin-auditable via analytics.

## Administrative and Business Flows

### Analytics and Monitoring
- THE system SHALL allow admins to generate reports on favorites and personalization usage by role, segment, activity period, or affected item type.
- WHEN generating analytics, THE system SHALL aggregate anonymized favorite counts, restoration rates, notification deltas, and error/exception statistics, compliant with privacy laws.
- WHEN suspicious or fraudulent favorite patterns (e.g., bulk favorites, bot-like behavior) are detected, THE system SHALL alert admins for manual review and potential account action.

### Integration
- THE system SHALL integrate with catalog, inquiry, address, user, notification, and analytics modules with strict referential integrity; failures in integration SHALL trigger error events for admin/correction.
- WHEN a catalog/product or address is updated/deleted, THE system SHALL synchronize favorite status or remove references as per the business rule before displaying results to users.

## Example Workflows and Edge Cases (EARS)
- WHEN a seller makes a bulk product withdrawal, THE system SHALL deactivate related product favorites, batch notify affected users, and offer restoration if/when products are republished.
- IF an attempt is made to favorite an expired or region-restricted item, THEN THE system SHALL reject the attempt and explain the business/legal constraint.
- WHEN a user with a maximum allowed favorites count attempts to favorite another item, THEN THE system SHALL suggest removal of older/unused favorites before continuing.
- IF a favorite creation or restoration fails system-side, THEN THE system SHALL log the error with full context and provide user a support request option.
- WHEN personalization is used to recommend products/inquiries or autofill order address, THE system SHALL prefer current active items but clearly indicate if historical snapshots are used instead.

## Mermaid Diagram: End-to-End Favorites Flow
```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "Favorites & Personalization End-to-End"
    UA["User Authenticates"] --> SIF["Select Item to Favorite"]
    SIF --> VC["Validate Constraints (User/Item/Policy)"]
    VC -->|"Pass"| CSC["Create/Update Snapshot & Favorite Record"]
    VC -->|"Fail"| ERR["Return Error Message (Code/Reason)"]
    CSC --> UFL["Update User's Favorites List"]
    UFL --> NTF["Trigger Notification (if relevant)"]
    NTF --> PRF["Recalculate Personalization"]
    PRF --> ANA["Analytics/Monitoring Module"]
    UFL -->|"Max-Limit"| ERR
    CSC -->|"Legal/Compliance Trigger"| AUD["Admin/Audit Action"]
  end
```

## Success Criteria and KPIs

- THE system SHALL maintain >99.99% integrity between favorite snapshots and source records, excluding legal deletions.
- THE system SHALL enable complete restoration/recovery of any favorite or snapshot removed within policy retention window (â‰¥30 days), with record of original state.
- THE system SHALL support generation of segment-based reports and notifications, and monitoring for business, analytics, and compliance.
- THE feature SHALL demonstrate horizontal scalability with no reduction in specified performance or accuracy as user base grows to high concurrency levels.

# Channel and Section Management Requirements (shoppingMall)

## Introduction
Channels in shoppingMall represent discrete sales, marketing, or branding outletsâ€”such as web storefronts, mobile apps, external marketplaces, and partner or brand-specific microsites. Sections are hierarchical, ordered groupings within channels that structure navigational content, products, or promotions (including homepages, sales, featured categories, custom landing areas, and campaign pages). Robust orchestration of channels and sections enables organizational agility, multi-brand/multi-tenant commerce, tailored customer experiences, and omni-channel analytics. All roles (admin, seller, customer) interact with channel/section structures according to business policies, permissions, and scope. Only explicit business requirements are enumerated belowâ€”no technical, integration, or UI detail is specified.

## 1. Channel Registration & Configuration

### 1.1 Channel Lifecycle and Business Logic
- WHEN an admin creates a new channel, THE system SHALL require and validate all mandatory parameters: unique identifier (system-wide unique), non-empty display name (unique across channels, case-insensitive), type (`web`, `mobile`, `marketplace`, `custom`), primary locale, and target audience description.
- THE system SHALL prevent creation if any required parameter is invalid, missing, or if the display name or identifier duplicates an existing channel. IF validation fails, THEN THE system SHALL return clear error codes (`CHANNEL_DUPLICATE_IDENTIFIER`, `CHANNEL_CONFIG_INCOMPLETE`, etc.) with specific guidance for correction.
- WHEN a channel is edited by an authorized admin, THE system SHALL allow modification of any business parameter except the immutable unique identifier; all changes SHALL be logged for audit and traceability.
- IF a channel is deactivated, THEN THE system SHALL mark it as inactive, block all further section management (except audit or restoration), and retain historical records for analytics or regulatory review. Customer/seller access SHALL be gated by channel status.
- WHEN an admin requests channel removal, THE system SHALL require explicit confirmation, perform a logical delete by archiving the channel and all linked section records, and disable any customer/seller interactions inside that channel context. Physical deletion SHALL never occur except under explicit business policy and with full evidence logging.
- WHERE a parent-child relationship exists between channels (e.g., local variant, white-label, syndicated model), THE system SHALL require validation on cascading changes and prevent orphaned child channels.

### 1.2 Mandatory Channel Parameters Table
| Parameter           | Required | Description                                                 |
|---------------------|----------|-------------------------------------------------------------|
| Unique Identifier   | Yes      | System-wide unique, immutable key                           |
| Display Name        | Yes      | User- and admin-facing label; must be unique (case-insens.)  |
| Type                | Yes      | `web`, `mobile`, `marketplace`, or `custom`                 |
| Primary Locale      | Yes      | Default language/region for content/sorting                 |
| Target Audience     | Yes      | Free-text or controlled vocab, used for analytics/marketing |
| Active Status       | Yes      | Boolean: true (active), false (inactive)                    |
| Section List        | Yes      | References to root sections assigned to channel             |
| Parent Channel      | No       | For hierarchical/cascading models, enables multi-tenant ops |

### 1.3 Business Rule Validation (EARS Examples)
- THE system SHALL block activation of any channel that lacks minimum configuration (at least one main section, primary locale, target audience) with error `CHANNEL_CONFIG_INCOMPLETE`.
- WHERE a channel or display name already exists, THE system SHALL reject creation/update with `CHANNEL_DUPLICATE_IDENTIFIER` error.
- WHEN a seller attempts to post products or manage a section in a channel they're not assigned to, THE system SHALL enforce permission blockade and return error `PERMISSION_DENIED`.
- IF attempted deactivation of a channel would orphan sections or cascade to locked channels, THEN THE system SHALL block the action, inform the admin, and provide an audit trail for manual recovery.

### 1.4 Role-Based Permissions
- WHERE admin role, THE system SHALL allow creation, modification, activation/deactivation, and removal of channels and full authority over channel-section structure.
- WHERE seller role, THE system SHALL restrict editing permissions to those channels to which the seller has explicit access (and never permit creation/removal of channels).
- WHERE customer role, THE system SHALL grant permission for channel browsing, product/content interaction, and section traversal but deny administrative or seller-only functions.

## 2. Section Hierarchy & Business Rules

### 2.1 Section Types and Assignment
- THE system SHALL support unlimited channels; within each channel, the system SHALL enable nested, multi-level sections structured as Main Section (root), Subsection (one or more nested levels), Landing Page Section (default or special use), and Special Purpose Section (campaign, promotion, custom features).
- WHEN any section is created by an eligible admin or seller, THE system SHALL require association with a parent channel andâ€”except for rootâ€”a parent section. All assignments SHALL be validated to prevent cycles or logic errors.
- IF attempting to nest a section deeper than five levels, THEN THE system SHALL reject the operation and return error code `SECTION_DEPTH_EXCEEDED`.
- WHEN reordering is invoked, THE system SHALL enable explicit index-based or business-driven sorting; any sort order changes SHALL be applied to channel navigation logic immediately, with all sorts maintaining unique index values (duplicate or invalid assignments are rejected with error `SECTION_SORT_DUPLICATE`).

### 2.2 Section Validation, Visibility, and Role Restrictions
- EACH section SHALL have a unique name within its parent section or channel root; inputs are case-insensitive. WHERE the name is not unique, THE system SHALL block creation with error `SECTION_NAME_DUPLICATE`.
- WHEN a section is activated or re-assigned, THE system SHALL validate to ensure no orphaned, cyclic, or otherwise invalid hierarchies result. IF cycles/orphans detected, THEN THE system SHALL reject the move, lock the affected branch, and detail recovery steps for resolution: error `SECTION_CYCLIC_OR_ORPHAN`.
- EACH section SHALL expose a `visibility` flag (public, seller-only, admin-only) and `active/inactive` status. WHERE a section is set to seller-only, THE system SHALL restrict content/products within it to assigned seller roles only. WHERE a section is admin-exclusive (e.g., staging, test, regulation), THE system SHALL prevent customer/seller visibility.
- WHEN a section is deactivated, THE system SHALL automatically hide all child sections unless an explicit override is set. IF deleted, THEN THE system SHALL archive section history and any descendants for future analytics, with all data available to admins.

### 2.3 Section CRUD Workflows (Business Logic Only)
- WHEN a seller is authorized for a channel, THE system SHALL permit section creation, editing, and product assignment only within that scope.
- IF a seller attempts to exceed authorized actions (create/remove/edit sections outside assigned scope), THEN THE system SHALL block and return error `PERMISSION_DENIED`.
- Admins may reorganize any section structure, transfer sections between channels (subject to validation), and lock/unlock sections for enforcement or remediation.

### 2.4 Edge Cases and Recovery
- WHEN a batch update (activation, move, archive) is partially completed (e.g., due to business validation error on some sections), THE system SHALL detail which sections succeeded/failed, provide error context (code and description) for each, and guide the user to remediate failed items without rollback of successful operations.
- IF any critical structural error occurs (e.g., looped hierarchy, orphaned root, missing main section during activation), THEN THE system SHALL automatically lock the affected entity, escalate to administrator, and flag for urgent business recovery. All actions SHALL be audit-logged.

### 2.5 Role-Based Permission Matrix
| Action                       | Customer | Seller                | Admin         |
|------------------------------|----------|-----------------------|---------------|
| Browse Channel & Sections    | âœ…       | âœ…                    | âœ…            |
| Register New Channel         | âŒ       | âŒ                    | âœ…            |
| Edit Channel Properties      | âŒ       | âŒ                    | âœ…            |
| Remove/Deactivate Channel    | âŒ       | âŒ                    | âœ…            |
| Add/Edit/Remove Sections     | âŒ       | Partial*              | âœ…            |
| Assign Products to Sections  | âŒ       | âœ… (as assigned)       | âœ…            |
| Reorder Sections             | âŒ       | Partial*              | âœ…            |
| Configure Section Templates  | âŒ       | âŒ                    | âœ…            |
| View Analytics               | âŒ       | Partial (assigned)    | âœ…            |

- *Partial: permitted on assigned channel(s)/sections only; activity out-of-scope is denied with error.

## 3. Cross-Channel Consistency, Templates, and Analytics

### 3.1 Template Consistency and Synchronization
- THE system SHALL support configuration templates for section structures reusable across multiple channels. WHEN a template is applied or modified, THE system SHALL propagate changes to all linked sectionsâ€”except for those flagged as "customized" at the instance level. WHERE a section diverges from template-based configuration due to local edits, THE system SHALL record this "override" state, flag for business review, and append the divergence to analytics logs.
- IF a customized section is present in a template update batch, THEN THE system SHALL skip automated update and visibly mark it for admin action.
- WHEN conflicts between template and customized section are detected, THE system SHALL show a detailed change/audit log, trace history, and enable business-driven reconciliation workflows only by authorized admins.

### 3.2 Batch Operations and Analytics
- THE system SHALL support batch actions (activate, reorder, archive, assign product, propagate template, etc.) across arbitrary sets of channels/sections for authorized admins. WHERE a batch includes ineligible, locked, or error status channels/sections, THE system SHALL break out actions per item, apply only successful sub-operations, and detail failed ones with actionable error context and codes.
- All channel/section create, edit, move, activate, archive, and audit operations SHALL be recorded in a tamper-evident, immutable business log accessible by admins with role-appropriate filtering.
- THE system SHALL provide analytics dashboards and exportable reports at both the channel and section level. Metrics include: item/product count, view counts, click-throughs, successful/failed actions, divergence from template, active/inactive section ratios, change frequency, and business success/conversion scores where applicable.
- WHERE data inconsistency or unusual behavior is detected (e.g., repeated failed actions, looped hierarchies, sections with no activity for defined period), THE system SHALL auto-flag the anomalies for admin business review.

### 3.3 Performance and User Experience
- WHEN a channel or section is created, updated, moved, activated/deactivated, or deleted, THE system SHALL complete all operations within 2 seconds for 95% of invocations. WHERE batch or high-load scenarios occur (e.g., activating sections across a channel with >50,000 products or users), the business logic propagation SHALL be completed within 5 seconds with push notifications for long-running operations.
- FAILURE to meet performance targets SHALL be logged and trigger admin awareness for business escalation.

### 3.4 Summary of Business Rules & Error Handling
| Ref   | Condition                                       | Expected Business Rule Behavior                           |
|-------|-------------------------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------|
| BR-101| Duplicate Channel ID or Name                    | Reject, error code: CHANNEL_DUPLICATE_IDENTIFIER         |
| BR-102| Main Section Missing at Channel Activation      | Block activation, error code: CHANNEL_CONFIG_INCOMPLETE  |
| BR-103| Section Nested Beyond Five Levels               | Reject, error code: SECTION_DEPTH_EXCEEDED               |
| BR-104| Duplicate Section Name In Parent                | Reject, error code: SECTION_NAME_DUPLICATE               |
| BR-105| Unauthorized Channel/Section Edit               | Reject, error code: PERMISSION_DENIED                    |
| BR-106| Section Divergence from Template                | Mark as customized, require admin review in analytics    |
| BR-107| Cyclic Orphan Structure                         | Lock entity, trigger admin recovery, error: SECTION_CYCLIC_OR_ORPHAN |

## 4. End-to-End User Scenarios

### Scenario 1: Admin Registers New Omnichannel with Template
- Admin selects â€œAdd Channelâ€, enters all required fields (unique ID, name, type: web, primary locale: English, audience: "US Sports Fans"), and applies a master template for root and campaign sections. Admin is prompted to add at least one main section before activation. System validates uniqueness, links template, and completes activation. All steps are audit-logged.

### Scenario 2: Seller Adds Custom Promotion Section to Assigned Channel
- Seller with explicit access to "Brand Outlet" channel logs in, is shown eligible sections, and may add sub-sections up to five levels. Seller proposes new section "Back-to-School Savings" under assigned node. System validates section name, nesting, and permissions. Section is created and, if seller designates as â€œSeller-Onlyâ€, section is visible only to the seller and assigned collaborators. All steps are logged and included in analytics.

### Scenario 3: Admin Performs Batch Template Sync
- Admin updates "Standard Home Layout" section template. System applies changes to all channels using the template, skipping and flagging customized exceptions. Any skipped sections are added to adminâ€™s review queue with change history and required reconciliation step. Analytics updated for all completed actions.

### Scenario 4: Batch Error and Recovery
- Admin attempts to activate multiple sections across channels. System successfully activates 18, but 3 fail: one lacks a main section, one is locked by a cyclic orphan, and one violates unique name. For each failure, system returns error codes (`CHANNEL_CONFIG_INCOMPLETE`, `SECTION_CYCLIC_OR_ORPHAN`, `SECTION_NAME_DUPLICATE`), preserves the adminâ€™s attempted inputs, and notifies which succeeded.

### Scenario 5: Automated Inactivity Flag
- Analytics module identifies a section in a popular channel with no views or product listings for 90 days. System auto-flags for admin review, adding a suggested action note to the analytics dashboard.

## 5. Mermaid Diagram: Channel and Section Management Flow
```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "Channel Management"
    A["Admin Creates Channel"] --> B["System Validates Uniqueness"]
    B -->|"Valid"| C["Channel Created"]
    B -->|"Duplicate"| D["Error: CHANNEL_DUPLICATE_IDENTIFIER"]
  end
  subgraph "Section Management"
    E["Admin/Seller Adds Section"] --> F["Validate Nesting and Uniqueness"]
    F -->|"OK"| G["Section Added or Edited"]
    F -->|"Too Deep"| H["Error: SECTION_DEPTH_EXCEEDED"]
    F -->|"Duplicate Name"| I["Error: SECTION_NAME_DUPLICATE"]
  end
  subgraph "Template Sync"
    J["Admin Updates Template"] --> K["Push to Channels"]
    K -->|"Customized"| L["Flag Divergence for Review"]
    K -->|"Standard"| M["Sections Updated"]
  end
```

## 6. Compliance, Auditability, and Developer Autonomy
All requirements above represent explicit business rules and logic for shoppingMall channel and section management. Developers have full autonomy over system architecture, databases, and internal APIs, subject to business logic and audit constraints as described. No UI, integration, or technical design is specified in this document.
