# Attachment File Management Requirements for shoppingMall Backend

## Attachment Support Scenarios

Attachment management in shoppingMall is designed to support a wide variety of file types and business use cases across all user roles (customer, seller, admin). Attachments are integral to business processes such as product management (product images, videos, documentation), customer orders (invoices, receipts), reviews (review photos and videos), customer service (inquiry documents), marketing (banner and campaign media), legal compliance (evidence files, contracts), and administrative record-keeping (audit snapshots, reporting downloads).

### Supported File Types and Size Limitations
- THE system SHALL support the following file types for upload and download: images (JPEG, PNG, GIF, BMP, WebP), videos (MP4, MOV, AVI, WebM), documents (PDF, TXT, DOC/DOCX, XLS/XLSX, PPT/PPTX), audio (MP3, WAV), and compressed archives (ZIP, RAR, 7z).
- WHERE new file types or extensions are required by regulatory or business needs, THE system SHALL support business-driven extensibility approval processes.
- THE maximum file size for uploads SHALL be configurable by business policy, defaulting to:
  - Images: 10MB per file
  - Videos: 200MB per file
  - Documents: 30MB per file
  - Audio: 20MB per file
  - Archives: 50MB per file
- WHERE attachment size exceeds the allowed threshold, THE system SHALL reject the file and deliver a clear, actionable error message to the user.
- WHERE upload occurs, THE system SHALL validate file type and size before accepting the file. IF a file is of an unsupported type or contains disallowed extensions, THEN THE system SHALL prevent upload and inform the user of accepted types.
- THE number of attachments per object (e.g., product, review) SHALL be limited by business rules; for example, products may hold up to 15 images or 2 videos; reviews up to 5 images and 1 video; receipts/invoices 1 per order.
- THE system SHALL support multi-file and batch uploads, provided limits are respected.

### Business Workflows per User Role
- WHEN a customer places an order, THE system SHALL enable upload and storage of attachments such as payment receipts, delivery instructions, or post-purchase review media.
- WHERE sellers manage products, THE system SHALL allow for attachment of multiple product images, promotional videos, and downloadable documentation to each product record.
- WHEN a review is posted, THE system SHALL permit customers to upload images and videos as attachments, subject to limits and automated business validation.
- WHEN a seller or admin needs to provide evidence for compliance, THE system SHALL support upload and timestamped linking of legal documents to the relevant case, product, or business event.
- WHEN administrators publish a banner or campaign, THE system SHALL require upload and management of image or video files tied to campaign/section/channel objects.
- WHEN a file is uploaded, THE system SHALL link it to its owning object (e.g., product, order, customer profile, review, support inquiry) by business ID and role metadata.

### Attachment Lifecycle
- WHEN an object with attached files is deleted (e.g., product, order), THE system SHALL evaluate if the attachment must be retained for compliance or business audit, and act accordingly.
- IF attachments become orphaned (no linked object exists or retention expires), THEN THE system SHALL remove them from active access and schedule for permanent deletion based on business policy.
- WHEN a file reaches its business-defined retention expiration (e.g., 5 years for invoices, 1 year for customer uploads), THE system SHALL remove the file from the platform and log all removal actions for audit.

### Error and Validation Scenarios
- IF an upload fails validation (type, size, virus/malware detection), THEN THE system SHALL block the file and provide the uploader with an error code and remediation steps.
- IF a user attempts to access a file without sufficient role permissions, THEN THE system SHALL deny the action and log an access violation for audit.
- IF an object is deleted but its attachments are under legal hold, THEN THE system SHALL retain the files and flag them for compliance review.

## File Metadata & Access Permissions

Accurate, auditable metadata is captured and required for all attachments in the system. Access and permissions are determined by role, object linkage, and lifecycle state.

### Required Metadata for Attachments
| Metadata Field            | Description                                                      |
|--------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------------|
| File Name                 | Name as uploaded                                                 |
| File Type / Extension     | MIME type and extension                                          |
| File Size (MB)            | Size of file at upload                                           |
| Upload Timestamp          | ISO 8601 upload time                                             |
| Uploaded By (Role, User)  | Role (customer/seller/admin) and user ID of uploader             |
| Linked Object             | Type and unique ID of business object file is attached to         |
| Attachment Purpose/Type   | e.g., product image, review video, invoice, legal evidence        |
| Retention Policy          | Business logic: default duration, legal/compliance flag           |
| Version Number            | Attachment version for updates/re-uploads                        |
| Checksum/Hash             | Integrity verification (e.g., SHA-256)                           |
| Status                    | Active, quarantined, flagged, pending moderation, deleted         |
| Deletion Timestamp        | Scheduled or completed deletion time (when applicable)            |
| DMCA/Compliance Status    | DMCA/takedown/appeal/litigation state as relevant                 |

### Business Rules for Metadata
- THE system SHALL require the assignment of all required metadata upon attachment upload.
- WHEN a file is updated or replaced, THE system SHALL increment its version number, link both old and new versions for audit, and enforce prior version purging per retention policy.
- IF metadata is malformed, missing, or inconsistent (e.g., missing object link), THEN THE system SHALL block the attachment, notify relevant user/admin, and flag for resolution.
- WHERE hash/checksum validation fails, THE system SHALL reject the file and provide a user-facing message explaining the cause.

### Role-Based Access Matrix (Sample)
| Action         | Customer | Seller | Admin |
|----------------|----------|--------|-------|
| Upload         | âœ… (own)  | âœ… (own/products) | âœ… (any object) |
| View/Download  | âœ… (own)  | âœ… (own/sales)    | âœ… (all)        |
| Delete         | âœ… (own)  | âœ… (own/products) | âœ… (all)        |
| Replace/Update | âœ… (own)  | âœ… (own/products) | âœ… (all)        |
| Quarantine     | âŒ        | âŒ              | âœ…              |
| Restore        | âŒ        | âŒ              | âœ…              |
| Audit/View Log | âŒ        | âŒ              | âœ…              |

- WHERE a seller uploads on behalf of a customer (e.g., order docs), THE system SHALL attribute both uploader and subject in metadata.
- WHEN access is required across multiple roles (e.g., admin reviewing sellerâ€™s attachments), THE system SHALL enforce business permissions and log access events.

### Attachment Linking and Orphan Handling
- WHEN an object is deleted, THE system SHALL evaluate attachment retention policy and move files to â€œpending deletionâ€/archived status if retention is required; otherwise, permanently delete.
- WHERE attachments are orphaned due to object purge, THE system SHALL log evidence and follow compliance protocol for data disposition.

### Error and Edge Conditions
- IF a user attempts to modify, delete, or access an attachment not owned or beyond permissions, THEN THE system SHALL block the action, record the event, and notify the user.
- IF a required attachment (e.g., product image) is missing or removed, THEN THE system SHALL flag the parent object as incomplete until restored.
- WHEN a fileâ€™s retention window has expired, THE system SHALL auto-purge file and record all reference removals for audit.

### Performance & Business Expectation
- WHEN a user requests access/download of a permitted attachment, THE system SHALL deliver the file within 2 seconds in 99% of cases for files under 20MB.
- WHEN a batch operation is performed (mass download, removal), THE system SHALL complete processing within business SLA targets and log all changes for audit.

## Threat Mitigation & Secure Delivery

Ensuring safe, compliant, and secure management of file attachments is essential for platform trust and legal alignment.

### Content Moderation & Threat Detection
- WHEN a file is uploaded, THE system SHALL perform automated and/or manual content review according to business policy, including virus/malware scanning, content moderation (e.g., prohibited imagery, copyright checks), and compliance validation.
- IF an attachment is flagged by automated or user report (e.g., suspected copyright, illegal, abusive, or malware content), THEN THE system SHALL move file to â€œquarantinedâ€ status, restrict access, and notify designated admins for review.
- WHERE legal hold or compliance probe is triggered (e.g., DMCA, fraud investigation), THE system SHALL preserve impacted files in non-modifiable state until issue is resolved.
- WHEN a takedown or report is resolved (approved, rejected, escalated), THE system SHALL update attachment status and notify all parties with appropriate business information.
- WHEN attachments are determined to violate business or legal policy, THE system SHALL enforce evidence snapshot, flag all links, and block future access/download. Record full trail for audit.
- WHERE recurring misuse by a user or role is detected (multiple flagged or banned file uploads), THE system SHALL temporarily suspend their upload privileges and inform them of the suspension reason.
- THE system SHALL provide admin and compliance dashboards to review, track, and resolve all flagged or quarantined attachments, with complete audit logs.

### Secure Access and Delivery Workflows
- WHEN a permitted user requests to access or download an attachment, THE system SHALL generate business-compliant, time-limited secure access token or download link, audit access event, and enforce role-based visibility.
- IF a download token or link expires or is used by an unauthorized party, THEN THE system SHALL block the attempt and record an incident for security review.
- WHERE device, session, or network anomaly is detected during file access, THE system SHALL require additional authentication or block the transaction per business rules.
- THE system SHALL ensure no attachment is accessible except through authenticated and authorized session, regardless of device or channel.
- WHEN a file is deleted, updated, or placed under legal hold, THE system SHALL immediately invalidate all outstanding tokens or download links to that file.
- THE system SHALL support audit logs of all download, access, modification, quarantine, and removal events, visible to authorized admins for compliance needs.

### Evidence and Audit Trail Requirements
- WHEN a file enters or leaves the threat mitigation process (flagged/quarantined/released/deleted), THE system SHALL log all actions, actors, and relevant context for compliance and future audit.
- THE system SHALL support exporting audit logs of attachment lifecycle events (upload, update, access, moderation, deletion) matching business needs and retention laws.

## Mermaid Diagram: Attachment Lifecycle and Security Flow
```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "Attachment Upload & Validation"
    A["File Selected by User"] --> B["Validate File Type & Size"]
    B -->|"Valid"| C["Scan for Virus/Threat"]
    B -->|"Invalid"| D["Block Upload & Notify User"]
    C -->|"Clean"| E["Store File and Metadata"]
    C -->|"Threat Detected"| F["Quarantine File, Notify Admin"]
  end

  subgraph "Business Process Linkage"
    E --> G["Link File to Business Object"]
    G --> H["Update Object State (e.g., Product/Order/Review)"]
  end

  subgraph "Access & Download"
    I["User Requests Attachment"] --> J["Check Role Permission"]
    J -->|"Allowed"| K["Issue Secure Token/Link"]
    J -->|"Denied"| L["Block Access & Log Attempt"]
    K --> M["Audit Access Event"]
    M --> N["Deliver File"]
  end

  subgraph "Moderation & Removal"
    O["Attachment Flagged or Expired"] --> P["Update Status (Quarantined/Deleted)"]
    P --> Q["Notify Stakeholders"]
    Q --> R["Archive or Remove File"]
    Q --> S["Export Audit Trail"]
  end

  F --> P
  N --> O
  R --> S
```

## Success and Compliance Criteria
- THE system SHALL maintain at least 99.99% data integrity for file links and metadata across all object lifecycles, excluding explicit deletion/compliance actions.
- THE system SHALL support role-based attachment management in accordance with data privacy and legal mandates, supporting rapid incident investigation and user notification within 24 hours of policy or law trigger.
- THE system SHALL deliver files within 2 seconds under normal loads and flag/notify when SLA cannot be met.
- WHEN process or role changes impact attachment business rules, THE system SHALL update policy and notify all affected stakeholders.

All requirements articulated in this document represent business rules only. All technical implementation decisions, including but not limited to architecture, storage, API, and database structure, belong to the development team. The document describes WHAT the system should do, not HOW to build it.

# 12-business-rules-and-validation.md

## Introduction
All central business rules, validation requirements, and evidence preservation logic for the shoppingMall backend ensure legal compliance, user trust, and reliable operational integrity. This specification addresses every aspect of data integrity, order and payment validation, inventory management, error and evidence handling, and proprietary rules for each role (customer, seller, admin). All requirements use EARS syntax for actionability and traceability.

## Data Integrity & Snapshots

### System-Wide Data Integrity Measures
- THE shoppingMall SHALL ensure that every business action (such as order, payment, inventory change, or user update) produces a permanent, tamper-evident audit record. The audit record SHALL contain actor, timestamp (ISO 8601), original and changed values, operation type, and a business context description.
- WHEN transactional data is committed to the core backend, THE shoppingMall SHALL validate referential integrity, ensuring no orphaned or dangling records can exist in any finalized business state.
- THE shoppingMall SHALL block the insertion or creation of any record missing mandatory business fields from user, product, order, or transaction profiles.
- WHEN updates or deletes occur to fundamental data (product, order, payment, user profile), THE shoppingMall SHALL create change snapshots capturing the before and after state, and link each to immutable audit trails.
- IF a conflict or data discrepancy (mismatched total, missing entity, invalid state) is detected during batch import/export or business process automation, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL flag the transaction for admin intervention and preserve complete evidence, including source system, triggering action, and data context.
- WHILE operating under an active regulatory compliance regime, THE shoppingMall SHALL preserve all business action records in an immutable state for a regulation-compliant retention period (such as 5-7 years, per jurisdiction).

### Evidence Lifecycle and Audit Requirements
- WHEN a financial or regulatory action (order placement, payment, refund, escalation, punitive adjustment) occurs, THE shoppingMall SHALL create a time-stamped, atomic snapshot of all directly or indirectly impacted objects (order, payment, inventory, user, evidence, etc.).
- IF a rollback, undo, or restoration is initiated, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL restore data to the most recent valid snapshot, log all delta changes, identify the triggering actor, and require a business justification.
- THE shoppingMall SHALL label every snapshot with metadata: source system, intent of operation, and business context, ensuring exhaustive evidence search and presentation during legal, compliance, or dispute audits.
- WHERE sequential updates are applied to a business entity (such as order, product, payment, or inventory item), THE shoppingMall SHALL increment the business object's version and maintain a fully ordered, traceable change sequence supporting forward and backward auditing.
- WHEN a critical data error (payment applied to wrong order, duplicate shipping, seller misassignment, mismatched regulatory key) is detected, THE shoppingMall SHALL permit authorized admins to run a full audit restore to a previous valid state and SHALL require documentation of the restoration evidence, rationale, and all resulting deltas.
- WHEN legal or compliance-mandated evidence export is triggered, THE shoppingMall SHALL provide traceable, tamper-evident, and digitally signed content.

## Order & Payment Rules

### Core Order and Payment Logic
- WHEN a customer submits an order, THE shoppingMall SHALL validate at submission that all selected items are available and in stock, prices are final and synchronized, customer identity and delivery information is present and validated, and the product and seller are in saleable status.
- IF an order contains items from multiple sellers, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL split the transaction into sub-orders per seller, preserving independent evidence for price, coupon, tax, and discount calculations per sub-order.
- WHEN a payment is initiated, THE shoppingMall SHALL validate the payment method eligibility, enforce anti-fraud and compliance rules based on business settings, and confirm that order status, line items, and payment totals exactly match the committed evidence and business policy.
- WHEN payment is successfully completed, THE shoppingMall SHALL atomically advance the order status to "paid,â€ trigger immediate inventory allocation, and record immutable evidence from payment gateways (transaction IDs, confirmations, financial timestamps).
- IF a payment attempt fails, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL NOT create or lock a committed order, and SHALL log all attempt context, transitions, input parameters, and received payment system responses for future review.
- WHEN an order is cancelled (by customer, seller, or admin), THE shoppingMall SHALL atomically update all related sub-orders and records, manage all linked refunds, lapse coupon/discount usages, update inventory, record snapshots, and prevent any future untracked changes.
- IF a cancellation/refund is requested outside policy (e.g., after 7 days from item delivery or policy cut-off), THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL reject the request with a specific reason code and automated notification.
- WHEN the seller or associated warehouse misses a fulfillment SLA (such as shipping within 2 business days), THE shoppingMall SHALL notify the customer automatically, collect supporting evidence, and escalate to admin for investigation.
- WHEN processing a refund, THE shoppingMall SHALL record all required gateway evidence and audit details (payment channel, reason, timestamp, admin/seller/customer trigger) and restrict the order from being refunded again.

### Payment Evidence and Fraud Scenarios
- WHEN handling multi-step payments (coupon discount, split tender, etc.), THE shoppingMall SHALL preserve all evidence (amounts, actors, timestamps, adjustment sequences) in immutable logs.
- IF a chargeback, reversal, or payment dispute is reported for any order, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL lock the affected transaction and evidence, notify appropriate admins, bar further related actions, and keep all records until dispute closure.

### Refunds, Cancellations, and Enforcement
- THE shoppingMall SHALL process all refunds exclusively through the original payment channel, requiring business justification for every refund; admin override and new evidence entry are required for exceptions.
- WHEN a cancellation is validated and processed, THE shoppingMall SHALL restore product inventory, revert all coupon or discount benefits to the original state, recompute all evidence, and record a compliant audit trail.
- IF a duplicate payment or order submission is detected within a short tolerance window (e.g., 60 seconds), THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL merge, deduplicate, or block such attempts, make a comprehensive evidence record, and notify all affected users with explanatory reason.
- WHEN any order or payment discrepancy is detected between shoppingMall and external integrations (such as payment gateways or logistics providers), THE shoppingMall SHALL record a complete evidence snapshot and escalate for immediate admin review.
- WHERE payment or fulfillment involves regulatory or cross-border rules (currency conversion, VAT/export/import), THE shoppingMall SHALL follow all compliance requirements for evidence labeling, metadata, and reporting.

### SLA and Compliance Rules
- THE shoppingMall SHALL support business-defined SLAs for all major order, payment, and fulfillment activities. When an SLA is violated, THE system SHALL automatically flag the incident, escalate to the next-level reviewer, and collect notification evidence for compliance.

## Inventory Consistency

### Real-Time Inventory Validation
- WHEN inventory is allocated due to a new order, THE shoppingMall SHALL atomically deduct from available stock, lock reserved levels, and update all associated evidence files synchronously.
- IF inventory falls to or below the critical threshold (zero or negative), THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL immediately block future checkout/fulfillment, log the event with stakeholder notifications, and permit only admin-authorized adjustments moving forward.
- WHEN multiple orders present simultaneous requests for the last available inventory, THE shoppingMall SHALL confirm fulfillment based on earliest received timestamp, blocking or rerouting later orders, and preserving all event evidence.
- WHEN a manual stock adjustment is made by a seller (restock, deduction, correction), THE shoppingMall SHALL validate all permissions, require justification, ensure compliance to business policy, and create paired before/after evidence snapshots.
- WHEN inventory is returned to stock due to order cancelation, return, or payment failure, THE shoppingMall SHALL restore stated inventory atomically and link to traceable audit records.
- SELLERS SHALL be forbidden from retroactively adjusting inventory for finalized or shipped orders; business exceptions require admin approval with required evidence entry.

### Oversell and Undersell Prevention
- WHILE an item is published and open for sale, THE shoppingMall SHALL enforce never-negative inventory regardless of order concurrency or suspected double-sell edge cases.
- IF an external feed, third-party sync, or API introduces mismatch in inventory levels, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL isolate the inconsistent product, block new sales, notify both seller and admin, and require compliance review and explicit release.

### Cross-Channel Synchronization and Stock Auditing
- WHEN inventory is synchronized or merged from external channels, THE shoppingMall SHALL trigger a full audit reconciliation and preserve side-by-side evidence, supporting cross-channel consistency and business reporting.

## Error Handling & Evidence Management

### User-Facing Errors and Recovery
- IF any business process fails due to user, system, or data validation error, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL provide a human-readable error referencing specific failure context, log all input parameters, and assign a unique error code for support traceability.
- WHEN an unrecoverable error impacts an order, payment, or inventory flow, THE shoppingMall SHALL atomically roll back all affected actions to the last consistent state and generate a comprehensive evidence record including causal analysis, affected entities, and all attempted remediations.
- WHEN a user initiates a correction action (such as cancel, return, evidence request), THE shoppingMall SHALL validate permissions, surface relevant evidence, and deliver success or error status with actionable feedback.
- IF evidence or audit data is missing, corrupt, or fails a compliance integrity check, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL lock affected business records, block subsequent actions, and escalate to admin or compliance admin for restoration.

### Evidence and Audit Trail Preservation
- THE shoppingMall SHALL store all business event evidence in an immutable, versioned audit log. Audit log access is restricted and auditable; only authorized parties may retrieve evidence bundles.
- WHEN a dispute, investigation, or compliance query is initiated, THE shoppingMall SHALL present a complete, chronologically linked trail of all related evidence (snapshots, actors, workflow logs, justifications, notifications, etc.) for admin and legal review.
- WHERE evidence for a dispute is adjudicated or the business incident is resolved, THE shoppingMall SHALL lock and digitally sign the evidence bundle, sealing it from further edits per legal standard.
- THE shoppingMall SHALL perform periodic evidence integrity checks for critical business flows (such as order, payment, admin override, or inventory adjustment), raising alerts for missing or suspicious entries.

### Legal and Regulatory Mandates
- THE shoppingMall SHALL comply with all regional and global data retention, privacy, and audit laws (such as GDPR, CCPA, SOX, financial regulations), preserving evidence for required periods and prohibiting unauthorized deletion.
- WHEN a regulatory time limit for evidence retention expires, THE shoppingMall SHALL securely destroy all qualifying data, logging the destruction and reason per compliance requirement; destruction logs are themselves retained for future audits.
- IF legal hold or court-requested evidence preservation is triggered, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL block any record modification or deletion until the hold is formally released.

## Role-Specific Rule Summaries

### Customer-Facing
- WHEN a customer attempts to submit an incomplete, fraudulent, or otherwise invalid order, THE shoppingMall SHALL reject the attempt, record all details for fraud prevention, and notify relevant compliance stakeholders.
- IF a customer repeatedly triggers suspected abuse (such as serial payment failures, excessive refund requests), THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL flag the account for elevated admin/seller review and evidence tagging.
- THE shoppingMall SHALL maintain an immutable, user-accessible log for each customer's major business events (orders, payments, refunds, returns, evidence requests), supporting transparency and self-service history queries.

### Seller-Facing
- SELLERS SHALL only alter or manage products, orders, and inventory strictly within their authorized domain, subject to verification and audit at all times.
- WHEN a seller requests an evidence report or business audit snapshot, THE shoppingMall SHALL validate the request, ensure all records are complete and up to date, and deliver securely via authorized channel.
- IF a seller repeatedly fails to maintain inventory accuracy, violates SLAs, or triggers compliance incidents, THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL escalate for admin action and evidence preservation review.

### Admin/Compliance
- ADMINS SHALL have explicit authority to audit, override, restore, or quarantine any business action, but every admin-level change MUST capture a complete evidence record (actor, timestamp, operation, rationale, affected data snapshot).
- IF an admin override is enacted (e.g., late refund, inventory correction, SLAs adjustment), THEN THE shoppingMall SHALL require explicit documentation in the audit trail, justification text, and referential linkage to all impacted business records.
- ADMINS SHALL be able to place business records "on hold" (locking further action) for compliance review or active investigation, with evidence of cause and associated notifications to relevant roles.

## Performance and Response Expectations
- THE shoppingMall SHALL process business-critical actions (order, payment, evidence entry or update, inventory mutation, audit read/write) within 2 seconds 95% of the time. This includes synchronous audit log or evidence writes.
- WHEN evidence or audit records fail to commit within the performance window, THE shoppingMall SHALL synchronously retry at least once. Persistent failure SHALL escalate as a blocking error to the admin for intervention.
- THE shoppingMall SHALL ensure all business and compliance flows are fully traceable: every order, payment, inventory transaction, and admin override SHALL link to its supporting evidence for compliance, dispute, or review with retrieval response within 2 seconds.
- ALL major error, audit, and evidence recovery scenarios SHALL automatically trigger notifications to the correct roles (customer, seller, admin) with contextual details for next-step action and support.

## User and System Flow Diagram: Business Rules and Validation

```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "Order & Business Validation Lifecycle"
    A["Order Initiation (Customer)"] --> B["Validation (Stock, Identity, Product, Compliance)"]
    B -->|"Passes"| C["Payment Processing"]
    B -->|"Fails"| D["Error Handling & Evidence Snapshot"]
    C -->|"Payment OK"| E["Order Finalized & Evidence Recording"]
    C -->|"Payment Fail"| D
    E --> F["Inventory Allocation & Stock Audit"]
    F --> G["Audit Logging, Notifications, Compliance Escalation"]
    G --> H["Order Completion or Next Lifecycle Step"]
    D --> I["User Feedback & Recovery Options"]
  end
  subgraph "Admin/Seller Exception & Dispute Management"
    J["Business Exception (Return, Dispute, Correction)"] --> K["Evidence Collection & Justification"]
    K --> L["Admin Validation, Approval, Action"]
    L --> M["Snapshot & Audit Trail Entry"]
    M --> N["Resolution Finalization & Incident Closure"]
  end
```

## Integration and Cross-Reference
- All product, user, order, and evidence management rules herein are referenced in or relied upon by the following requirement documents:
    - [Product and Category Management Requirements](./05-product-and-category-management.md)
    - [User Roles and Authentication Requirements](./03-user-roles-and-authentication.md)
    - [Cart and Order Processing Requirements](./07-cart-and-order-processing.md)
    - [Security, Compliance & Data Privacy](./13-security-compliance-and-data-privacy.md)
    - [User Scenarios and Service Flows](./04-user-scenarios-and-flows.md)
- Any future expansion or modification of business logic regarding validation, compliance, or audit must update this document accordingly.

# Security, Compliance & Data Privacy Requirements for shoppingMall Backend

## Personal Data Protection

### Legal Basis for Processing and Consent Management
- WHEN collecting, storing, or processing any user personal data, THE shoppingMall backend SHALL ensure that every data item is processed under a clear legal basis as defined by the corresponding jurisdictionâ€”including user consent, contractual necessity, legal compliance, or legitimate interest.
- WHEN seeking user consent for personal data processing (such as marketing, analytics, or third-party sharing), THE system SHALL present a clear, specific consent interface and SHALL record timestamped, granular consent for each category of data and purpose, in a tamper-evident audit log.
- IF a user declines or withdraws consent for any data category, THEN THE system SHALL immediately cease all related processing and SHALL notify all downstream or third-party data processors of consent withdrawal within 24 hours.
- WHERE processing is based on legitimate interest, THE system SHALL provide users with the means to object and SHALL document the business assessment justifying such processing, available for audit.

### Data Minimization, Retention & Deletion (Right to be Forgotten)
- THE system SHALL only collect and store user data strictly necessary for service delivery, personalization, regulatory compliance, fraud prevention, and business operations. Nonessential or extraneous data SHALL NOT be requested nor retained.
- WHEN a user requests access to or deletion of their personal data (right to access, right to erasure), THE system SHALL verify the userâ€™s identity and SHALL fulfill the request within the timeframes specified by applicable regulation (GDPR: 30 days, CCPA: 45 days, etc.).
- WHEN a deletion/erasure request is granted, THE system SHALL permanently remove or anonymize all user-identifiable records, inform all internal modules and any third parties, and record compliance actions for future audit.
- WHERE legal obligations require data retention (e.g., transaction logs for tax/regulatory reasons), THE system SHALL restrict access and repurpose retained data purely for compliance, clearly separating it from business or marketing workflows.

### Cross-Border Data Transfer and Multi-Jurisdiction Compliance
- WHEN personal data is transferred across jurisdictions (e.g., customer data from EU to US), THE system SHALL enforce all necessary safeguards: standard contractual clauses (SCC), adequacy decisions, or explicit user consent captured and auditable.
- THE system SHALL classify and label all user data by residency and transfer status, ensuring mapping to applicable data protection regulations (GDPR, CCPA, LGPD, PIPEDA, etc.).
- IF data residency or transfer requirements change (e.g., via regulation or case law), THEN THE system SHALL propagate updated restrictions immediately and apply to all subsequent cross-border transfers.

### Specific Rights Implementation and Business Scenarios
- WHEN a user requests rectification or portability of their data, THE system SHALL provide a structured download or update interface including all personal, purchase, and interaction data within regulatory timeframes.
- IF data cannot be provided or erased (e.g., pending refund, legal hold), THEN THE system SHALL explain the reason and give the user a reassessment/resubmission path.
- WHEN handling minor (child) accounts, THE system SHALL require verified parental consent and apply stricter data minimization and erasure standards where age-specific laws (e.g., COPPA, GDPR-kids) apply.

#### Mermaid Diagram: End-to-End Data Subject Rights Lifecycle
```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "Data Subject Request Lifecycle"
    A["User Submits Request (Access/Erase/Rectify)"]
    B["System Validates Identity & Request Type"]
    C{"Is Request Valid/Allowed?"}
    D["Process Request: Data Provided/Updated/Deleted"]
    E["Notify Internal & 3rd-Party Processors"]
    F["Audit Log Entry & Confirmation to User"]
    G["If Not Allowed: Provide Reason & Instructions"]
  end
  A --> B --> C
  C -->|"Yes"| D --> E --> F
  C -->|"No"| G
```

### Performance Expectations
- WHEN processing user data access or deletion requests, THE system SHALL complete all backend actions (confirmation, actual erasure, and compliance notification) within 24 hours for 99% of standard cases; exceptions must provide actionable error feedback to user within the same window.
- THE system SHALL match updates to privacy policies or legal requirements in all active jurisdictions within 7 days of regulatory notice or new market entry.
- WHERE data residency or localization conflicts arise in cross-jurisdiction processing, THE system SHALL flag, block, or queue affected actions and provide a clear business path to resolution through admin interfaces.


## Role-based Access Control (RBAC)

### Permission Structure and Assignment Flows
- THE system SHALL implement role-based access for all authenticated users. Default roles: customer (standard), seller (business), admin (administrator/high-security).
- WHEN a user is assigned or removes a role (e.g., seller added for product listing, admin privileges provisioned), THE system SHALL verify supporting evidence, enforce approval flows, and document the reason, actor, and timestamp for every change.
- WHEN a user attempts to perform a business action beyond their current permission (e.g., refund approval by customer, analytics access by seller, user ban by non-admin), THE system SHALL deny the action, log the attempt, and provide an actionable explanation via user-facing error message.
- WHERE emergency or exceptional escalation is needed (e.g., during a security incident or regulatory request), THE system SHALL require admin override with recorded justification, multi-factor authentication, and an independent audit log.

### Permission Matrix
| Action/Feature                              | Customer | Seller | Admin |
|---------------------------------------------|----------|--------|-------|
| Access personal account data                | âœ…        | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Edit/erase own personal data                | âœ…        | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Place/track orders                          | âœ…        | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Manage own listings/products                | âŒ        | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Access order status/payment for any user    | âŒ        | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Adjust permissions/roles                    | âŒ        | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Configure privacy settings/global policies  | âŒ        | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Access platform analytics/reporting         | âŒ        | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Review compliance/audit logs                | âŒ        | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Approve/refuse consent, erasure, portability| âœ…        | âœ…     | âœ…    |
| Emergency override/escalation               | âŒ        | âŒ     | âœ…    |
| Initiate cross-border data transfer         | âŒ        | âŒ     | âœ…    |

- Only admins may assign/remove roles, configure platform-wide security/policy settings, access system-wide analytics, or interact with compliance logs. Sellers may access and manage only their products and analytics.
- THE system SHALL synchronize all permission changes across sessions and devices within 10 seconds of action for 99% of cases.

### RBAC Business Flows
- WHEN an admin assigns a new role or permission set, THE system SHALL require dual confirmation and full audit trail with time, actor, and affected user.
- WHEN an RBAC policy or permission change is made, THE system SHALL immediately assess affected business actions and block or unlock corresponding operations.
- IF an unauthorized RBAC escalation is attempted (e.g., privilege abuse attempt, technical error), THEN THE system SHALL deny, log, and raise an incident alert for security follow-up.

#### Mermaid Diagram: RBAC Escalation, Assignment & Enforcement
```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "RBAC Management"
    A["Role Assignment Request"]
    B["Verify Evidence & Authorization"]
    C{"Approval Granted?"}
    D["Assign or Remove Role"]
    E["Synchronize Across Sessions/Devices"]
    F["Log Change & Notify User/Actors"]
    G["If Denied: Log Attempt & Alert Security"]
  end
  A --> B --> C
  C -->|"Yes"| D --> E --> F
  C -->|"No"| G
```


## Regulatory and Legal Compliance

### Jurisdictional Coverage
- THE shoppingMall backend SHALL enforce compliance with all major global and regional data privacy laws, including but not limited to: GDPR (EU/EEA), CCPA (California/US), LGPD (Brazil), PIPEDA (Canada), PDPA (Singapore), and applicable local consumer protection and e-commerce regulations in all operational geographies.
- WHEN jurisdictional overlap occurs (e.g., EU citizen customer using a non-EU seller), THE system SHALL always apply the highest/most restrictive data protection standard applicable to the scenario.
- IF a regulatory update or new law comes into effect (e.g., new state privacy law, country market entry), THEN THE system SHALL evaluate, log, and propagate all business policy changes within 7 days; all historic/ongoing data actions SHALL be auditable to the prior standard and transition logs kept for 5 years minimum.

### Compliance Process Workflows
- WHEN a compliance audit or regulatory inquiry is initiated, THE system SHALL provide authorized admins with a comprehensive, immutable audit trail including evidence for all data-related business actions covered within the inquiry.
- WHEN a compliance-relevant incident (e.g., security breach, illegal order, wrongful data access) is detected or reported, THE system SHALL immediately activate the breach response flow.
- IF non-compliance is discovered (e.g., data not deleted, processing without consent), THEN THE system SHALL block all further related processing, trigger admin alerts, and prepare a corrective action plan for regulatory review.

#### Mermaid Diagram: Regulatory Incident Response Flow
```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "Incident Lifecycle"
    A["Incident Detected or Reported"]
    B["Classify Incident Type & Jurisdiction"]
    C["Determine Notification/Action Timeline"]
    D{"User/Data Affected?"}
    E["Notify Regulator/Stakeholders/User"]
    F["Mitigation/Remediation"]
    G["Compile Audit Trail & Evidence"]
    H["Close Incident/Report Outcome"]
    I["If No: Continue Monitoring"]
  end
  A --> B --> C --> D
  D -->|"Yes"| E --> F --> G --> H
  D -->|"No"| I
```

### Edge Cases and Ongoing Compliance
- WHEN multi-channel or cross-jurisdiction users/sellers are active (e.g., a customer from Japan buying from a German seller on US infrastructure), THE system SHALL ensure all legal and contractual requirements are mapped, warnings are presented for any conflict, and admin intervention flows are available for exceptional scenarios.
- THE system SHALL provide a business path for remediation of all compliance gaps prior to expansion into new markets or product launches.
- WHERE user-generated content (e.g., reviews, inquiries) is involved, THE system SHALL apply the same privacy, retention, and reporting rules as for personal data.

### Performance Requirements
- THE system SHALL generate and provide all mandatory compliance or regulatory reports within 72 hours of request/incident initiation, unless regulatory regime demands faster delivery.
- Incident notification to regulators or affected users SHALL be completed within 72 hours for GDPR-relevant incidents and 7 days for other jurisdictions unless otherwise mandated.

## Audit and Privacy Policy Requirements

### Audit Log Model and Evidence Retention
- THE system SHALL create an immutable, tamper-evident audit record for every business action involving personal data, RBAC change, compliance event, and legal/data subject request.
- All audit logs SHALL record: actor, subject(s), timestamp (ISO 8601 format), action type, legal basis, module/channel, data fields affected, and evidence references (files, signatures, external notification IDs, etc.).
- Audit log entries SHALL be accessible to admin role only, with strict permission enforcement and dual-actor access for sensitive events retrieval.
- WHERE user rights afford review of audit logs (e.g., data access or processing history), THE system SHALL provide a user-centric interface with actionable logs and clear explanations.
- WHERE legal requirements specify, THE system SHALL retain audit logs and evidence for a minimum of 5 years, unless a longer period is mandated by jurisdiction or transaction type.
- WHEN a compliance hold or legal request is received (e.g., investigation, court order), THE system SHALL lock affected audit records for the event duration and notify all responsible stakeholders/admins.
- IF an audit log error or corruption is detected, THEN THE system SHALL escalate instantly to admin and block related actions until restoration or legal signoff.

### Audit Review, Notification, and Incident Response Timelines
- WHEN a business rule, privacy policy, or regulatory requirement is updated, THE system SHALL require complete policy review by compliance admins and document a signed approval before business logic is allowed to process new or modified personal data categories.
- IF a privacy incident is detected, THEN THE system SHALL initiate incident response workflows, preserve all evidence, and ensure all required notifications, corrective actions, and closure of evidence are performed as per business and regulatory obligations.
- Audit logs SHALL be reviewed at least annually and after each significant compliance incident, with remediation actions digitally recorded and certified by the responsible admin.

#### Mermaid Diagram: Audit and Evidence Traceability Flow
```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "Audit & Evidence Traceability"
    A["Business Event (e.g., Data Request, Role Change)"]
    B["Create Immutable Audit Log"]
    C["Evaluate Evidence/Compliance Tagging"]
    D{"Sensitive/Legal Hold?"}
    E["Dual Authorization for Sensitive Events"]
    F["Regular Retention (5+ Years)"]
    G["Compliance Hold: Lock & Monitor"]
    H["Access by Admin/User per Rights"]
    I["Error/Corruption Detected"]
    J["Escalate, Restore, Log"]
  end
  A --> B --> C --> D
  D -->|"Yes"| E --> G
  D -->|"No"| F
  E --> H
  F --> H
  G --> H
  H --> I --> J
```

### Privacy Policy Management and Communication
- WHEN privacy policy changes occur or new regulations come into force, THE system SHALL update all policy content in user interfaces, communicate the changes to all users and stakeholders within 3 days, and capture individual user consents or objections as required by law.
- THE system SHALL record and version every privacy policy and update event for legal auditability; historic versions SHALL remain accessible to compliance admins for at least 10 years.
- WHEN a user objects to a privacy policy change, THE system SHALL restrict further data processing for that user and provide business flows for either policy negotiation or user account exit per regulation.

### Compliance Validation & Continuous Improvement
- THE compliance team SHALL review, test, and validate all data protection and audit log business logic: annually, following any major incident, and after each regulatory update.
- WHEN audit gaps or compliance failures are detected, THE system SHALL record all remediation actions and evidence in a linked compliance log and restrict affected operations until a signed-off resolution is achieved.

---

All requirements above are written for immediate implementation by backend developers. No technical specification nor implementation details are implied. Business logic, regulatory obligations, jurisdictional nuances, and actionable incident/permission flows are fully described in natural business language. Technical architecture and engineering decisions are reserved for the development team. For related user authentication and RBAC requirements, see [User Roles and Authentication Requirements](./03-user-roles-and-authentication.md), for cross-referenced business rule requirements see [Business Rules and Validation](./12-business-rules-and-validation.md), and for data subject/user journey scenarios see [User Scenarios and Flows](./04-user-scenarios-and-flows.md).

# Scalability and Future Expansion Requirements for shoppingMall

## Extensibility Needs (Channels, Payments, APIs)

### Channel Expansion
WHEN any business unit proposes a new sales channel for shoppingMall (e.g., brand microsite, mobile app, global marketplace, or emerging digital partner), THE system SHALL allow authorized admins to provision, configure, and activate that channel with:
- Unique business rule sets, target audiences, content, and appearance
- Role-based permission mapping that supports customer (shop, consume), seller (offer, manage), and admin (review, oversee) functions
- Cross-channel configuration for payment options, fulfillment, localization, and regulatory compliance

THE system SHALL allow:
- Each newly onboarded channel to be independently activated, paused, or deactivated without operational impact to other channels,
- Complete audit and rollback for all channel onboarding or removal activities,
- Distinct reporting and analytics per channel and role
- Inheritance or customization of channel templates for rapid expansion
- Dynamic mapping of seller product catalogs and promotions to specific or multiple channels

WHEN an admin initiates channel onboarding, THE system SHALL enforce stepwise business approval, compliance review, and publishability checks (legal, brand, technical). WHEN a channel is paused, THE system SHALL communicate access restrictions and alternate options to users by role.

### Payment Integration
WHEN a new payment provider or method (e.g., credit card network, mobile wallet, local payment operator, international crypto) is requested for onboarding, THE system SHALL permit:
- Admin-configurable business rules for eligibility, risk limits, compatibility (per country, channel, role)
- Zero-downtime addition, removal, or update of payment gateways
- Seller branding/metadata in payment flows per channel
- Transaction mapping, asynchronous notification, and comprehensive audit for all transactions (success, fail, partial success)

IF integration of a payment provider fails during onboarding or at runtime, THEN THE system SHALL present user- and seller-facing impact notices within 2 seconds, provide alternative payment paths, log the incident, and auto-gen an escalation task for admins.

WHERE sellers or admins designate payment method restrictions (e.g., B2B-only, loyalty-only, large orders), THE system SHALL enforce selection policies per role and channel.

### API-Driven Expansion
THE system SHALL allow partner, supplier, logistics, analytics, and next-generation service integration by exposing APIs for:
- Catalog, order, customer, performance data exchange (REST, event-based, or business-approved standards)
- Role-aware permission enforcement: e.g., sellers can only access their products/orders, customers their history, admins aggregate data
- On-demand, versioned API publishing with visible deprecation/migration paths

WHEN new APIs are enabled, THE system SHALL require explicit versioning, non-breaking release procedures, dual-run capability for at least 12 months, and business-case documentation.
WHEN deprecating or upgrading APIs, THE system SHALL notify all impacted business partners, sellers, and developers at least 90 days in advance, and produce easy-migration guides.

### Data Extensibility and Schema Evolution
WHEN business attributes (e.g., new product features, personalization tags, channel flags, seller compliance fields) are needed, THE system SHALL allow structured schema adjustments with:
- Stepwise business approval and rollback (feature flags, migration windows)
- Audit trails for all extensions
- Role-based access to new/modified fields (e.g., only certain sellers/admins allowed to use, or only displayed to specific customer segments)

IF a schema update threatens legacy data or integrations, THEN THE system SHALL automatically maintain legacy endpoints/features until complete migration, notify responsible admins, and require business sign-off for removal.

## Performance Optimization Expectations

### User-Facing Responsiveness
WHEN a customer performs business-critical tasks (searching, browsing, purchasing, viewing favorites/personalization, reviewing orders), THE system SHALL:
- Deliver all page or API responses within 2 seconds 99% of the time, regardless of channel or device
- Instantly reflect updates to orders, carts, favorites, or preferences (â‰¤2 seconds end-to-end)
- Maintain consistent performance regardless of personalized or AI-driven logic; performance SLAs MUST NOT be relaxed for these features

WHEN sellers update catalog, inventory, pricing, or perform bulk actions, THE system SHALL reflect all changes to their customers within 2 seconds, and propagate notifications (email, in-app, 3rd party) within 5 seconds.

IF bulk, batch, or event-triggered activity (e.g., mass coupon issuance, holiday sales, inventory sync) is initiated, THEN THE system SHALL meet the following:
- Ongoing customer and seller-facing activities are never degraded beyond a 2x latency increase
- Roles are prioritized per criticality: order placements, payments, account access always trump bulk/batch
- Admins are fast-notified (within 60 sec) of any anticipated performance degradation

### Automated Scaling and Load Handling
IF business activity (e.g., viral event, promotional campaign, headline news, onboarding of a major seller) causes platform load to exceed forecasted thresholds, THEN THE system SHALL:
- Automatically scale horizontally and/or vertically to maintain optimal SLAs for all roles
- Auto-invoke degradation plan for non-critical background jobs
- Present clear status and mitigation messaging for affected users, sellers, and admins

Batch jobs, reporting, or index rebuilds SHALL never preempt normal operations; all user-facing activities take priority. Where critical system resources saturate, THE system SHALL prioritize interactive business flows as per business logic matrix.

### Concurrency, Quantitative KPIs, and User Experience
THE system SHALL sustain simultaneous activities for at least 25,000 active shoppers, 2,000 concurrent sellers, and up to 200 admin dashboard sessions (across all channels), with:
- More than 500 business transactions per second (order, payment, update)
- Concurrent bulk actions (upload, import, mass status) sustained with no >10% performance degradation
- Zero failures for high-priority transactions (order, authentication, payment) under forecasted peak

WHERE performance SLA breach is detected, THE system SHALL immediately alert business owners, throttle low-priority APIs, and generate per-role impact reports.

## Backwards Compatibility & Versioning

### Safe Upgrades and Legacy Support
WHEN shoppingMall business logic, endpoint, or critical data model changes are planned, THE system SHALL provide concurrent support for both new and prior versions for all roles, integrations, and partner APIs for at least 12 months (or as agreed by regulatory/business rules).

THE system SHALL offer:
- Complete user-facing and seller distribution of migration information, impact windows, and fallback instructions
- Automated documentation of all active, deprecated, or retired interfaces with per-role access clarity
- Explicit linking of version, status, change date, migration timeline, affected channels and roles in all business registers

IF multiple versions coexist (e.g., partners/sellers lag in migration), THEN THE system SHALL enforce version-specific role access, route traffic based on permission, and maintain historical data until full migration is verified and business sign-off is secured.

### Communication and Migration Management
WHEN a breaking or substantial change is introduced, THE system SHALL send targeted notifications to all impacted roles (customers, sellers, admins) with:
- Description of change and business impact
- Required user or partner action (if any)
- Migration/enforcement window, fallback options, and customer support escalation paths
- Pre-migration, dual-run testing window for major partners/sellers

THE system SHALL enable per-role feedback (e.g., have sellers test staged changes) and must make migration checkpoints auditable by business owner and IT.

## Business Continuity & Expansion Scenarios

### High-Availability, Failover, and Recovery
WHEN a critical dependency (payment provider, order engine, inventory sync, external channel, analytics pipeline) fails or degrades, THE system SHALL, within 30 seconds:
- Engage pre-configured failover routes (backup payment providers, alternative warehouse, partner systems, cached fallback data)
- Continue all business critical operations (order/return/refund, basic catalog, seller/admin dashboards, communications)
- Proactively inform affected users (per role) with current status, fallback details, and expected impact duration

THE system SHALL maintain complete audit logs of all failover/fallback events, including actors, duration, business and user impact, and notification recordsâ€”all accessible for stakeholder review.

### Expansion and Migration
WHEN business expansion targets a new geography, language, or regulatory domain, THE system SHALL support:
- Configurable localization (language, currency, tax, legal policy, content) per channel and market
- Geo-specific compliance business rules for checkout, payment, privacy, and marketing
- Cross-border logistics, tax, returns, and refund flows
- Audit and rollback for each localized expansion, with per-role control and reporting

WHERE live data migration is mandated (platform upgrades, international go-live, jurisdiction transfers), THE system SHALL:
- Guarantee zero or near-zero downtime (unavailability <5 minutes)
- Validate all migrated data before reactivation per role/channel
- Instantly alert business owners upon any migration validation error and enable per-record rollback

### Growth Readiness and Self-Service Expansion
WHEN additional business models (B2B, subscriptions, white-label, regional franchising) are approved, THE system SHALL enable:
- Segregation of business units (e.g., admin may define a new region or business vertical)
- Role-specific permissions attached to new business models (e.g., B2B buyers browse, negotiate, checkout; franchise managers oversee only their own sellers)
- No cross-contamination of data, customers, or privileges unless explicitly granted by admin
- Configurable KPI dashboards, analytics, and reports for each new business unit

Sellers, partners, and regional managers SHALL be permitted to autonomously expand within policy, provision sub-channels, run local promotions, and onboard associates, with admin audit and business logic enforcement.

### Scheduled and Emergency Maintenance
WHEN routine or critical maintenance/conflict occurs, THE system SHALL:
- Deliver channel-specific status notifications prior to unavailability, specifying impact, expected duration, and escalation protocol
- Offer fallback functions for users (e.g., view past orders, access support) where core actions are paused
- Maintain availability >99.95% for production channels; planned downtime does not exceed 30 minutes per event where possible
- Monitor and report real-time uptime KPIs and publicize on status dashboard

## Role-based Permission and Impact Matrix

| Extensibility Feature                  | Customer Impact                | Seller Impact                  | Admin Impact                    |
|----------------------------------------|-------------------------------|-------------------------------|---------------------------------|
| Add/Remove Channel                     | Channel browsing, real-time   | Offer products, manage sales  | Full channel provisioning,      |
|                                        | notification for availability | configure inventory and       | configuration, business rule    |
|                                        | and content                   | promotions per channel        | audit, compliance, reporting    |
| Add Payment Method                     | Available at checkout, stored | Enable/disable per product,   | Define eligibility, fraud/risk  |
|                                        | for future use, notification  | offer targeted payment promos | settings, reporting, compliance |
| Bulk Operation (Import/Promo, etc.)    | Receive updated inventory,    | Run own bulk uploads, manage  | Monitor, throttle, approve      |
|                                        | price, notification (if opt-in)| inventory, pricing, discounts | and report on all bulk ops      |
| API/Partner Integration                | Access enhanced features      | Access logistics, partners,   | Publish, update, deprecate      |
|                                        | like tracking/chat/support    | analytics, fulfillment via API| API endpoints, monitor partner  |
|                                        |                              |                              | performance, support migration  |
| Versioning/Migration                   | Notified of changes/fallbacks | Staged release for partner-   | Orchestrate migration,         |
|                                        | customer support for issues   | facing features, test         | manage test/rollback,           |
|                                        |/downtime                     | before GA                     | audit and evidence retention    |

Permission matrix is enforced by role at all business logic touchpoints. See the [User Roles and Authentication Requirements Guide](./03-user-roles-and-authentication.md) for further detail.


## Mermaid Diagram: Business Expansion & Failover Flows

```mermaid
graph LR
  subgraph "Expansion & Failover Logic"
    A["Admin Provisions New Channel/Payment"] --> B{"Disrupt Existing Operations?"}
    B -->|"No"| C["Channel/Method Auto-Onboarded"]
    B -->|"Yes"| D["Run Controlled Migration"]
    D --> E{"Fallback Ready?"}
    E -->|"Yes"| F["Enter Failover Mode"]
    E -->|"No"| G["Alert Business Owners & Rollback"]
  end

  subgraph "Performance & Scaling"
    H["Traffic/Event Surge"] --> I{"Exceeds Forecasted Capacity?"}
    I -->|"Yes"| J["Auto-Scale Resources"]
    I -->|"No"| K["Continue Normal Ops"]
    J --> L["Monitor SLA and Notify Roles"]
    K --> L
  end
  A --> H
```

## Error Handling & Edge Scenarios
IF payment, channel, or API onboarding fails, THEN THE system SHALL:
- Trigger business and technical incident logging (with role specificity)
- Notify affected role groups within 2 seconds by preferred channel (UI, push, email)
- Offer actionable user/seller fallback options
- Route admin to incident management console for evidence review and rollback
- Ensure all records of failed/partial actions are reviewable in compliance/reporting tools

IF legacy system or data cannot be migrated, THEN THE system SHALL maintain legacy endpoints until verified full transition, with scheduled reviews and sunset dates.

IF regional expansion raises compliance concerns, THEN THE system SHALL deny at-risk business activity in the target zone and escalate for legal/business review before activation.

All failover, migration, or rescue events SHALL be audit-trailed and business owners provided pre- and post-event analysis.

## Performance Requirements (User Experience Terms)
- All customer or seller interaction flows (browse, order, inventory, reporting, personalization) SHALL return in â‰¤2 seconds under normal operations, â‰¤4 seconds under documented performance degradation events
- Bulk operations or migrations SHALL not degrade standard transactions by more than 2x normal latency limits for any role
- Unplanned business downtime (emergency, migration, expansion) SHALL not exceed 5 minutes/event for production operations
- Scheduled downtime SHALL be communicated at least 24 hours prior and does not exceed 30 minutes
- All failover or expansion events SHALL complete in â‰¤30 seconds for business continuity
- Role-based notification and support required for all users affected by downtime/reversion

## Success Metrics and KPIs
WHEN expansion, scaling, or continuity requirements are exercised, THE system SHALL capture the following KPIs per channel, region, and role:
- Channel onboarding/removal time (mins)
- Payment integration launch/rollback duration (secs)
- Peak concurrent users/transactions/DB writes sustained during event
- SLA breaches by operation type/role
- Average notification/alert response time by user group
- Audit log completeness for migrations, failovers, reversions

THE system SHALL support executive, admin, and seller reporting dashboards to monitor all metrics and proactively recommend remediation where business risk is flagged.

## Business Linkages and Role Obligations
For comprehensive requirements on user and role management, permission inheritance, and security, reference the [User Roles and Authentication Requirements Guide](./03-user-roles-and-authentication.md) and the [Security, Compliance, and Data Privacy Rules](./13-security-compliance-and-data-privacy.md). All product/category, order, and discount management requirements are extended to multi-channel and regional expansion per this guidance.

# Advanced Features and Analytics Requirements for shoppingMall

## AI/ML Integration Capabilities

### Objectives
- Accelerate automation, personalization, and business process optimization throughout shoppingMall using advanced AI and machine learning
- Enable data-driven insights, proactive recommendations, and operational resilience for all user roles (customer, seller, admin)
- Position shoppingMall as an adaptable, intelligent, and future-ready platform

### Business Requirements (EARS)
- WHEN user activity is tracked, THE shoppingMall backend SHALL store detailed actionable data for each session, action, and behavioral outcome, enabling input for AI-driven and analytics models.
- WHEN new product listings, updates, or catalog events occur, THE system SHALL ingest and structure metadata to feed AI-powered recommendation, ranking, and search engines without latency exceeding 2 seconds per batch operation.
- WHEN a customer interacts with discovery or search, THE system SHALL surface context-aware, AI-curated recommendations using real-time behavioral and contextual data.
- WHEN sellers or admins monitor dashboards, THE system SHALL present AI-derived forecasts on sales trends, demand spikes, inventory risks, and fraud signals using the latest available training data.
- WHEN new transactional or feedback data is aggregated, THE system SHALL periodically (every 24 hours or less) retrain or update supervised/unsupervised models to enhance predictive accuracy and relevance.
- IF a user asks for an explanation of an AI-powered personalization result, THEN THE system SHALL provide a concise business-level summary of which key data facts or rules contributed most to the recommendation.
- WHEN automated decisioning is used for sensitive business flows (e.g., fraud detection, review moderation, personalized pricing), THE system SHALL maintain and expose human-auditable logs of input data features, model version, and reasoning chains for regulatory or dispute resolution.
- WHERE user consent is required or privacy regulations (GDPR, CCPA, etc.) apply, THE system SHALL capture, manage, and audit all opt-in/opt-out status, allowing users to review, adjust, or revoke personalization consent in real time.
- IF any AI-driven result or automation step cannot complete due to model failure, performance degradation, or missing data, THEN THE system SHALL fall back to established business rules (e.g., popularity sort, static discount tiers) and record the event for postmortem analysis.

### Business Scenarios and Core Capabilities
- Personalized product, offer, and content recommendation engines (cross-sell, up-sell, real-time personalization)
- AI-powered fraud or anomaly detection in order, payment, and seller behavior
- Automated support routing, intent recognition, and dynamic FAQ provisioning
- Dynamic context-based pricing, promotion deployment, and risk-based personalization
- Proactive community/content moderation with explainable AI-based flagging and escalation

### Data, Privacy, Bias and Explainability Expectations
- THE system SHALL process all AI-related data strictly according to published privacy policy, retaining all mandatory consent and limitation records.
- WHERE AI is used for business automation, THE system SHALL measure and report on model fairness, bias detection/remediation, and accuracy KPIs at least monthly; deviations in accuracy or fairness SHALL be flagged for admin review.
- THE system SHALL enable algorithm audit trails so admins can identify changes to model behavior/performance and attribute to version, training window, or data signals.
- IF users or external reviewers request AI audit records, THEN THE system SHALL deliver business-level explanations of how model inputs/logic led to results.
- THE system SHALL support A/B and multivariate testing of new AI features, retaining all test results for stakeholder review and version updating.

### AI-Driven Performance and Error Handling
- WHEN AI-powered recommendations, moderation, or automation are invoked, THE system SHALL return results within 1 second 99% of the time for standard user-facing operations; a clear status or fallback SHALL be communicated for delays/exceptions.
- IF significant AI system latency or disruption impacts user experience, THEN THE system SHALL disable real-time recommendations for the affected session, switch to default business logic, and inform affected users/sellers/admins within 2 seconds.
- WHEN business users, sellers, or admins provide feedback on AI accuracy or perception, THE system SHALL track, aggregate, and use such feedback to improve future model performance.

## Advanced Analytics & Insights

### Objectives
- Provide real-time, actionable intelligence, enabling daily, weekly, and long-range data-driven business decisions across all roles
- Equip sellers and admins with advanced dashboarding, trend spotting, root cause analysis, and export capabilities supporting ongoing optimization
- Enable comprehensive role-based insights, KPIs, and customizable reports across sales, operations, user engagement, and risk

### Business Requirements (EARS)
- WHEN an authenticated seller or admin accesses an analytics area, THE system SHALL display up-to-date dashboards, KPIs, and trend linesâ€”including sales by product, conversion rates, average basket size, leading return reasons, and inventory statusâ€”refreshed no less frequently than every 5 minutes.

### Analytics User Scenarios

- THE system SHALL provide full lineage, data source mapping, and audit traces for every metric and calculation presented in analytics
- KPIs SHALL include MAU, session time, acquisition and retention rates, GMV, conversion, refund rate, shipping/fulfillment cycle time, loyalty program ROI, AI recommendation precision/recall, and customer satisfaction indices
- WHERE data sources are integrated or external, THE system SHALL document all inbound data contracts, failure handling, and reprocessing rules
- IF analytics data is corrected (data error, regulatory adjustment), THE system SHALL record prior, change, and rationale in immutable audit logs and provide version references in reports

### Error Handling and Edge Case Management
- IF analytics latency exceeds 3 seconds, THEN THE system SHALL warn the user, log the occurrence with root cause trace, and retry data preparation internally

## Omnichannel and Cross-Platform Features

### Objectives
- Deliver seamless, role-consistent shoppingMall experience for customers, sellers, and adminsâ€”across web, mobile, POS, APIs, and future sales/integration channels
- Maintain unified user state, preference, business rules, and service continuity across devices, apps, and integrations
- Facilitate robust, traceable business operations and analytics regardless of access point

### Business Requirements (EARS)
- WHEN any user accesses shoppingMall through any channel, THE system SHALL synchronize user profiles, active session state, loyalty data, preferences, and recent orders across all touch points in real time.
- WHILE a user is authenticated on more than one device or platform, THE system SHALL preserve consistent notification queues, order status, and business context between all instancesâ€”resolving conflicts using defined business rule hierarchy.
- WHEN sellers update catalog data or process orders, THE system SHALL ensure item/inventory state, messages, and business event data propagate without delay across all associated channels.
- IF two or more updates conflict (multi-session or cross-channel), THEN THE system SHALL invoke a pre-defined merge/conflict resolution process, flag result for audit, and alert affected roles within 5 seconds.
- WHEN new external channels, partners, or platforms are added, THE system SHALL adapt data flows and business rules so that analytics, personalization, and compliance logic function without loss of accuracy or traceability.
- WHEN user or business actions require rollback or recovery (session loss, device switch, platform outage), THE system SHALL restore last known valid state across all platforms and provide continuity notification to affected users/sellers/admins.
- THE system SHALL log all cross-channel and multi-device data merges, user actions, and recovery events with timestamps and actor attribution; audit trails SHALL be available to authorized roles for diagnostics and compliance assessments.

### Omnichannel Scenarios and User Journeys
- Customers start an order on desktop, add to cart via mobile, complete purchase on POS/branch, and accrue rewards transparently through unified session
- Sellers toggle between mobile and desktop dashboards to manage orders, inventory, and inquiries with no lag and shared history of all transactions
- Admins enforce platform rules and analyze behaviors across all channels, quickly tracing any discrepancy or cross-user event, and initiating corrective workflows

### Role-Based Permissions, Personalization, and State Management
- THE system SHALL enforce role-based visibility/permissions for all omnichannel and analytics data (customers: own data only; sellers: own plus subordinates; admins: all scope)

- WHEN omnichannel state sync fails (partial outage, unresponsive endpoint), THEN THE system SHALL flag an incident for support, attempt automated resync every 30 seconds, inform the user, and provide alternate access to critical functions

### Performance and Recovery Requirements
- WHEN a user switches devices or channels (e.g., web to app), THE system SHALL synchronize preferences, cart, and mission-critical data within 2 seconds under normal operating conditions
- WHEN sellers/admins initiate or monitor a business operation across channels, THE system SHALL reflect the change systemwide with no more than 5 seconds latency in 99% of cases
